While this cooled the room at night my very pregnant wife did not find it comfortable. The sound of the ocean was novel at first but soon made it difficult to sleep even with the ear plugs provided.  I thought that maybe this was a southern California thing but upon talking to other people in town that is not the case.  Bottom line, if you like to be able to come back to a nice air conditioned room after a day at the beach this

Summary Heading: Disappointed with the Service for a Hotel of this Standard!
Summary: I was very impressed with the location of the hotel. Checked in a little before noon and was told my room was not yet ready. I had a business meeting at 2PM and had been traveling for 10 hours. They assured me they would put a rush on the room request. I had to change in he bathroom and was not able to shower before my meeting. By 5pm, after my mtgs were done, I still did not have a room, after inquiring 3x. Finally at 5:30pm I got my room but no apologies at all from the front desk staff. I was a text my room was available. I was not given a map of the complex, nor shown to my room. Once in the room, it had a beautiful view, but no air conditioning (or it wasn't working) and the shower did not work properly. The turndown service was excellent but I was very put off by the lack

Summary Heading: Good hotel but overpriced for what it is  oh and they totally need an AIR CONDITIONER
Summary: You just can't charge over $500/night for a room in So Cal without providing air conditioning. It's too hot.   That aside, the rooms were not bad. Small, but clean and the Surfside Room has an incredible location right over the ocean. The sound of the waves crashing is pleasant. The location on the beach is ideal and clearly it's best feature; without the location, it's unlikely they could charge more than $200 for a room.   Service was just ok. Felt like the staff weren't crazy about our presence, but nobody was rude.

Came to Surf and Sand for a couple of nights of R&R with my wife. Had a problem with our initial room but it was resolved promptly by Connor at the front desk. Every staff member was very friendly and efficient. Jordan at Splashes restaurant was great. I would recommend this hotel resort to any one.

My wife and I stayed here on our wedding night and had such an amazing experience. We only live 10 miles away but we felt like we were in paradise. Huge thanks to both Celia and Connor, Celia was the concierge member who made our stay unforgettable. I called that morning to see if they could do anything with the room, decorate, etc special for our wedding night and in a very limited amount of time she was able to get chilled champagne, rose pedals throughout the room, including a heart shape design on the bed, and also lit candles throughout the room. Also, Connor was the one who checked us and he was so friendly and helpful. Can't say enough nice things about this resort and their staff. My rating is: 5 star resort with a 5 star staff. You won't be disappointed, I promise.

Summary Heading: Loved our stay at Surf & Sand
Summary: My husband and I had a two-night stay at the Surf & Sand in early July. We had a room with a king size bed, and balcony directly over the beach. We both loved keeping the windows open and hearing the waves. I found that the room was comfortable, even without A/C or a fan. The staff was especially helpful and friendly. They were very accommodating with our request for a early check-in (I called ahead) and to help us with our miscellaneous requests - where to jog, for example. They even told us where the closest Laundromat was as we wanted to drop off a load of clothes for Wash & Fold service without having to pay high hotel fees. Location was great- we walked everywhere during our stay and felt like we got to see and do a lot.

I have been coming here with my family at least once a year since we discovered it in 2003.  The staff remembers us and is always so friendly and accommodating.  I actually call this place my home away from home because they are so welcoming.  It is also one of the few hotels directly on the beach, and the views are spectacular.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort and what a view!
Summary: This was our first time to Laguna beach and I found this resort on Trip Advisor. The reviews were excellent and they were spot on. The resort was incredible and the staff was so friendly! The only thing for people to know is that the rooms don't have air conditioning so that was an adjustment for this family from the Midwest. However, our room looked directly at the ocean and the breezes were cooling. Also, this is a motel type set up where your room opens up to the outside, that was also something I wasn't used to and at first I was concerned about safety. However, that concern was quickly dispelled and we were leaving the door propped open during the day after the first day! The staff was friendly, the food was delicious in the restaurant, and the VIEWS WERE TO DIE FOR! My

I was looking for a boutique hotel on or near the the beach in Laguna,  to spend with my daughter over the July 4th weekend. The surf and sand exceeded my expections and I was thrilled to find this treasure of a hotel. I will definitely be returning.

I could not believe what I got for what I paid.  It has a nice view and it sits in a charming beach town.  But the rack rate is flat out outrageous.  This is not the Ritz or the Four Seasons.  Not even close.  The standard rooms do not even have air conditioning.  They have ceiling fans and a giant "blower" fan to cool you off.   Luckily the sea breeze is somewhat cool.  The salty air is not very gentle on the decor and, while nicely decorated, the room furnishings are a bit worn.  Not what I would expect from such an EXPENSIVE property.  This place is a motel made better, but certainly not a luxury world class resort as the price would suggest. The lobby is tiny and not very welcoming.  A saving grace is the nearby partial sea view terrace.  The staff is nice, helpful and

Summary Heading: Do yourself a huge favor and stay elsewhere ....
Summary: My husband travels regularly and as a family we go on vacation every year. This was, by far, the worst place we've ever stayed! Where do I begin..... The beds were uncomfortable, the room needs updating (stained rugs, peeling paint, rusty), no AC, small room, noisy, dusty...... Need I go on? Okay, I will. The staircase that led to our room was filthy, had cobwebs, and looked as though it hadn't been swept in months. The ice machine was concealed by trash containers. The pool area was VERY busy and loud. Couldn't get a chair at the pool unless you got there super early in the morning. And there was NO privacy. Our room & dirty balcony faced the pool area, with only dusty shutters, no curtains. And, had to call the desk to get our room serviced at 7pm. Imagine paying over $700 a
Manager Response: Dear Joanne, On behalf of the Surf & Sand team, I apologize for your less-than-excellent experience at our resort. Clean, relaxing and available for guests are all qualities that we pride ourselves on, and I am disappointed that those were not reflected in your stay with us. We take your feedback into serious consideration as our guests' experience is our top priority. I encourage you to contact our Director of Rooms, Chad Bates, at your convenience to further discuss the issues you described. Chad can be reached at 949-376-2762 or CBates@jcresorts.com. Thank you.

Summary: It's a beautiful hotel, but I think it's overpriced. Also, some of the staff didn't seem very happy that we had young children with us. It's definitely an older hotel, and we were shocked that there was not any air conditioning! (There was a big fan in the closet to pull out and plug in.)  However... our view was amazing! We were right above the ocean and beach!

I have been going annually to Surf and Sand for almost 18 years and always enjoy the beach, the beach service, and the perfect weather. The food is very good at the hotel but the service can vary from time to time. The staff do try to make things right and I have always left satisfied and eager to return. Be sure and book rooms in the Tower Bldg right on the ocean. The concierge staff will help you ge great tickets to the Pageant of the Master's which is not to be missed. You are just a short walk to town or you can take the free Laguna Shuttle in the summer. Overall, i highly recommend the Surf and Sand. Just go and relax.

Summary Heading: Getting Intimate with the Surf and Sand
Summary: Orange County California, known for its beautiful soft sand beaches and expensive real estate simple has but one on the sand experience for visitors, The Surf and Sand. If you want to get intimate with the beach, I mean literally feel the ocean from you balcony or your bar stool this is the place and if that isn't intimate enough, have the amazing staff set you up with your own beach chairs and umbrella on the sand. The experience is complimented by great food and an excellent wine list at Splashes, which directly translates into excellent room service as well (possibly the best room service anywhere). It should also be noted that the Hotel is in walking distance from everything Laguna Beach has to offer. I travel 150 days a year and this is one of my favorite places in the

Great location for rest and relaxation. You can't get closer to the ocean. Beach and pool just steps away from each other. Food & beverage options offered good variety and prepared well. Service was excellent, associates always offered to do more. Very well managed hotel!

Summary Heading: Top notch staff, room, and location in Laguna
Summary: My wife and I stayed here this past week.  It was a blast!  The location of the hotel is great - right on the beach and not far downtown Laguna.   The staff was consistently helpful and kind.    The rooms were super clean and the view of the ocean was incredible.  If you're looking for a relaxing and enjoyable experience, stay here!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Escape Weekend at First Class Resort
Summary: This resort has an incredible setting right on the ocean, with a warm, friendly and very accommodating staff. Our room (as are most/all of the rooms in the resort) had an incredible ocean view, and we could hear the ocean waves as we slept.  It was a family vacation with our 2 teenage boys, and they loved it there also.  Our room (a suite in the Catalina building) was beautifully appointed and updated. We highly recommend this resort and will be back.

Staff is wonderful!  Beautiful property, right on the beach.  Great destination for a special occasion or just to relax on the beach.  Walking distance to several great restaurants and lots of shops.  We love it at the Surf and Sand, that's why we keep coming back!

Summary Heading: Great Staff, Great Service, Fantastic Location and Atmosphere.
Summary: Great Staff, Great Service, Fantastic Location and atmosphere.   We live in Huntington Beach but love to "get away" at this gem of a resort.   The Resort has spectacular vistas and fantastic beaches.  Norah at the front desk and Chad from security made me feel special and went out of their way to help me.  Great Staff, Great Service, Fantastic Location, and atmosphere.

My husband and I spent the weekend at Surf and Sand celebrating my husband's birthday!  Everything from the amazing room, the great ocean view restaurant and ocean view bar made our celebration weekend absolutely perfect!  The Spa staff even brought champagne to us to celebrate his birthday!  The staff missed nothing!  We will be back soon!

The hotel is located right off PCH, be careful entering as it is a steep incline and I have seen plenty of cars turn in quickly and mess up there undercarriage. The hotel has Valet and you can park yourself but Laguna is crazy to get parking and tickets are guaranteed so take them up on the Valet. Check in is Easy and the rooms are  not hard to find as there are only a few floors. Room size is good, price is what you expect in Laguna but the the views of the Ocean are outstanding. Restaurant/bar downstairs (not main restaurant) has amazing views with waves that crash right up to the building during high tide, you can walk in right off the beach and have amazing appetizers and fresh seafood with a million dollar view. Guests get chairs etc set up for them and food brought out to

We had a conference for 65 members and the reaction of attendees was terrific!! The rooms, the location, close by restaurants, and beach shops for the wives fit your needs.  If you just want a weekend getaway from a busy schedule, this is it. This location is not cheap in high season, but you get what you pay for.  To sit on your balcony, watch the waves crash and have a semi private beach below your room is priceless. Location is not real close to any airport, but shuttle service to the property is not a problem.  Enjoy!!

My husband and I stayed at the Surf & Sand while visiting family.  I would highly recommend anyone visiting the coast to stay for at least one night.    Nothing beats hearing the sound of the waves hitting the hotel at night!  The rooms are large and spacious and beautifully decorated.  The bathroom and room was spotless.  You can't beat the view from the balcony!   The service at the pool was top notch.  As soon as we sat down someone came over to take our order.  Dinner was divine and the view was stunning as well.   Advice:  We were driving through the area and were going to book our stay that night.  However my husband said lets just stop in and book since we are already here.  Since we booked in person it was much cheaper (not something I would expect and it may have been a

Came here to beat the heat and enjoy the beach. Hotel was centrally located, right on the beach. Service was excellent throughout our stay. Wonderful ocean front views from room, pool and restaurant. Highly recommend and will be returning soon.

Loved this property! Loved the rooms and views. Loved the concierge services (Sandra is the best!!). Many other staff members seemed young and inexperienced. Did not like Nicole at the front desk at all--if they got rid of her, the property would be perfect! Property itself was stunning--would highly recommend to anyone! We will definitely be back!

This is a beautiful small hotel located in the middle of Laguna Beach,Ca.   The beds are great with the best Italian linens. The view is spectacular. The pillows are some of the most comfortable I have had in a long time.   The bar has a full view of the ocean. Real nice place for late afternoon cocktail.

Was in town with a bunch of my boyfriends family for a wedding weekend. We were the only two who stayed at the Surf and Sand and we had the best time. Beautiful views, friendly staff and a lovely property with lots to see!  Between their restaurant, the little coffee shop, and the quick beach access, we were ecstatic!  Family members were staying a little further down that main stretch in laguna, but everyone took a trip up to see our hotel, and were completely impressed (and maybe a bit jealous)! We stayed on the top floor and when looking outside onto our balcony, all we saw was ocean. That view made the entire stay. With the door cracked, we slept to the sound of the ocean.   Overall, we had a lovely stay and will happily return to the Surf and Sand.

Any CA trip has three things on the list, enjoying the beach, dining well, shopping.  Surf and Sand has all three items within a one mile residence.  The quiet  beach is at the bottom of the stairs, with staff that brings the umbrella and chair to the sand. Surfing is a short walk to the left.  If the waves knock a little one over, well there is a pool at the top of the stairs overlooking the beach.  If sand, kelp, and sandflies are not your thing, sit on the balcony and enjoy the sounds of the sea.  Dining at a multitude of very good restaurants is out the front.    Laguna Beach proper, with the people watching galore and more shops and dining choices, is about a mile walk or free trolley ride away.  The rooms are large and the beds are wonderful.  Sleeping with the pounding of

My fianc√© and I went simply for an overnight "stay-cation". We arrived early and enjoyed the beach for the afternoon. The lounge chairs were very comfy! Then we went up to the room (603, fantastic!!) and got cleaned up for dinner. We walked about 7 blocks south on PCH to the Rooftop Bar for appetizers and a cocktail. If you want to watch the sunset get there early! We then enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the hotel's Driftwood Restaurant. We topped off our evening by climbing into the very comfortable bed and slept with the slider cracked open to fall asleep to the sounds of gently pounding surf. We enjoyed breakfast the next morning at the Orange Inn, a little cafe just up the road on PCH. The whole trip was wonderfully relaxing. We will be returning again in the future, we truly

This resort is one of a kind, hard to describe just how many things impressed us. The pool, restaurant and staff are top notch. The sound of the waves and the room itself made us not want to leave. If you have not been there I state, it is a must.

My fiance and I love this place we come several times a year. We've only eaten breakfast here and it was great. I have the pb&j waffles and salmon and cream cheese different occasions of course both excellent. There are great restaurants near by. Overall very nice staff and clean rooms. The bar is nice it has big bay windows looking forward out at the beach. The resort is off the beach easy access. Oh and I've seen seals swimming too cute.

We made a reservation here on the advice of my niece, who told us this was her most favorite place to go EVER!  From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we had the most delightful stay and the staff was equally as helpful. We stayed two nights and enjoyed being able to leave the door open to hear the ocean rushing to the beach. We ordered breakfast in our room the first morning and they set up with a white table cloth! The sunsets were also incredible and we enjoyed dinner at Splashes.  Will definitely add this to our list of "come back" places!

Love everything about this property. Especially the kind and warm staff members! Food is fab at breakfast and Splashes Bar. Rooms are wonderful. However, starting to show wear and tear. Would have appreciated a AAA discount or travel industry discount of some type. Weather is a HUGE factor for this particular property as they rely on it 90% of the time. Holiday weekends are packed with families and children...beware if not your deal.

I have been to this property several times and have loved it each time.  It may not be the biggest or newest property in the Laguna Beach area but it is fabulous nonetheless.  To my knowledge every room has an ocean view.  And I'm not talking about seeing it from the bluff... you are right there.  In fact, you may have trouble sleeping the first night because of the sound of the waves.  But once you get used to the rhythmic sound, you'll sleep like a baby.  The property is also located within a mile or so of the main beach and all the shops and restaurants, which is a real plus since parking in Laguna Beach is scarce.  The hotel may not be as fancy as some of the flashier resorts, but you ARE at the beach so I think understated is better.  I did not dine in the restaurant this

The sound of crashing waves outside our window was an experience like no other.  The staff is top notch in every regard.  And, dinner at the Splashes restaurant was one of the best dining experiences I've had.

My better half and I come to the Surf & Sand on a regular basis it is one of our favorite spots in Orange County.  Would recommend this spot to ANYONE!  Make sure to enjoy a sunset cocktail in Splashes and book a treatment at the spa!

Really enjoyed the room I was given.  Awesome deck overlooking the ocean. The quality of the hotel is not as nice as the Montage, up the street, but the location and ocean view from my room was pretty awesome. The rooms are beaten up a bit but service has been solid.  So if you want to be closer to downtown, a boutique feel and want to be on the water I recommend this hotel but if you prefer more of a resort style, higher quality and exceptional service I strongly recommend the Montage.

We stayed two nights at the Surf & Sand last week.  We had a fabulous breathtaking ocean view room. Service was great and everyone was so courteous and accommodating.  We arrived at the resort rather late on Thursday night with 30 mins before the kitchen closed and we were served a wonderful dinner, probably the best dinner in town, compared to the other restaurant we tried.  Thank you and we would definitely visit again.  Anne & Carl

Staff is friendly, valet service is excellent, friendly and prompt but the details really break down at this hotel with an amazing location.  The rooms are tired, grout not clean, tiles broken, dresser drawers keep rolling open, room heater stuck "on" and not fixed and worst of all repeated pre-arrival requests for a down-free (allergies) room were not honored and we had to request non-feather pillows around midnight after traveling over 24 hours from Europe to get there.  Even called from the airport in Europe to reiterate our request...  unacceptable.  Large group of high school kids arrived on our last full day who took over the pool area and non of the other hotel guests were able to access the pool/jacuzzi for the time they occupied the space... after that, the youthful
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  As our loyal and long-time guests, we value and appreciate being informed of the circumstances of your stay.  I apologize for the numerous issues you experienced and I am somewhat taken aback at the extent of those you describe.  Please be absolutely assured that each and every incident is being researched and addressed with our management team to formulate improvements.  I offer no excuses that the matters were not acted upon, and truly regret that I was not made aware of them during your stay.  As you mention and are aware, this is certainly not our usual standard of excellence, nor the quality of service which our guests expect.  We have always taken pride  in providing all of our guests the best service possible, which we failed to accomplish in this instance.   I would certainly enjoy the opportunity of having you as our return guests once again.  I offer my personal assistance so that I able to coordinate every detail of your future stay and ensure all of your needs are met and accommodated to your satisfaction.    Please call upon me directly at 949-376-2759.    Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel with breathtaking oceanview rooms
Summary: If you are looking for a upscale beachfront hotel this is the place to stay. It is located right in the heart of Laguna Beach and the sunsets are priceless.  The staff was more than accommodating! Friendly, courteous and very attentive.  We stayed in the villa suite which was over the top gorgeous.  It was our anniversary and to sit outside and watch the sunset and to sleep hearing the ocean tides unbelievable. Worth every penny!

Summary Heading: Great Beach Front Resort and Wedding Location
Summary: The Surf & Sand Resort located in Laguna Beach, California is a wonderful beach front hotel with excellent facilities for accommodating an outdoor beach view wedding ceremony and complete wedding receptions banquet facilities with a dance floor.  We enjoyed both a suite with large outdoor seating area with table and chairs, plus sofa, lounge chair and coffee table all with excellent ocean view, and their ocean front room with balcony containing two chairs and two tables for pure relaxation.  The staff was most helpful and provided excellent service during our stay.  I would highly recommend this excellent resort in Laguna Beach, California

Summary Heading: Over rated and over priced.  Not what you expect!!!!
Summary: Misleading on the website.  It felt motel-ish.  Not a good place for kids, or a girls trip!!     Now where to sit on the beach, or put up an umbrella and chairs.  Violent waves, at all times.  Earplugs in the room, not a good sign. Pool was not fun, but good view. Overpriced just because it's right on the beach.  Not great shopping near.  Very disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I have had a chance to view your Trip Advisor input regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand. My apologies that we did not meet your expectations.  Please be assured that we appreciate and  value your feedback so that we are able to make improvements.    We continually strive to make all of our guests comfortable during their stay. Due to our close proximity to the beach/surf, we offer ear plugs to those guests who do not enjoy the sound of heavy surf.  Depending on their preference, we also offer rooms that are not oceanfront.   At times, we experience high tides that prohibit the use of the beach, however, it is not a daily occurrence and we do offer beach service with umbrellas and chairs for our guests to enjoy.    It is unfortunate that during your stay, you experienced the high tides.  We would enjoy having you return to Surf & Sand when conditions are more favorable.  Please call upon me in the future so that I am able to accommodate the details of your stay personally.  You can call me directly at 949-376-2759.  Sincerely Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Pet and People Friendly on the Beach
Summary: This is a well-run property with attentive staff, clean and well-appointed (if a little dated) rooms.  Most rooms have dead-on water views, nice pool and steps from the hotel right to the beach. You are also just a few blocks walk from local shops with the nice Bluebird Canyon neighborhood a stroll away. The food is terrific but there are also good restaurants just a few blocks away. For the rooms right over the cliffs they provide earplugs so the surf won't keep you up!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your compliments of our Associates and property regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand. We value and appreciate your feedback very much.  We strive to  make our guests as comfortable as possible and I am pleased to learn that you enjoyed  your time with us.  We look forward to your return to our resort in the future.  Please contact us for any needed assistance when your travels bring you back to lovely Laguna Beach!  Warm Regards,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: I loved staying at the surf and Sand
Summary: Best resort hotel in OC. The staff and facilities were great. My room was a little small but the price was affordable. Plus being right on the beach was a plus. I would definey recommend to stay at Surf and Sand.

Impeccable resort with outstanding service and amenities.  Get to the pool early to grab a seat.  Spalshes is a great place to watch the sunset.  Surf and Sand is walking distance to Laguna Beach downtown so you don't have to drive into town if you don't want.  The staff has a few local spots you should ask them about and they are very attentive your needs.  Highly recommend this place for couples and families.

Summary Heading: WEDDING, Spa, Restaurants, Rooms, Bar -- PHENOMENAL!
Summary: The Surf and Sand was a PERFECT choice for our wedding! The hotel is absolutely beautiful-- the rooms, lobby, bar, restaurant, spa, it's impeccable. We had such a easy wedding planning process! We worked with Lauren Bergmann, who was very responsive and very helpful, on top of being adorable and having a wonderful personality. She was very accommodating of our vision, and helped me walk through my to-do list and necessary order of vendor bookings and any/all misc questions I had. I did not have to worry about ANYTHING on the day of the wedding, which was a relief. Prior to the wedding, Lauren had reached out to all of my vendors and organized the timing of everyone, stepping up as the contact person. We had a slight weather concern the day of the wedding, but I wasn't even

Splashes restaurant is by far the best combination of view and dining in Laguna Beach. Our last trip was for Mother's Day lunch and they over-delivered on every level. The GM Jordan and our server Kim made the day extra special. The prix fixe menu covered all the bases. I ended up going with the filet with potatoes and bone marrow wraps. Unreal. Definitely worth a stop in for food and drink whether you're staying at the hotel or not.

Stunning views, lovely staff and beautiful rooms.  My husband and I came to Surf and Sand for a long weekend. When we opened the door to our room and saw the waves crashing on the beach we were stunned by the beauty of the waves. The beach is gorgeous, not too big but a cove, perfect for a morning and evening stroll. We stayed in the tower and our room was lovely. The bedding is so soft, there are warm throws in the room for when the evening chill sets in, and the decor is soothing. Our wifi was very fast.  The staff are very welcoming and accommodating. My husband surfs the valets,Tom and Marcus, were very helpful in surfing beach suggestions and always asked how our day was. The hostess, Lyndsey, greeted us by name and was attentive. The view from the bar is spectacular. It's

I stayed at Surf & Sand Resort last weekend for my 5th wedding anniversary with my husband.  It was amazing!  Literally, as soon as we checked in to the resort we could see and hear the ocean the entire time.  Our room was in the Towers building which was right over the ocean.  We were able to sit on the balcony and relax together while sipping on sparkling wine.  We had dinner at the restaurant at the resort, Splashes, and once again we were loving the ocean views.  We sat outside on the lower patio and were able to watch the sunset during dinner (we saw a lot of other couple taking pictures of the sun setting over the ocean too).  The server even offered me a blanket if I was cold but I didn‚Äôt need it.  Last not but not least, was a spa appointment at the AquaTerra Spa.  It

This hotel is awesome.  The beach is beautiful and everything is within walking distance.  The staff is welcoming and helpful. We had breakfast overlooking the beach which was beautiful.   I love it here and cannot wait to go back again.

I was recomemend this by a friend to stay here and what a lovely hotel it is. The rooms are great along with the view... This is well worth the money and I'm sure you will enjoy your stay here. Alas my visit was too short but I will be back again sometime in the future.

I will recommend this place to anyone.we had a great time. Specially if you want to get out of the snow this is the place to visit. It is nice to wake up with a ocean view.  Our kids had a blast at the pool. All the employees  are Great  very  friendly. For sure will be back and will recommend it to people

Although the hotel has some good qualities (location, views, nice beach) my eye glasses were stollen from my room (Expensive, designer frames).  I have never had a theft occur at any hotel, let alone a hotel this expensive.  Staff was very unhelpful in the matter, the day after reporting the theft i returned to my room to find 4 maids in it who asked me to wait outside for 5-10 min.  Daily cleaning service did not occur, had to call each day at 4 or 5 to have it cleaned. TV didn't work.  Odd that the fine dining restaurant also serves as a pathway for bathing suit clad traffic from pool to main building.  Many of the staff was not very knowledgable about the hotel.  Vallet staff was great, i'll give them that!

People should be aware that this place took payment for 3times off my credit card. I only stayed 1 night. Still fighting with capital one. Just be aware. They even denied it at first. Saying payment would drop off. I had to get a friend to pay for next destination as my card would not work. $1400 they charged me  1night

I have been here the last 3 years for a business meeting.  This review is for the latest visit, which did not meet expectations.  I was attending a business event here, as in the past, and usually this hotel is a terrific experience.  This time, not so much.  I was given a room behind the pool and there was a very loud business related event out the door.  I was told it was going to be shut down by 9PM...there was still music and revelers out there close to 11PM.  Unable to get a bar on my cell phone in the room, required going out to the main floor to try and get reception.  Maybe not an issue if you want to download on a vacation, but if you are there for business, then you need access to your phone.  Bathroom was awkward as all get out.  It required stepping over the toilet

Beautiful well appointed hotel, beach and pool. Staff was gracious and helpful and responded to requests and a couple of small issues promptly. We asked for and got a refrigerator in our room. We had a issue with housekeeping and it was solved and the staff also gave us complementary drinks and appetizers at the restaurant for our inconvenience...we would return in a heartbeat

i am giving a 5 because of the view alone. It was stunning. We had a few glitches that couldn't be avoided but the hotel took care of them promptly.  The beds are amazingly comfortably. I would ask before you book to stay away from the pool area. Very noisy from the restaurant and pool. Over the waters edge away from the elevator.  The staff was excellent and the food was amazing. Very relaxing trip. Will be back

Great experience all the way around. Well worth the extra expense. Staff and facilities are top Drawyer. Location is absolutely perfect. We felt like royalty in the treatment by staff, quality of the food, and use of the amenities. It's our new favorite west coast destination.

We fell in love with this hotel from the moment we arrived. The staff was amazing from arrival to departure. The balcony view of the ocean is a memory we will never forget. If you are looking for a relaxing romantic getaway, this is the place to be. After a long flight from Texas, we were greeted with a nice bottle of sparkling water,  cheese,  fruit, crackers and the sweetest welcome letter from the manager. The breakfast part of the package was delicious and delivered to our room. The staff,  valet, bellman and everyone we came into contact with were morr than welcoming and helpful.  We are so happy we chose this resort and cannot wait to plan another trip!

This was our first trip to Laguna and we debated between the Montage, the Ritz and Surf & Sand. The price was not necessarily a priority for us but the price/value ratio was. We are so happy with our choice mainly due to the room being right on the beach and the proximity to the town of Laguna beach. We visited and dined at the other 2 properties and enjoyed our visits there. Both are beautiful. However, neither of those properties could beat the location of our room at Surf & Sand in a surf tower king literally right on the beach, even at twice the price. We also felt that the Surf & Sand was a bit more cozy and personal than the Montage or Ritz would have been. We enjoyed being able to walk (about 1 mile) all the way into the center of Laguna with shops all along the way vs.

Summary Heading: Luxury with the fewest steps to the beach!
Summary: You can't go wrong with this place.  The ocean is gentle at this point where their hotel is & very swimmable.  The pool & hot tub bring the whole beach experience over the top.  The guest rooms/suites close the deal to make this a Luxury Southern Californian Beach experience!

We stayed at Surf and Sand for 5 nights end of March. We had fond memories because 35 years ago we stayed by chance on a trip with kids to San Diego from San Francisco. Loved the ocean at night.   First time since that we got back to Laguna Beach, which is lovely. Unfortunately Surf and Sand still has the surf and some sand but we found it overpriced and we were underserved. It started when we were "upgraded" to a room on the top floor of the tower. Don't go there. The room is a bit bigger but that is because it does not have a usable balcony. Why would we want a room without a balcony when we are paying for the ocean and the surf and the place is not air conditioned so you want to be on the balcony for sure?  No one warned us. Then there was the guy below us smoking his cigar

Summary Heading: Escellent stay at the Surf and Sand in Laguna Beach
Summary: It was our first stay at Surf and Sand in Laguna Beach and we plan to go back when possible.  The staff were all helpful and friendly. We were celebrating our anniversary and were treated like royality by Sam the restaurant manager and our waiter Kyle.  The whole experience made for a very special get away.  The sunset from the hotel is spectular, the rooms are beautiful and the food in the Splashes Restaurant was extradionaryy.

We had yet another amazing experience at the Surf and Sand.  The rooms are amazing, the view stunning, and the staff is universally eager to please at every turn.  I can't say enough great things about this property.

Everyone was the coolest. This place is number 1. I have never been to a hotel with better service then here. Our hotel room was right above the sand and it wAs beautiful. Our two year old stayed with us he loved it. Great time

Summary Heading: The Epitome Of A Five Star Experience
Summary: Pricey?  Absolutely.  Worth It?  Again ABSOLUTELY!!  We stayed here for our daughters wedding.  She actually got married off property, but the family got a block of rooms for the weekend.All of us were thrilled with this hotel and no one out of the 10 of us who stayed here had anything negative to say.  The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and appointed.  The attention that has been paid to detail in the hotel, and even in the simplest guest rooms is phenomenal.  The guest rooms are comfortable, beautiful and are full of  amenities down to the finishing touches.  The views from every guest room are outstanding. Not a Bad room in the house.  But here's what separates a good hotel from a great hotel.. The service.  The service matched every ounce of the ambiance of the

Summary Heading: Over promise and under deliver - look for something cheaper
Summary: We recently stayed at the surf and sand for our wedding anniversary. How utterly disappointing. The hotel was very expensive. The service was very poor: the girl at check in was rude, the staff swinging by in the evening to offer bottles of water (although nice), did not appear to accept "no thank you, my three year old is sleeping" as answer.... The resort has its own beach, but there are better options in Laguna beach, especially for families with small (younger than 5 years) children. The hotel is not close to restaurants and the only on-site restaurant has a limited menu and, as excepted, is not cheap.

If you are looking to stay anywhere in Laguna Beach or the surrounding areas, choose Surf and Sand! The view is unbelievable and the staff had the best customer service I have ever had from a resort or hotel. Our room was very spacious and the balcony had comfy patio furniture and was literally over the ocean! I kept asking my Husband if we were in Hawaii it was so beautiful. We went to celebrate our one year anniversary and we couldn't have picked a better spot. It is a short walking distance to many great restaurants and fun shops even my Husband enjoyed going into. We were able to walk along the beach to the main downtown area off Forest Street and were able to go through the shops and a found a few great shots for dinner. The pool area at Surf and Sand was awesome! They have

This is an unbelievable ocean view! Our room was on third floor and the view was incredible! I guess you now realize its all about the VIEW! Waves crashing to wake you up in the morning and waves crashing to put you to sleep. I know some didn't like the sound of the waves but we loved it! This could be a 5 star resort if the only criteria was the view! BUT there are many things that don't fit with the view. The constant yelling and screaming of children was crazy. Maybe one end of the resort should be for adults only ? The slamming and banging of doors was 24 hours a day. Simply put rubber door dots in the frames could of eliminated this annoyance. The pool is way to small for the number of potential guest. Every spot was taken everyday by 8:00AM. Again maybe make it an adult

Summary Heading: Great one night away from the kids
Summary: I was in a wedding and helped my sister-in-law with the set up of venue Kat was awesome to work with! We later we're blessed to be able to stay for our anniversary in a different manner and I have to say the a taff was friendly, place was clean, gorgeous views, great design & great food! Lots of local shops and places to check out definitely will be back!

This has to be one of the best locations that I have stayed at. The rooms were fantastic. It was soothing to hear the waves as you went to sleep. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout the visit.

We had the Catalina Suite (448) and the outside noise was unbearable. We could hear everything going on outside and above us. The daily cleaning of the room was horrible. They never cleaned the shower once and they left dirty glasses and cups in the room for days. Beautiful view but not worth the money.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand. My apologies that you experienced some unfavorable conditions.  Please be assured that your comments are taken very seriously and are shared with our entire management team to address improvements.     We would certainly enjoy the opportunity of having you back with us so that we are able to provide the type of stay you expect and deserve, and select a different room location.  Please call upon me in the future for any needed assistance so that I am able to personally accommodate the details of your stay.   I can be reached directly at 949-376-2759.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights starting Easter weekend. Started off a bit shakey, checkin was impersonal and uninformative as to what the property offered. We were also underwhelmed by the junior suite...but you cant beat the location! The beach was beautiful with tide pool viewing down the beach at low tide. Close proximity to amazing restaurants and bars. We didn't use the pool much as it is overrun by kids. The last night front desk agent Nour upgraded up to a much larger suite which was stunning. Nour and the gentleman that works the front desk Thursday evening, sorry i forgot his name!, were both amazing and extremely helpful giving a much better impression of the overall staff! Kudos also the the banquet staff who were very attentive and put on a beautiful event

Summary Heading: Great hotel with great service in a great location
Summary: We spent 3 nights here and I would definitely go back.  It's right on the beach, the food was very good, the rooms were large and well appointed.  We had a second floor room with a balcony over the ocean.   I spent a day on the beach.  You can tell them at the pool how many chairs and umbrellas you want, and someone will bring them to you and set them up.  There are some great tide pools to go discover just a short walk up the beach. I might agree with some of the other reviewers that housekeeping and front desk might not have been as attentive as car service and pool staff, but it wouldn't keep me from coming again. The place might be just the slightest bit dated, and, no, it is not at the Ritz-Carlton Dana Point level, but we got a much better rate at Surf and Sand - hence 4

I did not stay overnight at this resort but did have drinks at the bar. It was a wonderful view and good strong drinks. Bartender was friendly and prompt. Worth stopping in for cocktails. We had margaritas and they were very good. The food looked good but we did not eat here.

2 1/2 hour wsit to check in. I was there at 315. Room was not ready till almost 530pm.No coffee in room. Video on demand.  didn't work for awhile. Upon check in front desk offered 50 dollar voucher but forgot to put it on bill so when I checked out they had no idea.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  My sincere apologies for the issues you experienced with checking in during your recent stay. Please be assured that this is certainly not our usual operating procedure and I appreciate you bringing the matter to my attention for further action.  I am very pleased to inform you that since your stay, we have installed Keurig coffee makers in all guest rooms as a guest convenience.    Please call upon me in the future for any needed assistance. We look very forward to your return to Surf & Sand.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Why is this rated so high?
Summary: We just spent 6 nights here.  I would say it is just okay, and I would not go back.  While the views and location are awesome, it is not nearly at the level of the Ritz-Carlton Dana Point, though the price is similar.  I realize its a beach resort, but it's a bit old, dirty, and while service is good, it needs a major rework.  The good: The staff is very nice, very laid back but professional, helpful.  Very accommodating.  The restaurant has a really fabulous view but the food is average, as is the presentation - it lacked attention to detail - nothing wrong with it but nothing stellar either.  It is literally right on the beach, sunsets are glorious, sound of waves amazing.  The bad: The facility looks good at a distance, and the views are as advertised however, this place -

We recently spent a special birthday getaway at Surf & Sand.  We stayed in a beautiful beach view room.  What a view!  The property is really nice and right i the heart of Laguna Beach.  Lots to do.  The general manager hosted a really special cocktail hour for all the guests complete with appetizers and complimentary wine.  A very nice touch.  Dinner at Splashes was great!  Special kudos to Jordan Farmer, the restaurant manager for making a nice evening into a fantastic one!  Looking forward to our return!

Friendly and efficient staff at concierge and at car service Very poor service at reception , room maintenance and administration Average service at restaurant Acceptable quality for food The forgot room service each day when service was done after request they always do it for one person even if we were two in the room  they triple bill by mistake , correction after discussion
Manager Response: Dear Serge,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  My sincere apologies for the issues you experienced.  Please be assured that we take your comments very seriously and each instance is researched with our management team and addressed for improvements.  Thank you also for the compliments of our Concierge and Valet Associates, which will also be shared and are very much appreciated.  Please call upon me in the future for any needed assistance. We look very forward to your return to Surf & Sand so that we are able to ensure a pleasant stay.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: Stayed over for 3 days Easter weekend , booked a pet friendly room, Surprised on second night after dinner got a call from Security that my dog is noisy.  Why advertise a pet friendly hotel when you dont want dogs barking, my little bichon dog is just inside the room was not even outside the hallway so why complain for noise, very very disappointed
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for being our recent guest and sharing your concerns regarding our pet policy. We take pride in being able to offer our guests an opportunity to bring their pets along with them during their stay.   In doing so, we must ensure the privacy, comfort and peacefulness that each guest expects. In the event that we are notified that guests are being inconvenienced due to any noise levels, it is our responsibility to take appropriate action and contact pet owners to restore a calm and quiet atmosphere enjoyed by all.    Please call upon us for any needed assistance in the future when you travels bring you back to lovely Laguna Beach!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: I'm very fond of the Surf and Sand and have stayed there perhaps a dozen times over the last several years. I don't think I've ever had a better ocean view. This place is *right* on the beach. The wonderful sound of the crashing surf is omnipresent. I really enjoy it and find it very relaxing, though the hotel does provide earplugs in every room because the surf, to some, seems too loud at night.   In general, I have found the staff to be very professional and friendly. The valet guys always give you a warm welcome and handle parking / retrieving the car very efficiently. The front desk and bell staff are also very professional and courteous. On occasion I've needed help from the maintenance staff as well, and they have always done an excellent job and have been very pleasant.

We were upgraded to a King corner room in the main tower. Very nice. The pool area was noisy due to spring break and the movies, and the bar music was very loud, but it did end at a reasonable time.  Loved the visit. It was a business trip, and it was great to have the backdrop of the ocean for our working trip.   The location was great - walked to the restaurants.   The linens were great, view was great, and the staff was great!

Fantastic experience, no complaints no issues! Ownership should be proud of staff they were all 5 star. I could see if it was very hot for days in a row that air conditioning (lack) could make the room very hot.  I hope this is a high level priority to make the resort  flawless.

There is a young man named Colin who works the front desk at this beautiful resort. We were very fortunate to have him assist us. And assist us he did! He went above and beyond the call of duty! Besides being helpful, he was very cheerful and has a great sense of humor.

Summary Heading: Deep pockets needed but worth every penny
Summary: Imagine basically sleeping on the sand with no fear of being washed out to sea because that's what this place has going on.  They have everything you need but you are transported into nirvana and essentially don't need anything.  I was there for a wedding but I have been going to the Surf and Sand for years.  It's a can't miss but don't tell too many people.  It's the best kept secret in Southern California, hands down.
Manager Response: As Surf & Sand‚Äôs Resort Manager, I thoroughly enjoyed your compliments of the resort.  As our very valued, loyal guest, we appreciate your rave review with those who have yet to experience our unique property, and those who also share your sentiments.  It is my hope that you will be able to be with us again in the very near future.    Warmest regards and thank you!   Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Be specific on requests when booking room.
Summary: Beautiful resort, friendly staff but when booking my room I was told it was sea view and pool view.  The agent never told me it was an obstructed view blocked by a building's roof, if I had been told that I would have waited to book here another time when they had a better availability.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  My sincere apologies that we did not meet your expectations regarding room type.  We look very forward to having you back with us so that we are able to provide the positive experience you expected.  Please contact myself directly at 949-376-2759 to ensure there is no miscommunication and you are assured of the room type you desire.  Warm Regards,   Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Surf and Sand Resort is magical; you must visit the resort!
Summary: Surf and Sand Resort is a vacation destination that will make every moment memorable! The resort sits right on the beach and every room has a breath-taking view of the ocean. The property is beautiful and offers all the amenities one needs; so we never left the property! The staff is amazing and they ensure your stay is enjoyable! The pool overlooks the ocean, the spa is wonderful, the gift shop has the best items at affordable prices, there is a quaint coffee shop on property and you must dine at Splashes! The restaurant overlooks the ocean; it's simply beautiful and the food is delicious! Make sure you stay on a Sunday where they have street tacos on the patio at 1555; you will be impressed! This is our thirteenth year visiting the resort; we keep coming back; we consider it

Love that it is on the beach. no climbing stairs to get to it. friendly staff and prompt service. the manager's reception was a plus. free beer and wind and appetizers at 530pm. Love the free trolley along PCH. Love this place!

Stayed here for a business meeting.  All I can say is wow!  Was put in a huge suite. I kept getting lost. It was bigger than my first apartment in college. Beautiful views of the ocean. Amazing balcony. All of the food and service for our conference was amazing.

The sound of the surf at night stays with you and the ocean view is as good as it gets.  The staff is helpful but not obtrusive.  The restaurant at the top of he hotel is   a wonderful place to enjoy a meal.  You forget you are in crowded Southern California. Beautifully appointed rooms.  Some reviewers have complained about no A?C but I have never found it necessary given the steady ocean breeze.  Very Romantic.

First, there is no A/C in the guest rooms and I don't want to leave the doors open for a breeze. The room got pretty muggy. Second, It would be nice if this hotel took in some consideration for their larger guests. The shower could be a bit bigger and it would be nice to have a towel that could wrap around your waist, but those are minor inconveniences. Third, upon check-in (about 11am) I was told my room was not ready. No problem for me, I'll grab something to eat. I asked the front desk person if there was a restaurant. They said yes and directed me to the 2nd floor. When I arrived at the restaurant's hostess stand, I was met with a blank stare from a young man. When he did not greet me, I went ahead and said "Table for one please". He informed me the restaurant was closed for

This is not one of the super luxury resorts of the Laguna area and to that I say hallelujah!  It is a 4 star level property but the main selling point of this hotel is being basically right on the surf.  The views are spectacular and the balconies are perfect for enjoying the stars and the sounds of the crashing surf.  I booked this for a last minute getaway from LA and the family was thrilled with the choice.  The pool area is very nice although I imagine on busier weekends it might be a bit of a zoo.  The restaurant is ok not great.  But again, views.    We most enjoyed hanging out in our room and by the pool enjoying cocktails and sun.  Beds comfortable.  Room was spacious.  The layout of the hotel is a bit confusing but once you get the hang of it it's fine.   I'm confused

Beautiful rooms overlooking the surf and sand!  Hearing the surf at night was wonderful to me but for some may be too loud. They do supply ear plugs!   There is no air conditioning but we were fine with the fan and door open to balcony but for some the room may be too warm especially during the day.  The beds were comfortable.  Overall, enjoyed the hotel and the grounds.  The beach is easy access and they do supply chairs and umbrellas  to sit on the beach which was very nice to have.  The location is excellent when in Laguna Beach. They had free wifi and complimentary coffee which was appreciated.

My nineteen year old daughter and I stayed here March 14-16 for the initial part of her Spring Break.  This was our first time to Laguna Beach.  The weather was a perfect sunny 90 degrees our entire stay.  We drove to this resort from LAX and it was easy to find.  ALL of the staff (bellmen, check-in hosts, concierge, waiters and waitresses, beach help, gift/coffee shop employees etc.) at Surf and Sand were extremely friendly and helpful.  We had a two queen bedroom in the Towers.  The room was extremely large and very clean.  The balcony was literally over the beach and the Pacific Ocean was only 20 yards out.  At extreme high tide, the water is almost directly beneath the balcony.  There is no a/c, but it's not needed because you can open the balcony door and position the fan

The Surf and Sand is a wonderful location for a meeting.  The sleeping rooms didn't have A/C but all the meeting rooms did.  It's a cute hotel, the food was excellent, and everyone that works at the hotel was extremely attentive and helpful.  I would really like to go back during a vacation so I could enjoy the beach and all the amenities the hotel offers.
Manager Response: I am so pleased to learn that you enjoyed Surf & Sand as the location for your recent meeting.  Please be assured that your compliments of our property and associates will be passed along, as positive comments are always appreciated.  We would certainly enjoy the opportunity of having you as our leisure guest in the near future.  Please contact our Executive Office directly so that we are able to accommodate the details of your stay.  Warm Regards,   Joanna Bear Resort Manager  Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: Surf & Sand Hotel in Laguna Beach, Ca. is THE BEST hotel and staff on the West Coast, bar none! They treat you like royalty, the grounds are immaculate, rooms have an awesome view, the staff is on point 100% of the time, the food is awesome, pool is clean and beach is awesome too! The amenities outside the property are all top notch too! GREAT job Surf and Sand, we will be back for years to come!!!

I was privileged to spend a night at the Surf and Sand. It was a very special occasion and the staff along with the beautiful setting made this stay, a very memorable weekend. The dinner was phenomenal along with the beautiful sunset made this a terrific end to a incredible day.

As Close to the Waves as one can get...nice place, nice people, great beach! I don't think that they have A/C so not sure what it would be like on a hot weekend we had hot weather for March it was ok at 81 degrees not sure it would have been at 90+

This was my wife and my second trip to this resort, we can't describe how wonderful both stays were. Although we live close, by it feels like worlds away. The staff is welcoming and friendly but the room far exceeded our expectations. We hope to make this an annual pilgrimage.

We stayed at the hotel last Sunday. We had reserved a king room but were given a double room. We asked at the desk if there was a restaurant for lunch (it was about 1:30 pm), and she told us there was a restaurant on the lower level. When we asked for a table, we were told that they were booked until 8 pm. I would have thought that guests staying at the hotel would have better service than that, or at least the person at the desk would have told us to go elsewhere. We ordered breakfast the night before to be delivered at 7 am, and it arrived on time, but only 1 of the 3 items were actually what we ordered. In addition, the room needed a makeover - the bathroom was old and run down. Next time we will stay at the Ritz.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback regarding your stay at Surf & Sand last month. As the Resort Manager, I was somewhat taken aback at the issues you described, which are not our usual standard of excellence. My sincere apologies that we did not meet your expectations.  Please be assured that all of the issues you experienced are shared with our entire management team to address improvements.    I would certainly enjoy having you back with us in the near future.   Please call upon me directly at 949-376-2759 so that we are able to provide the service expected and ensure a pleasant stay.    Warm Regards,   Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: This hotel was so nice!! I live about 30 minutes away from this place, but needed a staycation with my man for the weekend. Im so glad we stayed here. We got here on friday. Checkin was super easy! The front desk was nice. Our room was big and spacious. I felt so relaxed the moment I walked in. The bed was super soft and comfortable!  It was awesome to hear the waves crashing outside our room (which, by the way, faced the ocean and had an incredible sunset view).  The only thing i wasn't too ecstatic about was the maid service. On saturday,  We left for 6-8 hours in the morning and the really nice gal who i saw cleaning other rooms didnt make it to our room---of course until later when we were getting ready for dinner l that evening. We had a wonderful time other than that.

Incredibly romantic, incredible kept grounds and service is always excellent! I have been to some awesome places, but hands down, this is the BEST resort ever!!! The people are so friendly and the atmosphere is relaxing. If you are looking for a great vacation - Surf and Sand is the way to go!!

My wife and I were treated by her company for a business trip at the Surf and Sand Resort and it was an incredible hotel. The hotel is literally on the beach! Our room had the most amazing view of the ocean and we loved falling asleep to the sound of the crashing waves. We spent as much time as we could walking along the beach during the day and night. We couldn't get enough. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating from the room service to the housekeeping staff, the desk service to the concierge. It was a great romantic experience. We would return in a heartbeat!

What s waste of time! Our room was less than 10 feet from a staircase and deck that had lots of guestroom traffic on it. By 10 feet away I mean the window was 10 feet away and the foot of the bed in the tiny room, a total of maybe 12 feet away. All the walls are glass. So saying there was no privacy is another statement period we decided we couldn't even spend one night there and left. I posted the pictures. The room was $400 per night, but we wouldn't have stayed for $50 per night. Really. There was a conference in town but that's no excuse.
Manager Response: Dear Dane94306,  As Resort Manager of the Surf & Sand, I am very concerned that we did not meet your expectations during your recent stay. My sincere apologies that your room location was not ideal.   We would certainly enjoy the opportunity of having you back as my guests so that I am able to coordinate the details of your stay and ensure the service and accommodations expected.    Our premium oceanfront Towers rooms are a favorite of our long time guests and always in high demand.  I am quite confident you would agree once you experience the location of the rooms and their proximity to the ocean.   When you are able to return to lovely Laguna Beach, please contact me directly at 949-376-2759 so that I may provide assistance personally.   Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: From check in to check out we had an incredible stay! From Nolan at the front desk to Tory at the pool, and Kyle and Zach down at The restaurant, we were surrounded with nothing but happy workers that did a fantastic job! View was worth dying over, we didn't want to check out and will definitely be back. Bravo!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Resort, Not Meant for Work
Summary: We stayed here on a family vacation for a few days before a work event at the hotel, it was perfect for a 3 day family getaway. The rooms were large, very comfortable, and my favorite was the open doors to the ocean. The waves made for the most peaceful nights rest. The pool was small but we never had an issue with getting chairs. One of the unique things is all the different levels, you sort of go through tunnels and up and down to get where you want to be.   As for the meeting, I dont think the hotel is really set up for this, it appears to be mostly filled with locals who stay here for a few days away. The facilities werent there for corporate events. There isnt a hotel bar, staff was pretty sparse. The meeting rooms do go straight to the outdoors so you arent stuck inside

Summary Heading: This is just about the most restful place that I know .Gorgeous sunsets (see below) , and gracious staff.
Summary: I keep coming back to this place and always leave rested and content. Staff is gracious and unobtrusive- they always act as as though they love working here, and I can't blame them! This time, in addition to gorgeous sunsets, we saw dolphins not far from the shore. Magnificent!

Stayed here over the weekend of Feb 7th for a friend's wedding. The property is amazing - rooms overlook the ocean and the view from the balconies cannot be beat. I loved falling asleep to the sound of the ocean waves. We did have a slight issue the first night with a neighboring room's alarm clock going off for 3 hours (11 pm - 2 am). We called the front desk a number of times but they thought the noise was coming from an unoccupied room next door... the security guard met me outside our room and I showed him the room where the noise was coming from and it was apparently occupied (not sure how anyone could sleep with that beeping going on). Anyhow, they called and knocked on the door but no one answered.  I requested that we be relocated to another room and within 5 minutes we

Summary Heading: Hotel and Staff reside on a terrain of excellence!
Summary: So in love witth Surf&Sand from beginning to end. Checking in at night can sometimes be a fast forward of ushering through a welcome process to being dropped at your room so you just get there already. Not so with the Surf&Sand. David made us feel welcome immediately taking care of our obvious exhaustion as well as creating an atmosphere of warmth and comfort. The hotel has all the amenities and ambience of a 5star hotel minus the pretentiousness. Fabulous cuisine with views second to none. I cannot even imagine why they include earplugs in the room. Blasphemy!  So for those of you that want a hotel directly on the beach but don't want to hear the surf, download a screensaver and stay in town. You are right on the surf, you are going to hear it. Don't want to hear it? Don't

Summary Heading: If you love the beach you will love this resort
Summary: I had the pleasure of staying here due to a work related event.  The rooms were beautiful and I think the majority if not all the rooms are oceanfront.  Leave your balcony door open to enjoy the relaxing sounds of the ocean and view beautiful sunsets.  The staff was very helpful and polite.  Best hotel I've stayed at ever!

Summary Heading: Beautiful setting but HOT and Loud Rooms
Summary: Views of the ocean are spectacular as you cannot get closer to the water however at night the ocean is so loud that it is hard to sleep without closing ones doors.  Even without closing the doors the rooms get very stuffy and hot and there is no air conditioning.  This is unacceptable at this hefty price point.
Manager Response: Greg, Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I understand your frustration and disappointment in the lack of air conditioning. The majority of the time along the coast it is not needed; however when it is needed, it is a concern. I am very pleased to inform you that we are presently in the process of researching air conditioning options for the entire resort, and are very excited at this prospect; however, it will naturally take some time to realize fruition.  We hope to have the chance to invite you back again. Thank you

Summary Heading: Can't wait to come back to a great hotel with great service
Summary: Excellant service; Beautiful views; Great Food; Spa is fantastic; steps away from the beach; what else do you need at a resort.  This is the only place I stay in Laguna now.  The hotel never disappoints.

the Surf & Sand hotel has been a favorite of ours for years, however we saw a different side of the hotel while staying on a holiday weekend.  They were under staffed in most areas.  Our room wasn't made up until the afternoon, our room was not what I was told I would get when I made the reservation (So make sure they clarify) and Valentine's dinner was just OK.  The pool was packed and unstaffed.  Although there were bumps, we would go there again, just not on a holiday weekend!

The rooms have a fantastic view of the ocean  The pool and hot tub also have a wonderful view. You can walk to shops and restaurants. Great getaway for business or romantic getaway. Service is outstanding.

I love this place. I love the ocean sound in the rooms. The view. The staff is great. Very nice people. When we got there first time i had the best experience in my life :) I got to feel like a millioner

I stayed at the Surf and Sand and loved the entire experience!  I had a beautiful room with sliding glass doors that opened up to a balcony view of the ocean.  I slept soundly with the ocean waves crashing on the shore.  Gorgeous!  The staff were are very friendly and helpful - it was a wonderful break.  The only - only - negative was my bathroom door.  It was wood and did not close correctly.  It was a pocket door and probably off the tracks.  I stayed by myself, so having it shut completely was not an issue for me.   I think Laguna Beach is a quaint town and everyone really liked to chat and learn more about me.

Got wanting to purpose to my wife and I ordered for my  To be decorated for 110 you get what looks like 30 rose  Peaddles and 8 cheap candles, and not mentioning everything else wrong. Splashes was great tho, Kyle was super friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Best hotel for relaxation and beauty
Summary: Excellent service, a beautiful hotel and location. Not a single complaint with service, amenities, location, room or anything! Did not want to leave. Woke up to the sound of the waves. Wish I can come back once a month or more!

Summary Heading: Favorite hotel on the beach near Los Angeles
Summary: This is the best beach hotel near Los Angeles (about 90 mins. depending on traffic...it's 50 miles away).  It sits literally on the beach.  Keep in mind that at night the waves crashing can be very loud.  There is no Boardwalk or tons of people walking past like some  other beach hotels in Southern California.  The beds are luxurious with nice linens.  Very upscale without being super expensive.  There's a great restaurant in the hotel and the pool is good too.  You can see the ocean from both.  If you were any closer you'd be in it.  They have chairs and umbrellas if you want to sit on the sand.  I've vacationed there with my kids when they were little and as adults.  And it's great for a romantic get away as well.  Just know that there is usually at least one family at the

My first visit here and I'm not sure what took me so long. We came here for our minimoon, just one night and it was Super Bowl Sunday. We had room 416, the balcony is 50 feet above the sand. The crashing waves are right below you at high tide. With the sliding glass doors open, you feel like you are laying on the beach. But in reality you are in a comfortable king size bed.   The service was perfect and room service is great. Will definitely be staying here again.

The room(285 8th floor), was very clean and looked like it was just renovated.  In fact, this hotel was built in 1948 but renovated in 2010.   Bathroom was all marble and large with dual sinks.  There was a couch and large desk area.  The balcony had 3 chairs and a table and foot stool, so quite roomy for two people.  And it is right on the sand.  At high tide the water nearly reaches the hotel!  There's a nice pool area and room on the beach to lay out.  Lots of people walk their dogs on the beach as well.  There are ear plugs for people that find the ocean waves too loud, but they put us to sleep.  There isn't air conditioning though and even though it was only 70 degrees outside it was a little warm in the room.  They have a ceiling fan and a floor fan(in the closet.)  Their

The best place to stay in Laguna Beach.  The employees are all friendly and accommodating and the rooms are beautiful and perfectly decorated. You couldn't ask for a better view it is phenomenal and the hotel is right on the beach!   We would recommend this place to all our family and friends who come to visit us. Thank you for an awesome experience and we will definitely be back again!!

We again enjoyed a great one night "staycation" at the Surf and Sand.  We love staying in the Surfside King tower, directly on the sand.  We enjoy sitting on the large and comfortable balcony enjoying the amazing views.  We remembered to bring binoculars and saw some dolphins.    Staff is always "on point" from the front desk, to valets, to the maintenance staff, to the friendly morning wake up call.  The Surf and Sand is only a 20 minute drive from our home............but you feel a 100 miles away when you are there.    Also enjoyed visiting the local shops---so many interesting things to look at.  One of our favorite get a ways..............

I had the most amazing experience from beginning to end.  Pamela Hopkins and the staff at the Surf and Sand made sure that my boyfriend's birthday celebration was the most relaxing and stress free day.    I would book this massage package over and over again and recommend that anyone planning a special day for their loved one do the same!  Thank you for making his day special :)

Summary Heading: No better place on the United States West Coast!!
Summary: Had to take a moment to pass on our thanks to the Surf & Sand Resort. It's located in Laguna Beach in Southern California, right on the beach. Rooms are exceptional (stay in the tower) with 180 plus views of the ocean below, great restaurant/bar - Splashes and all staff are exceptional from the front desk, valet, room staff and an exceptional Chef Concierge named Ali (North).  This will be part of annual trip back to North America from Australia.  Can not recommend a stay here enough. Thanks for a great visit.

Summary Heading: Who plans noisy non-emergent maintenance to begin at 10pm and continue all night directly outside the rooms?
Summary: I had originally wanted to stay at the Pelican Hill Resort for my 2 nights in Laguna, but was persuaded to book here on the basis of its beach-front location, position within Laguna town, and proximity to a yoga studio.  What a mistake!  When I arrived everything seemed nice at first.  There was a corporate event by the pool that was a little loud and drunken, but the view was beautiful and it didn't seem overly busy.  Most of the beach had been washed away in a storm, but it was still pretty.  The room was beautiful to look at.  But, as many have said (and as I knew before booking having read these reviews) there is no air con.  I was there in early October and there was a heat wave.  But, having read the reviews I understood that you could leave open the windows and enjoy a
Manager Response: Dear Shuboo,  I would like to apologize on behalf of the resort for the noise you encountered during your stay with us in October 2014.  I completely understand that when our guests stay with us it is to relax and enjoy the beautiful ocean views and any maintenance noise at all is disruptive of that.    Since you mentioned you may not be able to travel back to Laguna Beach in a year time frame, we would be glad to extend the gift certificate.  Please contact Pamela in our Executive Office when you are ready to return.  We would love the opportunity to treat you to the experience you originally desired.  Regards,  Lindsay Myers Assistant General Manager

Summary: Still The best location in Laguna with direct Access to the Beach and the Sound of the Waves. Since I visited the first time some 20 years ago, they did, apart of Changing the decor of the rooms and painting the walls, not that much. Still a rather used bathroom (comes with sep Shower), a really basic hot-Air heater and no A/C. Lifts overused and the Restaurant Splashes in Winter not one place without the chill from  outside. Nevertheless it remains a Hotel of great view and feelings with the direct view to dramatic Sunsets on the balconies, the Splashes and the Bar s places. The Service and Standard of the house is **** Level. In Winter the House is packed with large groups for Seminars, Insentivs ect. As an individual one can feel a bit 'lost'. A unique place which could be

Summary Heading: Best ocean view - we will be back
Summary: We booked the "Stay, Spa & Splashes" package and never once had to leave the resort during our getaway because everything we needed was right there -- good food, decadent spa treatments and a luxurious beachfront room.  In fact, the room was so close to the ocean that all we wanted to do was hang out on our balcony in robes sipping coffee, reading the paper and listening to the roar of the waves.  The pool is also lovely with many of the comfortable lounge chairs turned to face the ocean, and the pool food was surprisingly good and served promptly.    We had amazing weather in January and I can only imagine how fabulous this resort would be in summertime.    There were some minor glitches that didn't detract from our overall experience but were surprising given the high prices.

My wife and I visited Laguna Beach in the Spring.  The hotel was wonderful and our room was on the beach front.  The sound of the waves at night were nice but as the night wore on it did become a little loud and the breeze was cool so I did close the windows.  The hotel staff is very accomdating.  The town is a great place to stroll with many art galleries and fine restraurants available.  A great weekend.

What an amazing resort !!!  We stayed in a room that was out and away closer to the shore.  I loved the roar of the ocean waves breaking right below my balcony and missed it when I left.  However, for guests who don't enjoy the roar, the resort provides complementary earplugs.  The room was elegantly appointed and the view from our balcony was spectacular.  We enjoyed dining at their restaurant, bar, and room service.  The property was just lovely & conveniently located near a variety of seaside shops and dining-all within walking distance.  I loved every minute there.

As we prepare to leave for the airport I wanted to leave a review. We were here for a conference and as far as that goes the resort did a great job. The view from our room was incredible and we couldn't ask for more. We ate and drank at the bar and pool area and the food was great and so was the service. The prices are high. If we were to leave with any complaints it was that the room was not cleaned very well each day. We would come back again and again.

I wanted to like this place I really did because there are a lot of cool elements like the court yard and the pool and the beach and ocean. But the staff could screw up a free lunch. And carpeting outdoors by the ocean? I don't understand it. Fix a few things like staff training and how to be professional and casual at the same time and this could be an all around cool place.

The staff are very friendly and helpful. Our had an amazing view of the ocean. A A special place at the end of our day to enjoy the beautiful Sunsets from our room was breathtaking.
