We had an amazing experience having dinner at Splashes. The staff is very educated with the menu and Cassandra was just so special and made the experience something we will never forget. We will be back to stay here soon.

The location of this hotel makes it worth the visit! Sitting right on the beach in Laguna Beach, the Surd & Sand Resort is a wonderful place for a business meeting or a weekend getaway.  If you like the sound of the ocean to help you to sleep, this is the place for you.The sight and sounds are amazing. For landlubbers or light sleepers, the hotel provides ear plugs in your room to help damp the noise. Yes, that is how loud it is!  I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!  If you're a cyclist, be sure to rent a bike from Laguna Cyclery, just down the street, and ride the Pacific Coast Highway. The views are spectacular!

Wonderful Weekend.  Fantastic facility.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Do enjoy splashes bar.  Great place to end a fantastic day.  How can you compete with the waves splashing below you in a perfect resort with people who actually, or at least make you believe they do, care about you.  Don't hesitate on this one.  I stay at a lot of very nice places.  This is top notch, from the moment you get there till check out.

The room we stayed in was really nice and clean.  The grounds were also clean.  The staff was not the friendliest.  There was a door in our room that led to another guest room and when I was putting my kids to bed and in bed myself another guest walked into our room.  There is no lock on the door to keep another guest from walking into your room!  When I called the front desk about it he said, "I know the other guest already called.  Sorry."  And that was the extent of how they handled a situation that felt violating and uncomfortable to say the least.  There is no air conditioning in the room which is ok during the day, but if you leave the sliding glass door open at night just know that sleeping might be difficult when the tide comes in.  They have ear plugs in the room for

Summary Heading: Very nice, very close to ocean.
Summary: Our room was very small, but was on the bottom floor closest to the ocean. This hotel is one of the nearest ones to the beach. My son was delighted that twice we could watch sea lions swim by. The crashing waves are pretty loud at night, which is something to consider if you're a light sleeper. They provide ear plugs on the night stand, but they're just cheapies and you could probably bring better ones from home.  The room itself has been updated very nicely, but it is an older building. Lots and lots of stairs. We saw one elevator in the section we were in, but it was a bit dated. My techie husband was grumbling that there weren't enough power outlets for all his stuff.  Room service was very good. Everything comes from the on-site restaurant, Splashes, and tasted good and our

We loved this hotel. It was paradise from the moment we stepped into the hotel. The staff was amazing the rooms were stunning. We did a package which included breakfast. We decided to stay an additional day it was so perfect we couldn't bare to leave.  Everyone was deserves an escape like this. It was something I will never forget.

Summary Heading: freezing with only one small vent.
Summary: The room was nice. The location of the room was awful. We froze to death. Wore our jackets and under the blanket the whole time. One small vent,  almost to the floor,  and blocked by a bench. Turned it all the way up and still no warmth. They did have a throw in the room. .... there was a fan in the closet So I'm suspecting that summers are just as miserable. Will never go back. It was 1500.00 for two nights and we couldn't get comfortable at all. The amenities do NOT equal the pricing of this place!  If you're wanting a view of the water stay somewhere else and walk to the beach!  No coffee pot in the room. No fridge in the room. The T.V. remote guide didn't work and they were supposed to come by the next morning and didn't. You had to go channel by channel to see what was on.

Summary Heading: Another great visit to the Surf and Sand!!
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times. This visit, over Thanksgiving weekend, confirmed my belief that this hotel cannot be beat. The location is outstanding as it's an easy walk into town. We were in a surf side room. I have not stayed at any other hotel which allows me to be so close to the ocean. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The food at Splashes is very good. The fitness center is small, but efficient.   The only negative which comes to mind is that the bar is very small. So, if the hotel is busy, it is hard to get a place to sit.

We ushered in the New Year in a very special way by booking our "Stay-cation" @ the Surf and Sand Resort for 3 days. I ABSOLUTELY recommend you request room 290: it is in the Tower bldg, on the top floor and has panoramic sunset views of the ocean. Breathtaking! It is so romantic and soothing to be able to hear the sound of the waves rolling in and see the deep blue boundless sea. Another very special feature about this particular room is that the spa- tub has accordion window shades that open up to the room and the ocean view. I had my essential oil baths every evening watching the sunset! Service is a smidgen more relaxed than "white glove" but the staff is young and good looking: very apro pos for a Resort in beautiful Laguna Beach. We booked both our New Years eve dinner

We had the best time. Beautiful rooms and excellent service. We will be back yearly. The rooms are right over the beach. The breakfast in the morning was excellent. I can not say enough about the friendly service. The beds are very comfortable and the linens super soft. Loved every minute.

I was there  meeting I enjoyed the room very confortable but the sound of the waves were not romantic very noisy it was september waves were very strong houskeeping was good clean staff was quite helpful

The property is gorgeous and it is literally on the beach. Our room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable with clean sheets. The room also opened to a balcony to see the ocean and sunset. Our bellman Trevor offered incredible service! He brought us ice and waters literally minutes after we requested them. He also was very nice and told us all about the resort and what thy had to offer. Surf & Sand had plenty of lounge seating areas to have a drink or just watch the beach and relax. Splashes restaurant was delicious! Our friend Jessica Martin recommended this place and my husband and I will be back! We loved our stay!

Always wonderful to bask in the joys of the Pacific views and let the staff cater to our whims!  A Christmas Eve comped welcome treat of a cheese and fruit plate with wine and the mild temps made us very merry!

Awesome room, waves at your door! High end and nice facility.  Location, location, location right on the beach......yummy Mexican restaurant within walking distance.  **************************************************

Summary Heading: Excellent rest and relaxation get away
Summary: My husband and I had a room on Surfside. We enjoyed  dinner and breakfast at Splashes. Service was excellent. We were able to rest and regroup after the holidays. I had a massage at the Aquaterra Spa. It was a wonderful retreat and experience from our hectic life!

We enjoyed a wonderful meal and ambience on Christmas Day, the food was amazing and the service even better, this hotel is one of the best places to visit in Laguna Beach, CA.  The views are spectacular of the ocean any time of the year.

We have been coming to this resort since the early 1970's. It has been through a lot of management changes but it is still the place we try to get to from the midwest as often as possible. I do not know of a place that is closer to the water. The rooms have been upgraded several times through the years. They are large with a nice sitting area with a desk . The furniture on the balcony is very comfortable. Everything is first rate. The staff is outstanding, especially the concierge named Ally who has been there the last two visits. We took the package that included breakfast at Splashes, their restaurant. Great food and service looking at the waves. This place is more than about location. It is just comfortable and beautiful. We will return as often as we can and for as long as

The location is amazing! This is one of Southern California's treasures! Sean Pettit (valet manager) helped me get my car cleaned after I parked under a very messy tree! The entire staff is always awesome at this hotal!

Summary Heading: great location and views, ok hotel
Summary: This hotel is located in prime real estate of Laguna Beach- probably the closest you can get to the ocean without actually being in it.  It's towards the south end of the strip on South Coast Highway but still within walking distance to the shops and restaurants which is why we chose it for our mini vacation rather than the Montage where we'd have to get in the car and drive to places.  Just about all the rooms have a private balcony overlooking the ocean which is also a great feature.  The hotel itself, although remodeled to convey a chic modern allure, actually looked to us a bit like an apartment building from the 60's.  We actually didn't have a problem with that-what we didn't like was that we had originally booked a Surfside King room (in a smaller 3 story building) but

Summary Heading: Surf sound is music to the ears!
Summary: Love this resort! We have been coming here for last 18 years. Love the easy beach access, spa, service, and food.                                                      We have been guests at the Surf N Sand for the last 18 years. The on beach access is the BEST!

My husband and I had the pleasure of spending our honeymoon at the Surf & Sand a couple of weeks ago. It was an absolutely amazing experience. The combination of the beautiful room with a breathtaking ocean view paired with the excellent customer service from all of the staff we encounterd made our stay there one we will never forget. If you're planning on staying here be sure to check out the restaurant Splash downstairs. The food is to die for and the bartender Ken was such sweetheart. We might have to make a trip back just for dinner and drinks. We would definitely recommend this resort and plan on returning soon.

Top notch hotel. Rooms were right on the beach. Who knew the waves could be so loud. Like sleeping on the beach but without sand up your ..... Pool area is excellent as well. Hotel is pretty central and a minute from breakfast, lunch and dinner places.

What a beautiful and peaceful place to stay.  Had a great experience. Everyone was very sweet and helpful.  We will definitely return to stay again,  The restaurant Splash had amazing food.  Everything was delicious and staff was great.

Summary Heading: Have the time of your life!
Summary: I knew California was a clean state but this resort brings clean and neat to whole new level.   Everything is top notch in this resort. The food, the service, the location, the ocean view rooms.   Experience falling asleep in their UBER MEGA comfy-cozy beds under the sweet lullaby of the ocean waves hugging the shoreline.  Have a morning swim in the ocean during high tide, watch the sun rise in the morning right form your window, see it traverse the sky leaving its vast reflection in the ocean during the day and soak in the beauty of the sunset in the evening. Try the amazing food served at the restaurant accompanied by the refreshing  ocean breeze.  Would be a shame not to mention the friendliness of the resort staff They are the heart and soul of what makes this an amazing

Summary Heading: A must do for your bucket list
Summary: If you have ever dreamed of the perfect setting in the perfect location overlooking the Pacific Ocean with that special someone, you can't miss this one. As if the location and view were not enough, the service is 5 star all the way! From the moment you arrive and are greeted by name by the Valet, to the last moment when he brings your car around, it is nothing short of elegance. My wife and I were first time guests and felt like royalty. We were greeted by the General Manager, given a complete descriptions of the hotel and a room with a view that is beyond imagination. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever had the pleasure of resting in and the food in the Splashes restaurant unmatched by any California Coast Cuisine. Everywhere we turned there was a friendly face

Staying at the Surf and Sand was an experience whereby I wanted to suspend time, embrace the moment, and fill my soul with the beauty of my surroundings.  The sound of crashing waves and the ocean breeze as I slept was refreshing; I enjoyed sitting on the balcony and looking at the moonlit waves. The hotel staff is amazing, the food was wonderful.  The only change I would make - would be to stay longer.

Beautiful resort right on the beach.  My room was bright with a balcony right above the beach.  Quiet rooms with the surf being the only "noise."  Great staff who were helpful with all needs.  A very quick taxi ride or a nice stroll to get to town.  Awesome stay overall.

Summary Heading: Most Comfortable Bed Of The Year Award!
Summary: Our recent stay at The Surf and Sand was beyond wonderful!   The rates at The Montage for a Saturday night were too steep so this was a very nice alternative.  We were given an upgrade to a tower room which has a balcony over the water.  Our room was beautiful with the most comfortable bed ever and at night it was lit up during turndown service.     This resort has a beautiful pool also with lounge chairs that look directly out to the ocean.   There is poolside food and beverage service also here.   Splashes Restaurants was wondeful for breakfast and lunch.   Our stay was only one night but next time we would like to stay longer.   Thank you Surf and Sand for making our short anniversary stay very special.  :)

Very good hotel location and facilities but too expensive. Service is not accurate and satisfactory relative to the high price charged. It was Confusing and difficult to find the location of the room and hotel facilities

Summary Heading: Felt like a king for a few days
Summary: My partner and I decided to spend a romantic weekend away at the Surf and Sand resort and we were not disappointed.  Cory the wonderful front desk employee helped us book the room and made sure we got the view we wanted.  He answered all my questions and even made our arrival special by having some beer on ice when we arrived in the room!      When we arrived we were greeted by the valet team (there is only valet here so be prepared for that).  We walked in and there was a Christmas tree with presents under it and it was a very clean lobby!  The woman at the front desk...I forget her name but it was unique like Noru or something, gave us our keys, a map and was very friendly and welcoming.       We stayed in room 270 (in case you were wondering) but we went to the second floor

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, right on the ocean
Summary: Wonderful service, beautiful views and the most wonderful natural ocean sounds for a wonderful night's rest.  Within walking distance for local shopping in Laguna Beach.  Recommend if you are in the area.

We have stayed at Surf and Sand several times since we literally stumbled across it walking the beach from the main beach in Laguna. Joanna Bear is the property manager and she insures that everyone's stay is like home on the beach. The staff follows her lead and makes everyone a VIP from the time they arrive until they have to leave, usually kickin and screaming because they don't want to leave this paradise in SO CA. Every room overlooks the ocean and draws you away from the rest of the world.

I live in Las Vegas and working in the hospitality field, I can be a little critical and picky about where I stay when traveling. However, I can say this, hands down, The Surf and Sand is one of my all time favorite places to stay!!! The view from your room is incredible and their staff is always top notch, especially the Valet Team. They have an array hotel offerings making it extremely easy to never need to leave property. Although if you do, the location is just a short walk to their downtown area and nightlife. I highly recommend anybody to stay at The Surf and Sand when visiting the Laguna area, it's definitely well worth it  .

Love this Resort so relaxing, Waves gently crashing puts me right to sleep, they have the MOST comfortable beds ever, All I know is I told my wife we need this mattress.  Never used the spa but everytime I read the menu I want to  Staff is great, recommendation for restaurants are spot on, was recommended the look argentine Place, Maro's fantastic  Will stay here, always do when in town

Having been an occasional guest and restaurant patron over the last 25 years I can only say that the team has become more and more impressive over time. Comfort, understated luxury and service with a smile in one of the best locations on the coast. We will be back again and again!

The Surf and Sand is in a prime location on the beach in Laguna Beach CA. The rooms are tastefully decorated, immaculately clean, and very comfortable. The views of the ocean, sound of the surf and location, cannot be matched. This was my second birthday stay. I recommend the hotel without reservation and I'm a tough critic.

We loved everything about this place! The food was terrific, the room was beautiful and being so close to the ocean was amazing.  Everyone was thoughtful and professional and went out of their way to make us comfortable.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel and their staff! It truly is a magical place to visit in Laguna Beach, and somewhere I genuinely call my favorite "home away from home". I live in Newport Beach, about 20 minutes North, but treat myself to a stay every few months. I love the location and beautiful waterfront views most rooms offers guests. There's so many great bars and restaurants located on the grounds and more close by. Kyle Finney has continuously helped me book and find the perfect weekends to stay and enjoy some R&R! Collin at the front desk has been especially helpful in creating the most romantic night for me and my boyfriend this past Saturday! They both have helped me embark on memories that have lasted a lifetime. They pay attention to detail and make

My mother lost a diamond earring stud while attending a wedding and reception at the Surf & Sand. We are extremely grateful to all those at the resort who had a hand in finding it and returning it to her. Something so small could have been swept up or found and kept. But I give high praise to the the organization and staff. I did not stay at the resort, but the wedding, reception and food were superb. The setting is unbelievable. The wait staff at the bar and serving the appetizers were friendly and made sure everyone was getting the passed food. They are professionals with ethics. We left the party feeling good about the Surf & Sand. But adding the return of a diamond bumps them up to SPECTACULAR. THANK YOU.

Amazing three days at Surf & Sand. Highly recommended for "overhelmed and stressed out people!" Quite and very private. No screaming children or strange noises. The food is amazing...filled with rich flavors!  Kind of place that you can go by yourself and enjoy the quite sounds of the ocean right at your balcony or perfect for a romantic time.  Not recommended for kids. It is not the loud and screaming place where kids would enjoy. But EVERY adult needs to make the time to check this hidden treasure!

Summary Heading: Best resort in Laguna.  Amazing Location.
Summary: We have stayed in several different resorts and hotels in Laguna Beach.  Surf and Sand is by far the best.  We had a wonderful time during our stay, the location is amazing(on the water, walking distance to town, direct access to the beach), and the service is excellent.  We will definitely be coming back!

The hotel was great and staff was friendly. It is worth every cent for a mini vacation on the beach. All the rooms seem to have ocean front views and location is great. The area around is cute and many places to eat and shop.

A definite ten. I loved the room, the view, the friendliness of the staff, and the location. Good walking and great food at Splashes. You cannot go wrong here, you really can't. Would love to return during the summer!

My husband and I really needed a weekend away without child, and living in LA, this was an easy distance.  We got a room over the water (a surfside King) and the sound of the crashing waves all day and night was amazing.  LOVED everything about this hotel as a getaway, Friday - Sunday felt like a week away from home.  Easy walk to adorable town, pool, bar, everything was great!

Summary Heading: We had our Dream Wedding at the Surf & Sand!
Summary: The hotel is beautiful, just the right size (not too big, not too small), and all of the staff was very friendly to us! The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. We had our dream wedding there recently (Nov 8, 2014), and our coordinator was Lauren Bermann (ask for her if you can!!). She was just amazing! She helped us through the process of planning our magical day from start to finish, and saw to every detail in between.   We had our ceremony on the breath-taking Catalina Terrace, and the Ceremony in the Pelican Ballroom and were overjoyed with the results. Our guests were all thrilled to be there, and we received so many compliments on our choice of venue. The food and the service at the reception were excellent!   Our evening ended in an amazing suite that was

Summary Heading: great views , pleasant staff , relaxing experience
Summary: the surf and sand is an exceptional hotel from its location to staff to restaurant and bar services ... all things were coming up roses . i plan to stay here again and i have stayed here in the past . its a great place for romance or just to relax . i recommend a stay here to all !

We were celebrating our 20th anniversary & I'm so glad we decided to stay at the Surf!! The staff there are very nice & go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. We ate at the restaurant & hung out at the pool where Mitch was a class act üòé he had a great sense of humor & recommended great drinks & eats!!! Alls I can say is try the SURF & SAND you won't be disappointed üëç

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel!! It was truly magical. We stayed for one night on our babymoon and I never wanted to leave. The service was top notch, the room was luxurious beyond belief, and the view is the best I can imagine. We stayed in the Catalina Suite and we were truly blown away. Huge balcony and a fireplace!! I am so happy we stayed there and I can't wait to go back.

Summary Heading: I'd give it 6 starts if I could
Summary: The utmost beautiful and amazing boutique resort you will find in Orange County.  The sound of the ocean at night is a welcome rumble that will lull you to sleep.  Even if you don't stay at the hotel, you can enjoy a cocktail and appetizer at the restaurant/bar and watch the sunset.  I absolutely love this resort and restaurant...

Summary Heading: Room tips; description of the different buildings
Summary: Room tips: When making my reservation, I spent like 2 hours doing internet research to choose my room.  I didn't find anything that really answered my questions so I'm posting this for other travelers.  The hotel has three buildings:  Oceanfront Towers, Surfside, and Seaview.  I was looking for true oceanfront, and I found it.  I ended up choosing Surfside building; ended up with room on second floor, right near the pool.  It was almost like being right on the beach.  Next time, I might ask for Surfside room on first floor to be right on top of the water.  The hotel's description was spot on:  the balcony was perched over the sand/water.  Surfside building was slightly less expensive than the Oceanfront Towers. Per website description, Oceanfront rooms are larger than the

If you want to get away and are looking for a beach weekend look no further. The ocean is literally at your fingertips. The room was perfectly designed and very updated. I recommend the lower floor of the Tower to get the best sights and sounds of the Pacific. The crashing waves washed away all my worries from a tough week before. Incredibly therapeutic. Worth every penny.

After a disastrous check-in things were great.  I didn't get an oceanside room and the front desk staff didn't seem to care.  That involved visiting the room, the front desk, another room (next door) and then back to the original room while carting my luggage to the front desk each time.  I wish they had just said that was the best they could do.  After that fiasco everything else including the other people at the front desk were great.  The food and facilities are top notch.  I saw other reviews prior to traveling that mentioned no a/c but that part of my room was great.  It was on the terrace where I felt like I was at someone else's party.

Walking into our room for the first time we saw and heard ocean! From there we experienced a first class hotel with an attentive and professional staff. From dropping the car with the valet staff (Jake) through visiting the five star dining every step was exceptional. Even our departure was well attended (Sam) and made us not want to leave. Thanks for making our wedding night unforgettable.

Beautiful beautiful beautiful room. Our view was breathtaking, we couldn't have been any closer to the water. Hearing the waves crashing was awesome. Room was large and very clean and staff was extremely held ull and pleasant.

I was here for a business trip and could have stayed a week.  The hotel is right on the beach, the waves break up near the building during high tide, the layout is spectacular.  I don‚Äôt get down to Laguna much but next time I‚Äôm there I‚Äôm staying at this hotel again.  It wins on all points except the rooms have no air conditioning for some reason.  Yes you can sleep with the balcony door open and I totally recommend it.  But you‚Äôll need to call room service for an extension cord to get the fan in front of the door.  Yes there‚Äôs a ceiling fan and a portable fan.  You‚Äôll need to get the fan in front of the door to get some cool air in the room.  When the sun sets the room gets incredibly hot and doesn't cool off.    You might see air conditioning as a revolving theme in many of my

Summary Heading: Loved sleeping to the sound of waves!!!
Summary: This lovely hotel has a lot of wonderful perks.  It is genuinely ON a sandy beach, except during very high tide.  The ocean-front rooms, of which there are many, have a stunning view of the ocean and can hear waves crash.  Simple, beautiful and clean rooms.  Pool and spa steps away from the beach, allowing entire family to enjoy both pool and beach at same time.  Splashes restaurant was delicious for breakfast.  Hotel is close enough for walk to many restaurants, art galleries and shops.  Will certainly return....with the kids this time.

If you think this is an overstatement then you have never been here.  Stop by for dinner at Splashes or drop in at the beach side bar, you will beg the front desk to find you a room.  That's what I did!

This is a wonderful 'right on the beach' hotel. Gorgeous ocean view, wonderful rock formations and schools of dolphins playing in the sea. The restaurant is fabulous. Wonderful staff. All in all an outstanding experience.

We stayed here a few times while traveling to Laguna Beach to look for a house.  Service was good, and they usually upgraded our rooms.  Each time we stayed there we had a high floor, ocean side room with an awesome view  The rooms were clean, service was good.  Falling asleep with the sliding doors open and the sound of the waves at night is amazing.  Spalshes restaurant (attached to the hotel) had good food, and there aren't too many restaurants closer to the ocean (especially during high tide).  Valet service was quick to pull up the car.   I would definitely recommend a stay here if visiting from out of town (or even a stay-cation).  It's a few miles from Main Beach where most of the shops are centered around, however this is Laguna Beach, and the whole coast line of the

The Surf and Sand is in a great location in Laguna Beach. The hotel is fabulous and nothing  is better then the views of the beach and ocean. You can see  dolphins or an occasional sea lion as well as pelicans and lots of shorebirds.  The hotel has excellent food and is also close to other restaurants as well as shops

Stayed here for a few nights over the weekend. Its a great hotel, great location and staff for the most part are up to a 5 star hotel. A few of the staff members don't get the high end hotel concept. Valet parking guys, when a car pulls up, you open the door, when drive opens the trunk, you get the luggage, you don't just watched, all three of you, while talking about your surf morning. The biggest problem is rooms. Ok you know about the non AC, it is a problem. Not only because it gets hot and stuffy but the noise of other guests from the outdoor banquet facility above your head. We had a nice Vista suite with a large balcony with couch and chairs, fantastic to enjoy the weather and beach,  the only problem its below the banquet facilities. Noise of people talking, drinking,

This property is one of my favorites!  I have been several times and plan on returning! The location is prime here!  The views are wonderful and the ocean view rooms are incredible.  You realize how majestic the ocean is!  Although this property is expensive and might be "out of range" for some, i still recommend it to do at least once.  It makes a special occasion more special, so go for it!

The Surf and Sand is a long time favorite of ours; the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion or simply get away. The rooms are beautifully appointed, the service top notch, and the location is phenomenal. The view from an oceanfront room is the BEST anywhere... we enjoy sitting on the balcony and watching the sunset... simply spectacular.

Summary Heading: Great time at Surf and Sand
Summary: Surf and Sand Resort in Laguna was a wonderful experience.   The grounds are gorgeous and immaculate.  It is right on the beach and so relaxing.  Our room was elegant, perfect for business or pleasure. The view is breathtaking and all of the staff were excellent.

The Surf and Sand is the classiest place on Earth.  The staff is generous and so willing to please.    The beach is wonderfully accessible, the view from the restaurant is divine, and the service is the best in the world.   Sleeping to the sounds of the waves is like being in heaven!  I had my USC college reunion here with six ladies at the best table in Splashes restaurant with what felt like a 270 degree view of the Pacific Ocean.  The next evening the manager greeted me and my guest with a complimentary glass of champagne.  My letter was sent to a northern California address compliments of the house.    The spa service was a ten on a one to ten scale.    The Surf and Sand is nirvana!  Lonce LaMon

We enjoyed another lovely 3 days at our gorgeous go-to hotel.  Our loves are the sound of the waves, the relaxing room, the great staff, breakfast in bed and all that Laguna has to offer in restaurants-Watermarc, Nicks-& shopping-Kokopelli Gallery. Compliments to Juan Delgado of room service who brought me a special, personalized treat when he found out it was my birthday; to David at front desk who accommodated our wish for early check in and the perfect room; to Martha, Alejandra & Yolanda in housekeeping for keeping our room so nice; and to Pamela in Adm for helping me with a special request.   We came home so relaxed and refreshed.  We have visited for several years and can't wait to return next year.

We had a great time in this beautiful hotel....swam in the ocean and the pool. Walked to dinner and drinks. Breakfast in bed....wish we could have stayed longer.  We Will definitely go back as soon as possible.

Summary Heading: Good news , bad news about my favorite place..The waves are closer ...but at high tide, there is no beach!
Summary: If you love  the sound of the waves, there is hardly a better place.! Due to a hurricane in Baja, most of the beach has been washed away at high tide--see my pix (We understand that it gets washed back in the spring), so the good news is that you now feel as though you're literally on the edge of the water because YOU ARE !!! I for one, love it, but my husband finds the sound of the waves on the ground floor too loud! (The hotel supplies earplugs for the light sleepers). If there is still not much beach when we return, we will ask for a higher floor.  Note: at low tide, you can probably walk to town via the beach but you may have to walk a block or two along the main road at other  times....Not  bad walk, since there are several cute and casual places to have breakfast along the

I really enjoyed staying here. Falling asleep to the waves crashing was wonderful. The rooms are really nice with the beach theme throughout. The pool was nice as well. We did eat at the hotel and it was good nothing memorable. Defiantly will come back.

This was a well needed stay, right on the beach, fabulous rooms (even though there is no A/C) you enjoy the ocean breeze and sounds of the waves crashing. Could keep you up if you are a light sleeper. Well appointed room and amenities.  Great location, great staff throughout the entire hotel. Great restaurant and bar. You will definitely enjoy this hotel.  Would come back and stay there again. Thank you Mitchell for making the pool day really fun!!! What a great bartender!

This was my third stay at Surf & Sand -- each visit has been excellent. Every room has an ocean view (the hotel sits on the ocean side of PCH; the hotel, in fact, hugs the beach). Some rooms overlook the pool, some sit right above the ocean.This time around the waves were crashing directly below our room, with the high tide. Coffee on the balcony in the morning. For our second night we went to Whole Foods in downtown Laguna and grabbed cheese, salami, wine, bread (you get the idea) and ate on our balcony and watched the sunset. There are restaurants within walking distance, including the rooftop restaurant about five minutes away, and the restaurant on-site is romantically excellent as well (have eaten there for dinner and breakfast). Finally, the rooms are stylish and classy.

I went there with my significant other for his birthday. Our view was perfect right on the beach. We were given robes. Breakfast to our room. Lunch at splashes was a pleasure. View and food was wonderful. I will have to save up to go back but it was worth it.

Ocean front, beautiful decor, white, light, clean. Comfortable bed, helpful staff and very polite.  Convenient location within walking distance to great restaurants and bars.  *Television was super challenging, with no channel access clearly available. Ask for instructions, to avoid frustration.

Surf and Sand was recommended to us by a friend that lives in Laguna.  I was very excited when I looked at their website.  It appeared to be right up our alley. We were traveling with our 16 year old, so we reserved a suite. Upon arrival, the valet, front desk, bell hop were all great, but our room was not.  When we walked in, the room was a sauna.  I know it was unseasonably hot, but sleeping and getting dressed while you are sweating is not acceptable for what we were paying.  Our ceiling fan was blowing in the wrong direction, but there wasnt a chain to try and switch it.  Maintenence was to come and fix that, but when we returned it was still in the wrong direction.  Also, the balcony overlooked a roof top.  Again, not acceptable when paying that price.  Since we were

Perhaps one of the best places to Stay in Laguna--you can not get any closer to the beach.  The staff, especially Cory C,, who is great and took great care of us. This resort is one of those places you can park your car and not have to leave. Perfect location to other shops and eateries.

It starts with the toilet paper. You know how concerned a resort is about your well being by the concern it shows for your bottom. The Surf & Sand Resort in Laguna Beach California has the best paper my bottom's ever met. My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary there and it was magical from the get go. As we entered our gorgeous room we were met with a bottle of sparking wine on ice and sumptuous chocolate covered strawberries. From the people at the front desk to our valet guys, the staff went out of its way to make our stay extra special and were attentive to our every need over the three nights that we were there. If you like your room close to the water you can't get closer than a room at Surf & Sand. No trip to Southern California is complete without a visit to the

My Wife & I were looking so foward to our 4 night stay here at the end of September. We booked a beach front room at almost $500.00 a night. It was a nice little getaway we had planned for some time. The location is increadable, breathtaking and one of a kind. At check in our room was not ready yet so we had to wait 2 hours, till 5pm to finally get into our room. When we first walked into our room we were met by our bell hop with all of our items.  The room was like a sauna, it took your breath away it was so hot and stuffy. The bell hop opened the sliding glass doors and left the door to the room open for a breeze. The bell hop proceeded to explain that the resort DOES NOT HAVE ANY AIR CONDITIONING!  But if you leave the sliders open and your hotel room door open you will get a
Manager Response: Dear Mitch 89044,  Your feedback is very important to us and we understand your discomfort with the lack of air conditioning. The majority of the time along the coast it is not needed; however when it is needed, it is a concern. I'd like to inform you that we are presently researching air conditioning options for the entire resort; however, a project of that magnitude will take considerable time before realizing fruition.   I invite you to call upon me directly at 949-376-2762 if you do decide to try the Surf & Sand Resort possibly in a cooler time of the year.

Summary Heading: Only one place to stay in Laguna
Summary: Don't think twice, spend the extra money and experience the best oceanfront hotel in Southern Ca. The service was exceptional. Food is amazing and served all over the property, the beach, restaurant or courtyard, all with ocean views. Splashes Bar is right on the sand, best beach bar ever. Great for families, or couples getaway, we've done both and each experience is incredible.

Surprised that this hotel routinely gets outstanding ratings because it isn't of the caliber of other area hotels that are deserving of high ratings.  I can only think that Surf & Sand travelers expect less.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  I appreciate your comments and take them very seriously.  We make every effort possible to ensure a pleasant stay for all of our guests.  I invite you to call upon me directly at 949-376-2759 to return in the future so that you and your family are able to enjoy Surf & Sand Resort to the fullest.   Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: It was totally breathtaking, walking into the room after a 9 hour travel day.  The ocean right out the window, the sunlight.  The room is completely comfortable, great linens & mattress.  Spacious & pretty bathroom, good water pressure.  We didn't have A/C & the afternoons were very warm, since the windows faced west-- we just went to the pool & bar!   I loved the sound of the waves at night right under the balcony.... My husband had a 1 day conference on the property with 3 wonderful meals... and I just loafed & loved it.  In walking distance of great restaurants & shopping.  We didn't want to go home

Just returned from a glorious 2 nights. 1st level Surfside Room-and I do mean surfside. At high tide the water was under our balcony! The force of the waves was breathtaking (for some the provision of ear plugs will be an added plus). Hotel has undergone lots of work in the recent past. The staff was perfect from the valet to the beach person. Obviously the hotel has been built and expanded over the years and the layout is a little unusual but tests your memory getting from place to place. Early morning free coffee was very welcome for that walk on the beach.  Splashes restaurant was a treat for breakfast, lunch and dinner(room service). A wonderful, relaxing get away was exactly what we had expected. I marked down sleep quality a little due to the sound of the waves might make

My family and I have been coming to this hotel since I was 8 months old. We absolutely love it here! There is no other hotel like it. The rooms are literally right over the ocean! The service at The Surf and Sand is another reason we keep returning. Especially at the pool, Mitchell and Kyle are the best!  They knew us by name and remembered us from our previous visits. Every morning Mitchell would greet us with a warm smile and set up our spots at the beach and pool. It's so nice to see familiar faces when being on vacation. I look forward to seeing everyone again in November!

There is something about Surf & Sand you simply won't get anywhere else in the city. Anytime you can look straight down and see the water from your balcony it is about as close to an ocean view as you will find. The service from the valets to the bellmen to the front desk to the pool service was spot on. We spent our entire day poolside due to high tide and were really impressed by the amicable service and team. Beds are amazing and to me there is nothing better than battling with the sounds of the ocean as you sleep.   The one thing that has stood out to me over the years is the consistency of the resort when it comes to service. I saw many of the same faces and that to me is a true rarity. I feel you can pay significantly more for the bland service at the "5 star" resorts but

Summary Heading: Can't get much closer to the beach!
Summary: This is one of our favorite coastal getaways in Southern California.  From the comfortable beds and bedding, pool with a beach view to the incredible sunset ocean view at Splashes Bar.  All of this makes for a great way to relax and really enjoy your stay!  In addition the service has always been on point.  Well greeted by the bell men and front desk upon arrival, kept comfy by room service and wined and dined at the bar and restaurant.  We can't wait for our next stay!

Summary Heading: Great property... with room for improvement
Summary: Property was great but we were surprised our suite was not air conditioned, and the ceiling fan was loud and rattled. When notified, the staff smiled and shrugged. Also, despite several calls, security did little or nothing to break up our noisy neighbors above.

Summary Heading: Needs Updating and Pool Staff Training
Summary: Although the location is wonderful, the hotel requires major updating.  Not only refurbishment but a major cleaning, too.  Rooms are a little down on their luck lately -- we did not feel this way when we stayed three years ago.    With the current Southern California heat wave, the room fans do NOT dispel the heavy and hot air.  The hotel must stop telling guests that leaving the sliding glass door open and the fan on will make the room cool.  IT DOES NOT.    Finally, the numerous pool area servers need to be trained in customer service.  They mill about the bar area, forgetting to "scan the room" for hungry and thirsty guests.  We got tired of flagging them down.

Although the hotel and staff was lovely, great location and good food.  It was very hot and impossible to sleep at night because of the lack of air conditioners in the guest rooms.  The hotel staff reassured us that the ocean breeze will cool down the room, but it never happened and we woke up bathed in sweat.

Summary Heading: Great location, you can't get any closer to the beach.  But the security doesn't do their job!
Summary: We've stayed at all the resorts in Laguna.  Montage (6X), St Regis Monarch Beach and Ritz Carlton.  Those resorts are all beautiful and no complaints, but the Surf and Sand's rooms are so close to the sand, you literally feel like you can jump out of your room right into the ocean!  As a matter of fact the waves are pretty loud it can keep you up.  But we loved that!  We did notice though that there were a lot of "non-guests" that just hang at the pool and they take coveted pool lounge chairs away from paying guests.

Summary Heading: It was the worst of times... It was the best of times
Summary: Ultimately, our trip to surf and sand was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. If you go, you have to book an oceanfront room. If you can't splurge for an oceanfront, stay somewhere else. Originally, we were in an ocean view overlooking the pool. It was horrible. We had lots of traffic right outside our door, which had to be left open due to no air conditioning. It was hot, noisy, and had no privacy. However, the staff, and especially Stuart, were incredible. As soon as an oceanfront room became available, they moved us to the most fabulous hotel room we have ever stayed in. The room was beautiful with breath taking views of the ocean and the waves crashed up right under our balcony. Still no air conditioning, but well worth it for the experience. The property is

Much too pricey for what one gets all in all, but location smashing - albeit waves noisy! It's too much to be greeted by 5 people. A bit overwhelming. Also, one should be able to park oneself. we're not completely helpless;) The trash had not been emptied - tut tut!!!A 4 star hotel, you say?! Not all supplies were supplied the second day, so we had to ask for more.  Lovely and overwhelming location! Loved the ocean. However, it got a bit noisy, so we had to use the ear plugs - thanks for supplying them, so we could sleep. Two nights with the waves making such a noise was enough, could not have stayed in that rooms for longer, although it was very picturesque and seemed romantic at first sight! We had to ask for our room to be made up on our second day there, as it had not been

For an island girl this had it all.  The quality you expect in Laguna Beach and the authentic beach feel.  I would come again and again. Nothing more relaxing than opening the shutters and being serenaded by the crashing waves.  The staff so efficient and friendly you almost feel as though you've known them before. The hard part was leaving and getting back in traffic.

Summary Heading: An absolute must stay for dream location on beach!
Summary: Surf and Sand Resort, Laguna Beach, CA is a must stay!! Not only was the service second to none but the location on the beach was literally over the water feeling. The rooms are beautiful and clean and the restaurant served delicious meals. We stayed for our honeymoon and the entire staff congratulated us during our entire stay. The personal attention to detail was awesome. We will plan future vacations around the resort just so we can have another stay there. Don't miss out on the opportunity to sleep listening to the sound of crashing waves, wake up to a breathtaking view, and be pampered with outstanding customer service at the Surf and Sand Resort!!!

From the moment we checked in, everyone made us feel so welcomed. The hotel is right on the beach, at the edge of the Pacific Ocean. Our room was on the 6th floor with view over the ocean: what else can you ask for? My wife and I spent the late afternoon on the patio reading a book, even took a little nap, rocked by the soothing sound of the crashing waves on the sand. Our dinner at Splashes could not have been more perfect: our table was on the lower level, right by the beach. So close we could almost touch the sand. Our overall dining experience was just perfect: service was impeccable, food was outstanding. We could not have asked for more. Surf & Sand is the perfect spot for a romantic couple getaway.

It is rare that we can relax on a family vacation with a 7 and 5 yr old.  This was spectacular! Our every need was met right down to providing cartoons for us to watch in the DVD player in our room! We will definitely be back, but maybe when it's a little cooler as there is no AC in the rooms and we like to freeze when we sleep! :)

From the minute you arrive, it feels like you have arrived in heaven.  Can't beat the ocean view from every room and very clean and you feel pampered.  Stayed here for our anniversary. We will return every year!

We visit The Surf and Sand Resort every year for my wife's Birthday and as always this resort is right on point, from our arrival to our departure the staff and ammenities are outstanding!  Thanks again Surf and Sands for making me look like a rock star on my wife's B-day!!!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, but Spa Needs SERIOUS Help
Summary: The hotel was wonderful, our room was gorgeous, right on the water and the room service was fantastic. I was, however, greatly disappointed by the cleanliness of the AquaTerra spa. The massages we received were fabulous, but the steam room, shower and jacuzzi in the women's lounge, were all filthy. I mentioned the issue to the manager of the spa, and she said she'd handle the issue and offered us a complimentary massage or refund for our massages. We will return for massages, but only after they clean up and repair!

Such a wonderful resort hotel! The perfect spot for an adult or a family getaway. Amazing location and unbelievable, attentive and friendly staff, that make this stay extra special. One of the only hotels in south county that has such easy beach access (right on the water!) AND has both beach and pool service. Bonus - great spa.

Our family of four stayed a full week. we loved the view of the ocean and the service was great. The pool area was very nice. The hotel is well staffed. The only suggestion I have is for tougher security at the pool. It is tough to find a seat and half the people in the pool area on most days are not hotel guests and are not supposed to be there but no one really kicks them out. I saw one lady talk the staff into letting her and her large family stay even though they were not guests and the pool area was packed.

So, I have stayed at the surf and sand roughly 30 times.    I am a regular.   Yes, there are a lot of great things.   I love the room in the tower as it feels as if you are floating on a ship.   A few things bothered me this time.  1.  POOL SERVICE.   AWFUL!!   I was approached to see if I would like to place an order and I said "let's start with ice water with lemon", I was instructed that there is a cooler with lemon water and to get it myself!!    Later, I asked for a glass of chard.   It was finally delivered warm with a cup of ice!!!  I sent it back.   2.  NO AIR!!   I did not get a good night sleep for three nights.   The room was like an oven.   This is the first time I really needed air.   While I realize "normally" guests do not need air as it cools down at night quite

I've stayed here many times. It's pretty, clean, spacious and with great amenities such as the food , spa and beach area. The view is amazing! It wouldbe a fabulous venue for a wedding.   They used to have Aveda products as their amenities.

We just returned from another stay at this property.  It's in a great location with all the amenities of a first class resort.  I am sad to say that for the first time we had some issues.  We had requested a corner room, upper floor s. side of Tower Bldg. to stay away from pool/bar noise at night as this was a R & R trip for us..we were awakened at 715 AM on day 1 by a jackhammer in the building next to us.  In other properties we have been advised of ongoing construction in the area, but not this time...sleeping in impossible even with the supplied ear plugs.  Having said that the housekeeping, valet, and bell staff were always smiling and helpful. I have downgraded my rating as we were given no warning of potential ongoing construction noise, even lesser rated properties do

Summary Heading: When we came back to the room the door was wide opened, I couldn't  dile 911! Hotel called local police, which refused
Summary: It is a very nice place, but it was unfortunate for us, when we came back from dinner to the room the door was wide opened, the 911 didn't work from my i phone. Hotel called the local police, which refused To file a report on braking to my room

This place is absolute luxury all the way. We loved every minute of our stay and didn't want to leave. Right on the ocean, rooms/pool/beach all beautiful, excellent foodand service. Do not miss it! Perfect resort for families.

Summary Heading: Excellent view, nice room, fashionable pool
Summary: The staff was fantastic.  Great service all around.  The rooms are nice and the pool is great despite the $15-$18 drink prices.  You can't beat the view and the beach access allows you to take a stroll down Laguna's shore.  The heavily populated restaurant alley is about a mile away.  We would definitely return.

This was our first overnight trip and visit to Laguna with our two and a half year old daughter and it was just perfect. The location, the food, the service was superb. We stayed 3 nights and had a great time and hope to return every year. We live in the San Fernando Valley it was great to take a quick hour drive down south to get lost in the beautiful town of Laguna. The Surf & Sand is at the top of my list for our next "staycation." We spent hours having fun at the beach, just a few steps down from the hotel. It is pricey but you are paying for one of the best boutique resorts in town and you cannot beat the location.

We have stayed at Surf and Sand for a week in their suites.  Sitting out on the balcony is spectacular and worth every penny.  We will book again for next summer.  The food at Splashes is excellent and overall the hotel staff is professional and friendly.

My husband and I stayed the weekend at the Surf and Sand Resort for our anniversary, and we had such an amazing time!!! The location is beautiful, you are right on the beach!!! On our anniversary when we came in our room there was champaign, chocolate covered strawberries and a card for us!!! I thought that was very thoughtful of the hotel staff!!!

Starting with location, perfect choice. Direct access to one of the most beautiful beaches, unbelievable views.. all right from your balcony. The ease of access to restaurants and shops also adds to the location. There is a trolley if you don't want to walk the mile down to little downtown area, making things extremely easy and the restaurant choice has great variety, all excellent. What makes the hotel stand out is the open air, I think no air conditioning was a real plus. The rooms, hallways, and restaurant all have an open air feel that just improves the whole beach experience. Last, the staff is what really made us enjoy our holiday. Extremely accommodating and just all around pleasant, really contributes to the relaxing feel of the place and makes for happy guests. I can't

I love Laguna Beach and travel there often. I booked two rooms, one for my parents, and one for myself and my husband with ocean views. They were the same price as the Montage but I figured it would be better to be in town.( I didn't realize that the hotel is actually a mile from the town center.. ) at first glance, the hotel looked like a road side motel, ugly building, carts and trash bins everywhere, dirty staircases. Anyway, you would hope that booking two expensive rooms would mean you would be treated well but we got given two rooms on low levels which meant our "ocean view" was essentially the pool. Reception staff seemed young and inexperienced. The rooms are nice and light but small and the decor is dated and cheap. The pool is small and loud. Access to the beach is

Awesome property and location, I have stayed here several times and at different times of the year and never been unhappy.  I have twin boys that love the beach and pool which makes this enjoyable for the whole family

Summary Heading: Surf, Sand, Sun and Relaxation to the max!
Summary: Beautiful resort on the beach with the surf breaking non stop.  Rooms are impeccable, sheets a delight and the bath amenities will make you smile. Splashes restaurant‚Ä¶.a view like no other with food to accompany such a beautiful experience.  If you love California and the beach/surf - this is a must.  Laguna also has many shops and a light airy feel to enjoy!

On August 18, 2014 my son made reservations for my wife and I to enjoy an amazing dinner and night together at the Surf & Sand Resort. We arrived early and the Lobby Staff: Nolan, Marcus, and Rebecca were amazingly helpful. The Surf & Sand literally sits on the sand less than 50 feet from the break water, overlooking the ocean. The sound of the surf while you sleep is incredible.  That night we had dinner at the resort restaurant and Nick, Kyle, and Sam made our 35 Anniversary a very special time. I highly recommend the Surf & Sand Resort and restaurant as a must visit for any occasion. My wife and I will definetly be returning soon.

While the stay at this resort was lovely, the month following the trip has been HELL! So if you do plan on staying here, you better pray they don't make a mistake because chances are they will not return your calls...I am now having to dispute with the credit card company since apparently they have better things to do then help!   It's really too bad because it's a nice resort...I have never written a review ever, so this is not flagrant in its intent but rather disappointing that I must take it to this level.

Surf & Sand continues to excel in all things wonderful.  There is nothing like falling asleep to the sound of waves crashing on the sand just feet away from your balcony.  The service is exceptional, and you will love the attentive beach staff.  Great lunch delivered right to your umbrella.    You will love your stay!!

My Husband and I have just spent 2 nights at this beautiful resort. The rooms were fabulous, spacious and well appointed and our balcony hung over the beach. We watched dolphins play in the ocean and saw spectacular sunsets. The food was very good and the service was superb.  I thoroughly recommend this resort for a special experience.

You can't go wrong staying at this hotel. Gorgeous rooms right on the water. Great food, courteous and attentive staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone for a relaxing, fun and romantic spot on the Laguna Beach coastline.

This beautiful, tasteful resort is well located for all things Laguna Beach.  There is even a shuttle that runs every 15 minutes so there are no parking concerns.  Our  room was hanging over the beach and at high tide the water came up right under our balcony.  Beautiful decor and excellent service.  Pricey but worth the occasional splurge!  Came for the "Pageant of the Masters" and will do it again.

If you are looking to get away from it all, this is clearly the place to do it. Is it cheap? No. But if you're looking to spend a little coin into Value for your money they think of absolutely everything here. It is pure luxury.

For our 22nd wedding anniversary, we booked a room at this resort.  Beautiful location, gorgeous beach and very nice hotel.  Rooms Rooms were nicely done and from what I could tell, each room is an ocean view room.  We had room 315 which was right over the pool.  Very nice view although could be a little noisy at time due to the pool crowd; not really an issue though.   People have complained about no A/C in their rooms.  This particular weekend was very hot and it was not an issue for us.  At night, leave the sliding glass door open, turn on the fan and put some ear plugs in (supplied by the hotel).  My wife and I slept soundly!  Food/Restaurant On Fridays, they have a managers reception outside of the lobby.  Great appetizers that fill you up quickly.  We also ate ate the

We have been coming to the Surf and Sand to celebrate our "funny-moons" over the past 24 years.  We love the stellar location of this hotel, sitting right on the beach so we can hear and smell the waves crashing at the shore and of course, we love the posh in-room amenities + great restaurants and awesome pool + bar.  It' an easy walk into Laguna Beach's shopping/restaurant and art gallery center.  A 3 day stay is always rejuvenating and we will continue to enjoy this truly special gem of a hotel.

Summary Heading: A great time in Laguna Beach
Summary: This is one of the best located hotels in Laguna Beach. The staff are very friendly and the service is exceptional. The pool does have limited seating but this is more than offset by the beach which is supplied with plenty of chairs and umbrellas. The bar has a great view of the sunset and it is a must to finish off the day with a drink and view of the sunset.

Beautiful resort, but must be in towers rooms.  Pool and beach are great.  Limited dining options.  But cannot beat the location, right on the beach.  Staff around pool and beach very helpful.  The upstairs firepit area very nice for view and drinks

I have stayed at the Surf and Sand many times.  The view and proximity to the ocean make it one of the most desirable hotel locations in Laguna Beach.  I would rate it 3 1/2 stars because the rooms have not been renovated in awhile.  I stayed at the Surf and Sand a few months ago.  For the first time in all the years I have stayed there I saw cockroaches in my bathroom.  The management did give me some write offs to compensate me after I complained but really: what is worse than finding cockroaches in your hotel room?  I travel extensively and had never seen a cockroach in a hotel room - until I saw them at the Surf and Sand.  It's troubling because if cockroaches are in the guest rooms they are probably elsewhere in the hotel as well.  Maybe in the kitchen.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I would love an opportunity to personally speak with you regarding your stay at Surf & Sand Resort.    Please feel free to reach me directly at 949-376-2759 or jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: If your goal is to be right on the beach, almost in the surf this is certainly the place. Be prepared to spend wildly for this. The value does not, in my opinion overcome the price. It's simply over priced

Went here with my close family. Walking distance to all the restaurants and shopping along the beach. Hotel food is overpriced and not that good so definitely go into town. Staff was courteous and helpful. Beach is right out the door and pool is nice as well. If you stay here, you MUST ask for a room not right above the pool. It was incredibly loud at night with kids playing and hotel staff did enforce the closing time. They also woke us up at 7 AM to hose down the entire pool deck, which was loud and INCREDIBLY wasteful, especially since we stayed there during a severe drought.

Nice room if you like cold showers.  When we reported the problem, we were told to just let the water run for a really long time.  How ironic for a hotel that launders guest bedding every three days to be more Eco friendly.  Not what you'd expect from a very expensive property.  They'd rather pour gallons if clean water down the drain instead of  fixing their plumbing issues.  Disappointing!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am so sorry to hear about the inconveniences you encountered during your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I would love an opportunity to personally speak with you.  I can be reached at jbear@jcresorts.com or my direct line is 949-376-2759.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: In heart of laguna with the best of everything.  I have traveled many places and this is a top place to stay.  The staff is the best very kid and family friendly.  This is the place to stay in laguna we will be coming back soon

Overpriced property & disappointing experience. No air conditioning. Who knew there are still hotels out there with no air?if your room faces the ocean & there's no breeze, trust me, the overhead fan just doesn't cut it. NO CELL SERVICE. If you have to conduct business or want to have access to family etc, don't stay here.  The "manager" Victor told me no hotels on the beach had cell service(an untruth) & that it really wasn't the hotel's fault there wasn't cell service. BTW, when you check in there is no signage anywhere that this might be a problem Shower handle hard to access.  There's a glass panel blocking easy access, plus one cannot decipher hot from cold. Guest has to step in to shower & then turn on water. Sounds picky but this is supposed to be easy. Staff's attitude
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I would love the opportunity to personally speak with you regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  Please feel free to reach me directly at 949-376-2759.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: This hotel does not even have air conditioning in most rooms. We have one of the expansive suites and no air. When ask you told to use the fan, which is right above the beds and obviously does not let you sleep. When you ask the manager and team what to do, you are told that if you let the door of the rooms open and the door giving on the ocean open  the room will eventually cool off ''thanks to the ocean breeze''. When you mention that bugs are likely to enter if the window is open you are told: ''yes, but they are harmless''. You don't believe what you hear. They repeat it: 'really harmless animals''. How come this was never reported?  The rest of the hotel is low level quality resort. Swimming pool small and also very old fashioned. Hugely overrated.

We are locals and like to take overnighters or weekenders here especially when out of town family visit.  We always feel guilty about spending so much on a hotel that is 20 mins from our home but then once there, we feel like we are on a five star vacation far from home.  Normally going to the beach with our 2 small children involves a lot of hassle with parking and dragging all of our stuff down to the beach so it is nice every now and then to enjoy valet and chair service and soak up the sun for 2 full days hassle free :-) I normally don't write reviews but I have to write about our most recent stay last week.  My sister and her fianc√© were meeting us there straight from the airport so I had to hide the cake & champagne I brought them to celebrate their engagement that took

This is a very expensive hotel.  Its main feature is the magnificent view.  Our check-in experience is awful.  We went on the recommendation of a friend.  We should have read the reviews. If you plan on spending a great deal of money, you should check out some of the other resorts in  surrounding areas.  I cannot think of why we would ever return.  The staff (except for the check-in) are friendly, and the food is OK.  The breakfast quality was quite good.

Truly gorgeous ocean view, and loved the location and food.  If you like falling asleep to the sound of waves (who doesn't?)--this is the place for you.  Visited on a trip to visit a client--can't wait to bring my husband back here for a vacation.  Upscale hotel, but still comfortable and authentic.

The most beautiful view of ocean, romantic getaway, Pricey restaurant, very bad server, but overall nice staff. Needs improvement in check in area. Use Spa, Pool and the beach, Avoid the restaurant, Bar is perfect.

Summary Heading: Fabulous setting and great staff but......
Summary: One of the first things you spot in your very spacious and comfortable room is a set of earplugs with a message that the hotel's greatest asset is also it's noisiest. Slide open the balcony windows and you have the ocean on your doorstep - a truly fabulous setting. However, given the lack of air-conditioning in the room (a bit of a surprise given the quality of the hotel), we assumed that sleeping with the windows open wouldn't be a problem. Wrong - the breaking waves make an absolute racket making it impossible to get a peaceful night's sleep. Sleeping with the windows closed (which turns the ocean sounds into very soothing) isn't an option either as the room gets too hot and stuffy. There is an overhead fan that makes a small difference if you keep it on full speed the whole

Good location ,wonderful staff .No sleep due to no air con in the rooms ,the heat was un bearable . You are provided with a fan ,which is not only loud but makes little difference . We were not informed about the hotel having no air con even though we booked direct .

Summary Heading: You are directly on the beach
Summary: Splurge for an oceanfront room in the tower for one of the best sweeping views of the CA coastline you will ever see. The rooms are nice and bright and well appointed. One drawback is the lack of air conditioning, though the ocean breeze is pretty good for the most part. I would still prefer AC for sleeping. The pool is quite nice though it can get crowded. Valet service was a bit slow and I could not check in until almost exactly 4:00pm, but I still did get to my room by 4:00pm so I guess I can't complain. The location is superb but some of the foot traffic in the hallways is heavy and the hotel has a "busy feel" to it, but then so does Laguna Beach in general. I can't rate this property as excellent and I think it is a stretch to do so.

Surf and Sand  "Tale of Two Cities"  A question I never thought I would ever ask at a hotel...especially one costing $800/night..."is there air conditioning?"  Well, the answer at Surf & Sand is NO...."we are an open air property" was the response I got when I asked how to turn on the AC. By the way, don't look for ANY evidence of this in advance. It's a "secret" until you get there!  There is no mention on the web site, not mentioned when reserving the room, not disclosed at check in...NO MENTION until you too finally ask someone how to turn on AC when you enter your stifling hot summer room.  My second clue (first clue was overwhelming heat) should have been when I saw the ear plugs. Why would you need earplugs in $800/night hotel room?  Well, its because you have to open all
Manager Response: Dear Michael, Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us, and I appreciate your comments about our exceptional staff, beachfront location and dining at Splashes Restaurant. I am disappointed to hear that the lack of AC negatively impacted your experience and would love another opportunity to have you back during cooler climate conditions.  Please feel free to call me directly at 949-376-2759 or jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: I will recommend it to anyone!! We stayed at this amazing Resort one night as a get away with the kids. From the front desk receptionists to the restaurant staff to the great ocean view rooms. Every one was very nice and courteous! We had an amazing time. Loved the fact that the hotel is right on the beach!!

Summary Heading: If You Want to be Close to the Surf in OC!
Summary: When I go to the BEACH I don't want to be a golf cart away (Pelican, St. Regis), stuck up on a cliff (Montage) or across the street from Pacific Coast Highway.  After trying The Surf & Sand years ago here's where we always go back to.  It serves many purposes and I've seen what appear to be "distinguished" guests and celebrities -  it's REALLY a good place - so close to the surf it's as if you're on a cruise ship!  Pricey but really worth it.

Summary Heading: Always a treat!!!! Wish I Was Still There
Summary: Always a great time at Surf and Sand, location is amazing and staff are great to us everytime.  Ally at the Concierge desk really knows her stuff and makes it easy for you and your guests.  She set up the paddle boarding for my husband and Niece, all was perfect they had a blast with the company they recommended.  There were restaurant reservations off property and Pageant tickets as well.  Can't wait until we get back there....

LOVED this hotel, the staff, the location, the amenities but the absence of air conditioning made it extremely uncomfortable for us.  Sleeping required the ocean front doors be open at night for any ventilation. We seemed to have hit the spa on a bad day as the mens steam room was inoperable and locker room was FILTHY.  Staff was amazing, the property is beautiful and food was wonderful. For this price I would expect air conditioning and , at minimum, notification from the spa that the one major amenity is not available.

Treat yourself to this quietly elegant resort just a bit south (but walkable distance) from the Main Beach. It's an oasis of many delights and on many levels. You won't regret it and you will look ahead as to your next stay.

THis place just rocked it.  What a venue.  Beach side,   no a/c needed at all.  Great happy hour for the guests. Staff was 100% the consummate professionals.  A bit pricey at times,   but worth it for a romantic getaway.

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel on the beach in Laguna
Summary: Had a wonderful 3 night stay at this delightful hotel on the beach in Laguna, California.  The rooms are lovely, service is excellent and the beach is magnificent.  Rooms overlook the "surf and sand", and you are lulled to sleep with the sounds of crashing waves.  Staff is very friendly, helpful and efficient.  Great bar, pool and restaurant on site.  Can't wait to go back!

We came down to celebrate our anniversary and could not have been happier with this resort.  First off, the staff was probably the friendliest I have ever encountered.  The rooms, the views, the restaurant, the bar, the beach was 5 stars across the board.  They even offered us a Yoga class on the beach in the morning, which was fantastic. All and all a memorable experience and would highly recommend this resort to anyone heading down to Laguna Beach. This is our new favorite hotel.  Thank you  Surf & Sand!
Manager Response: Dear Value Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay with us.    I am thrilled to hear that your anniversary celebration was memorable. Your comments regarding our staff, rooms, restaurant, bar, beach (and yoga!) will be shared with our team.    We look forward to your next visit with us!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: We continue to return to the Surf and Sand because of the uniqueness of the facility.  Not only is it 5-star quality all the way but its location right on the sand makes it an exceptional experience. Staff are customer-friendly and well trained. The food options are second to none.  In fact the calamari was the best we have ever had...the spicy apricot jam adding an most unusual touch but so GOOD. We will continue to come back.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us at Surf & Sand Resort!   We appreciate your feedback regarding our customer service, food options and calamari.  Also, I agree with your comments regarding our location.  It is such a gift to have our property right on the water.... Hard to believe our best asset is our loudest - the ocean!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: I went with two of my friends for my birthday and all I wanted was a relaxing getaway. I had to wait literally 15 minutes before I was helped by someone in the lobby. The customer service was definitely not very accommodating.  The room wasn't bad; it was clean and looked fresh. But for the price I was paying, I wasn't satisfied. When I learned that there was a pool, I was super excited to try it but it was really crowded and there wasn't a spot that me and my friends could sit together.

It can not be said that the location of this hotel is not the best for the beach lover.  The building is merely 10 yards from the surf.  BUT.....   the sacrifice you make for this is NO AIR CONDITIONING.  For a Southern girl used to cold rooms and quiet sleeping conditions this was not the place for me.  And like most properties that are open to the elements things are a bit worn looking.  The bathroom was particularly warm which made getting dressed to go out very uncomfortable.  Some of the rooms appear to have small venting windows on the interior that would create a nice cross breeze between the shaded / cool hallway and the room, but mine did not.    Other oddities = the need to walk right thru the restaurant for beach or pool access if you are staying on the 1st floor...

No air-conditioning and it wasn't mentioned on the website. They provided an additional electric fan but the wind coming from that wasn't good enough even. It has an $850++ price tag and it doesn't include breakfast. Front desk staff was snobby.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for your feedback.  I am disappointed to hear about your stay and would love another opportunity to have your back during cooler climate conditions.  Please feel free to call me directly at 949-376-2759 or jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: An excellent find. We stayed at 5 hotels in the last 2 weeks with family. Sheraton, California grand at Disney, hotel del Coronado and hard rock in San Diego. This is our favorite of all. We feel at home here. Family wants to spend a week here next time. Absolutely fantastic. Management has created an overall happy attitude and fantastic experience. We are raving fans!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am thrilled to hear about your recent stay with us!  As we strive to achieve an exceptional environment for our guests, it is always a pleasure to know when we have hit it.  Your comments will be shared to all our team members.    Thank you again, and we look forward to your future stays with us!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay for Pageant of The Masters
Summary: Great little spot in Laguna with amazing ocean views cause you are right on top of the ocean! Downside is there is no air conditioning, but it's still a favorite. If you are in town for the pageant you can hop on the free city Trolly right across the street. Nice!

After a week in New York and then Santa Monica, the family was excited to get to laguna and it didn't disappoint The rooms are decorated with a beach feel and our two rooms looked straight to the ocean as far as the eye could see, most amazing views especially at sunrise and sunset And yes you can hear the waves, but that's the attraction for us Staff were great, views from restaurants also amazing We will be back

This is my 2nd trip within the last two months.  I love this hotel and makes a great couples getaway and also a great getaway for family.  We get  a beach front room which I love to sit on the balcony and listen to the waves.  They have a great spa which I used the last trip.   The staff is amazing and go out of their way to be helpful. The restaurant is nice and the margaritas in the bar are awesome. This wont be my last trip here.  It makes a nice getaway.

Summary Heading: A Vacation that is sure to be Unforgettable
Summary: The Surf and Sand Resort is absolutely the best resort in Laguna Beach! You will be amazed by the rooms and the room view is beyond compare.
