The sound of the ocean waves crashing as you sit on your balcony is mesmerizing! The resort staff seek to accommodate your every need and always ensure your stay is spectacular! We recommend this resort and travel here as often as possible!

Me and my hubby have visited three times and every single time the trip was amazing in everyway. Super clean, perfect location, friendly service, helpful, great food, perfect beach, wonderful pool, rooms are perfect, and you never even have to leave the resort!

Summary Heading: great staff amazing location... BUT no a/c in room :(
Summary: Great location, amazing views, and wonderful staff. BUT rooms are overpriced for not having a/c!!!! At Surf and Sand's price point, one expects a/c in their hotel rooms!  The crashing of the ocean waves was much louder than we expected (I know that sounds bad, but I am from Solana Beach, Ca. and I live blocks off the beach now. I love the sound of the ocean and I feel my expectations were realistic).   The first night we left our balcony door open for the fresh air, but we couldn't sleep due to the waves crashing upon the shore (lovely sound, but not while trying to sleep). The second night we closed the balcony door, only to sleep equally as poor, due to our over stuffy hot hotel room! It was painful to wake up and pay our hotel bill this morning after two nights of poor sleep.

We stayed here as part of our weekend to see Pageant of the Masters. I will agree with other reviewers that this hotel is pricey.  That said, it is worth every penny. Our wonderfully comfortable room faced the ocean and it was magical falling asleep each night to the sound of the waves. The service is impeccable- friendly and courteous. The property is spotless.  We ate in their dining room, Splashes, for both dinner and breakfast and found it to be excellent. Service there was very attentive.  Our room was 327, which overlooked in the foreground  the pool and a small part of the dining area and , past that, the expansive ocean beyond. While we were not distracted at all by the noise level, the only complaint I had is that because people dining could look up directly at our

This was our 3rd stay at Surf and Sand over the past 8 years.  The hotel is expensive but it provides a unique experience if you get a ocean view room.  Just open the door to the balcony and listen to the waves hitting the shore. They even give you ear plugs if you want to sleep with the door open.  The room we stayed in had no air conditioning so we had to leave the door open.  The first night I had to use the ear plugs but got use to the sound by the second night.  The hotel is a little bit of a walk to downtown but it is a nice walk either on the beach or on the road. Lots of small shops and restaurants on the way.  There is always a lot of activity down on the main beach.  Great place to watch people and see some good volleyball games.  Laguna Beach is a favorite and the

Summary Heading: 14 years in a row at this property
Summary: One of the best properties in Southern California.  The ocean front rooms are spectacular and offer the best sleep that I have all year when we visit.   If this hotel can find a solution to the occasional smoking that can occur on the balconies that would be great!

Gorgeous location in Laguna Beach. Very convenient beach access and access to Laguna Trolley system. Splashes is a great restaurant and has a beautiful sunset view location. Only surprise for us was no air conditioning and the incredibly loud wave break outside of the ocean facing view window. Hotel provided ear plugs with good reason. All-in-all a great visit.

Having read past reviews, and driven by the Surf and Sand Resort times in the past (we are local Los Angeles travelers), we thought this Hotel might be perfect for a two day getaway in advance of the 4th of July Holiday weekend.  We were traveling with our children, ages 7 and 3, and so we booked the "Family Package" in a "Seaview-Deluxe Room."  First, the "Family Package" claimed to offer the children a welcome amenity of cookies and milk upon arrival and this didn't happen. And while the cookies and milk were delivered the next day with housekeeping, it was not the same experience.   Also, the children were to be offered "snores and s'mores" (a Reservations Assistant had even asked for our children's names) and so we had been looking forward to this personalized amenity only

Actually lying in bed at the "resort" as I write this.  Property is beautifully situated, but very confusing.  Rooms are nice but. NO AIRCONDITIONING!  Only ocean breezes which are okey AFTER sunset. Seems they can't decide if they are a family resort, (lots of loud children) or a wedding/honeymoon venue, or  fine dining or???  Right now our nice (warm) room is comfortable but because of the VERY LOUD MOVIE being shown at the pool below we have to close the doors, no cool breeze, no ocean sounds, just King Kong! blaring away at  9:25 pm.  After flying out, and adjusting to the time change we'd appreciate quiet.  On a positive note drinks down in the bar were nice, as was the cheese tray and shrimp cocktails.  The bar is small, loud but festive and right on the beach, so pleasant

Great Hotel, and as long as you are not unfortunate to get a heat wave you will love this Hotel. Spectacular view and complimentary Laguna Beach shuttle service can take you just about anywhere.  (hotel has no A/C but fans and cross breeze were more than sufficient.)

The Surf & Sand Hotel is my favorite hotel, and I've stayed in a fair number of hotels. When you drive onto the property, it is anything but luxurious looking.........but don't be fooled. Paradise awaits. Parking is valet only and pricey, but it got my husband and I to our room that much quicker. When you open the door to your hotel room, you can't help but sigh.........you now have a $1,000,000 view of the ocean. The rooms are plenty big and gorgeous! The balcony is not large, but big enough for a small table and 2 chairs. We had our sliding glass doors open all day and even at night, so that we never missed a moment of hearing the waves crash. The property isn't big, but is has everything you need -- a beautiful uncrowded beach, a bar and restaurant with ocean views, a huge

Summary Heading: The best hotel in Laguna Beach
Summary: I brought my wife to the Surf and Sand for a business trip that was extended for a romantic weekend in Laguna Beach.  I can't imagine a better hotel based on the location, activities, night life, and amazing ocean views from your room.  The conference facilities were perfect for the size group that we had (~90 people).  My wife is already trying to figure out how to get us back there with our two boys.  This is a fantastic getaway spot of couples or business.  The full retail price seems pricey, but it might be inline with the other options in Laguna Beach.  I would recommend going in the off season.

If your budget allows, this is the BEST hotel to stay at. It is pricey, however it is well worth it. The entire staff is friendly, courteous, and efficient - service exceeded expectations. The room was comfortable, however a little small. The deck overlooking the beach/ocean cannot be compared, as well as the experience of staying right on the water, listening to the ocean roar outside your window. Room service/food was delicious!

Property is in an incredible location. Pool sits RIGHT on the ocean so you are able to sit in lounge chairs while watching the waves crash. Splashes restaurant is super romantic and has amazing fish!!

Summary Heading: The Best Place Ever to be at the Beach!
Summary: Complete Experience with Sand, Service & Style. Treated like your the most valued guest that walks the face of the Earth!   Rooms were great, service like no other. Food & Drinks the best ever. In coffee shop make sure you eat a pecan tart! To Die For!

Great hotel right on the beach. We had an oceanfront room high floor and couldn't have asked for better accommodation. Falling asleep to the waves pounding right outside your window. Really awesome! It can be loud though so be prepared. The room was nice and large, well appointed. Will love to return to this piece of paradise, the beach is so beautiful here!

Summary Heading: One good stay, one not so good
Summary: I stayed here for a conference I helped organize and received a room upgrade with a large terrace overlooking the ocean.  Very nice, but didn't to enjoy it much since I was on a business trip.  The service is a bit aloof, not terrible, but not what I'd expect of a resort of this caliber.  A year later, our daughter's wedding was at a winery about 50 miles away and we stayed at the winery for a few days.  The day after the wedding, we decided to stay at the Surf and Sand so we can relax.  I reserved  the same room type, paying for the upgraded view and balcony.  We didn't get the same room, but a smaller balcony on the top floor set back a little from the ocean overlooking the roof of another building. Unfortunately, there was a large loud wedding reception on the rooftop, so the

Back for another wonderful experience.  What can one say about excellence?  The rooms are delightful and the view is breathtaking.  Seriously, you will feel like you are out on a cloud when you lay in your bed and look out the windows at the view of the ocean which is unsurpassed.  The convenience of the hotel to restaurants and shops is wonderful.  The cleanliness of the hotel is great and the spa is a truly restful time. It sits right on the beach and offers such a little slice of heaven. Splashes restaurant offers a nice respite and it has an interesting menu.  You can walk to just about everything that you may need.  I always feel so rested when I leave this place...don't miss it if you come to this area of CA.

Summary Heading: Great location & great upscale beach vibe
Summary: My family frequently stays at the Surf ad Sand.  You can't beat the beach (less crowded than the "main beach" in more central Laguna).  My children frolic in the waves all day, having to only go up the stairs for pool/jacuzzi breaks.  The food service at the beach and pool is excellent.  Beach chairs and umbrellas are included.        We often see dolphins and whales from our ocean-front room.  The crashing waves lull us to sleep at night.  Room service has always been timely and child-friendly.  The onsite restaurant is delicious.  Also, great and possibly more economical restaurants and coffee shops are within walking distance or only a short drive away.      My family loves this hotel, it's great location, and helpful, courteous staff!

Spent four nights at the resort.  Great spot and spacious rooms for beachside. Downside is no a/c, not enough spots at pool to cover guest. Staff struggles to keep up with guest. Took an hour for breakfast at 9 am on a Monday. Room service is slow.  Nice spot but not upto par from a service level with other options in area.

Summary Heading: Excellent Location, Terrific Experience & Fun for the Whole Family!
Summary: Great place all the way around! Visited last week with twin 9-year old boys for 2 days and had a fantastic time. Could not have asked for a better location or experience. Right on the beach and plenty to do. Great service, and super easy access to the pool, restaurant, etc. Can't wait to go back. We had a minor issue with something, and the GM went completely out of her way to make it right -- I was impressed.

Summary Heading: The Views are what it is about
Summary: We spent two nights here and loved balcony views and the sound of the crashing waves.  We had a king room with a balcony right over the sand.  The room was comfortable and nicely furnished and the bath was great with a separate shower and tub.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We will definitely stay here again - can't wait to hear the sound of those waves again!

My husband and I have been coming to the Surf & Sand Resort for over 20 years, it is definitely our favorite place to stay. We love everything about this hotel, but the staff members are what keep us coming back. Every staff member shows pride in their work and in their hotel. They anticipate your needs and are always there to assist with a smile. They make you feel like you are the only guest staying at the hotel. The hotel rooms have a resort beach feel and offer balconies overlooking the beach. The hotel is very well kept and maximizes the ocean views to the fullest, from the 15FiftyFive outdoor lounge, to the pool area, to the Splashes Restaurant and Bar. Splashes Bar is one of the best places along the coast to enjoy a cocktail at sunset.  The spa is intimate in nature and

This charming property is a great combination of fun and luxury.  Staff is wonderful and grounds are very well kept.  Be ware, small pool area is overrun by children in summer months, which families will love, couples looking to get away from kids will not.. The rooms are very well done and offer that perfect Beachy vibe and luxury feel that most love. Splashes Bar, below the restaurant, is a great little gem on the property.  Great food, delicious drinks and killer views of the beach and ocean are served up in this fun little room below the pool deck.  If you are working while staying here be ware that WIFI is spotty and Verizon does not work at all in the rooms.  Was this Surf N Sands way of telling me to stop working and enjoy the beach life? Maybe this is on purpose-

My husband and I spent our anniversary at the Surf & Sand Resort. We were greeted by a bottle of champagne and his n hers cupcakes, and a handwritten note wishing us a happy stay. Every detail was lovely - from the beautiful rooms (we stayed in the basic, but it was far from basic!) that included a balcony overlooking the ocean, to relaxing by the pool side, wonderful massages, and a drink at Splashes, the resort's restaurant. We were tempted to stay for dinner but also wanted to explore Laguna Beach during our short stay. Downtown was a short and pleasant walk. The next morning we had our breakfast in the terrace and basked in what was to us a perfect getaway. Highly recommended!

From the sound of the waves to the smell of the see breeze, this is the most relaxing resort in Orange County. Just steps from the beach with a beautiful restaurant and pool. The staff here is always so friendly and welcoming. The resort has this amazing "beachy" feel to it. The restaurant is beautiful and open to the ocean, there isn't a bad table in the place. It is a very laid back, relaxing environment.

Summary Heading: Simply The Best of The Best!
Summary: The oceanfront location is to die for.....any closer your getting wet!  But honestly, the best  part is the service...the people anticipate your needs very well!  A bellman in the parking area saw me with an ice bucket looking around....he found me and guided me to the ice.....simple yes, but how many would seek you out to help?  This is the attitude throughout....over the top no attitude...pro's.  We will be back for many more anniversary's.  Thank you for making our time so memorable!  Ken in the Splash's restraunt is such a treasure....loves his job, and is always smiling.....Makes a great martini as well.....Til next time....all the best

Beautiful, romantic and pure luxury. Rooms are spacious with a drem come true view. Just a perfect for holiday. Ocean is in front of you, full view. Beautiful Hotel, super romantic . Neir by is a small town, also full of great things to do. Perfect place to spend weekend or more.....

Summary Heading: expensive, no AC, Jersey Shore clients, but gorgeous view and the room was lovely
Summary: No A/C.  Surprising and never saw this on the website.  If you don't want the noise of a fan or the ocean (and not everyone in my family did), you will be very hot.  The room, however, was lovely.    We checked in early expecting to spend the day at the pool which overlooks the ocean.  Unfortunately, there was a group visiting that were very lewd, overserved, loud, and highly sexual in the pool.  All families with kids had to leave based on their behavior.  When security was called, they did not ask the group to leave although they informed the manager on duty that they did.  I am not sure this is an appropriate resort for families if the "Jersey Shore" crowd is a normal client.  This was very disappointing.

We stayed at this hotel in the 1990's and recently decided to return for a two day stay.  It really has remained an outstanding facility over the years.  Everything about this property is exquisite. The rooms are elegant and clean.  The grounds are impeccable.  The views are to die for.  I have stayed in many beach side hotels over the years, but this one seems to capture the essence of what a beach resort should be. It exudes serenity and relaxation.  I literally felt that I could just sit on our balcony and enjoy the magnificent views without doing anything else. I usually try to include other activities when I travel such as golf and shopping and sightseeing. I didnt need to plan any other activities during our stay here.  Everything you need is right here.  There is not one

The room is great.  The view is outstanding - if you like watching dolphin play in the ocean.  The staff is beyond friendly and helpful.  The amenities in the room are awesome - robes, slippers, fireplace, balcony, soaking tub, chocolates.  I just wish my family was here with me, but I would bring them here in a heart beat.

Summary Heading: A beautiful resort property in the heart of Laguna.
Summary: From the minute you enter the secluded courtyard there's a sense of overwhelming serenity and peace. The beautiful facilities, delicious food and outstanding personalized / doting service make this resort a one-of-a kind facility. The rooms are beautifully appointed, the views are fantastic, the facilities are well appointed (amazing pool and Jacuzzi) and the staff is beyond wonderful. They define excellent customer service. I look forward to my next visit. In the meantime, I'll keep dreaming about my two days there.

stayed at the surf and sand at the end of my americian holiday in at the end of my holiday and this I have to say is the best way to finish any holiday. Beautiful accommodation,stunning views , great bar and food short walk to town with lots of great shops on the way. I haven't stopped telling all my friend how good this

There are many hotels/condos/rentals in California that provide ocean views or access, but the Surf and Sand is unique, to my knowledge, because you are on the beach.  Look down (not out in the distance) from your balcony and you see sand and waves--amazing.  Our corner king unit in the main tower was beautifully decorated, great view, clean and modern (bathroom small, but stylish, with all the right stuff) and a great bed. All of the staff were professional, friendly and overall just great. Our only negative comment (and this is this visit only) is that management failed to inform me of construction at the property next door that directly impacted my premium level (and priced) room.  Neither did they offer any apology, rate reduction or resort credit for the inconvenience.

Summary Heading: No better hotel in Laguna Beach
Summary: I don't think you could find a better hotel in Laguna Beach or on the California coast for that matter. The hotel sits directly on the beach, all the room views are breathtaking and you're literally steps away from the water. This hotel encompasses what a beach vacation should be. Plus the bed was so comfortable! I loved every minute I spent at Surf & Sand.

Summary Heading: A beautiful setting for a special splurge
Summary: Located on the beach, Surf and Sand is an upscale hotel with comfortable rooms, splendid ocean views, terrific breakfasts and mostly wonderful customer service. Some of the staff at the concierge could have been a bit more obliging and did not go out of their way to help, but the overall atmosphere from the minute one drives up to the hotel is one of graciousness. The hotel is presently being remodeled so there is some work during the day. Be prepared to fall asleep to the sound of the waves crashing onto the beach and enjoy the splurge.

This year for our Anniversary my husband and I went to the Surf and Sand Resort.  We stayed in the Surfside King room.  The room was fantastic.  We live in Orange County and are used to nice ocean views.  This room was different.  The water comes right up to your room.  It was beautiful and relaxing.  We are used to the ocean and could not believe how loud the waves were.  They even give complimentary ear plugs because it was so loud.  I found it very relaxing.  We sat on the balcony and watched the beautiful sunset.  They also knew it was our anniversary and they gave us a bottle of champagne and chocolates.  It was a thoughtful touch.  We got rooms service sent to our room and it was delicious.  It was from the on property restaurant.  We also went to that restaurant for

There are probably only a couple weeks throughout the entire year that would require air conditioning in this hotel.  Unfortunately, we picked 3 days during these times.  It wasn't completely unbearable, but for $500+ per night, I never thought to even check into whether or not they had air conditioning.    They are right on the beach and they also have a pool and hot tub for guest use.  The bathroom was nice, however, the shower was quite small.  There was no ventilation fan in the bathroom and it would get quite hot and humid in there while showering.    The beds were very comfortable.  Felt more like home rather than a hotel room.  The hotel staff was very nice to us and seemed genuinely happy to see and help us each time.  The sunsets were beautiful each night.  You can

My boyfriend and I had two days off at the same time and booked a little getaway at the Surf and Sand.  It was PERFECT!   We so needed to decompress and relax - to feel like we were actually far away from our home (which btw is about 1 1/2 hours away) - to feel like we were in a luxurious and upscale place.  MISSION ACCOMPLISHED.  We already booked the same room for August.  This place is amazing.   Whether you like the pool or the beach - both were so easy and low maintenance.   The beach was SOOOOOO LOW MAINTENANCE.   A staff member Kyle helped he out - brought me two beach chairs, towels, and an umbrella.   I also was nursing an ankle injury and every hour or so would bring me a bag of ice to ice my ankle.   He was so great and I didn't have to lift a finger.   The beach was

I stay at the Surf and Sand every opportunity I have when I need a get away; the hotel is right in the middle of Laguna Beach which has wonderful shopping, restaurants and nightlife.  However, it may be available but you may never want to leave Surf and Sand to go outside to anything - no reason!  The hotel is beachfront; the rooms are fantastic; the pool is unbelievable; their restaurants (and room service) is wonderful and I cannot say enough about the staff and the service.  I have stayed in all areas of the hotel; the tower is my favorite but all the rooms are great. I have stayed their with many different people, from friends to family and romantic weekends and never have I had anyone disappointed that I have taken with me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Surf & Sand! We're so thrilled to hear that you've enjoyed your stays with us, and we look forward to future visits as well!

Summary Heading: Laguna Surf and Sand is great!
Summary: This place is RIGHT on the beach in Laguna Beach and the views are awesome.    Hotel is very upscale and all the staff were incredibly friendly.     Our Ford Focus was quite humble in relation to Mercedes, etc., but staff paid no attention to that.    It was a fantastic place to celebrate an 80th birthday!

We stayed for a quick seaside getaway and were not disappointed. It is pricey but the view, location and service are top notch. First - the view - our room was in the tower with an ocean view, Lovely d√©cor and amenities. Free Wi-Fi; nice sized balcony where we could see swimmers, divers, paddle boarders and the sunset; all this along with the rhythmic sound of the waves made us feel like we were far away from home and work.  Next - Location. In my opinion the location is PERFECT.  It is right on the beach. While it's not on downtown/main beach, it's walking distance to some of my favorite places in Laguna, for example, K'Ya bistro (LOVE this place - food is unique but not weird and delicious, e.g., lobster risotto is so so good), the Rooftop Lounge, Mozambique restaurant

My wife and 11 year old son joined me for a four day stay. It was our first stay in the area and could not have been more relaxing.  We stayed on the fourth floor and was fascinated by the sound of the ocean.  It may be too much for some but was quite tranquil to us being from North Oakland County, MI. The food from room service was as good or better than actually in the restaurant.  Our server set  the table out on the balcony. Just was a splendid stay.  We will absolutely be back to stay again this year I hope.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location - depending on the room!
Summary: We have recently returned from five days in The Surf & Sand. We were originally allocated room 317 which I have to say along side room 318 must be the worst rooms in the hotel, so when you check in if you are given these rooms save yourself a journey. After complaining, they couldn't move us that night but did the following into The Tower block. It was like being in a different hotel - room was bigger, better furnished and the view was spectacular. The only complaint was that the sound proofing is really, really poor.... We were awoken by the couple next door 'rutting' like they were on a film set at 10.27pm, 1.20am and 4.46am. They then followed this with a lengthy dialogue. Clearly a newly formed relationship for obvious reasons. I appreciate it is relative but we could hear

Summary Heading: Always love the Surf and Sand!!
Summary: This would be our third visit to the resort in the past Year. We  were at another hotel in Laguna Beach last year and were not satisfied with our accommodations or service on our first night there. My daughter and I went on a run and saw the Surf and Sand Resort , went in to check availability. They were wonder, did have availability and even allowed me to see the room they thought would suit our family. We loved it! Right on the beach, beautiful clean rooms and the amenities were just what we were looking for. The pool being right on the beach and the hotel it self not too large entices me.  I have a 9 year old and felt very safe having her running back and forth from pool to beach. My teen agers loved it as well. The pool and beach staff were great! Always making sure we had
Manager Response: Shelli, Thank you very much for reviewing Surf & Sand Resort! We're thrilled to hear how you and your family have enjoyed your stays with us, and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: What an incredible night we had at splashes! The view was spectacular, it was like having dinner right on the beach. Our Sommelier Kyle, made the perfect wine and entree pairings. Wonderful vegan options as well as mouth watering short-ribs and Halibut. The service was perfect, relaxed and comfortable, we could have stayed all night. We will be back soon.

Beautiful hotel right on the water.  It appeared as though almost every room on the property has an ocean view.  Beautiful, clean grounds and friendly staff.  Amazing restaurant with ocean views from vitrually every table.  Excellent food!  We had breakfast, lunch and dinner at Splashes restaurant and each meal was delicious with great service.  The only reason I'm not giving this hotel 5 stars is because we found it to be extremely noisy.  We had a hard time sleeping the first night due to the group of teenagers above us.  We also tried to take a nap the second day because we hardly slept the first night and it was so nosy with people walking around our room and housekeeping staff working around our room that we couldn't sleep.  This would be a difficult hotel to take a baby or

I stayed here for a week and felt like I was in heaven. My room was right on the beach and the room was impeccable. Service was very attentive from the valets to bell hops to restaurant staff. I would highly recommend staying here if you are looking for a place to stay in Laguna.

Our family thoroughly enjoyed surf and sand hotel. It is very different than any hotel we have stayed in before. This boutique hotel offers a swank environment for young and old alike and is also family friendly. The staff is excellent all around. The rooms are enormous and beautiful and offer queen beds with luxury linens.  All rooms are Located right on the ocean the waves will rock you to sleep. Splashes restaurant is delicious and offers high end and unique dishes. Our kids loved the breakfast. Cocktails by the pool and at the sunset view bar are a treat. Walk to shops and restaurants. Although a little pricey,  We will return.

This hotel could not be any closer to the Pacific Ocean if it tried. The waves are inches away from the main building and enjoyed by surfers, bathers, and the plain old scaredies like us. We had a suite with a large patio balcony on the fourth floor and the view was tremendous. Pre warned about the noise of the waves overnight we were duly kept awake most of the night, only to discover that the patio doors and a bedroom window had been open all night! Earplugs are thoughtfully provided but were absolutely unnecessary the following night once all the windows were properly closed! Lovely pool and downstairs bar with, of course, tremendous views of the sea. Ate in Splashes restaurant on first night but only small plates so can't comment on full blown meal. Very attentive staff

This place has to be seen to be believed - the waves come right up and touch the hotel at high tide! Superb rooms, superb views, superb food and helpful and friendly staff. A bit pricey but overall excellent and one of our favourite hotels in the world.

Don't let the PCH frontage fool you.  This hotel is right on the main street but miles and miles from the rest of the world.  The suites with the sun decks are posh and airy.  The service has been impeccable since Jon first showed us to the room.  Breakfast was delicious and unique...who puts dates in an omelette...?...but it works.  A fresh flower arrangement, not just some stems, was on the desk with a card.  Ashley at the beach will bring you whatever you want (as long as it isn't alcoholic...apparently that's illegal on CA beaches). Seafood salad was light with lemon vinegrette, while the caesar salad was memorable...and when's the last time you could say that?  The best part?  Some really scary looking rocks sort of block the way to the main Laguna waterfront, and most
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am thrilled to hear about your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort!  Creating memories for our guests is what we strive for by training with our team throughout the year.    We look forward to your next stay with us!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: This is the most beautiful hotel!! It is our favorite place.  Every room has a fantastic ocean view, but we prefer the Tower rooms.  The waves literally crash right outside your window.  The food and service by the pool are outstanding, especially Kyle and Mitchell.  They are so friendly and knew us by name every morning when we went to get our spots.  Splashes restaurant is the most romantic place to have dinner.  Food is amazing and the ambiance is even more spectacular.  If you want to celebrate a special occasion or just relax and be pampered then this is definitely the place for you!!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am thrilled to hear your pool experience and dining at Splashes exceeded your expectations!  We look forward to your next stay here with us.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager  Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: I came here for a small conference which meant we were inside much of the time. But when we weren't, we had the most beautiful views of the ocean imaginable. Everything (except the conference room) is set up to take maximum advantage of the location--even the placement of the bed in the room!  The pool and spa look out on the sand. After walking down the beach to town and back, we slept with the window open so we could hear the ocean.  In addition, the food from the restaurants was delicious and interesting and all the staff, from the valets to the waiters and front desk staff, we're helpful and accommodating. We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  As we always strive to create wonderful memories for our guests, it is a true joy to have it posted on Trip Advisor!  It will be a pleasure to share your comments with our entire team.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: We wanted a close by location for a 3 day anniversary trip. I had been told of the luxurious accommodations and fantastic location of the Surf and Sand from a business associate so we decided to give it a try. Located on the 101 in Laguna Beach this Resort is right on the sand. There was a slight mix up with the rate of our stay but that was quickly taken care of by a very friendly and helpful desk staff.  We stayed in a Tower King room that faces the ocean. We were on the 4th floor and the view was absolutely breathtaking!! The room itself is spacious and VERY clean. There was a welcome fruit and cheese plate that we enjoyed with a bottle of wine we brought with us on the balcony. I absolutely LOVE the sound of the ocean...it puts me to sleep and I love waking up to it. For

Let's start (and end) with the views. Whether sitting in my room, the restaurant, the terraces or the pool, the views of the ocean and sunset were amazing.  That alone will make you relax.  Add on the delicious food from the restaurant, the great service from the staff and the terrific location, and you have the perfect vacation.  This hotel is directly on the beach and within walking distance of the town center.  I should note that this is a very family friendly hotel.  If you are looking for a quiet, romantic get-away, this might not be the best choice.  After awhile, my travelling companions and I joked about the 'kid soup of the day' (lots of children in swim diapers in the jacuzzi!). Luckily, if you visit the spa, there is a separate jacuzzi for adults only.  The Surf and

Summary Heading: Spectacular you have to see it to believe it!
Summary: We have been enjoying the Surf and Sand Resort for over ten years; now we fondly refer to it as our home away from home. The service is beyond compare;the ocean view is like none other. Splashes is phenomenal and the Sunday street tacos are awesome. The staff is top notch making guests feel special and accommodating our every need. This place is a must...make your next vacation the Surf and Sand, you will not be disappointed. V & M

My wife, two young kids, and I stayed here for four nights this past week. While the weather was less than perfect, I cannot honestly say this resort is. We stayed in an upper level tower room and the size of the room and the views are amazing. The resort staff were all pleasant and helpful with the valets greeting you by name when you return to the resort with your car after a day away from the hotel. The pool area is great with poolside bar/food service and the kids loved playing on the beach. While pricey, as is the food in their onsite restaurant, it is worth the money to fall asleep and wake up to the sounds of the surf hitting the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words Jonathan! We're so glad to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay regardless of the weather. Hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: I used to LOVE this hotel. This is the first time I'm disappointed.
Summary: Oceanfront rooms are spectacular, BUT -- avoid rooms right over the pool if you want to avoid  screaming kids. To get true quiet, you will  have to close your windows- which of course means you also close out the sound of the  waves- which is why we were there in the first place.!!! Also the hotel seems to be saving money on housekeeping staff- our rooms weren't cleaned until 4 pm - and no cards are provided where you can ask for early housekeeping. Also, cell phone service is virtually non-existent for ATT subscribers like me (better for Verizon-- it seems those ads don't lie!) , and many internet users in the morning means slow downloads, surprising for a premium hotel.

Stayed one night for a special occasion. Hands down the best view of the beach, but the desk staff can use some customer service training. Did not feel appreciated. After my checkout, the hotel general manager sent me multiple emails asking me to fill out their survey, so I provided detailed constructive feedback regarding my stay. No follow up at all.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am disappointed to hear about the lack of service and follow through you have received.   I will be looking into our survey system to ensure what you experienced does not get repeated.  In addition, I would love the opportunity to speak with you directly to better understand the details of your stay.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: Location, Location, Location I don't know if there are words to explain what a fantastic place this is. Great clean rooms on the beach, wonderful mouth watering dishes in their restaurant which sits right on the beach, great welcoming staff, courteous valet guys, great drinks at the bar downstairs on the beach. On the beach is the right explanation. Would recommend this place to anyone.

We're "regulars" at the Surf and Sand because our stay is always most enjoyable. With all rooms having an unobstructed view of the ocean, you never have to leave the resort to enjoy a relaxing time at the beach.  In fact, we order room service for dinner and eat on our balcony where the view is better than any restaurant!  (And the food is just as good, too!)  The staff is friendly and most accommodating, and they make you feel like a true guest of theirs. I highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for a great place to stay in Laguna!

Can't say enough how much we loved the resort! Beautiful large ocean facing rooms. We loved our breakfast and dinner at splashes! We had our kids with us and this hotel was above and beyond our expectations! The pool area was lovely! They staff very friendly but have to mention the gentleman who I think his name was Ames or Anu he set up our chairs and umbrellas right on the beach and was always making sure we didn't need anything! He was always working and helping the guests! There was also a wonderful lady who worked by the pool who brought us drinks and towl soon as we needed a new one! You can't find a better beach location resort than this!

We decided to stay in Laguna for an additional night, spur of the moment, we drove to the Surf and Sand. The had a great room facing the beach one floor up. It was very nice. We had looked at this hotel a few years ago and decided not to stay as it was not very nice. They did a remodel, great job. Had everything we needed.

Summary Heading: High end place, can be noisy
Summary: Stayed one night while attending a business meeting at the hotel. Nice large room with comfortable bed, spacious bathroom (although the toilet got backed up), usual room amenities. There is a safe which fits a laptop. Some noise from nearby rooms and from the fire pit, where people gather at night -  must be why they offer ear plugs. WiFi included. There is a fitness room (I didn't visit it this time). The staff is way too obvious fishing for tips e.g. trying to snatch a carry-on bag from your hand to carry it a few steps across the lobby, etc.

I travel for my job...this is one of the few places that I would spend my own money to come back to for a personal vacation.  Try it you will fall in love with it!  The proximity of the room to the ocean is outstanding and certainly an experience that you will not forget.  Having breakfast overlooking the ocean early in the morning from the restaurant...there are no words to describe the beauty.

This is a great resort located on the beach. The staff was very friendly and attentive. There are a couple of restaurants on the property with prices that are not overly expensive. At this resort you are within walking distance to many restaurants, art galleries, shopping a public beach. This resort does not have air conditioning which was not a problem in early March, but could be a concern in July or August. I will come back.

My wife and I, along with my infant daughter, stayed 4 nights at the S&S while we vacationed in Southern California. I spent a little bit more money than I usually do, because I was about to begin chemotherapy, and wanted to do something really special with my little family before it all began.  A few days before we were scheduled to arrive, S&S called my cell phone and said they had noticed I would be traveling with an infant - and asked if they could put a crib in our room, free of charge. I thought that was really cool of them.  We pulled in after a long drive, and were greeted by energetic and very friendly valets, the helped us out of the car, and a bellman immediately got all of our baggage onto a cart for us and directed us to the front desk.   The desk agent was happy

Summary Heading: Lulled to sleep by the Ocean
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Surf & Sand this past weekend. Unfortunately, it decided to rain this particular weekend in So.Cal, but who cares when you are at the beach right?! Our room was on the sixth floor with an amazing view of the ocean. I had hoped to score a room on floors 7-9, but for whatever reason we ended up on the 6th floor. The room itself was classy and clean. Our bellman was extremely friendly and knowledgable. The best part of the room was being able to sleep with the door open and being lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves. We ate at Splashes on our first night and really enjoyed the food. The service was also exceptional. My husband and I did use the jacuzzi on Saturday morning and had the whole place to ourselves. The pool area is very nice and it

My husband and I decided to stay in Laguna at the last minute and truly enjoyed staying at the Surf & Sand Resort.  This is the first time we've stayed in Laguna and I don't think we will stay anywhere else if we visit again.  We don't live far away and it can be hard to splurge when you're so close to home, but it was worth it.  It was great to listen to the waves crashing on the beach below and the spectacular ocean view was awesome!  We will keep our eyes open for a great deal so we can stay here again.

I really enjoy staying at this hotel.   It can get a bit expensive during the summer time but so much fun to stay here.   The hotel sits right on the ocean and has awesome views.   I only live 15 miles away but every time I stay here it feels like I‚Äôm on vacation.  The bar area is nice to sit and listen to the waves crash below you.  The pool area is so enjoyable and I can easily hang out here all day and run up a decent pool bar tab.  The rooms are nice but really nothing special.  Don‚Äôt get the room directly in front of the swimming pool gate or you‚Äôll hear it slam nonstop.  Also when eating room service on your balcony watch out for seagulls‚Ä¶they have no problem landing on your table while you are still eating.   The location is great with tons of restaurants, bars, shopping

Summary Heading: Surf &Sand is a fantastic weekend get away!
Summary: We have been coming to Surf & Sand for many years. We enjoy everything the resort has to offer. First the spectacular ocean view! The rooms are the perfect size and always spotless. Our visit last weekend was the first time we stayed in a junior suite, the room was bigger than we had stayed in before it was a real treat. We really enjoy sitting by the fire pits in the morning with a cup of coffee and at night with a drink to watch the sunset. The resort is walking distance to some wonderful shops. The restaurant on the property is very good. From the moment you drive on to the property to a relaxing lunch on the beach,the Customer Service is Outstanding!!!! The Team at Surf & Sand is the true reason we keep coming back. Thank you for giving us a wonderful spot to make fantastic
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.    We are thrilled to hear you had a fantastic stay and enjoyed our guestrooms, amenities, and service.  I will be sharing your comments with our team.  The walking distance to many wonderful shops in Laguna is a great plus - I agree!  We look forward to your return,  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Pure perfection 40 years in the making
Summary: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary at the Resort as we had done on our wedding night.  Our stay, though short, was the perfect way to start our trip down memory lane.  The location is stunning and as if sunset from our balcony wasn't enough, the sounds of the ocean right below, provided the perfect romantic soundtrack to our evening.  Our room was elegantly appointed and spacious with breath taking views, but perhaps what was most memorable was the service.  At check-in we were greeted so warmly and our anniversary acknowledged without prompting.  The recommended dinner at Splashes and it truly is a must when you stay, offering great food and warm friendly experience.  I also suggest you start off you're evening at the patio lounge, great
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It is a true joy for us at Surf & Sand Resort to create special memories for our guests.  We appreciate you choosing us to help celebrate such a joyous occasion, as your 40th Wedding Anniversary!    Thank you for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Short stay No Air Conditioning in rooms
Summary: Check in and were taken to our room. There was an outdoor walk to the next building and the down a flight of stairs to our room which faced the ocean and the afternoon sun. The room had shutters that did not close all the way to block out the sun.  The room was hot so we looked for the A/C thermostat. There was none to be found and then called reception who told us that there was no A/C in the hotel.  Neither the web site nor my travel agent mentioned there was no A/C which I expected from experience with many 4 & 5 star hotels. I was told by the front desk that it was not listed in the list of amenities shown on the web site.  We cancelled our reservation and left.  If you can stay in an non air conditioned room this is really a nice place
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  My sincere apologies that you were unable to experience a pleasant stay at Surf & Sand. As our very valued guest, I appreciate your feedback so that we are able to improve upon our services.     I understand your frustration in our lack of air conditioning.  I am very pleased to inform you we have been in the process of researching options to  include air conditioning for all of our guestrooms.  As with any project of this magnitude, it will be a lengthy process;   Please feel free to call me directly at 949-793-8054 for any future assistance.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: Stayed 3 nights for a work trip.  Brought my wife and 7 year old with me.  The hotel is great.  The location and views are phenomenal.  We loved the area and were able to get to Disney one day.  The drive wasn't too bad.  I highly recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.    I was thrilled to hear you and your family enjoyed our property as well as our proximity to Disneyland!  We hope to see you again soon,  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: Stayed three nights for a conference - so didn't have time to fully enjoy the amenities and the ambience.  When you think California, beaches, surfing and sunsets this place is the epitomy.  The hotel sits directly on Pacific Coast Highway - but no rooms fact or back the road, so this is not an issue.  You are a bit away from the main shopping area in Laguna Beach - but it is walkable.  Staff was very welcoming - from valets to the check-in folks. Lobby is minimalist to say the least.  The room was very nice - furnished very much in a beach motifff,very nice. The king bed was comfortable, but not the latest or greatest pillow top you see in many hotels.  My one complaint, the pillows were not very good - probably time to replace them.  The bathroom was nice sized with a jetted
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  I am pleased to hear your enjoyed our services, guestrooms and views.   I will have our Housekeeping Director address the pillow concerns immediately.  Having a good night sleep for our guests is a top priority and will ensure all pillows are of the same quality.  We hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to Laguna Beach.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: My husband and I took our 2 kids to this resort and this is by far the best place we have stayed at in California. Every single staff member makes you feel so welcome!   You are literally right on the beach and when you look down from your balcony all you see is sand.   If you are looking for an amazing place on the beach to stay this is it!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you so much for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor.  I am thrilled to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next return!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Lovely overnight at Surf & Sand Resort
Summary: My boyfriend and I had a lovely getaway overnight at the Surf & Sand Resort in January. We loved our room, which was directly over the sand and the ocean. We preferred the sound of the waves, but the hotel provides ear plugs for those who don't. We spent as much time as possible on the balcony taking in the restful and beautiful view, and also walked on the beach below, just steps away! The room was very comfortable and the amenities were also great. Only downside was that we were on a low floor and could hear the people on the beach below us who were there to surf and have fun. Nothing wrong with them, just more noise than I would have liked. Also, I realize that a room overlooking the ocean is a very special thing, but the price of the room will make it difficult for us to go

We stayed at Surf and Sand Resort from February 14 to 17, 2014. I booked the oceanfront room with Expedia since I did not see anything available on their website for the time I wanted. The hotel ended up being everything I wanted. I wanted to hear the ocean waves and we did. There is a nice short beach walk that starts right at the hotel. Room was cleaned in the morning and prepared for the night. Pool area was a nice place to hang out - bar, music. Staff was friendly and answered questions. Their "make your own breakfast burrito and pancakes" morning service was great. The only suggestion I would give is to hire few more waiters in the Splashes restaurant and in the Pacific Perk/Gift shop. We had to wait for service for a bit since no one was found at the Pacific Perk one
Manager Response: Nina, Thank you for your review of Surf & Sand! We're so glad to hear that you had a fantastic stay, and we appreciate your feedback regarding service at Pacific Perk and Splashes Restaurant. I've shared your comments with our dining staff. We look forward to your next stay!

Summary Heading: Great place for vacation, weekend trip or just a short visit.
Summary: We had a great stay at Surf and Sand. It's a nice hotel right at the beach. Not even Montage is that close to the beach. So we really enjoyed it to go out for a walk at the beach, swim in the pool and enjoying the view (and the whales that were visible right from the poolside). Very friendly and helpful staff.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am happy to hear you were able to enjoy our pool and beach facilities (and of course our Surf Dolphins that perform!).  We look forward to your next visit with us.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Perfect Laguna Destination / Incredible Dining Experience
Summary: My wife and I went to Laguna earlier this month to visit family and decided to stay at Surf & Sand.  The choice was a HOME RUN.  Surf & Sand strikes the perfect balance of indigenous Laguna charm with resort style amenities, dining and service. Speaking of service, Ashley our waitress at Splashes was great, and curated an incredibly delicious lunch for us.  Get the brussel sprouts by the way...they are UNREAL.  Also, a sunset cocktail at Splashes Bar is a MUST as well.  Can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am thrilled that about your lunch at Splashes and will certainly be passing along your comments to Ashley and our Executive Chef.  We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager  Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: Located on the Beach!  First rate rooms;  Spacious, excellent amenities, and crashing waves as background.  Staff is excellent in all aspects of service.  Resort is very accommodating and very easy to work with.          Splashes Restaurant is very appealing.  Great view of Beach, sea breeze, interesting style in table setting.  They have plenty of heater for those chilly Days and Nights.  Good choices on Menu of meals and cocktails.       Be aware long walk to Laguna Beach Central,  but lots to see and do on way.  Check-in is at 4:00pm  a little late?  This Resort is awesome and you will enjoy!

Years ago, my husband and I came to California from Atlanta for a business trip.  On the last day, we came down to the Surf & Sand Resort.  We had lunch and spent the day at the resort and walking on the beach. The service, friendliness of the staff and food were terrific.  The location is incredible.  We had such a fantastic and wonderful day, when my husband was asked to transfer to California, we immediately said yes!  Thank you, Surf & Sand for changing my life!  It is truly a very special place.
Manager Response: That's wonderful Susan! We're so happy to have made a positive impact on you and your husband's story! I will share with our staff =)

Summary: This is a nice hotel at a great location.  I'm guessing its the most expensive resort to stay at in the area.  Despite a nice view and easy beach access, the lack of air conditioning makes it unreasonable for the price.  In the summer months, you must keep a fan on and the windows open to stay reasonably comfortable.  This leads to a very noisy night given the waves constantly crashing just outside the window.  Its hard to enjoy yourself when you're struggling to fall asleep due to extreme heat an noise.  They do provide ear plugs but, again, at the prices they charge air conditioning is not too much to ask for.  Stay only during late fall to early spring.

Fabulous views of the ocean make a stay at Surf and Sand completely relaxing.  On top of that the service is excellent, -- the perfect balance of friendliness and professionalism - from every employee from valet, to reception, restaurant host and waiter as well as the spa personnel.  I recommend the resort very highly.

excellent service, beautiful property by the ocean, room  ammenities are just right, mini service bar has great selections to chose from. room service menu is just perfect, i you like wine and cheese you will not be disappointed, cheese selection is good

A yearly pilgrimage from San Diego to this fine resort during the Christmas -New Year holiday season is an absolute must. The rooms are very spacious and well-appointed -each one featuring a panoramic ocean view and replete with just about every amenity you can think of...even nightly turn-down service. The staff is friendly and efficient and the service first-rate. We just love the atmosphere and overall ambiance and consider this fine establishment a "home away from home".

Summary Heading: How could anyone be stressed at this resort?
Summary: First class from start to finish.   Check in experience: Seamless. Valets greeted cars, took baggage. Lovely reception area, well appointed, seashell color and decor. Our room was not far ‚Äì room 338. Not a plus that we needed to lift our heavy baggage a few times over one step or a short flight of stairs to get to our room. We had the option of having a porter bring it to our room, but I am conditioned to take my own. If I was less able, I would not have been able to manage this on my own. I like to be able to manage on my own. For those who this is important, it should be mentioned upon arrival.   Room: Beautiful d√©cor, again in the soothing seashore colour d√©cor, soft beiges, whites, coral decorative touches. The balcony gave out onto the nearby sandy beach, palm trees, an

What a nice surprise! I knew it was overlooking the ocean but I had no idea it was going to be so close that we felt like we were on a cruise ship! We had the best time ever and we only live forty minutes away, yet it felt like we were in another state! The service was fantastic and the restaurant was so good we went both nights of our stay. Bruce and Alfredo were so kind and every recommendation they made was perfect! I am in the hospitality industry and I know what to look for, you can not go wrong with this beautiful property. Everything was within walking distance. We didn't even use the car after we checked in. Oh and don't forget to spend an afternoon at the spa while you are there. Also we had dolphins see us off on our last day. they were literally playing in the surf

Summary Heading: Waves, Ocean, Sand under your Balcony
Summary: I live in San Diego and every year for my birthday, I try out one of the five star resorts in Laguna Beach.  So far I have tried the Ritz, Montage and St Regis.  I have ALWAYS wanted to stay at the Surf and Sand but it is really pricey.  I took advantage of a Black Friday special that made my stay somewhat affordable.   The basics of the hotel...  It is located on PCH about a mile from the heart of Laguna Beach.  It is about a 20 minute walk to the main town area.  Around the hotel itself, the dining is limited outside of Splashes (the hotel restaurant).  There is a Ralph's grocery store about 6 blocks down and a liquor store about a block away north of the hotel for drinks and snacks.   There are plenty of stores around the hotel but if you want to be IN Laguna Beach, I would

Purchased a living social deal for a one night stay for my husband's birthday- I upgraded our room for an additional $40.00 to a room directly on the ocean front- originally was booked in the sea view room overlooking pool and ocean- I was very happy with our room and view; however the pool /ocean view room would also have been great as almost every room has a view. Our view was outstanding. We took advantage of all of the amenities at the resort except the spa. We enjoyed 2 meals at Splashes, one of the hotel's restaurants. Dinner and service was exceptional.  Overall the hotel service is casual yet attentive. It is extremely expensive, but it has a laid back vibe because it is located on the beach- not pretentious. My only complaint, and I know it sounds lame is the noise

Once here there is no need to leave - very comfortable rooms, excellent food and room service, very family friendly, excellent beach walking. It is well located if one does wish to venture out to explore more of Laguna Beach. Staff are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We would very happily return for another visit.

Had a terrific 3-day stay with my wife; right on the ocean in Laguna Beach. A very 'beachy' place - great service and awesome views of the ocean. Room very comfortable - only issue is that it can get a bit warm in the room in the afternoon if you keep the slider closed. Only reason to do that is to somewhat block the very loud waves. We loved the closeness of the waves, but it may be a bit noisy for some. All depends on what you're looking for in a beach-side stay. We really enjoyed ours!

Summary Heading: The only place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: The Surf and Sand is the perfect destination no matter what the occasion and no matter what the make up of your party.  The Surf and Sand is a wonderful destination for couples enjoying a romantic weekend, friends getting together for some fun and/or families wanting a beach vacation.  I have been going to The Surf and Sand since before I could walk.  And, before that, my mom stayed at the Surf and Sand when it was a fraction of its size.  I have celebrated nearly every memorable occasion in my life there.  It is a magical place.    The Surf and Sand is the only resort in Laguna that is on the ocean.  That's right - you simply walk down the steps and you are on the beach.  There is no bus to PCH that you have to get on...you just walk out of your room.  You can smell and feel

I admit that I didn't see much of the resort except for reception, the restaurant and our room,,,,,,but what a great room! Beautifully decorated, comfy bed, and 20 feet from the ocean 6 floors up! Just high enough that we didn't really hear the few people that were on the beach. Fabulous balcony that was quite private. The room service,,,,,, amazing. We had a delicious cheese platter on the balcony watching the ocean before dinner and eggs benedict the next moring with coffee, all while enjoying the view. The staff was attentive and detail oriented. We would go back!

A very cool atmosphere. Conveniently located. You can walk to restaurants and shops and galleries. Great food in oceanfront settings. The oceanfront rooms are worth the upgrade. Rooms are nice, clean and adequate, yet not over the top. Halls and stairs need updating, but it's not a major issue. Overall a great place to stay. Will definitely be back.

We stayed 2 days at the luxury suite with a great view .I never experience best service in a while ..We received warm smiles and sincere greetings from everyone we came in contact with.Christmas dinner was delicious  . Spa Experience amazing .very pleasant stay ! Thank you!

I have been going to Surf and Sand Resort for the past twenty years and it is our family's favorite place to vacation above any other.  Laguna is a quaint community that offers everything that you are looking for, from fine dining to wonderful art galleries and pristine beaches.  Surf and Sand in nestled in the heart of the Laguna beaches.  All of their rooms have a ocean view.  We prefer staying in the Tower rooms which offer a beachfront experience like no other.  The waves are literally just outside your balcony and the waves lull you to sleep.  The service at Surf and Sand is impeccable and the food is excellent.  The Splashes Bar is a wonderful place to sit and have a relaxing cocktail, with the sand literally just steps away.  Or relax poolside, where they also have a pool
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It is always a pleasure to hear such wonderful feedback from our loyal repeat guests!    I am thrilled that Surf & Sand Resort continues to creates special memories for you and we look forward to creating many more in the future!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: I have taken my family to the Surf & Sand on many occasions and each time we have had a spectacular time.  The pool is awesome, the views are unbeatable, the beach access couldn't be better and bringing it all together is the consistently excellent service from making the reservations to arriving and during the stay - second to none!

Hopefully some of you guys get a chance to read my somewhat thorough review. I am proud to say I‚Äôve had the privilege of visiting this resort ever since I was 6 years old. 25 years later, I find myself taking my children here now too. My most recent stay was this past weekend for our New Years holiday getaway. I must say, Surf and Sand‚Äôs pride in service, luxury and impeccable accommodations have never let us down.    Laguna Beach has been rated with some of the most beautiful beaches in the Pacific, over Hawaii‚Äôs beaches in fact and although there are a few other choices to say in Laguna, nothing comes close to Surf and Sand‚Äôs unique experience. The moment you open your door to your room, you are quickly greeted by them smell of fresh ocean breeze and the sound of crashing

This was my wife and my first time t the Surf & Sand and we were thoroughly impressed!  The room right on the water was great.  The sounds of the waves crashing on the shore was like a symphony.  I spent quite a bit of time on the balcony, event though it was cold and rainy outside. The service from all the staff was exceptional.The room was very comfortable with all the amenities you could need.  The food and drinks were very good...the view from the restaurant and bar is to die for.  So nice for watching the sun set on the Pacific.  We'll be back!!

I have stayed at Surf and Sand three times and each visit is better than the last. Aside from having a perfect location with breathtaking views, the accommodations, staff, spa and food are all amazing. Their employees are genuinely warm and friendly.  Whatever we needed, they were always there to assist us with a smile.  We ordered room service and ate in the restaurant, and each experience was perfect.  We live in LA and will definitely return to Surf and Sand as soon as possible for a weekend getaway!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of Surf & Sand! We're so thrilled to hear that you've enjoyed all three of your stays with us. Happy New Year!

Summary: Believe it or not, all the reviews are accurate...  The good, since it am an optimist.  We made reservations for New Years Eve for our family (my husband and I plus 2 teenagers) at the last minute.  Hats off to whomever I spoke with on the phone.  She was so incredibly knowledgeable and helpful!  It was a long complicated call because of what we were looking for, and the customer service was outstanding!!  The hotel has had some major renovations.  From the curbside, it almost looks like a nice motel.  When we  pulled up to the valet only parking (beachside, no parking to ever be found anywhere, ever!), they were nice without being pretentious.  The indoor lobby is tiny but lovely.  The outdoor lobby is truly lovely...many small sitting areas with many small fireplaces...drink
Manager Response: Lori, thank you so much for your detailed review! We're so glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay at Surf & Sand. Happy New Year!

Summary: The rating for this hotel needs to be downgraded.  The hotel restaurants do not reserve seating for their hotel guests.  We have been denied twice a table because the local (Laguna Beach etc.) reserve the tables.  So, don't expect to eat at the hotel's restaurants. Also, the check in time needs to be moved to 7pm from the so called 4pm slot.  The hotel has most of all the guests checking in wait until late evening hours for a room.  Our reservations were made 3 months  in advance.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts and concerns regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  I apologize that the issues you experienced are, indeed, not the norm for our resort.  Your feedback is well taken and I understand your frustration.    I would love to speak with you personally regarding your details.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: The only bad thing about this place is that we have to leave in a few hours!  I'm so thankful that I found this spectacular resort on tripadvisor. I'm a hero to my family of six (with four teenagers.). As we stepped out of our rental car, we all knew that we were in for a treat when we noticed the comfortable outdoor seating around glass firepits nestled in front of glass railings overlooking the pounding pacific surf! When we opened the doors to the Upper Catalina suite that we rented, we were amazed to find a glass terrace with comfortable outdoor seating that we could enjoy privately. We spent most of our time out there and will never forget how relaxing the sound of the surf was. At night, we left the doors open so the surf could lull us to sleep. Our teenagers shared a room

Summary Heading: One Year Later - Expectations Exceeded Again - Surf & Sand is THE BEST
Summary: Our family returned to the Surf & Sand again this year after we had the time of our lives last year.   The weather was IDEAL and the resort didn't let us down...in fact it exceeded our expectations that we had from our trip last year.  We returned to see many of the familiar faces from last year....the same pleasant people at the valet, bell desk, front desk and concierge. Even the General Manager of the property, Joanna Bear, remembered us when we ran into her for our morning coffee. The people that work at the Surf & Sand define the word: hospitality.   I could tell that the property had made some changes from last year with upgrades in the rooms and around the property. The Surf & Sand seems to constantly be reinvesting money into making it better for the guest experience

We had the pleasure of enjoying a two day stay at your lovely resort and enjoyed every moment of it   The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable just loved hearing the crashing of the waves.  The staff were very friendly and most helpful.

I had a chance to stay the night in one of these rooms after a holiday party and, holy cow, it was incredible. A valet took care of my car for me and the front desk staff was very welcoming. The resort is right off a main road, but once you're inside the gate, it feels like you are completely secluded. The big WOW was when I opened my room door and saw my view of the Pacific. The room was amazing, don't get me wrong, but that view trumps everything else. If it wasn't such a chilly night, I practically would have fallen asleep on my balcony! Comfy bed, sweet decor, awesome shower and stellar view. At night, you get put to sleep by the sounds of the waves. My room service breakfast was a little pricey, but waking up to eggs, toast and sausage with that view was 100% worth it. Even

Was fortunate to spend a weekend at the Surf and Sand and cant wait to start planning our return trip.  The hotel is simply amazing.  We had an ocean front room and the views were spectacular. Everything was "top-notch" and could not offer a suggestion of how my stay could be better.  The beach was AMAZING, the kids had a blast in the pool and drinks outside next to the fireplace, just fabulous.  Would highly recommend!

Summary Heading: The Only Place to Stay In Laguna Beach!!
Summary: I have stayed at the Surf & Sand multiple times in the past 6 years and it continues to get better and better.  The staff is first rate and will do everything in their power to make sure your stay is the best it can be!  All rooms have a full ocean view, and they even provide ear plugs for sleeping if you don't enjoy letting the surf put you to sleep. The property is always updating, to make sure guests have the latest and greatest amenities without losing any of the charm of this "original" property. Don't be mistaken this is not the size of the Montage, but in my opinion this resort has many pluses over it.  Staying at the Surf & Sand, you simply cannot get closer to the ocean and have the experience at a 5 star resort.  The rooms are large, always clean and well appointed.

Summary Heading: Best in Class Laguna Beach Resort
Summary: I stayed at the Surf and Sand for a business trip and will definately come back with my family. The view from the room out to the ocean is breathtaking. I would recommend this resort to anyone. It is worth the price. The resort is extremely well run as well. Enjoy!

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here recently.  Room was very nice and clean. Our package included breakfast, which was delicious! My only objection was the price. I felt it was a bit high. Without a doubt, the nicest hotel in Laguna Beach! Can't beat the view and the sound of the ocean.

We have ben going to the Surf and Sand since the early 70's. We have been through refurbishments and management changes. The proximity of the property to the ocean is as good as it gets for us midwesterners. That stretch of beach is just beautiful and we always feel so fortunate to be able to walk it every morning we are there. We have learned through the years to ask for our rooms to be in the south tower with a north corner exposure, the higher the better.This time the staff seemed friendlier than ever and made a conscious effort to make us feel welcome. Splashes Restaurant is very good. We had some sort of a package this time and breakfast went with the room. Our room ,as always, was very clean and comfortable and stocked with many nice bathroom products.  The concierge we

Summary Heading: The perfect Laguna Beach romantic retreat
Summary: I cant say enough about this property. its right on the beach, with a gorgeous view of Catalina Island off in the distance, fresh and well appointed rooms, really friendly staff and walking distance to art galleries, great restaurants, from cheap and yummy fish tacos (Wahoos) to Sapphire (great deck, relaxing and interesting menu) to Nicks (hipster cool and good menu). The sound of the waves crashing is awesome, though if you're not used to it, the hotel even has earplugs in the room to help you sleep. they miss nothing. The pool and hot tub are nice too, overlooking the beach, we took a dip at night, and it was lovely and warm. Cozy robes and warm outdoor fireplaces you can curl up with someone special near and watch the sun go down. We'll be back I'm sure of it :)

I went there for 3 days 2 nights for a business meeting.  After reading posts on "trip advisor",  I was looking forward to rest and relaxations.    Hotel is actually right on the Pacific Ocean.  I would call this place a "large boutique" hotel.      Lobby is actually very small but friendly staff.  My room wasn't ready (checked in at 1:30 PM) so I waited outside while overlooking the ocean....not a lot of stuff do there at the hotel.  My room had a fantastic view of the ocean (just steps away).  I was mesmerized from the view when I stepped out onto the balcony.  I was so looking forward to next few days.  Room was pretty decent size but the closet was tiny.  If you were staying there with your significant other or a family, it would not fit in there.  Bed was excellent
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I offer my sincere apologies in learning that you were disappointed with your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.    We strive to make every guest‚Äôs experience a pleasant one; however, there are occasions when the elements prohibit our efforts.  We do have other room locations to offer that are not as close to the sound of the waves and still provide lovely ocean views. We would certainly enjoy having you as our guest in the future.  Please call upon me in the event you are able to return so that I may better accommodate the details of your stay.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: My wife and I just spent two nights at the hotel. Location is truly amazing, right on the beach, with high-quality facilities.  However, overall experience was ok, not awesome:  1/ BR was great and bed was v comfy. Balcony facing the ocean was beautiful (room 347)  2/ Bathroom was ok, but not comparable to other luxury hotels such as Four Seasons or Ritz (no separate shower, towels are v small)  3/ Their restaurant is ok, but not more than that. We had appetizers at the bar downstairs and food was ok. For breakfast, we had a good meal (eggs Benedict, toasts) but needed to pay for every single item, including extra piece of bread. They also don't have home-made fresh squeezed juice. This is not the service level I expect from a five-star hotel. You'd better price up the items but

We only stayed two nights here as part of a 10 day SoCal vacation and in hindsight I wish we stayed longer. We had a corner room in the main building on the 3rd floor.  The sunsets were amazing and the waves lulled us to sleep each night.  We had an awesome and extremely relaxing stay!  We had our 3 month old with us so were in early each night, but we loved the short stroll to where the shops and restaurants were.  There a liquor store close, so we bought some nice wine and enjoyed that on the patio once the baby was down.  We also realized the hotel restaurant has corkage free Monday and took advantage of that with a really nice wine we brought ;) Overall, you won't be disappointed, the rooms are spacious and well kept and the furniture on the patio is very comfortable, so we

Our family recently stayed at this property in November of 2013, just prior to Thanksgiving.  The location of this resort is excellent in Laguna, we found it close to everything we needed.  The staff was very nice and also very helpful all around.  The valet staff was great and accomodating.  Valet is $30/night, parking in Laguna is hard to come by so parking at the resort is probably best.  The food was ordered from that bar was good, the beach was clean with plenty of chars and umbrellas for guests.  The main bedroom was very nice, bed super comfortable and the turndown service also a plus.  The view of the ocean is outstanding and very peaceful.  I did find it a bit noisy with guests from above.  The wifi signal, although free which is nice, is super weak.  My ipad couldn't

I have been staying at this property for the past 30 years and it just continues to get better.  The view of the ocean and the sound of the waves gently coming ashore beneath your room is beyond compare.  The staff are friendly, professional and highly service oriented.  The location is the perfect walking distance from amazing shopping and restaurants.  A big "thank you" to the team at Surf & Sand for the excellent service and wonderful years of memories. Don't know how you manage to just keep getting better - but you do!

Just went to the Surf and Sand for one night to stay with a relative and meet up with friends in Laguna.  Everything from the incredible ocean view room and sound of the surf, the wonderful meal at the restaurant and the top notch hospitable service..... was superb.  Loved relaxing by the pool with cocktails,  a long watch on the beautiful beach and even a brisk dip in the ocean.  This may very well be my favorite seaside resort ever!
