We just spent 3 nights celebrating our Anniversay at the Surf & Sand and it was absolutely amazing!   I can't say enough about the accomodations, service, and property.  Our room was spectacular- the views were breathtaking and the bed was super comfortable.  Not only was it incredibly elegant, but it was spotless.  The service at the S&S is fantastic - from the bellman to the cleaning staff.  The bellman was very sweet to run to my car and retrieve something I forgot and seemed genuinely happy to do it for me.   We relaxed by the many firepits/fireplace and watched the sunset and drank wine at night and then enjoyed complimentary coffee in the morning as we sat by the fireplace.   The property is so clean and the staff is very friendly.  We wanted for nothing; all of our needs

Just stayed her for 4 nights and I couldn't be happier with our experience. The rooms were beautiful and all have a direct ocean view, and free coffee until 10am doesn't hurt either! All of the staff were so helpful and we were amazed when we found out that they could child-proof the balcony for us. We called reception and within 20 min an engineer came and installed child-proof netting across the balcony which meant my son couldn't throw things off the balcony or stick his head through the bars. What a great idea and so helpful for us! Absolutely loved this hotel and can't wait to go back one day!

Summary Heading: after 14 years of being loyal visitors we have to say good bye for good
Summary: We have been visiting S&S for 14 years, had our honeymoon there and have stayed dozens of times. Over a decade and half we have seen rates and room service costs sky rocket but quality in service decline....the location is what kept us coming back...simply stunning ocean views.   We stoped odering room service after last years experience....we had ordered the filet and desert...same as every year but the portions were literally half the size as before...the explanition given by managment was a "new vision" from the chef...the delicious "generous" carrot cake was nothing more than a thin cookie (literally half inch deep) with a table spoon of icecream....this was off the adult menu....we felt ripped off so decided to start go to Bandaras for dinner each time before check in. So
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  On behalf of the Surf & Sand Resort, my profound apologies for the unfortunate circumstances you experienced during your recent stay.  Please rest assured that each incident is being reviewed and addressed with our entire management team.  We are honored to have been your resort of choice for the past 14 years and would be grateful for the opportunity again.    When planning your next visit to Laguna Beach, please contact me directly for any needed assistance.  It would be my pleasure to personally coordinate the details of your stay, and to ensure a pleasant experience.   Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: Surf & Sand exceeded expectations for service, cleanliness, friendliness of staff, and the best food I've ever had at a resort/hotel. I was there on business, but I'm looking forward to another visit with friends, where I can sit in front of the outdoor fire place and relax with a glass of wine and a good book.  Must try the tuna tartar in Splashes, it's excellent!

The Surf and Sand exceeded my expectations.  My daughter's destination wedding was there and it couldn't have turned out any better.  The staff  was extremely helpful and Kat the wedding coordinator was outstanding.  The wedding went off without any problems at all.  It is a gorgeous location.  We stayed in a jr. suite and it was beautiful. I would recommend the Surf and Sand very highly. I couldn't imagine a nicer spot for a wedding and everyone involved was so helpful.

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Surf and Sand.  We especially appreciated the help of the executive staff in making it happen.  The room was beautiful and the private deck had a spectacular view of the ocean.  Location was great for a walk on the beach and a short drive into town.  Would highly recommend this to anyone considering a stay at this upscale hotel.

In my opinion, the Surf & Sand is the finest hotel in southern California. Its location right on the beach and just feet from the surf, give it a unique positioning and create an overall wonderful experience. Staff are well trained and knowledgeable about not only the hotel, but also the Laguna area. Chef David Fune creates succulent dishes for Splashes restaurant and adds seasonal creations to enhance a top-notch menu. It is a place to be experienced!  You won't be disappointed.  Diana M

We love to go for a long weekend  to  Surf and Sand. We prefer this hotel because it is just few feet away from the ocean. Also Splashes restaurant has excellent food. The hotel has a boutique feel to it and within walking distance from center of Laguna Beach. The only drawback is an absence of AC in rooms, however you can notice it only on hottest days. Night are nice and cool always, and we love sitting on our balcony and listening to waves crushing on the shore...

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay - very memorable experience.  We especially thought the rooms were large, excellent maid service, super comfy beds and hearing the waves crash through the open balcony was the pinnacle of our stay.  Food and service was top notch!

Everything was wonderful: the room, the view, the dinner, the wine, the breakfast, the bathroom, the pool, the hot tub, the company (my family). So grateful for this experience, couldn't have had a better venue.

We wanted one special night right on the beach to hear the roar of the ocean....no ear plugs for us. The person who took our reservation talked us into a package that included valet, breakfast, and resort fee....actually glad that we did as it more than covered everything. While this property is older, the updates they have done are tasteful. We received superb service from the moment we pulled in....from the valet...an upgrade...a special anniversary greeting. Only caveat....no air conditioning and we were there in 90+ with no breeze from the ocean....fans helped, but it was hot. No matter we loved it. The staff seemed to knock themselves out to make certain we appreciated the experience.

I stayed at the Surf and Sand with my parents and brother recently and soaked up the luxury of this hotel and its location to the best of my ability. The rooms are beautiful, clean, and serene. The ocean is literally steps away from this hotel and I delighted in the sound of crashing waves that permeated my room when I had the balcony doors open. I also loved my morning swim at 7:30am. :) We ate a delicious breakfast and dinner at Splashes (the restaurant at the hotel) and the service was top of the line. I would definitely come back to The Surf and Sand and stay again. Highly recommended!

Recommended to our family by many locals we just had to make a stop at this resort. 5 amazing nights at this resort which couldn't get any closer to the pacific ocean if it tried.  Rooms were very luxurious and the amenities in the room were amazing. It was my wife's birthday whilst we were in house & our family back in AUS organised a red velvet cake & flowers to be delivered to our room on the morning of her birthday which the resort took care of perfectly.  Very polite bellman staff who our children enjoyed interacting with during the week. Short walking distance to many good restaurants in laguna including Italian/ Mexican which we sampled.  Pool was awesome down by the beach & we enjoyed cocktails at the pool bar most days. Do yourself a favourite & spend a few nights here

My wife and I stayed this past weekend to celebrate our anniversary.  From the moment we arrived, the amazing staff took care of us.  The room and view are truly a unique experience in Southern California.  The hotel is so close to the water that until you look down from the balcony, you aren't sure it wasn't actually built on the water.  I've stayed at many resorts in Laguna Beach and none had this incredible location.   We had drinks and appetizers at the bar Friday and saw the most wonderful sunset on the ocean.  Our server was attentive and gave excellent recommendations.  We spent Saturday going back and forth from the beach to the pool area.  Again, the staff checked on us every 15 minutes to ensure we having a great time and to see if we needed anything.  Sunday morning

If you want to stay virtually on the beach, a few feet above the waves, and hear them crashing on the sand as you sleep, this is the place for you.  The bedrooms are beautiful, and the staff is very friendly.  In addition, Laguna Beach is packed with incredible restaurants and art galleries that you can easily walk to.  However, I would not recommend either the hotel or Laguna Beach for a family vacation. It is more of a couple romantic getaway place.

Summary Heading: Terrible Customer SErvice In Stunning Location
Summary: Customer service was horrible. The surroundings were beautiful.  The rooms very nice.  But bottom line is that I'd never say here again due to poor service.  After making a noise complaint at 1:30 a.m. due to a domestic dispute in the room next to me, that was addressed by security at 2:00, and then when I called at about 2:15 a.m. to report that the situation had not be resolved no one at the front desk would pick up the phone.  I called three times over about 10 minutes with no answer. So, I finally got up, got dressed, walked to the reception desk to find it empty. After poking my head around, I found the attendent coming back from somewhere with two cups of milk in his hands.  He said he was only away a minute or two (becuse he wanted some milk to drink).  It is true he
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for your feedback regarding your recent stay. I appreciate your comments, which I take very seriously, and extend my sincere concern and apologies.  I regret that, upon attempting to reach you via telephone and leaving you a message, I was unable to speak with you personally.  Please be assured that the inconveniences you experienced are, indeed, uncommon and not our usual standard of excellence, and I understand your frustration and displeasure.   I would appreciate another opportunity of having you as our guest in the future, please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: I've stayed at the Surf and Sand Resort twice in the past year and the staff at this hotel has excellent customer service. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable as well. I will be returning here again.

The sound of the surf lulls you to sleep after a day of lolling around at the well designed pool area or on the beach.  Every attention was paid to us, making this vacation a must return to.  Great shopping in town, can't get better weather and sightseeing surrounding towns such as Newport Beach.  Went whale watching and was not disappointed watching the blue whales and myriad dolphins escorting our excursion boat.  A lovely and laid back hotel/resort.  And a big plus for me was that it is a dog friendly hotel and town.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Place for a relaxing weekend
Summary: I stayed here with three girlfriends as part of the tail end of a long weekend, and it was wonderful. Service was very attentive. We actually had a problem with the shower in our room, they offered to move us, immediately sent someone to fix the problem and then gave us a credit on the room. The views from the rooms are incredible. Watched an amazing sunset from the balcony of our room. Plus the pool beach area is delightful.

To be fair, we spent two nights prior to arriving at the Surf & Sand at Hotel Bel Air, which was an amazing luxury hotel experience with an attentive and polite hotel staff that essentially falls over themselves trying to provide their guests with world class attention.  My only knock on the Surf & Sand Resort is their hotel staff, which by comparison is inadequately trained and brings an attitude unfitting of a luxury hotel.  From them moment we checked in, I felt as if the check-in clerks was doing me a favor by running my credit card, and how they can possibly lose your car in valet parking at such a small resort is beyond my comprehension.  When I asked to speak with the hotel manager, the clerk refused.  None of this is a huge deal to me, because the hotel rooms and views

Summary Heading: Prime Location for a Faded Lady
Summary: Stayed at the Surf and Sand for a business conference.  Very high end, but property is old and, while updated, there are vestiges of yesteryear.  For example, our room had only one easily available outlet for cell phone chargers and laptop power supply.  That's why you pack a power strip. New flat screen TVs have been hung over light switches so you have to reach behind the TV to turn lights on and off. There appeared to be no air conditioning.  Thankfully you could open the doors and windows for fresh Oceanside air, but you could be compromising your security if you left them open all night. Food was good to excellent, and staff was very attentive to our needs.  The view is a killer with quick access to the beach, making some of the other inconveniences trivial.

We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in Rome in June of this year and raved about the hotel and the service.  We are now at the Surf and Sand - and it is every bit as good!  The location, the room, the food and the staff - are all awesome!  The one star rating below is clearly the work of some really disturbed idiot!

We visit Surf and Sand every September for my wife's B-day, The customer service is outstanding from top to bottom and the view from every room is Fabulous!  If you ever want to surprise your partner for a romantic evening, ask the concierge to decorate your room with rose pedals, candles, champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries, it will be one of the best nights you ever have!!

This place has it all.  Right on the beach.  A fabulous pool with a bar.  Excellent restaurants.  Attentive staff to help you with anything you need.  Immaculate well appointed rooms.  A little far from some of the popular restaurants and shops but a quick taxi ride takes care of that.

The customer service, room, and ocean views exceeded all of my expectations! All of the staff was very well trained, professional, and delighted to serve us. Our room was beautiful and very well maintained. Not to mention spotless! The pool area and ocean views from this resort are top notch. I would highly recommend Surf and Sand Resort. I will definitely be back!

We came here again after our visit one year ago. Must say it still has a very high standard and pleased we made the choice.  Ocean front rooms are pricy but we knew that before we came. Compared some other high end hotels but wanted to stay close to the beach.  By the way, if you like the sound of water crashing this is the place to be. If this keeps you up at night, might want to reconsider. The ocean sounds like you are about to be blasted but then I like that.  Our room was on the top floor in the corner which is what I wanted. Quiet and without any noisy parties going on near us.  All the services we had were first rate from dining, maid , gym and concierge .  Staff was attentive, know how to do their jobs without you asking. Gym was a bit small but fine for most. No AC but

We decided to stay at the Surf and Sand Resort to escape the heat. We beach front room was incredible. We spent the day at the beach, then sat on on balcony sipping wine and enjoying the incredible sunset. We had a wonderful dinner at Splashes. The staff is friendly and efficient. We will definitely stay at the Surf and Sand Resort again. It was a great experience!

What a perfect way to end our summer! It was absolutely wonderful! Our balcony view looked right over the ocean just like on a cruise ship, almost as though you could just dive right in. The food at Splashes restaurant was amazing and we loved our waiter Alfredo! The kids enjoyed the pool and the beach immensely and could not have been more content being served lunch right at the waters edge. I had a wonderful massage by Beth and enjoyed the steam room. I loved being addressed by Name from the staff and was greeted warmly always. We felt special and well taken care of! Well worth the price for a little piece of heaven!

We were walk-in guests and checked in on a holiday when the majority of guests were checking out so we got a fantastic rate on a suite overlooking the ocean.  The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful.  The room was clean and spacious.  There was no air conditioning but we were not affected at all as we had the ocean breeze.  We would definitely stay here again and, in fact, can't wait to return!

Summary Heading: 50.00 Entree-Horrible Food Horrible Service Room Hot
Summary: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE FOOD WAS HORRIBLE   We checked into the Surf and Sand looking for peace and tranquility as we have found in the past and this hotel. Upon arrival the front desk person was snappy and rude to my fiance we let it slide. That night we went to dinner and our dogs barked so we got a call from the security. When we arrived a group of over zealous security guards surrounded our room like the Gestapo.  We informed security the dogs would not bark again and they were quiet the rest of the trip. The dinner that night was around 450.00 that only included three cocktails the rest was food charges. The food was HORRIBLE we were served dry fish and some green rice menagerie that tasted like paste each entree was 45.00 dollars. The appetizers were oysters that tasted rancid
Manager Response: To our TripAdvisor Family:  It's rare that we speak in this fashion, as we tried to discuss these issues with this guest.     Please know that our goal is to exceed our guests' expectations with both our service and product.    Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Like sitting on top of ocean~
Summary: We stayed for three nights.  The sound of the waves was incredible.  Soothing, but loud.  Wore earplugs for two nights and slept very well.  Room was nicely decorated and light and airy in feel.  Didn't know about the no a/c prior.  I like my a/c, but we did get used to it after a time.  The wind is always moving with the windows open. The staff was very accommodating and food at Splashes was good.  I booked a Swedish massage on last morning with Rebecca.  Have to say it was the "best" one I have ever had.    If you don't like salt water, the pool is nice and near enough to almost be in the ocean with the sounds and wind.  Great way to spend the day.  I noticed a lot of dogs running by the ocean and made me wish for mine to be there.  They were welcome on the beach and seemed to

Summary Heading: no air conditioning in most guest rooms.
Summary: The hotel has no air conditioning in most of the guest rooms which causes both temperature and noise problems.  There are large floor fans in the closets, which might be adequate during the winter months.  They also have ceiling fans.   Otherwise the guest rooms are well appointed and clean.  The bathrooms are large with separate tubs and showers and two lavatories.  Everything was in good repair.  The lack of air conditioning, combined with the noise from the beach, made sleep impossible, however.

way overpriced for the room and hotel, but I guess they have no problem selling them in the summer. Nice fire pit and kid function outside and good service overall.Good location on the beach and close to things in Laguna.

We have stayed at the S&S over the past several years and it is by far the best resort in Orange County.  The hotel sits on the beach and the views are unsurpassed.  The employees are so polite and helpful.  The two restaurants are great.  The rooms are wonderful and all have a great view.  Although, the rooms do not have air condition, there are ceiling fans and floor fans that are more than adequate. I would highly recommend this resort.

I booked four rooms at the Surf and Sand for myself and my bridal party during my wedding and was completely underwhelmed by the experience. The rooms themselves are fine (on the small side for sure, I stayed in the room in the picture, it's super tiny and skinny) and it's nice to be right on the beach, but the service was absolutely horrendous. The front desk staff must be completely mismanaged or untrained, because we have had never-ending problems with them. Not what I expected from a resort at this level. When we checked in, the front desk woman didn't explain the resort to anyone and didn't inform our guests that we had booked a special package for them (for free breakfast and free parking) and when I checked out they had messed up the payment and didn't charge the 4 rooms

Just stayed at Surf & Sand this past weekend. We only had time for a quick one night getaway, but it was just what my "travel doctor" prescribed! The beach walk, then wine and sunset on our patio, then a very tasty dinner ( I recommend the Halibut) at Splashes was just the thing for my wife and I after a long week at work.......  Guest Service, Resort Amenities, everything was spot on. What a treat!  This place will earn a permanent spot in our roster of places to return to!

You can stand on you balcony and the waves will crash under you at high tide. You can't get closer to the sea without getting wet. Love  Great service, great location, friendly staff and. Great food!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Fantastic location on the beach, but accomodations disappoint
Summary: We loved staying right on Laguna Beach. We found the Surf & Sand Resort to be small and expensive, but you are paying for the beach front access.  LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION I booked this hotel for its prime location: right on the beach. The views of the ocean are breathtaking and you can fall asleep to the sound of ocean waves crashing. (The hotel does provide ear plugs, in case you find the ocean waves to be too loud). The hotel is walking distance from lots of small shops and restaurants. The hotel provides chairs on the beach, as well as chairs by the pool.   ACCOMMODATIONS: A BIT OF A DISAPPOINTMENT We booked the Catalina Jr Suite-Lower. For nearly $800/night, I was a bit disappointed. The "Lower" part means you overlook a roof before you see the ocean. The bedroom and

RIGHT on the beach, wonderful service, walking distance to wonderful restaurants and Laguna Beach sights, this is the best place in Laguna! We love to leave the sliding glass doors open and hear the waves as we fall asleep and wake up. Fitness center, wonderful, relaxing spa, great restaurants and fabulous grounds.  You MUST stay here ONCE just to experience it!  Don't miss out.

Summary Heading: amazing hotel almost in the water
Summary: An amazing hotel built on the beach and it seems like you could dive into the ocean from your balcony in fact during high tide the waves were lashing right under my room. The town is great with a huge variety of restaurants which are located to offer great views of the beach and the food is great almost everywhere,it is very visitor friendly and has a lot to offer for people who love the beach. The hotel has great rooms and a really nice bar which i felt was a bit too small for the number of rooms so they have really cramped everyone.It is a hotel which leaves a mark and makes you want to keep going back and is also extremely convenient specially from los angeles, it is one of the best hotel on the beach that i have been to.

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, great rooms, no A/C
Summary: We stayed here over the Labor Day weekend and had a really nice experience.  The service was phenomenal, the rooms were modern and the views beautiful.  However, for the price paid we were extremely surprised to find out that there was no air conditioning in the rooms.  They did provide fans and the rooms cooled down at night, but if you stay here on a hot weekend be prepared for the heat.  The service more than made up for it, but be aware of no A/C!

Summary Heading: Great hotel right on the beach
Summary: Friendly and helpful staff.   Enjoyed this smaller hotel feel.  Very personal service.  Great location for walking around Laguna Beach and doing some shopping in the small stores.  Amazing sunset views from the bar.  We traveled with our three young children and felt very welcomed.  Heated pool was nice since it was a little cool the days we were there (even in July).  Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Love the Surf and Sand Resort!!!!!! Favorite Hotel
Summary: We have stayed at the Surf and Sand Resort every summer for the past twelve years! We can hardly wait to come back. We  love it here.  Since my husband does not fly, this is our Hawaii!!! The staff is so kind, friendly and accomodating...they are the BEST!!! We look forward to all the special things the hotel has to offer daily.  Our favorite is the taco bar on Sunday, the outside bar overlooking the ocean in the sitting area near the fire pit. Love the morning coffee, reading the paper and enjoying the ocean view....such a special place!

Summary Heading: A beautiful and relaxing get away!
Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel. I did not want to leave. It was very clean and the service was excellent.  I love the way the room was big decorated very tastefully. The view was beautiful and I could hear the ocean from my room!

The view alone was incredible.  It was like you were floating on the ocean.  The friendly staff were very welcoming and helpful.   One morning I woke up to go take a swim in the ocean. It was simply fabulous.  We will definitely be visiting again.

A-Mazing!!!!!!!  This is such a special place.  I stayed in a room overlooking the ocean and the sound of the waves crashing on the beach was breathtaking!  I can't wait to go back.   You will not regret staying here.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel. Get the lowest beach balcony room available.
Summary: Had a great stay here at this hotel.  Service was excellent, and the restaurant was nice.  Try and get the lowest beach front balcony room.  Leave your balcony doors open all night and listen to the waves crash.  They even supply ear plugs if the waves are too loud!  Pool area is small, but nice.  Awesome place.

I wanted to take my best friend for a much needed getaway.  We stayed in one of the rooms in the tower overlooking the Pacific.  The view from the balcony is breathtaking and you really can't be any closer to the ocean.  It was such a peaceful, relaxing stay and our spa services were truly outstanding.  The restaurant on site (Splashes) has a wonderful menu with the same amazing views of the ocean.  The staff at the restaurant and throughout the property make you feel so welcome.  I live in Irvine less than 15 miles away and yet I felt like I was completely on vacation.  Perfect little getaway to recharge and relax.  Surf and Sand is truly gem!!

Family of four staying in one of the ocean front tower rooms.   We splurged in the hope that it would deliver the appropriate value and it more or less did.    Room was fab and the service throughout was very very good (special mention to concierge desk girls).  Poolside food was perfect for what we needed, breakfast good too.  At dinner there once and it was ok but at much better to be in town (particularly recommend Nick's and 230 Forrest). Pool is small, full to the brim with kids, and sunloungers packed together like sardines so that you have no choice but to get very close to your fellow guests.   Didn't actually bother me as much as I thought it would but might not suit everyone.   The beach is lovely and the hotel has an 'on-beach' facility for towels, beach chairs (not

My self, my Husband and our son age 14 years, had a great and lovely time in this resort. Although it is a little expensive but it was worth it. Breakfast, valeting services, room cleanses, staff and the Beach  was fab. definitely go back again:). My son has the pleasure to meet the actor David tennant ( Dr Who), so it definitely one  of the places to meet a celebrity:))  May

My wife and I recently went here for a weekend getaway and we had a pleasant experience. The staff was very kind and knowledgeable of local reataraunts and stores. This hotel is located right  in the center of town, perfect for walking local shops. And the beach.... perfect not to crowded and if you like the ocean you really can't get much closer. We had an ocean room with a balcony. If I had my fishing pole, I could have casted into the ocean from our balcony. We could actually see this fish swimming in the water. The seagulls were fun to watch as they would land on the balcony each morning. One even came into the room. Be sure if you have food in your room that you close the balcony doors.    My wife went to the spa on property and as usuall spent a few hours trying out the

Really enjoyed our stay at surf and sand.  Very chill place, nice room overlooking ocean.  Free coffee a.m., and a nice managers cocktail reception.  negatives are small pool with many kids running around, and rather steep price....great choice in laguna if you don't mind the kids and cost!

Thank you so much for such a Beautiful Resort to have our Wedding & Honeymoon! We were married on July 31st 2013 on the Balcony over looking the ocean just before Sunset.  Have some of the most incredible photos of our special day!! The rooms, service, atmosphere can't be beat by any of the other hotels! We look forward to coming back for many Anniversary Celebrations!!!! Thanks again,  Sheri & Patrick Moneymaker Dallas, Texas

We chose Sand & Surf over the Ritz Carlton to be closer to the beach. Our room was so close to the beach they gave us ear plugs so we wouldn't hear the waves crash as much at night! This hotel was STUNNING. Our room was beautiful and bright and overlooked the beach from the second floor.   We ate at Splashes for breakfast every morning which was great, as we are super healthy picky eaters. They took great care of us.   The one thing I suggest is to park your car on the street if you can to save yourself some $$ to have the valet park it every night. It's about $30 a night!   There are so many great shops and places to eat out everyday and night. We LOVED the location so much- it's so laid back and casual. You can dress up or dress down, either way you will feel fine. I do

I am giving this resort 4 stars because this is one the nicest locations we have ever stayed at. You are literally on top of the Pacific Ocean due to a shallow beach, its breathtaking. We got to the resort at 12:30 pm realizing we'd be be lucky to get into our reserved room. I explained to the girl at the desk I had medication that needed refridgerated and would like to get in asap. She did offer to keep in in the valet's cooler outside until our room was ready, I also told her I needed to give myself an injection within a couple hours, she said no problem. At 2:30 my husband went to check, still no room. I went back at 3:30 a little agitated....still no room. Finally at 4:30 I demanded we get a room, after waiting at the desk another 10 mins or so, they sent us to our room.

This year we were a party of 3...Mom...Dad...adult Son....from Nicole at Front Desk to Bell Service from all Bellmen....Rebecca at Concierge ....Robert, Abel and Pedro in Splashes Restaurant....Michael for check out on Baggage Service.....All friendly...professional....helpful....all around exceptional service....of course the property right on the beach is beautiful....having a cabana-like atmosphere at the pool made it HEAVEN....no sunburn for me!!!...We are already planning for next summer to go back...We ate at Splashes for Breakfast and had Lunch at the pool....FABULOUS!!!!

Been going to this place for 30 years.  Love the location on the beach.  Booked as usual for a number of nights (5 in this case), arrived to find I had the absolute worst room in the hotel.  Instead of the usual Ocean View and crashing waves, was on the basement floor overlooking the pool and throngs of screaming kids til all hours.  Hotel made little attempt to correct/move me - even though they knew I was a lifelong customer...and was paying $700 per night.  After a long drive to get there, decided to just take the room and deal with in the AM - mistake - had to keep the doors closed to block out the screaming kids in the pool til at least 10PM.  This morning, after they couldn't manage a solution (in a very large hotel), I decided to save the money and angst and check-out
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest:  I am responding to your review on Trip Advisor, which has me very concerned as I  take all of the feedback we receive very seriously. As our very valued and loyal guest, I offer  my sincere apologies for the frustration and disappointment you experienced during your recent stay.  I also thank you for reminding me of the importance of continued staff  training in all areas.    Of course, I would enjoy the opportunity of having you as our guest once again. In lieu of booking through our Central Reservations, I invite you to contact me directly in the  future so that I am able to personally accommodate the details of your stay, ensure there is no miscommunication,  and  you receive the rate and room type of which you are accustomed.  Warm regards,   Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: This was my first time staying here. Just so comfortable. They have morning coffee and tea in the outside lobby. You can sit and look at the waves crashing below. You are just steps from the ocean. They provide everything you need to enjoy your beach day. The rooms are spacious. They provide ear plugs as the ocean gets pretty noisy at night. Each day there are different activities especially if you have kids. We went up to the pool each day for lunch. Food was very good. Lots of choices. Everyone is very nice and they greet you when they walk by. Yes, a little pricey especially in summer but it's worth it. Will definitely be back.

We all loved this hotel! I stayed here with my husband and two children, ages 24 and 16. They loved staying right on the ocean. We stayed in the Tower Building on the second floor. You couldn't get any closer to the ocean unless you were in it! We had lunch at Splashes upon arrival, the nachos and the fish tacos were delicious and we had a great view of the ocean. All the staff at this resort are very nice and professional. Our room was very spacious, we stayed in a double queen. The maid service at this hotel is topnotch. I know that some of the reviews are complaints about the price of the rooms. You are paying to stay right on the ocean in a beautiful room with excellent service. Just be sure to book a room in the Tower Building, oceanfront, second floor or higher, if you

What a great place.  People bent over backwards to make sure we felt right at home.  The corner King Suite was beautiful and I don't think you can get closer to the ocean.  Balcony furniture was comfortable and the view was tremendous.  Our luggage was misplaced upon arrival, but a negative was turned into a positive as the bell captain informed us immediately and he personally brought our bags up to us with an ice bucket and complimentary bottle of wine.  The manager sent us up complimentary drink tickets for the bar and/or restaurant along with one for an appetizer.  This was certainly not necessary or asked for on our part as the delay was not long.    We will certainly return.

This is a difficult review to write as our experience was very different after we changed rooms. Perhaps our first mistake was to book a room at the weekend in the middle of the Summer. The hotel was completely rammed; there seemed to be people everywhere! The first problem we encountered was at check-in when we arrived past the check-in time but our room was still not  ready. We were asked to go down to the restaurant for a drink but this was so full of inebriated guests we preferred to walk the streets. We were then given our room which was probably the worst one in the hotel. Ground floor at Seaview Terrace, overlooking a small but noisy pool and the roof of the restaurant. Yes you could also just about see the Ocean but the balcony was not an inviting place to sit. But what
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.   On behalf of the resort, my sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced. As our very valued guests, we take your feedback very seriously, and your  disappointment and frustration is certainly understood.    As you are aware, during the summer months, the resort is typically at very high occupancy, and  you are correct that during ‚Äúnon-peak‚Äù season, we are able to be more flexible regarding room type, rates and dates of stay.   To ensure a pleasant stay in the future and you receive the room type you prefer,  I would like  to invite you to contact Pamela Hopkins in the Executive Office directly at 949-793-8075 so that  we are able to personally coordinate the details of your stay.   We look forward to having you back with us when your travels bring you to lovely Laguna Beach.  Warm regards,   Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: I don't run in the $765/night a room crowd, but my wife wanted to surprise me with a trip. Room was great, overlooking the pacific. But, it is on a highway and you still hear the garbage trucks in the morning; The shower head pressure was so weak it was nearly impossible to get shampoo out of my hair; breakfast waiter was sooooo.... slow to get a cup of coffee. Oh and the beach is quite narrow, especially at high tide. Pool area is tiny and five kids in it overwhelm it. So, this may sound picky, but to my na√Øve taste, not worth the price.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for providing feedback on your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  My sincere apologies that we did not meet your  expectations.  Your comments are appreciated  and taken very seriously so that improvements may be made whenever possible (i.e., the shower pressure and slow service).    We would certainly enjoy having you back as our guest when your travels bring you back to Laguna Beach.  Please contact me personally at 949-793-8054 for any needed assistance in the future.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary Heading: The best Laguna has to offer!
Summary: We have been staying at the Surf and Sand Hotel for 17 years now.  Laguna Beach is just under an hour away from our home, but it truly feels like we are in a different world!  Upon arrival, you enter the property and are welcomed by curtious valet personnel.  Once you exit your car, you are greeted by gracious front desk staff, a wonderful concierge and the magnificent Pacific Ocean.  Surf and Sand is located on the beach!!  The rooms are all stunning!  Remodeled recently, they are confortable, cozy, clean and beautifully appointed.  Our favorite things to do are have drinks at Splashes, the bar/lounge sitting right on the beach and we walk to the village, which is exactly 1 mile away from the Surf and Sand.  We rarely take the car out once we have checked in.  The staff at both

Grounds are pretty, suite remodeled and gorgeous furnishings, but old bones.  HORRIBLE beds. Room service brought our food the first night but didn't set up- tacky.  Locals at the pool which was very small anyway. I also asked a pool attendant to clean up blood from a woman's cut foot and he got one spot out of several. we got into our room 45 minutes late but weren't allowed a late check out. Spa was four of five stars - small.  Massage and facial were pretty good.  Manicurist great.  Splashes was great.  If it weren't for the annoyance of the cramped pool, it would have been more special- they need to bump up security down there.  Overall, a nice place, but I don't need to come back.

Top notch service! I would usually complain about a hotel that only offered valet parking but this place shows their patrons the best service around. My wife and kids must have been in and out of our car 20 times over the course of our five day stay plus going out for day trips - it'd drive anyone nuts. But they were so helpful! Mike - the head valet - and the other guys helped us almost daily with waters, directions, and even told us some local hot spot to visit. My wife also visited the spa and said it was the best massage she'd ever had. Plus you cannot beat the location. The team at S&S is the best we've encountered on vacation. They made staying with them a real treat.

Unfortunately, horrible beds. My back is killing me. The food at splashes was mediocre at best.  Besides the view from the room, there is nothing special about this place. The pool was full of locals, we met a woman that told us she takes her kids to swim there daily! There were random people coming off the beach to use the pool, the staff didn't seem to mind at all. They let people save loungers first thing in the morning so there is no place to sit due to every chair having a towel reserving it. Can't believe for the price how disappointing this place was.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I appreciate very much, your comments regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand. My sincere apologies that we did not meet your  expectations.  Your concerns are taken very seriously  and are being researched and addressed with our management staff.   Our pool area is extremely busy during the summer months when the resort is at very high occupancy. Thank you for reminding us of the importance of continued staff training in all areas so these types of issues are  remedied.  Please contact me directly at 949-793-8054 for any needed assistance in the future. It would be my privilege to personally accommodate the details of your stay to ensure all of your needs are met.   Sincerely, Joanna Bear Resort Manager

Summary: We visited this resort during a very busy summer weekend.  The location is great and we could hear the sounds of the ocean all night long.  The resort was sold out, and we were concerned there would be some loud guests walking around throughout the evening, given the fact that there were 2 weddings that weekend.  But much to our surprise, it was really quiet!  The room decor is very "beachy" and tastefully done.  The only two complaints are: first, the windows are single pane, so the noise from the ocean is really loud, although they do provide earplugs for the guests.  Second, some people decided to use the open area at the end of the corridor on the 1st floor as a smoking area, but once I informed the staff, it was quickly dealt with.  This is a non-smoking property!  Go smoke

Summary Heading: We would return again in a heartbeat
Summary: We stayed at the Surf and Sand for three nights.  We had an easy, quick check-in, and when we entered the room we were so happy because they had set up a small tent with sleeping bags for our children.  It was so sweet and the kids were super excited.  They also had s'mores as a welcome treat.  The beds were comfortable and the room was clean and nicely decorated.  You just can't beat falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves right below you.  The pool area was full of energy and the poolside drink/food service was fantastic.  Just walk down one staircase and you're on the beach.  In the evenings they light several fire pits in the upstairs lounge area, which is lovely.  I appreciate a hotel that can provide such a nice environment while remaining kid-friendly. We had a

This is a very nice hotel situated right on the beach. Can't beat the location.  The rooms are a good size and nicely decorated in light colors. Great bathroom with tub and separate shower. Some of the most friendly hotel staff I've experienced.  The only reason I didn't give it a "5" is that there was no air conditioning in the rooms, or anywhere but the Spa. At the beach that usually isn't a big deal but late in the afternoon if you were in the room it got a little warm. Also you have to like sleeping with the door to the balcony open, as long as that doesn't bother you (it didn't us) you would be comfortable. However, I would not stay there in August as it can get hot even at the beach in So. Calif.

Wow. What a fantastic hotel!! The matinence staff, pool attendants, bartenders/patio staff, & housekeepers are unbelivably hospitable! The front desk agent who checked us in could smile a little more... but overall it has been a glorious experience! I will definitely be returning and recommending to all friends/family.

I stayed here for one night at short notice on a California coast trip . The property is excellent. Right on the beach , super clean, rooms are light and breezy, restaurant and bar were lively but not over the top. The staff were the friendliest and most helpful I have ever met. Truly a great find and I will be back for sure.

We actually left another hotel south of this one because we were looking for a nicer place then we currently had. Although not the newest hotel I have ever stayed in, it was still a very nice with an up to date look. I don't believe there is a bad room in this hotel. We had a pool view partial ocean. Although not the most expensive room I would take it again in a heartbeat. For a trip that started out a little rocky with some weather, a few days here made Laguna our new favorite place to be. That being said prices are not for the faint of heart. You can stay at other high end hotels for the price but I know I won't bother looking anywhere else. Check out the spa too, their couples options are wonderful. For a romantic getaway this is an awesome hotel, if going for family

We stayed at the surf and sand for a girls weekend and it could not have been better.  We had originally looked at the Ritz Carlton but it was fairly booked, so glad it was because the surf and sand is better.  It is right on the beach, every room has an amazing view and its easy to walk to the town of laguna.  The other nice aspect is that isn't overwhelmingly large and industrial like the Ritz can feel sometimes.  I would recommend this as the best place to stay if you want to be right on the ocean!

Summary Heading: You hear the waves crashing + excellent service
Summary: This was always one of my favorite places.  You are right on the beach, and through the open doors the balcony you hear the waves.  What a wonderful sound to lull you to sleep! During our recent stay I found the housekeeping to be outstanding.  Our toiletries, bedside items etc. were arranged and organized without misplacing anything.  All in all, a wonderful experience.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Laguna
Summary: By far, this has been one of the best places I have ever stayed while vacationing. The service here is outstanding and everything is elegant and beautiful. It's in a great location and everything was just perfect. You will pay more here than you would any where else in Laguna, but it is SO worth it. Turn down service everynight is amazing. I was a bit nervous being from Texas that there was no air conditioning in any of the rooms! BUT, none was needed. We just cracked the balcony doors open a bit and listened to the waves at night while the breeze blew in. I would highly recommend this resort! AND they have an amazing spa too!

this hotel is gorgeous the pics on trip advisor don't do it justice I need upload some, the beach and views, the pool and resteraunt, bar are gorgeous, really friendly staff and rooms were spacious imaculatley clean and really nice loved our stay here, it is very expensive but I loved it.:)

Amazing! The Surf and Sand is a beautiful hotel. It is a bit pricey, however, we had an ocean view room and it was just amazing to hear the ocean waves throughout the day and wake up to them in the morning. The service was excellent and the staff were very courteous.   I would definitely go back to this hotel.

We were placed on the bottom floor of one of the buildings, with our terrace opening out onto the pool area, and immediately asked to change rooms as it was noisy with the kids at the pool. Also, our door opened out onto a corridor that was essentially the service hallway - ice was thrown onto the floor and left to melt, dirty stains, etc. Not a pretty sight.   The rooms were comfortable and clean but not memorable in any way. Service was ok but we didn't feel that the staff were that genuine. Also, it was annoying to only have valet as we went in and out quite often.

We live in Laguna Beach, California, in a great ocean view home.  Recently we replaced our lower level floors with wood flooring.  We moved to the Surf and Sand for just over a week.  While there are wonderful hotels in Laguna, including the famous Montage, we find that the Surf and Sand has the best views, rooms, restaurants and location.  This property is in the heart of town, yet it seems like you are isolated.  The hotel sits right on the ocean wall, and all rooms face the Pacific.  The decor is light, wide shuttered windows, marble baths.  Leave the shutters open at night and feel the breeze and listen to the waves hit the beach.  Service is great.  Had room service quite a few times.  Varied menu, loved everything.  The pool has a glass fence around it to cut the breeze,

I gave my kids a 1 night stay at the Surf and Sand Resort a few months back for their honeymoon night.  The remainder of their week was to be spent in Santa Barbara.  I had won the night stay during a raffle at a charity event.  Unfortunately, the money we had set aside for the remainder of their honeymoon in Santa Barbara needed to go toward a new place to live when their apartment flooded.  As my kids now only had 2 nights and three days I called the manager, Joanna, and she had Tammy work with me.  Tammy was wonderful, very understanding and went out of her way to help.  She gave me a great deal on another night and ensured that all extras associated with a honeymoon couple were provided.  They were treated like royalty, with champagne, chocolates, breakfast and a truly

Excellent hotel, have been there 3 times for business would love to go back with my husband. The hotel is cozy not huge and great access to lots of shopping you can walk to.  Splashes has great food, and there are lots of other great places close enough to walk to as well.  Loved it!

What an absolutely perfect birthday getaway just up the coast! Our room and view was phenomenal, and the service was exceptional.  Every resort staff member we encountered was  extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and most important friendly!  From the very beginning of our experience including making the reservation Lindsay was absolutely a doll in helping us get an amazing room, while at the same assuring me how wonderful the stay would be. It was very easy and quick to make the reservation with her, and she also sounded like she genuinely wanted us to have a great time!  We arrived a bit early before check in, where Nicole was able to pre-check us in, and also have a bellman take our luggage while we were able to go down to the beach. Nicole was very genuine and efficient during

My wife and I recently stayed here for a 5 nights as part of our honeymoon. It was absolute heaven!! The room and views are amazing,the staff are fantastic and the food and drink is fantastic too! I couldn't recommend this place anymore. Cannot wait to return.

We had an incredible stay, the only disappointment is the size of their  bar and no Host you have to fend for yourself which is usually not a problem but this bar is very small but fabulous ambience right on the surfs edge you want to be able to enjoy it as a hotel guest.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, right on the beach, lovely restaurant
Summary: I was here for a 3-day business event, which was a bit of a pity as this would have been a great place for a long weekend. I had a room which was right on the beach, but beware if you do get one of these rooms that the earplugs provided are not there for nothing - the breaking waves really are loud!  Room was really nice, very in keeping with the location, very Caribbean-feeling.  The restaurant at this place is excellent; a really nice setting with an open area where you can enjoy a drink/dinner and watch the sun set; nice atmosphere and excellent menu.  The hotel building is quite convoluted and difficult to find your way around. I think it's a result of the place having been extended over the years, but beware that there are not necessarily elevators to every part of the room

I was pleasantly surprised when my husband surprised me with a night at the Surf and Sand for our 5th year anniversary. I was thrilled as I had been to Splashes (their restaurant) and Aquaterra (their spa) many times. The view from our room was spectacular and the bed was extremely comfortable. There were just one or two things that would have made the stay a little bit better:  1) I didn't have the internet code and had to call to get it. When I called the front desk they kept me on hold for close to 10 minutes and apologized saying they were short staffed. I think that with the amount you pay for a hotel like this and the star level that it is not acceptable to have to wait 10 minutes just to get an internet code.  2) Our room was on the first floor and was located near their

This was a beautiful room on the 5th floor with the ocean rushing under the balcony. Stunning view of the ocean right outside on the balcony. Comfy beds, elegant setting, lobby and common areas are also more luxurious than a lot of oceanside hotels. Attentive staff too.  We ate at Splash, the restaurant, right on the beach, it's lovely. The sashimi was excellent, but the ahi tartar was literally melt in your mouth. It was enough for 2 people and we devoured it.  Good service too at Splash, the setting is very, very pretty and it makes for a great evening, romantic lighting and windows everywhere. The only bad thing about the hotel (and I have to mention this because it's a pet peeve) is the shower. First of all it was so close to the toilet it was crowded, and the drain wouldn't

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Surf and Sand Resort.  The staff is outstanding.  Every single person with whom I interacted was friendly, helpful and efficient.  The room was very clean.  The amenities were nice.  The waves are pretty loud, at least on the lower floors, so I would recommend using the ear plugs at night (I should've taken my own advice).  Be aware that there is no air conditioning, but with the door open, the ceiling fan on and running the portable fan, the room was very comfortable.  Breakfast was very good, too.  I would stay there again if I were in the area.

The Surf and Sand was amazing. The resort and rooms were perfect. We had a 180 degree view of the ocean. Slept to the sounds of the waves, beautiful balcony and great service! Laguna Beach isa great town with shops, art and music. Great way to celebrate our 20th anniversary!

This is The nicest resort in Laguna....It is expensive. but worth it. My wife and I stayed for a weekend getaway with friends And loved it. Our room seemed like it was in an odd place (as we walked down stairs after stairs) but it was the first set of rooms above the sand. We heard the ocean all night long and loved it.....Great Couple Get-a-way.... Very Romantic.

We had the pleasure of staying with the Surf and Sand Resort for our anniversary and we absolutely loved the resort.  We also loved the restaurant Splashes there.  Everyone at the resort was so accommodating and nice.  Although we were in California where we reside, we felt like we were on a Hawaiian vacation because the resort sits right on the beach in Laguna.  Hearing the waves crash each night and being able to take a romantic walk on the beach was definitely a plus. This resort is very expensive but to me it was worth every penny that we spent.  My husband was surprised and enjoyed every minute we spent together there.  And the couples spa experience that we had there was awesome!!! I can't wait to get back to the Surf and Sand resort again.

Summary Heading: Great resort, awesome staff only a few small things.
Summary: Overall, I think this resort is spectacular and look forward to coming back.  Positives - Amazing view of the ocean and you are literally right on the beach. - The staff is awesome and super nice and helpful.   - They definitely do the little things like chocolates on beds, free wifi, etc.  Negatives - For an amazing room - the shower is a bit small for having such a huge bathroom. - The ocean wave can be a bit loud so some folks had a hard time sleeping but the hotel does provide ear plugs.  Would highly recommend coming here.

I had the opportunity to stay here because of late work hours, and again they were so accommodating!  I had a late check in (1:00am!) and was able to sleep in with a late checkout.  Although it is hard to sleep with the roaring waves right outside the balcony! jk Friendly check in, and a soothing atmosphere upon arrival in my room - makes it hard to leave!

The Surf and Sand Resort is magnificently appointed with superb service and a great location overlooking the coastline. Its unique location made it easy to get around town and enjoy the ocean views. The staff is very service-minded, who really does make the extra effort to ensure your stay is special. The location of the property, beautiful rooms and wonderful staff members created a relaxing energy and memorable experience. This is hotel is definitely worth a return visit!

Stayed here for 3 nights recently - great views, good location, good service. Housekeeping was good and the concierge was very helpful. Cannot fault the experience in any way, though that's what you'd expect for the price! On top of the room fees, there's a resort fee and also additional fees for parking which is valet only (so add tips to that fee)!  All in all, great place for an event (eg wedding) but not sure i'd stay here otherwise!

This place is fabulous!  Our room was on the second floor of the Surfside Building and it was great. Same level as the pool, easy access to Splashes. The beautiful, flat beach was just a quick jaunt down the stairs. It it was hard to leave the room though, with the balcony overhanging the beach, we could sit in comfortable chairs, listen to the surf all day, feel the sea air and have all the comforts of the room.  The housekeeping staff kept the rooms so nice and they were by accommodating, love getting bottles of water everywhere.  Turn down service was available, too.  On the beach there are towels, chairs and umbrellas.  Valet service is excellent and personalized. The beds and pillows were comfortable, no problem with noise or other. One night there was a private party as we

Well appointed spacious rooms,outstanding service, and very attractive restaurant . The Montage has bulky furniture in a smaller room. Felt claustrophobic. All children here are entertained in an appropriate fashion.

I almost went for  booking the montage but we went here instead  even though it looks older from pictures. The room is spaciously layer out, deck is large with one lounger chair and two other chairs with footrest this is where we spent most of our time when awake.  The bed is super comfortable with warm soft sheets and silky light down like  comforter. Tv is large, easy to use and great picture. Room was 8th floor near the top and was super quiet we never were woke up by anything. The waves were super loud but truly peaceful to sleep through.  My husband was awakened by the loudness of the waves. I lived it. When I looked down from the deck the water runs right up to the bottom of the hotel. Beach is nice below. Restaurant was not that great we went for dinner and breakfast .

Summary Heading: Scrimp  everyplace else , but splurge on this hotel!!
Summary: This is one of the few hotels I've been to that I believe is worth every penny! The views and the sound of the waves are incomparable (They will even give you earplugs in case you find the roar of the waves too loud!). We especially like  the main section in the tower above the reception desk. At high tide, our room seems to be just feet from the water..And you can keep your windows open all night. the hotel staff is unfailingly friendly, polite, and extremely patient with guest requests. You get the feeling that they all think the place is special ,the guests are special, and they all love working here.!  The food was creative, very California, and delicious. The Splashes restaurant has several tables (reserve early) that open practically right on to the beach. The decor is

What a great hotel!!  The views are amazing. Loved the decor and the restaurant Splash was great.   Walking the beachs to downtown shops, etc very close......  We've also been with our kids and its great with family too....

You can not beat the view of the Surf and Sand Hotel situated on the beach with a panoramic view of the ocean. The pool, resturant and bar area are located feet from sand and the Pacific Ocean.   Attention to detail, cleanliness and a professional staff made this one of the best hotel experiences we ever had.

Great hotel with awesome staff. Best in Laguna Beach.their restaurant ,Splashes, is like dining on the beach. the rooms are well appointed and the hotel is pet friendly. It is a long walk or short car ride into the center of town but there are shops and restaurants close by if you don't want to go into town

Ask about A/C if you are booking here not all room have air! Beautiful facility, great spa, beautiful views but NOT all rooms are what I call ocean view... It seems if you can get a glimps of the ocean it is considered ocean view...not my idea of ocean view! Upon given oral directions to our room to the other building through the winding complex, we eventually found our room on the first floor at the very end of the path. Opening the door the room was very warm so we looked for the A/C thermostat which we learned later was NOT an A\C control. When calling the front desk we were told to open the sliding doors and pull the screen. OK but there was NO screen only shutters that kinda locked but still would not keep out any little creepy crawlers or anything else. Maintenance arrived

Summary Heading: One of my favorite hotels in the world
Summary: I absolutely love the Surf and Sand. It is an extremely nice luxury hotel without the pretension. It is as comfortable as it is luxurious. It's right on the beach, it has a phenomenal outside pool with really attentive bar staff, direct access to the beach, and all rooms are ocean facing. And the rooms themselves are designed beautifully; they are comfortable, spacious, and are designed in the color pallet of the ocean. There is nothing you would need that you don't have. And the beds are really comfortable, surprisingly so.   The restaurant is also wonderful, although certainly expensive. But the bars have great drinks and a good wine selection.   I will always come here, it is one of my favorite places to stay. Period.

I stay here once every few months and have always been pleased. The views are amazing, Splashes is great for breakfast, the staff is courteous and really take care of all your needs. I let them know I was celebrating being single and they sent me chocolates and champagne. I received the same on my return visit months later, plus cheese plate and wine that I enjoyed with a bubble bath listening to the waves because I sleep with the sliding door open. The rooms are perfect size. And I love the Philosophy bath amenities.  I really love this resort! The pool is perfect to enjoy a cocktail and some sun too! The only downfall is there is no air conditioning. The temps never seem to get that high so Ive never needed it.

Summary Heading: Asked for a quiet room but are directly below a massive party with a live band.
Summary: We asked for a quiet room and they put us below a live band who are currently doing a drum solo/Tom Tom thing. When we called the desk about the noise, they said they would send security over. A huge company is having a leadership convention here. Of course they did not shut it down.   We've paid close to $700- a night to be here with our 10 month old and 2 Yr old. We've had no maid service today, there is no kids club as described when we called because it's not high season, the concierge, Rebecca, told us there would be beach toys at the desk but when we arrived, they directed us to the hotel shop to buy them.  But most of all the room is pedestrian. From the photos they looked pretty but our room is very beige and a little worn. It has a tile floor in the living room which is

Location and setting beautiful.  We really enjoyed ourselves, however, last night we had an annoying clicking sound from the electrical in our bathroom.  We told the front desk and she said "oh I am so sorry" that was it.  Not a great way to leave our local stay.

Our stay at Surf and Sand Resort was absolutely amazing. The hotels location in Laguna is walking distance to restaurants and shopping ( if you decide to even leave the hotel) . The valet services were so accommodating upon check-in and Jeff delivered our luggage before we even made it to our room.  All of the rooms have ocean views and are really light and have been designed very well. It was so nice to be able to watch the waves crash from our balcony and from almost every other location on the property.  We enjoyed most of the day by the pool and ordering food from Splashes, which was really delicious.  I would highly recommend staying at Surf & Sand. We felt like we were the only guests staying there!

If you ever come to the surf & sand, make sure they don't give you room 453.  It's the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in.  It's above a kitchen and smells like food, It has no lights in the ceiling and no lamp near the desk, I'm sitting at a dark table writing on my lap top which is the main light source.   There is a party right outside my door and it's impossible to go to sleep.  The view out the patio door is a brick wall.  It really should not be classified as a hotel room.  I came all the way from Atlanta Georgia and it's shockingly terrible, I'm totally disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.    As we strive to exceed every guest's expectations, we clearly failed to deliver this to you.  We would love another opportunity to have you as our guest.  Please call me directly at 949-793-8054 or at jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely.  Joanna Bear  Assistant General Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: A wonderful hotel, hidden in a quieter location and impeccable service.  You are treated like royalty upon arrival and they have everything available -- spa, restaurant, excellent shopping within walking distance and beautiful rooms.  A great anniversary get-a-way or just a weekend of sunshine and fresh costal air!  I love the place.

This resort was just ok for us. Granted, we might be spoiled in that we live on the west coast of Vancouver Island, so although the scenery was beautiful it probably doesn't hold the same magic for us as it would for someone who lives in the city or away from the ocean. Went for a 3 night getaway and thought we'd try out Laguna Beach and this resort. Having read the reviews on the rooms we figured it would be a real treat to get one of the suites, settled on one of the Upper Catalina's. We got the suite right at the top of the stairs that lead down to the lower levels....I believe it was 448? In any case - I do not recommend. Not for over $1000 a night. The exterior door lends no sound proofing at all so we could hear everyone walking by and I'm sure they could hear us! There

Summary Heading: "The" Nicest Hotel In Laguna, Bar None!
Summary: What a wonderful experience we enjoyed at the beautiful Surf and Sand Resort. From the moment you arrived until the day you leave you get top notch, VIP treatment from the entire Hotel Staff. The accommodations are First Class and the restaurants are the same. Not to mention the location, it's a short stroll to the heart of the Village and Main Beach area. We park our car on arrival and don't use it again until we checkout.  We have been coming to visit Laguna for 30 years and have stayed in almost all of the Hotels there. None come close to the level of hospitality and amenities you enjoy at the Surf and Sand Resort. For the most memorable sunset possible, be sure to visit Splashes Bar downstairs on the beach. Huge windows look out at beach level and "Ken" might even be tending

We've been coming to the Surf and Sand for the last 10 years.  We usually try to make it here at least twice a year.  And there's a good reason:  It is one of the best hotels in Southern California. Many places that use the Pacific Ocean as their selling point, don't feel they have to provide nice rooms, good food, accommodating staff, or service-oriented help.  The Surf and Sand takes none of that for granted. The fact is, the hotel provides all of the above and it just happens to be situated right on the water.  In fact, because of all those amenities, we feel we barely need to leave the room.  For dinner, we order room service and sit on our balcony and watch the sunset. No restaurant has better food AND a better view!  And, if you like to fall asleep to the sound of crashing

I have been coming to the Surf and Sand for longer than I like to remember....back when it was just a motel!  Through the years, in all its incarnations, it just keeps getting better and better.  The location is amazing, and sleeping to the waves each night is the best sleep elixir ever.  The spa is gorgeous, and Shannon, the massage therapist, gave the most intuitive and theraputic massage I have ever had!  And I've had plenty.  For all of my travels, and all of the top Eurpoean Hotels I have stayed in (The Ritz Paris, Hassler, Roma, Claridge's London to name a few) The Surf and Sand is my favorite hotel in the world.  I am admittedly a beach girl, but the staff, the location, the food at Splashes, the spa....it's all that I ever want, and so attainable.  The staff in

One of the most memorable vacations ever.  While Laguna Beach has always been a fave with us, we found that Surf and Sand Resort really completes the experience. From the spectacular views from our well-appointed room, to the smiling and courteous staff to the soft sandy beach and sound of 'real' waves, Surf and Sand is a true beachfront resort in one of the most sensational Californian towns. Some of the must do's: walk along the beach, dinner at Splashes, savor a drink around the firepits by the lobby, paddleboard, walk to downtown Laguna and enjoy some of the restaurants. While we live in So. Cal, the experience was unique enough for us to feel like we had traveled for days to get awat - we plan to be back soon!

Summary Heading: Can't Get Any Better Than This!!!!!
Summary: Surf and Sand Resort is the ideal place to stay in Laguna Beach. The resort is located directly on the beach. Just a few steps and you are on the beach or relaxing by the beachfront pool enjoying soft music, cocktails and lunch served by the most amazing pool and beach staff. All of the rooms and suites are ocean front with private balconies with an outstanding housekeeping staff as well. While you get the amenities of a five star resort you have the luxury of a laid back atmosphere. The sunset as well as the service from Splashes Bar is a must! One of my favorite things is watching the dolphins while enjoying my oceanfront breakfast in Splashes Restaurant. On weekend nights you can enjoy cocktails with relaxing live music while watching the sunset at 1555. The resort has a

This was our second stay at this resort hotel-- our conference group liked it so much two years ago, we all came back.  The view is wonderful and the comfort is incredible.  Very friendly staff.  It is an easy 10 minute walk to downtown so you don't need a car to hit the shops and restaurants.  Definitely a place to return to.

This is a wonderful resort that could be stellar with a few tweaks.    In for a conference, we added several days to make it a vacation.   We were not sorry.   The resort is right on the Pacific Ocean.  While all rooms overlook the ocean, the best rooms and unobstructed views are in The Tower.  The balconies provide place to sit and watch the wonders of nature.   The rooms are spacious, well appointed, clean, and very comfortable.   The bed is great; we slept as well as at home.   The restaurant (Splashes) is quite good as well.   We used the spa which was luxurious.   A superb massage.   Guests can enjoy the beach, pool, or balconies.   With all that is wonderful, a couple of odd things kept this from being idyllic.   The bathroom is fine, but the showers are oddly configured

We stayed three nights at this amazing hotel in a ocean view room.  It was amazing and the sound of the surf lulling us to sleep was incredibly relaxing.  The furniture is very comfortable and the sheets were impossibly soft.  I found the shower well appointed, but awkward in size.  The bathtub hd sand in it from a previous guest when I went to use it.  Staff was excellent and friendly, from the maids to the desk staff.  There is a wonderful area off the lobby for sitting for coffee in the mornings with views of the ocean or for evening cocktails on the weekend nights.

Summary Heading: This was our fourth time back!
Summary: Room location on this particular visit was least desirable. Stay away from the 400 building.  We still had a great room and terrific  ocean view. We had hot water issues and Wi-Fi reception issues in our room. Probably because we were so far away from the main building. The comp happy hour was wonderful good appetizers and people watching. The splash bar is a dive. We recommend the "wine gallery" just half a mile south of the property great place! Breakfast at "Penguins". A 50-year-old mom-and-pop breakfast and lunch joint.  All and all we just love surf and sand and will be back again :-)

My personal recommendation, stay elsewhere.  The rooms are musty, dingy and dirty.  I have stayed at this hotel on business a number of times. Over the last two years, things have deteriorated considerably.  The rooms need updating.  They are musty and the walls and baseboards are dirty.  There was leftover seeds and crumbs on the floor next to the bed when I checked in (after waiting for hours). The manager, Victor left me with the impression that their hands are tied and they really can't do anything to help (he did call me later and mentioned he bribed another guest to swap rooms with me - this sounded so outrageous I declined).  The least they could do is clean the rooms.  My last room was right in front of the pool.  It was loud without a view.  If you find yourself on the
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I would like to sincerely apologize for your recent experience at Surf & Sand Resort and would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you personally.  In addition, we would love to have you back as our guest and have you experience the service and amenities we are noted.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054 or via e-mail at jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many of times and it has always lived up to our expectations. My husband and i have stayed at nice hotels all over the world, and this is truly our favorite. It is complete California paradise. We stayed here 2 weeks ago to kick off my daughters spring break and just like always, it was hard to get in the car to drive home. i have to say that this was def one of our most memorable! My daughter got to see dolphins, a whale, starfish, manta ray and even a seal that came up out of the waves to greet us. Those are things that she nor us, will ever forget. The pool is beautiful and actually where my daughter learned to swim years ago! The staff are amazing. Anything you need or want.. they're on it. We have stayed at the montage a little ways down the

Surf and Sand is a hidden gem on the West Coast. If you were driving down PCH and were not specifically looking for the hotel you would never see it. The service at the SS is TOP notch. Everyone is very accommodating. My wife and I spent 3 nights there and our entire stay was hampered by the fog that literally just sat right on the coast line. We made the best of it and hung out by the heated pool and had plenty of drinks at Splashes on the glass. A great spot for couples or families in my opinion. The rooms are small but when you are beach front who cares. All the amenities you need is right there for you. Will definitely be back.

The Surf and Sand has an incredible location, cannot say enough about falling asleep to the sound of pounding waves. Service from everyone and food was great, even room service was prompt and very good.   The room itself had much to be desired especially for the price of almost 700.00 a night. The surround of the bedskirt was torn, the carpet spotted in the first room we were taken to, the second room did not fair much better as the bedskirt was also torn( maybe from the sun....if they used proper material such as sunbrella I doubt they would have as much damage) and the carpet looked like it needed a good cleaning, the bathrooms and rooms are very outdated ....mold around areas in the bathroom.  I really was expecting much more for the price of the room . I have to say I was

Summary Heading: MUST STAY, even if you live in SoCal!
Summary: Ok..I can't say enough about the location.  The Surf & Sand Resort is RIGHT on the sand.  I only know of 3 hotels that have this proximity to the ocean and sand ( in Southern California).    The rooms are wide open (and completely private) to the Pacific Ocean.  The building is perched above the sand, which enables you to leave your sliding glass doors/thick wooden shutters open all night...to the sound of crashing waves.  You cannot beat this place.  Period.  Service is outstanding ( it better be for what they charge per night).  That's a given.  The restaurant and bar both have ocean views.    If you want to impress a lady (or man!) for a sunset cocktail...take them to Splashes Bar, overlooking the ocean.  I've shared this with many people by showing them this spot.  Even many

The valet greets you quickly and eager to help. Quick check in. Maid service accomodates you with whatever you need. The view is the best in town. The room was very big and very clean. The bed was a little soft.  The decor is very homey and up to date. It's perfect if you like to be seranded by the crashing surf. Stayed on the third floor - end unit right above Splashes restaurant. Enjoyed the live music from our room that came from the restaurant for a few hours. The soaps and shampoo's were gentle on our skin and they came packaged with novel positive quotes-(loved that little bit of poisitivity) little reminders about love and life. Splashes is always great for dinner. This time we had breakfast there-it was good but the service was a just a little unorganized. The servers

Just spent our first family vacation here. It was absolutely amazing. We have stayed here a few times before and we never once have been let down. The staff is always so accommodating and welcoming.
