They have turned us on to some amazing hot spots in town. The rooms are spotless and very well maintained. If you don't like getting covered in sand and still want to lay out and enjoy the weather their pool is amazing. We have stayed at many other hotels in Laguna and there isn't a hotel that can even come close to their "standards". It's was always our couples retreat and this trip we brought along our 8 month old. They set us up with a very nice crib and were very helpful in anything that we needed.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It is always a pleasure to hear such wonderful feedback from our repeat guests.  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments and we look forward to many future returns!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for two nights for her birthday getaway.  We had a Surfside King room right over the sand,  The furnishings were very nice and the balcony was great but the room was not exactly spacious.  If I stayed here again I would get a suite as the room felt a little cramped.  The staff was excellent and very helpful and service in the restaurant was excellent.  The location couldn't be better both for beach access and for walking around town.  The bed and linens were excellent and very comfortable as were the patio furnishings.  The single biggest annoyance was the shower.  Instead of a shower curtain or sliding door there is a single pane of glass that covers half the tub and is hinged at the wall to swing in and out.  The problem is that because the pane isn't
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am happy to hear you enjoyed your recent stay with us at Surf & Sand Resort!  I am sorry the size of our Surfside King Room did not meet your expectations.  It is our smallest room product.  For future consideration, both our Towers King and Seaview King rooms are larger and more spacious, as well as our suites.  Thank you again, for your kind words regarding rest of  your visit.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear  Assistant General Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel for my fianc√©'s birthday getaway and it was beyond my expectations!  All of the rooms have an ocean view and the waves literally crash under your balcony.  The happy hour at the bar had a great view of the sunset and a great drink list.  There are restaurants in walking distance but you almost don't want to leave the hotel because it is so beautiful.  If you're looking for a romantic getaway this is your place!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am thrilled to hear your fiance's birthday was a success!  And you enjoyed our amenities and services.    We hope to see you in the future for more celebrations!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: You are right there ... over the breaking waves on the beach.  How amazing!  And if the sound of the breaking waves is too loud ... they have ear plugs in each room.  WOW!  It doesn't get any better than this.  I love seeing the wild birds, the dolphins, the seals and other ocean animals from our balcony. We have been making trips to the Surf 'n Sand since the 1990's. The customer service is exceptional.  Our requests were expediently fulfilled. Everyone on the staff is so friendly. The morning brewed coffee is strong ... and free! The barrista shop is accommodating with such friendly people! It's only a 15 minute walk into the Laguna Beach Village ... an easy walk ... or convenient free trolley ride away.   The outdoor fire pit is very enjoyable.  The pool is remarkable with

Summary Heading: Love Surf and Sand with our family
Summary: We have been to Surf and Sand for the past 3 summers with our kids.  We absolutely love it.  It is pricey, but it is something we look forward to and plan for all year, despite the price.  The pool area is wonderful, with the beach only steps away.  Although we have always traveled with kids, I can see how there are areas around the pool just for adults, and would be very relaxing, facing the ocean.  One of the best things for a busy mom like me is towels!  :)  I love that all the beach towels are right there at your fingertips, along with beach chairs, and even some sand toys for the kids.  You are able to just tell one of the staff members how many chairs and umbrellas you want on the beach, and it's done.  It is so convenient and saves me lots of time setting all that up for

If you like the sound of crashing waves a few feet from your room, this place is for you. It's a wonder the place hasn't been claimed by the sea, but it has been here for decades so who am I to guess! The food at Spashes restaurant is outstanding...especially the Brussel sprouts. Odd but true. The staff is attentive and very pleasant all around. The rooms in the north building are slightly cheaper and newer. Go for those.

Stayed at the Surf and sand in August last year. We were still checked in at the Beverly Hilton and we paid for an extra night here because it was so gorgeous. The location is amazing. You won't find a better location. We had a King Surf side room which was lovely. Rooms are pricey but when you see the location you  can see why. The only con would be the size of the swimming pool. The sounds of the waves from the room is out of this world!!

Summary Heading: Best resort hotel in Orange County!!!
Summary: As a local from OC, we are familiar with many of the resorts.  My wife and i just stayed here over the weekend and could not have asked for a better time.  This resort hotel has many things which can't be beat which include...  Service, Location, Rooms, Spa, and restaurant/bar.  The hotel staff and management were over the top nice.  The resort not only sits directly on the water, it is also located in the heart of Laguna so you park your car for the entire weekend and simply walk the beach and streets.  The hotel has been renovated so the rooms and common areas are superb--everything overlooks the ocean.  We also were extremely pleased with the spa.  It is tough to beat a sunset beverage in their bar called Splashes!  Can't say enough great things about this hotel and we will

We have been coming here for several years now, and are NEVER disappointed. Everything - from the moment you arrive - is always impeccable: Service, location, cleanliness, extraordinary spa, decor, food... We are native San Diegans, and pretty spoiled at our own hometown resorts; however, this is our favorite getaway when a stay-cation is in order! Their spa is first-rate, and the glorious icing on their cake. You will NOT be disappointed at your experience here - not a better location on this coastline!!

Enjoyed a fantastic weekend getaway. The staff was excellent throughout the entire facility (so friendly).  The room was beautiful and nothing beats the sounds of the waves to let the stress roll off and into the ocean.   Enjoyed a nice night cap at splashes with the ocean as a backdrop.  Then, back again for lunch with crystal clear blue skies.  It was a perfect getaway.

This was my second time staying at this beautiful Laguna Beach resort. It is one of my favorite places to stay in Orange County. Beautiful rooms, friendly staff, and a breathtaking view! Make sure to try the restaurant "Splashes" with its exquisite menu and wonderful view overlooking the Pacific Ocean. I will definitely be back!

This great boutique hotel on the waters edge in Laguna. In the evening, you'll fall asleep by the waves below. The beds are extremely comfortable, the staff is attentive, you can't go wrong with the location if you're looking for a stay at the beach.

When we arrived at The Surf and Sand Resort it was California Cold -- 55 degrees. But the staff was very warm and welcoming. We arrived at our very spacious room, threw opened the balcony door and were warmed by the sun and lulled by the waves. My husband had a lovely massage in the spa while Ti Ti gave me a relaxing pedicure.  We went across the street for dinner at Ristorante Rumari. While dinner and service there were very good, a guest spilled a glass of red wine down my back. I used club soda to remove some of the stain from my back and as we left the hostess said white wine takes out red wine stains.   We went back to Splashes and Ken, the bartender gave me a glass of white wine to remove the stain. When we tried to pay Ken, he waved the money away and said,"you are trying

After being disappointed by the Casa Laguna Inn, we stayed here. Much better! Cleaner rooms, more pleasant staff and great atmosphere! I proposed to my girlfriend here and it couldn't have worked out better! Good value and experience. Would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Just magnificent.  Most truthfully-named place, ever.
Summary: We were looking for a romantic place for our anniversary, and the Surf and Sand was absolutely perfect.  Despite less-than-ideal weather, we couldn't possibly have been happier.  The waves were crashing at our feet when on our balcony, the bed was divine, the spa services were other-wordly, and every single person at the resort was friendly and more than responsive and accommodating.  Really, it's hard to criticize.  When I would call for my car from valet, it would be there before I could get to the lobby.  When someone forgot to have the ice in my room that I'd asked for, they appeared with a half bottle of champagne as a token of apology.    Some teeny-tiny nits:  some of the materials used in construction weren't 100% top-notch (so, for example, there was some wobble in the

I had the privilege of staying at the Surf N Sand resort for a business meeting. The facilities are immaculate. The ocean view from the rooms with a view are great! I cannot remember a week in a hotel where I slept better. The sound of crashing waves right at your window is soothing! I slept every night witht he sliding windows open. The bar downstairs is a great place to unwind, enjoy the view, take in the breeze and watch dolphins on the horizon.

Summary Heading: Unprecedented Beachfront Location and Amazing Staff
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Surf and Sand last month and had the most romantic trip.  Every room is beachfront.  We felt like we were in one of those rooms you see in Tahiti right above the water, we were that close.  We kept the balcony door open and listened to the waves crash throughout the night.  We had pre-dinner drinks at the Splashes bar and then moved upstairs for dinner at Splashes restaurant.  The food was amazing.  Our waiter Kyle made our entire evening!!!  He knew everything about the menu and was so entertaining. He kept us laughing the whole time.  Make sure you ask for his table if you go to the restaurant.  The valet and bell service were also super friendly and accomodating.  I agree with other posts, this is a hotel for couple not children.

Obviously they know that there most important asset is The Pacific. The Hotel is quite used and n√∂ more really up to date. Bathroom equipment has not been improved for 20 years. Service: you arrive by car, 3 Bell Staff are there but you need to unload and Carry your cases and bags your self. Not even 5 Dollars tip was helpful. Personel not greet you when you meet them. The very possitive: best Location in Laguna by far. The waves carry you in a wonderful sleep and the view to the Pacific is stunning. Restaurant is fine and has a wonderful Outsider Sitzung aera. Staff of Restaurant and Bar is very friendly and helpful. I stayed there almost Emery Year for 20 years during a Convention in Anaheim and most certainly i will book again....just for the brillant location and with a rest

Summary Heading: This is a place to go for ultra romantic/adult weekend.
Summary: this isn't a kid's hotel, this is couples, or singles who are retreating, and it is located walking distance to town. Easy for guest visits, as they can park off site on PCH or side streets.  Casual, and non effected, this is the closest thing to an apartment on the ocean you can get, as it isn't fussy, you stay secluded in your room starring at the most amazing views that feel like one is  on a ship on the water.  The waves pound, so if that bothers you, don't stay here, its too loud. I love the sound personally.  Small gym, small restaurant, small pool area smallish beach in front but all super nice.  Not a resort, more a retreat and a lot of sex appeal.  Rooms are older, not amazing, but the views are shockingly gorgeous.

Summary Heading: Location excellent, some staff not service orientated.
Summary: Checked in around 945p, was surprised when I heard the clerk advise people in front of me that room service stopped at 10p, as well as bar and restaurant. I called room service from reception, ordered a sandwich immediately.  Layout to get to your rooms confusing and did not eagerly explain how to get to yor room.  Plus, the beach is at your doorstep, sound of waves soothing.  Breakfast in restaurant very good all around.  Overall, nice place, just orientate some staff to provide better service.

Summary Heading: Ignored and room door left wide open
Summary: 3rd stay here but not again. Didn't have our booking even though we had confirmation took 15 mins to find they could fit us in. Ok not a problem mistakes happen.  Friday around the pool was lovely but boy was Saturday different as you felt as if you are in a different resort. The pool was empty but people had put things on the best chairs to reserve them. I asked if I could remove them after 30 mins but told no. That was a mistake as the staff ignored us for the rest of the day. They asked people around us if they wanted a drink or food but not us. My husband went across the road bring in food and drink for us. The pool staff by 10.30 had reserved all the front seats for locals staying in the hotel and even we people asked if they could sit as no seats left they got a no. Many
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you very much for the feedback regarding your recent stay with us.  It is vital to know when situations, such as yours, happen to ensure proper training and follow through are being addressed.  I want to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced at the pool and with your guestroom door.  I can assure you that I will be personally following up with these issues.  We would love another opportunity to have you as our guest.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a few times before and always found it to be wonderful.  This time, we had an issue in the dining room, which was immediately taken care of, along with a bottle of champagne delivered to our room.  The rooms have been updated, and the tower rooms are large and have a direct ocean view.  Wonderful stay.

It was our 1st dating anniversary together so I decided to surprise my boyfriend and indeed he was surprised! From the moment I got on the phone to make the reservation to the last second we got into our car, the whole experience was OUTSTANDING! Everything that others have written in the reviews are all true and more. Amongst the wonderful staff, there were a few gems that really took hold of our heart--Emil Chamie, from the concierge for one, went above and beyond to make it extra special for us. He was very understanding, helpful, patient, and accommodating in every way. Emil and his colleague did an amazing job on the room, it couldn't have been more magical and perfect. It's the little things that count and when it is genuinely done from the heart, it fills the people's

Another AMAZING and RELAXING stay.  From check in to check out.  The room renovations are beautiful. The view is unsurpassed and the spa was amazing.  The Spa was amazing.  Great menu to pick from. You could not ask for more.  There is no place like this!!

I always stay here when I travel to Laguna and always will!  The restaurant is simply the best, rooms are incredible and clean and all face the ocean.  Staff is so friendly, some of the best I've ever encountered.  I've stayed for weddings, meetings and R&R.  This is a great hotel and I'm a huge fan!  Thank you Surf & Sand and kudos to the GM for for running such a great operation.

My wife and I stayed here for a "Fantastic" week and loved every minute of it. From the minute we arrived we received the best service possible from the friendly well trained staff. The room was superb and very comfortable. The view from the balcony with the surf crashing in below us was the best, and the gorgeous sunsets and beautiful clear water with seals and sea birds practically at our feet are something we wll always remember. The food and service at the restaurant was exceptional. We'll definately be back!

If you are looking for something that has everything: luxury accommodations, supurb service, amazing cuisine and breathtaking views of the ocean...you have found the place! I frequently stay in high end hotels for business but this one takes the cake! From beginning to end, the valet and front desk staff were genuinely welcoming. Our oceanside room was fantastic with a balcony to sit and enjoy the sunset. It had super comfortable beds with nice, clean linens. We fell asleep to the sound of the waves. Even housekeeping went above and beyond! Not only did they clean the room meticulously, but they organized our things. (not evasively, but efficiently) When we returned to our room we found our beds were lit up underneath; a small detail for ambiance that went over in a big way. We
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for your valuable feedback!  We strive for excellence and am thrilled we delivered it to you during your last visit.    I will be sharing your comments with our team and we look forward to your next stay with us at Surf & Sand Resort!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: It's not hidden but it is definitely a gem. I hadn't been to this property in quite some time so I was ecstatic to see the the room renovations that had taken place and how they rival any other luxury hotel in Southern California.  First off, you can't get this close to the water at any other luxury, or otherwise, hotel in the area. In a matter of seconds you can get from your room to the beach which is heavenly. All the rooms offer an unrivaled view of the Pacific Ocean. The bathrooms are utterly fantastic, the beds are ultra comfortable and the decor is stunning.  Secondly, there's really no reason to leave the property. Even though you're in the heart of Laguna Beach which offers multiple attractions, you have a choice of multiple venues on site. Splashes Restaurant offers

I was able to stay here over a long-working weekend in Laguna Beach. The hotel is gorgeous and the staff, from the moment I checked in, was courteous, friendly, but not over bearing.  I watched the dolphins every morning during coffee on the front balcony!  I can't wait to go back!

Summary Heading: This hotel is the perfect blend of top shelf class and absolute relaxation
Summary: What a place! The location of Surf and Sand is beyond sublime. Couple that with the beautiful rooms, warm and professional staff, and overall exquisite ambiance- one of the best spots on earth! I have been to many 5 star hotels in my lifetime - this place is the total package. Wait until you see the sunset from your balcony! If you are looking to stay in an environment where you feel relaxed, spoiled and in total awe of Mother Nature - this is it!

We took advantage of the Black Friday special and had a wonderful stay.  We always enjoy the Surf and Sand.  The view is amazing, the service is excellent and the sound of the waves can't be beat! In the summer they provide chairs and umbrellas on the beach, as well as food service on the beach.

Our company has held two conferences a year for the past 30 years.  Our attendees are highly educated, discerning professionals who look forward to coming to the Surf & Sand each year.  Many come back during the year and bring their families for a holiday.  The ocean views from beautifully appointed rooms are picture perfect.  You actually hear the ocean waves crashing on the beach. The sunsets are breath taking.  The Surf & Sand is large enough to accommodate large groups and small enough to have friendly, helpful staff.  Many of the staff members have been with the Surf & Sand for several years.  They take personal pride in their service to each guest.  The conference rooms are elegantly decorated while providing modern, technical setups for professional presentations and

Summary Heading: First Class Destination with a personal touch
Summary: Our family stayed at Surf and Sand this past week and had an amazing time.  This has to be one of the coolest places to stay. I believe every room faces the ocean and has views that are all beautiful. It is so close to the water that every room comes equipped with ear plugs. However, you don't need them because they must have installed sound proof sliding doors to every balcony. We spent a lot of time on our balcony just watching in awe. We saw dolphins several times...we watched one of the most beautiful sunsets...very relaxing!  The room is decorated with a designer's touch. The beds were extremely comfortable, bathrooms very elegant, and inviting balcony.   If you are travelling with children, ask them about their "smores". They bring in a very small tent to your room with
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback on TripAdvisor.  I am thrilled to hear you had a great stay with us and I will be sharing your comments with our team.  We look forward to your next stay with us!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Loved our stay on New Year's Eve
Summary: I was able to obtain an aweome promotional rate by responding to an online offer on "Black Friday and Cyber Monday".  I was surprised that the offer even included New Year's Eve.  Arrived early and Melissa at the front desk was gracious and extended an early checkin and Jennifer gave us an appreciated late checkout on New Year's Day.  Our room was absolutely gorgeous with a breathtaking view.  We were even given a small bottle of champagne in a pretty wine cooler in the early evening in our room to toast the New Year.  I was told that all rooms received this -- what a treat.  The onsite restaurant, Splashes, was very good with a great wait staff and hostess. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  My husband and I love the Surf and Sand and we both agreed to come

I cant imagine there is a better place to experience Laguna Beach like the Surf and Sand Resort. First of all the staff is very polite, attentive, courteous, friendly and helpful. The attention to detail blew my mind.  When I wanted the car, I didnt even have to give them a ticket or anything... they knew exactly which car was mine... everyone always greeted me by my last name... and with a friendly smile!  The room? well.... OCEAN FRONT.... gorgeous... I could hear the crash of the waves at night... AMAZING.... felt Iike a meditation room!  LOOOOVED it.   I want to go back!  I recommend it 100%

Just went to Laguna last week before the holiday. Just have to say what a great experience i had. The service was very attentive and welcoming- always asking if i needed anything first. Front Desk, Concierge, Valet and server at the bar- extra credit.  Facilities and food -fantastic.  And the hotel is in a perfect location- directly on the beach and close enough to walk downtown while wandering in/out of shops and art galleries.  I can still hear the waves crashing while i watch the orange and purple sunset from my balconey dip below the water line and watch the surfers as they try for that perfect ride.

The Surf and Sand Resort is a full service resort that offers a comfortable room with ocean view, small spa and gym, and restaurant. If you are a returning guest, the resort will also deliver to your room a half bottle of wine with chocolates-a nice touch. The only reason I gave the resort 4 instead of 5 stars is due to price. Having stayed at hotels throughout the world, the resort is priced about $100/night too high for their standard king room. Also, with so many top quality restaurants within walking distance of the resort, the price you pay for the convenience of dining on the property detracts from the dining experience at Splashes (the resort restaurant).   But if price doesn't bother you, you can't go wrong with this property.

Incredible view from the ocean side rooms. Very nice people. Rooms are spacious and clean, people are really pleasant and helpful. Restaurant and bar have nice views, I feel best place to stay on this end of Laguna.

What a perfect property for a great getaway.  The service was spot-on while very relaxed.  The Tower Rooms are very spacious, beautifully appointed & very clean. The balcony furniture was so comfortable.  It was the perfect place for morning coffee, afternoon reading & evening drinks. Being smack on the ocean was fantastic:  the sound of the waves, the sunset views & the people & dog watching was all great.  The greeting at the spa was terrific; the young team was efficient & personable.  I had intended to book just 1 treatment, but they suggested 2 & I thorougly enjoyed them both.  The poolside area had a great atmosphere with plenty of lounge chairs & good F&B service.  Can't wait to go back again.

Surf & Sand is a true oceanfront gem. It was a quaint property right on the sandy Laguna Beach in the middle of town.  Our room was comfortable, spacious, and what a view to wake up to!  We didn't want to leave the room and ordered room service for breakfast.  It arrived in less than 25 minutes on a Saturday morning.  I wish I was able to stay another day to truly experience the resort. Our friends had a suite, and it was dropdead gorgeous!  I'd definitely splurge on the suite in the future.  Staff was courteous and truly enjoyed working at the property.

Everything about our stay we beyond perfect.  Check in was flawless with Kyle.  John our bellman for both arrival and departure was kind and gave us great advice for my birthday dinner at Splashes and even made our reservation. The views at this resort are out of control.  We were so close to the ocean from our room that my boyfriend got vertigo looking over our balcony.  And, when you have ear plugs to block the sound of the ocean you know you are in an amazing location!    We had cocktails prior to dinner and watched the sunset and it was amazing.  Pepe was our waiter for dinner and was very nice and professional.  He gave us great suggestions and was very attentive.  Kyle was our waiter the next morning for breakfast and was also wonderful.  It was a cold morning and we had

Great hotel. Down to earth people. This hotel is literally ON THE BEACH! I had an ocean front room and when I looked down from the balcony, it was water right below.   S & S is a boutique hotel - rooms are clean and the location is great. Restaurant is small but offers great food and drinks.

My Partner and I were here for the weekend for a wedding.  Our room was on the wedding patio overlooking the Pacific ocean.  I had heard so many great things about this Hotel from many people, so I was excited to finally give it a chance. Cons- For such an expensive room, I expected there to be a coffee maker.  It's minor, but should have been included.           This is the first hotel I have ever stayed in where ear plugs are provided. It was quite noisy.   The walls were paper thin and you could hear peoples conversations.            The wedding reception was at the hotel and the training of the servers were not up to standard.  They practically threw the bread down onto the table and had no training as to how to properly place plates down.  For such an expensive wedding I

Surf and Sand was awesome! Great hotel, great people, great food! It was a beautiful location and a walk away from the center of Laguna Beach. They also have a great fitness center and spa! They were super helpful at finding other restaurants and places to go. Thank you S&S!

I continue to return to this property for many reasons. Location - It has an amazing location and we can hear the waves from our bedroom. I have never stayed in a room with a bad view. I enjoy the coffee shop downstairs and  we bring our own wine to drink in our room while watching the waves and the sunset. The staff is amazing - Melissa at the front desk went out of her way and was wonderful. The food is gourmet and I am not a great fan of gourmet food so it is not really fair for me to comment on the menu. The hotel is on the beach and it is a truly amazing spot.

Summary Heading: Nice on the Beach...but the bathroom/bedroom is not so nice
Summary: We stayed at the Vista Suite which was advertised in the Nov.2012 issue of Coastal Living. The living room and patio did NOT disappoint...but the gloominess of the bedroom (one window which looked out to a brick wall) and bathroom need to be upgraded...the staff was very efficient and the meals were quite good.

Summary Heading: Surf and Sand A Quaint Place by The Ocean
Summary: Surf n Sand is a beautiful hotel right on the beach in Laguna. It has great views in all the spaces...gym, restaurant, outdoor lounge, etc. The spa looks amazing, we did not get a service but loved the chill out room there. The pool is OK but you should really be running and swimming in the ocean anyhow. Great people and comfy beds too. I bit pricey but it is on the beach. :)

Here is a copy of the response I sent Surf and Sand via their email survey:  "We had a very nice time in Laguna and although your hotel is beautiful, overall we did not have a pleasant stay due an unfortunate experience with both temperature and odor in our room.  When we arrived on Friday afternoon, our room was extremely hot. (I did not realize there was no AC), so we did our best to cool the room down by using the extra fan provided, and keeping the sliding glass door open. Although, for safely reasons keeping the sliding door open is not something that I am very comfortable with, especially over night. However, we really had no choice, because our room was so hot. Then at about 1:00 am we started to smell a horrible skunk stench, which we think was coming into our room via
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  On behalf of the Surf & Sand Resort, thank you for providing feedback on your September stay with us. I appreciate your concerns and take your comments very seriously.   I extend my sincere apologies for the inconvenience regarding the lack of air conditioning and odor permeating your room and certainly understand your displeasure.  We make every effort at all times to make our guests comfortable during their stay; however, unfortunately, we experienced an unusually warm summer in Laguna which made it difficult to achieve that goal.  I would certainly enjoy having you return to Surf & Sand when the weather is more suitable to ensure a pleasant stay.  Please feel free to contact me personally, when you are able to revisit Surf & Sand, so that you are able to enjoy the beach environment for which we are known, and all your preferences are met. My direct line is 949-793-8054 or via e-mail jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: My partner and I stayed at this facility on the recommendation of a friend, but I was not impressed. I have been to resorts in other locations and other countries, and this one had a few things missing, although it was a nice place. I expected perhaps landscaped gardens, a golf course, tennis courts, or something of that nature; there were none of these. There was a swimming pool, but it was rather small and rectangular. Basically, this hotel is sandwiched between the highway and the ocean with other properties on either side. At high tide there is about 20 feet of sand between the hotel wall and the water. The nicely decorated room had a great view of the ocean, with louvered doors for nice breezes, but the room had very dim light bulbs (a common problem these days), and the

This boutique hotel has one of the best locations in Laguna Beach. If you can get a room in the Tower Building, ocean front, you'll be set with an ocean front view right on the water. Some hotels boast ocean fronts or ocean views when all you see is a speck of blue-the Surf and Sand fulfills it's promise if you get a room in the Tower Building.  The rooms are lovely although every time we go there they seem to be in need of a bit of an update.  The hotel has a pretty good restaurant but you'd be better off going into town and eating at 230 Forest Avenue.  I love this place. It isn't perfect but has a lot of charm, has a fantastic ocean view, and it's not an overpriced giant chain hotel where the price of the extravagant entry way to the hotel is built into the price of your room.

Your rooms are literally, right on the water.  Updated and modern boutique hotel, I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  The lobby is small and modern.  The staff was very helpful and very nice.  Rooms were very large with full ocean views.  I was also pleasantly surprised to see Philosophy branded shampoo's and soaps in the bathroom, which was a first for me.  I would definitely recommend to stay here..but if not would go back for lunch or dinner in the "on beach" restaurants.

The views from this hotel are incredible with the ocean waves breaking right below you. The weather was perfect with clouds that lit up the sky during the sunsets and the islands clearly visible. Combine that with the comfortable rooms and great restaurant right on the beach, you can't help but fall in love with this place. A great vacation for the price.

Summary Heading: short vacation at Surf and Sand
Summary: Super hotel all services first class. Views stunning just above the ocean and very relaxing. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Not to far from Laguna Beach town centre - excellent local restaurants close by though hotel restaurant is also excellent. One of the best hotels we have stayed in - we'll be back !!

Summary Heading: Beware of hidden and extra charges
Summary: Lovely hotel, great room, but beware of hidden costs, such a charge to use the leisure facilities....! Cost of breakfast requires a bank loan....better hotels, offering better value...Parking fees are outrageous, so look for alternative parking. my hidden fees came to over $400 just for 6 days....!

sitting on the deck looking at the paddleboarders paddle by and the birds drift in the wind sooo relaxing. Rooms still great. Had a massage also great.  You get a paper at your door in the morning --but you do have to go to the lobby for coffee in the morning -- that is ok no old beat up coffee maker like many places have. Next trip I hope I can stay longer

We had a king room in the main tower and enjoyed the spectacular view and sounds of the surf.   We had an excellent dinner and breakfast at Splashes. Special thanks to Emil the night manager for taking care of a special request. We will look forward to a return visit to this lovely property.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous, unless steps are an issue
Summary: This hotel is right on the ocean with spectacular views.  The rooms are beautifully furnished with the bed facing out toward the ocean.  The terrace was large and watching the sunset was close to perfection.  There is no AC in the rooms, but there is a ceiling fan. The room was very hot in the late afternoon with the sun streaming in but cooled off quickly once the sun set.  Not sure what it would be like in the summer heat. We did need to sleep with the terrace sliding door open and the ocean was deafening. It didn't bother me (the hotel provides ear plugs) but it did keep my husband from sleeping.    The major problem with the hotel is also the reason why it is so special. It is literally built into the cliff from the road to the beach below.  This means that there are steps

from Kimberly @ the Front Desk to Michael (Bell Captain)....every employee on site was friendly and knowledgeable about the area....we are a family of 3 (adults)...37yr ....26 yr....60 yr....something for everyone...we hung out at the pool and had snacks....VERY GOOD....drinks REEEEALLLY GOOD....definitely 5 Star service....we had dinner at SPLASHES there and we each enjoyed our meal and Pepe (waiter)...beautiful spot right on the beach...we had a balcony room over the ocean and slept with the doors open...we all slept in.....happy ZZZZZZZZZ's....we will go back next summer to do it again

Love the Surf & Sand! We had an oceanfront room (have stayed several times.) We are local to the area and it's one of my favorite places to stay at the beach. The rooms are really on the beach, it's so nice. The spa is nice and had a great massage. It's small but unique.

Just home from 5 days of pleasure at this lovely resort in Laguna Beach California.  From the staff to the decor you couldn't beat this retreat!! The weather was gorgeous and hot and this hotel has no A/C but it does have lovely views of the sea and with it lovely sea air and the "roar" of the waves to put you to sleep.  Fans and the windows all open more than compensated for no A/C. There are wonderful little, quirky shops all down the PCH that is the " main " street of Laguna and great little restaurants/bars to meet every need!!

A small group of us stayed at the S&S two weekends ago and the experience was amazing.  Looking at other review people's expectations seemed a little off with the no ac conversation but this is nothing to the overall five star experinece we received from the staff.  The resort is on the ocean, the pool, bars and resturant are on the ocean.  We wake and go for a swim, have lunch or a drink in the bar and go for a swim.  Actually, I swam and ate my lunch thru the windows with my traveling companions.   All six of us loved the rooms, the beds are so sampling, the ocean at night and by the way ac is going in next year.   The morning coffe shop was great as breakfast which was one of the best.  We often stay at other resorts around this part of the coast but this wins on all counts.

Our visit to the Surf and Sand was wonderful.   The rooms were beautifully appointed and my daughter loved the "floating" beds! The lights under them make them look they are floating in air.  We loved sleeping with the windows open to hear the surf.  As a Southern Californian I love the heat, so I did not mind the no a/c.  We just hung at the pool and dipped our feet in the surf. The beach is clean and the pool side service was superb. The pool was closed early in the evening to prepare for a private party, but we did not mind as we spent the whole day at the pool.  Spashes restaurant offered excellent service and food, and it was a great place to watch the sunset.  Our stay was short, but I would certainly stay again. Even though we just came up from our own resort town of San

Honestly, the view from the rooms is awe inspiring.  I was so mesmerized by it, I find it difficult to write anything else about the room in general. Yes, there is no AC.  I was able to keep the room temp very manageable and I like my rooms pretty chilly by other peoples standards.  I did sleep with the windows open (shutters closed) and I slept VERY well.  If you are sensitive to sound - yes, you will hear the waves crashing.   I found it soothing.  In the morning you can sit on your balcony and enjoy coffee and then maybe take a walk on the beach.  Just beautiful ...SUCH a lovely experience!  Okay- and beyond the ocean views, the location is great - we would walk downtown for dinner.  If you are staying in laguna, the two things you want to consider are beach access (ideal to

When we stepped into the room it was so hot and sticky... I searched up and down for the a/c control, but was surprised when I realized there was no air conditioning! I live in Las Vegas and have dealt with 120 degree summers, but spending +$500/night, you just assume there would be a/c. I wish I would have read these reviews before hand to know this, especially since I get hot very easily. Personally, I like having the balcony door open to listen to the waves and having 2 fans full blast distracted from the ambiance, not to mention didn't cool it off enough.   There were 2 wedding on the Saturday and 2 more on Sunday. The lobby area and walkways were packed with people and it was very awkward walking through all the dressed up people wearing shorts. We weren't informed of the
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I apologize that you were unable to enjoy your time with us due to the unseasonably warm weather and wedding business volume.  We would love another opportunity for you to experience our service and products that we are known for‚Ä¶ please call me directly at 949-793-8054 for arrangements.  I look forward to speaking with you.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel with ocean liner views
Summary: We have been coming to the Surf and Sand for many years. The location of the hotel is incredible withe rooms in the main part if the hotel literally looking right out into the ocean. It is as if you had stepped out onto your ocean liner deck. Although there are several other beautiful hotels in the area, none of them has this view. The decor of the rooms is lovely; light and airy; very cheerful. There is no air conditioning but this had never been a problem due to the wonderful ocean breezes---until this visit. The room was very warm and required the use of two fans to make it more comfortable. I can't imagine what it must have been like two weeks ago when the temperature was 100 degrees.  The personnel at the front desk and concierge are cheerful, efficient, and helpful.  The

If you're up for a splurge, invest it in an ocean front room. Stepping out on the balcony makes you feel like your steps away from the water. Also, I love being able to hear the lull of the ocean crashing when falling asleep.  As for desserts, wasn't very impressed.  Overall, this places earns four stars for location!

Summary Heading: could be great but....NO A/C for $400 + per night
Summary: This place is disappointing more because it's so close to being a 5 star hotel and given it's location it should be but for some reason someone in management thinks the cool air breeze from the ocean is enough to warranty NOT having air conditioning.  The biggest disappointment is that you're paying for a 5 star hotel and getting 3 to 4 star accommodations. I couldn't imaging paying $500 + and have no AC, this summer was hot and the waves crashing  can get pretty loud at night.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your recent review on Trip Advisor. I  appreciate your positive comments and also extend my sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced during  your recent stay. I understand your displeasure and appreciate you as a valued guest.  We make every effort at all times to make our guests comfortable during their stay; however, we experienced an unusually warm summer in Laguna which made it difficult to achieve that goal.    I would certainly enjoy having you back as our guest when the weather is more suitable to ensure a pleasant stay.  Please feel free to contact me personally at 949-793-8054 when you find the time to revisit Surf & Sand so that you are able to fully enjoy the beach environment for which we are known, and that your expectations are met.   Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: My wife and I spent the weekend recently for the wedding of our son who was married on their Catalina Deck.  The hotel and facilites are amazing.  It sits literally right on the beach with many amenities but the feel of a small boutique hotel.  Steps to the beach for a long walk on the sand, or lounge by the pool with a view of the Pacific Ocean.  The rooms are very nice.  The food in Splashes REstaurant is very good, but my favorite place was the Splashes Bar.  It is set a few feet above the sand with the waves crashing below; windows open, breezes coming through...it is fantastic!!!  I live in southern OC and this feels like you are in Hawaii.

Summary Heading: The view can't get any better...other things can
Summary: We just spent a night at this resort to celebrate our wedding anniversary (Myself, husband + baby).  When they say Ocean View suite, they are not lying!! Our room was literally on the water! The balconies are right above the small beach and very, very close to the water; so much so that from the balcony you have the impression to be immersed! We found the room to be quite nice, even though there was no A/C. Now, it's common for beach resorts not to have A/C, but I must say that when you pay more than $ 700.00/night, you expect A/C. The alternative is to leave the windows open and the ocean gets very, very loud!!! We ordered room service from the Splash restaurant and it was good. Not to dye for, but good for a room service order. Also, it was served very quickly. For breakfast

We have stayed at this resort several times over the last 20+ years and continue to enjoy the view, service and its overall quality.  Recognize that the nightly stay is very expensive, but the location cannot be beat as the property is right on the beach.  One recommendation for the staff would be to increase the bed size to double queen rather than two doubles as it appears since our last stay the bed size was reduced.  We received several recommendations for breakfast and dinners, all turned out fine.

My wife and I just went here for our 10 year anniversary. Unbelieveable place with exceptional service and views. If you're willing to spend the money you will not be disappointed. You are in walking distance of everything in Laguna including shopping, food and activities. Splashes restaurant has exceptional food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The only negative I have for the resort is that the bar area is small. Even though it's literally on the beach, it can get crowded on the weekends. Other than that, it's a fantastic place.

Wanted to surprise my ailing mother with a seaside celebration of her 76th birthday. Andrew in reservations saw to it that we were accommodated with a very nice ADA equipped suite on the Tower side of the property. Thank you, Andrew!  Our beautiful seaside room was perfect. Stunning views of the ocean and soothing waves have left her with a treasured memory. A note of thanks to fitness instructor, Tommy Bensen who so graciously held his Boot camp workout dispite the fact that I was the sole boot camper, inspirational!! Housekeeping was so incredible in regard to my mother's limited ability to leave her suite. Did not get the name of the man and woman that attended to her the afternoon of September 1, but thank you! Splashes dinner birthday celebration for the 14 of us was

Summary Heading: Great Romantic Getaway -- Surfside Rooms are the BEST!
Summary: This was a beautiful location...and to be honest it is our new favorite Laguna hotel...no more Ritz C for us!  The service was wonderful and our room was extraordinary.  When making a reservation ask for "Building 4" as there are about 24 rooms in that building which is located on a strip of the beach where the waves break...and you have the most unobstructed view of the ocean.  I believe it was called a "surfside room."  Watching surfers, joggers and the like was really nice while sipping on vino.  Then, the sunset was just absolutely stunning!  We slept with the sliding glass doors open all night and were lulled to sleep by the wonderful crashing sound of the waves.  The spa experience was great too.  If you are booking soon...the Pumpkin Chai Package is amazing.  It starts

Summary Heading: Still lovely, but needs some tweaking.
Summary: I stayed for the second time for a week recently. A few things have gone downhill since I was there last. One was the front desk staff. I dealt with one lady a few times, and she was less than welcoming and hardly pleasant. The other was Splashes. Last time, I could have eaten there every day - this time, after the first lunch we decided not to return. The service was brusque, it took 25 minutes to get a glass of wine, and the food was only average. The waitstaff had an argument directly behind me. I wonder what happened there. Onto the good points - I booked the Vista Suite for the days it was available, and it was lovely, with a wonderfully large outdoor terrace. Be aware though, it does hang over the pool area, so if it is a busy weekend, you may not want to hear the music

First time in Cali - second time at Laguna beach. We loved the location so much we returned to Laguna beach on our road trip back to LAX, after two seriously rubbish hotels, one of which was in Laguna, we decided to make the most of our first trip to the states. This hotel made our holiday, service was immaculate, views and rooms out of this world. I may spend the next 6 months paying off my credit card but when I sleep at night I dream of this place. Yes the sea is noisy, and there is no air conditioning but who gives a damn ..... It's paradise

Summary Heading: I can't get enough Surf and Sand resort
Summary: I first stayed at this amazing resort after a rather unpleasant weekend in Las Vegas. The trip to Vegas was so negative that I didn't want to return home with that negativity. So, by pure luck I searched local resorts and found Surf and Sand resort. It was late evening, during peak season when I called. I spoke to Emil at the front desk. He was very professional, helpful, and made me feel more welcome than any resort I have ever experienced. I HIGHLY recommend asking for Emil if you want that "special guest" feel. I have spoke to other front desk personnel and the service and feel was just "typical" check-in experience Not bad, but nothing like my experience with Emil.  Also, I cant say enough about the bell desk and Valet service. Those guys are so accommodating I feel like a

Summary Heading: Rooms are uninhabitable. Nice place if you don't have to stay in a room
Summary: Great location & beach. Good & tasty food in restaurant. High prices are justified because of the views & open air.  The rooms are nicely furnished, but are uninhabitable. There is no air circulation in the rooms which is especially bad because there is no air conditioning. If you are on the ocean side, the waves are so noisy, that you cannot sleep. If your room is facing PCH, the traffic noise is unbearable. You can't close the sliding glass door unless you don't mind suffocating. The bathroom had no exhaust fan or window for air (A violation of current codes)  The operator knows how bad things are. When we complained, they brought up ear plugs & noisy, inadequate fans. The staff also suggested that we leave the door to the hallway open, but there was no air circulation in the

My 2 Sisters and I stayed for 2 nights in the California Suite. It is perfect in every way. Gorgeous but understated.  Views to die for.  2 Incredible full bathrooms.  Oceanfront terrace that could not have been improved.  Great room service. Entire staff so friendly and acted delighted to help you out with anything.  WE LOVED EVERY MINUTE of our stay and cannot wait to return.  Go to the Surf and Sand as soon as you can. California Suite pure heaven. September 2012

A friend and I stayed at the Surf and Sand from 8/28 to 9/2/2012 and had a lovely time in spite of the fact that there is no air conditioning and the temperatures were in the high 90's.  There was need to move twice to different rooms and the staff was very accommodating.  We ate at Splashes most of the time.  There is great variety in the menus.  I prefer the breakfast menu, but my lamb chops at dinner one night were cooked to perfection and presented nicely. I liked hearing the waves at night and felt safe keeping the balcony door open throughout the night.  My friend and I didn't have a car, but there is parking on site. My daughter was married here .   The weather was beautiful;  the sun shone fiercely, and my only complaint is that there was no overhead coverage on the

This is the closest you'll get to the beach in style. Wonderful property. Live music overlooking the ocean. Walked down the steps from pool onto the nicest beach in Laguna. Well worth the extra money to be here. The room service was 4 star with 5 star prices. The linens and oceanfront room were incredible.

The resort did it's best to make our stay truly enjoyable. Our room was upgraded, the staff was helpful and friendly. We used the spa, fitness room, room service, the food outlets and all met our expectations.  The roar of the waves takes some getting used to, but if you just let not overwhelm you, you get to dig it.  The Concierge booked us a whale watch at Captain Dave's and truly enjoyed that. Also ate at several local places which were all enjoyable. We plan to come back and extend our trip next time.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but not on a holiday weekend
Summary: The Surf and Sand still can't be beat for its location on the beach and the sound of waves crashing in your room. But don't go on a holiday weekend.  Unfortunately, the hotel is wildly under staffed when it's full, and as often as the overwhelmed staff tries to apologize for all the inconvenencies this causes, it's not the experience you signed on for at the really exorbidant holiday rates (topped off by a $30/night parking fee and $15/night resort fee). The problems?  Room not ready at check in time by close to a hour, a 45 minute wait for breakfast to arrive after being ordered, a traffic jam at the valet station that causes a 20 minute delay in getting your car for dinner...you get the picture. But some of the problems shouldn't have even been caused by the full house, like

Summary Heading: Amazing view, seconds from room to beach, great service!
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is it's location on the beach.  Walking from your room to the beach literally just takes seconds.  Rooms are nicely decorated, and have a nice sized balcony with stunning views and sounds of the ocean.  Beach side service (food/beverage, beach chairs/umbrellas/towels) is excellent.  The hotel has a great laid back atmosphere, and was perfect for a family getaway.  The cons: The pool is not heated, is a bit small and feels crowded.   There is no air conditioning.  This was not an issue in the end of May, but I imagine would be an issue late summer.

I think the Surf & Sand Resort is having an identity crisis.  There it sits -- as close as you can get to the waves of the Pacific Ocean.  It's got nice sized rooms, the amenities of a luxury hotel (comfy robes, big balconies, good toiletries, comfy beds).  The staff is very helpful and there is a superb spa.  It's within walking distance of the shops, galleries, and restaurants of Laguna Beach and the in-house restaurant -- Splashes -- is hands down a winner in my book.  In short, it has just about everything that it takes to be a great beachfront hotel -- it simply does not have enough of the things one expects at a true resort and it doesn't have enough of a sense of what kind of customer it wants to serve to be that great beachfront hotel  Let's start with the pool -- get

Me and my girlfriend arrived after a few dodgy nights at a hotel,nr a wedding we were attending.we had decided to "push the boat out" for our last 3 nights in california. We were not dissapointed,amazing views of the pacific,lovely room and great service(maids come twice a day),we would 100% come back again.

My friends have stayed at the Hotel several times and never experienced the problems of this trip.  First of all there were two I. The room and only towels and amenities for one.  We called about that and the problem was taken care of.  We ordered up a coffee pot and it was broken.  The valve on the athtub was broken,windows were broken and didn't open, there were ants in the bed one night and on and on and on.   The Hotel did listen to our complaints and gave us a credit plus cut the room rate I half for the scodn night.  However, whe. My friend received her credit card she was charged for the full amou t p,us the corrected amount plus an additional fee.  It was all correctedbut this shouldn'thappen at an expensive Hotel.  Next it e I. lacuna we will choose another source of
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I would like to apologize the many inconveniences you encountered during and after your stay with us.  Please know I value your feedback and will be personally following up with our Director of Housekeeping and our Front Office Director to ensure this type of situation does not reoccur.  I would like to have you back as our guest.  Please feel free contact me directly at 949-793-8054 or jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but beware the weddings and functions
Summary: We stayed with the family for a 4 day stay in may this year. We book a Catalonia suit as the terrace looked amazing on the website. However when we got into the room we were really disappointed as when out on the terrace we were completely overlooked by a business function that was happening on the terrace above. It felt like there was us and our two children sat amoungst a load of suits! It really isn't as private as it looks on the website.  We were also worried that there were ear plugs left by the bed and though how late are these parties going to go on! As it turned out though the plugs were to stop the sound of the sea at night which for me no plugs were needed as there's nothing better than falling asleep to the sond of the sea, We were going to leave but decided to stay

The front desk guy was so friendly, he gave us the best room ever with beautiful ocean and sunset view on the top floor. This is a beachfront resort where you can directly step out to the beach from the pool area. Room is extremely clean, definitely 5 star treatment. Very great location with lots of restaurants near by. We love this place so much, it was so sad when our vacation was over. Definitely will come back.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but not a great resort.
Summary: They should concentrate on being a great hotel right on the beach where you can hear the waves instead of trying to be a resort.    The rooms are way overpriced but nice, the pool area small and crowded.  We had a room on the pool level but the view was blocked by a wall and lots of pool noise (a family movie at night!)  I'm surprised there were so many kids there at those prices!  I had no problem w/o air conditioning as you could leave the sliding door open and close the shutters.  Lots of wave noise but what do you expect?  You can't get any closer to the beach! Good food and drinks poolside and outside the lobby.

I like this hotel very much.  Amazing location right on the beach, accomodating staff, warm pool.  Not surprising the hotel restaurant is pricey but very good.  There are cheaper food options (Subway, Jack in the Box..) within walking distance.  Lots of stairs getting around the property because it is built right on the beach.  Lovely little touches...Philsophy products in the bathroom, high thread count sheets.  The only drawbacks we experienced were the lack of air conditioning in the oceanfront rooms (not their fault that we visited on one of the hottest weeks of the year) and the thunderous wave sounds at night.  Many people would love these sounds but my kids were scared.  Too loud and crashing for them.  Otherwise, the kids had a great time going back and forth from the

Summary Heading: Good for families Average resort - above average price - great restaurant
Summary: Disappointed. The front desk, hostess, housekeeping ( response time ) and pool servers were not what you'd expect from a hotel at this price point, really disappointing.  Front desk and hostess were indifferent - servers just not sharp, quick or professional.   Provided some notes that it was a special occasion and notes weren't passed on. Do not recommend Rooms on first floor on far north end of hotel. Feels like basement. Amenities are weak and generally it lacks the special touches you expect from high end resort brands.   That being said although the service was not very good in areas noted the valet and bell employees are very sharp and service oriented and the food, menus and plate presentations were exceptional.   Rooms very clean, bed linen great and ocean front rooms

Summary Heading: August at the Surf and Sand Resort
Summary: The month of August in Laguna Beach can be warm. We recently took a family vacation and had 4 oceanside rooms.  The oceanside rooms at the Surf and Sand Resort do NOT have air conditioning and the rooms can be uncomfortably warm.  This was our first experience having paid $600/night for a room with no a/c and the room was noticeably and miserably warm.  The hotel management suggested opening the ocean front door and rear door for better air flow but this only helped marginally.  With the door opened, the sound of the crashing waves is so loud it will keep you up at night.  While the staff is very polite and sympathetic, the hotel is aware of the problem as they provide both floor fans and "ear-plugs" in each room.  Information as to NOT all rooms are air conditioned on the Surf

Summary Heading: Any closer to the Pacific and you are in it.
Summary: A very unique resort in terms of location, smack dab on the beach. The waves at high tide nearly hit the building; so close that ear plugs are provided bedside. Ocean front views of Laguna Beach coastline are very good.  Service was top-notch, as staff was very attentive, friendly and helpful. South of the main Laguna Beach tourist cluster, a 10-15 minute walk (plenty of shops and restaraunts along the way) or free shuttle ride away.  Really a lovely spot in all respects.

Very disappointed. Not a 4 star hotel. No air conditioning. More on the cheesy side. Room was located in a storage area. Food not good at hotel. At the room rate, we paid a little more and moved to a much nicer 5 star hotel up the road.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I was disappointed to hear that we did not meet your expectations with your room location, quality of food and lack of air conditioning.  We would love another opportunity for you to stay at Surf & Sand as our guest.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We are from Southern California and we still like we have arrived at a tropical vacation. The beach in front of the hotel is rock free and soft. The water is glorious. Our hotel room (6th floor) is ocean view and what a view! It's high enough from the beach that it doesn't feel like the waves crashing through your room...unless you like that. Expensive but love the hotel, location and room.

Great staff, location and food.  Walking distance to shopping, dining etc... No AC in rooms might be an issue for some.   Rooms looked recently renovated as did common areas of the hotel.  Otherwise , very nice.

We had been once before but were blown away by the property and service! Everything from the room to the amenities to the view to the pool to the bar upstairs was fabulous.  I was impressed with the service at the Concierge and Front Desk and the Bell Staff. The best part was the view. I literally LOST my breath when we opened the blinds. It was like we were hovering over the ocean! Would stay there again and again.

Whether you're staying here or not, cocktails at this resort are fantastic! You get an amazing view of the sea from the patio and/or you can cozy up by the fireplace‚Ä¶either way you've got to try the cocktails in this location! The resort is first class and the drinks are even better! If you make it for happy hour they actually have a manager's reception where they pass around incredible  hors d'oevres! If you want to eat directly over the beach I recommend their restaurant "Splashes". WOW is that place great! Great food & great view, truly a resort as beautiful as the city!

We just spend 2 nights here with our son, daughter-in-law & 2 grandchildren (7 & 10). We all loved it! We had rooms side by side on the 8th floor directly above the sand and pounding surf. The rooms were large, good size balcony, very comfortable beds, pillows & wonderful sheets. Yes, it was expensive, but this is the time of yr they make there money. The beach was clean & beautiful. The attendents bought & set up our beach chairs & umbrellas. The pool seemed heated w/comfortable double lounge chairs. Service is excellent. The Splaches restaurant had a very good breakfast. The room here was actually larger & nicer than the del Coronado which we love. Prices about the same. The kids saw a seal on the beach at night. Very cool.

The Surf and Sand is one of the best hotels if you are looking to stay right on the water! The waves break right outside your room. It is is the closest you can get to the water in OC. The beach is beautiful and there is a good chance you will see whales and dolphins! Make sure to stay in the water front towers versus the pool view rooms. There is a huge difference. What a great place to stay!!

The Surf And Sand Resort has been providing me with consistently great holidays for 25 years. This past visit was an opportunity to pull myself together after five major cancer surgeries in the past four years. No one bothered me, needed anything from me, just rest and relaxation. Perfectly comfotable for the solo traveler. Superb food and service. Despite all the plethora of nearby restaurants, it was challenging to not dine onsite every evening!

We (family of 4, 2 teenage kids) chose Laguna Beach as a place to rest up after a holiday on the east coast. We really liked the vibe of the area, relaxing, friendly people etc and were really pleased we'd stayed out of LA. We had a 2 bed suite for 4 nights. The in-room facilities were very good and being on the top floor, we had a great view over the ocean  We enjoyed the noise of the surf and instead of using the kindly provided ear plugs, we opened the balcony doors and let the crashing sounds in. We all slept like babies. This is a good resort. It's well located so that you can walk out the door to the village (unlike Montage and Ritz Carlton) and its position right on the beach is enviable. We didn't make much use of the facilities, but the restaurant which we used once for

We moved from the Hotel Laguna to the Surf and sand, it was amazing and so were the staff. They took the time to show us a room and then when we booked they gave us rooms together!! All in all a Great experience and I would definately stay again!!

Summary Heading: Nice Location; Right on the Ocean
Summary: We stayed here for a conference, then extended our stay for the weekend.  Our room was literally just above the waves crashing on the beach.  It was a spectacular view, albiet a bit noisy.  If I go again, I would ask for a room higher up.  The staff was helpful and the food with the conference was excellent.  There was a nice manager reception on Friday evening.  Splashes Bar and Restaurant also have spectacular views, but a bit pricey.  Paid $23 for a glass of champagne and a white wine at the bar.  I'll submit a separate review for the restaurant.  Our room was nicely appointed, but they are aging a bit.  There is no air conditioning in the room.  The bathroom was very small and the shower awkward.   So, all in all, it was a nice stay.

Another great visit for our family at Surf & Sand where we have come many times over the  last ten years. We love the place: fantastic location right on the beach; you can hear the waves pounding, disconcerting sometimes in the middle of the night, yet oddly soothing as well. There are many families in July/August and our kids always found friends with whom to hang out in the waves or the great pool. The rooms are reasonably priced considering the amazing ocean view; the service is friendly, pleasant and efficient. Cocktail hours at Sunset is priceless. Splashes offers a great range of  healthy interesting food which pleases everyone. There is another ocean view from every table; the only drawback is that you may need to speak a bit louder to cover the sound of he waves.

The hotel was wonderful and tasteful. Everyone was especially attentive and pleasant. The food and service was wonderful in the resort restaurant Splashes where we had dinner and breakfast twice overlooking the beach. Our room was right over the beach (surfview) on the 2nd floor in the Towers, which we prefered to the slightly larger and set back and above the beach in the "oceanview" rooms. The rooms bed faced the patio and we could see the ocean as soon as we opened our eyes. The pool area and bar is nice, though since we did not bring kids, the jacuzzi seemed too crowded and loud most of the day. This was my only complaint. Other than that, the resort was wonderful. The only vacation where there were no complaints at all.

Agree with other reviewers - the pro with staying here is you are, literally, hanging out over the beach/ocean, so view is great and we loved the sound of the surf - and you can walk right onto the beach.   Beach staff is very helpful and pleasant arranging umbrellas and chairs.  But you pay a  high price for that view and the location.  Rooms are very average - we were in one of the larger ones in the Tower Building - and bathrooms are tiny - really felt like an average mid-level chain hotel with slightly nicer furniture.  We were also located at a stairwell, so could be pretty noisy.   And, no A/C in the room -just a fan.   Pool area is way too small for the size hotel.  Maid service was terrible - they woke us up just after 8 one moring and we had to wait to take showers
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I was disappointed to hear that your recent stay at Surf & Sand did not meet your expectations.    Your feedback is critical to our success and I will be addressing them with our team leaders to ensure proper training and checks and balances are in place.  We would love another opportunity to have you as our guest.  Please contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice rooms.  Wonderful location for July 4th firework shows.
Summary: We were here for July 4th 2012.  From our ocean view balcony, we could see two fireworks shows clearly to the north of us.  We could also see some of Dana Point's show, and very far in the distance, the Long Beach show.  This was a pretty great location to celebrate July 4th.  pros: great beach location you can hear the surf from your room our 500 sq ft. double was quite large.  nice bathroom.  nice decor. good balcony facing the ocean we could see dolphins and ocean wildlife right from our balcony complimentary coffee beach hiking to laguna village is pleasant Laguna Beach has free trolleys so you never have to use your car good showerheads spacious room safes  cons: the pool is small given how many rooms there are the hot tub is tiny if you are looking for an adult getaway,

Summary Heading: Splashes was the highlight of our afternoon!
Summary: We recenly went on a family vacation in Southern California.  Friends had suggested eating at Splashes in the Surf and Sand Resort if we wanted good food with a great view when in the Laguna area.  We stopped in and I was beyond impressed!  We were there mid afternoon and even though every table in Splashes was full, our server Ken made us feel like we were the only ones there.  He was very attentive and took the time to provide wonderful food recommendations for us and even provided us some options for my finicky daughter that were not on the Splashes menu.  All of the food was fabulous and the view was phenomenal.  It is right ON the beach - we were able to watch people enjoy the water and even saw a dolphin in the distance.  Thanks to Splashes and Ken for a great afternoon!

Summary Heading: Pros and Cons to this place
Summary: We stayed at this resort for 3 days on a family vacation.  Pros: awesome tacos, great pool area, good location on the beach, nice staff, loved the firepits, and they did let us check in early.  Cons: the rooms are showing some wear/tear and could have been cleaner (we moved the tables to pull out the bed on the sleeper couch -YUCK!); my daughters refused to sleep on the sofa sleeper because it was so uncomfortable (you could feel the springs through the matress; you pay for EVERYTHING; they lost our laundry (after they promised to have it back by 830am --good thing i called since we were leaving that day from our vacation and insisted they find it and bring it back. That took a good 2 hours of calls back and forth).  When visiting Laguna Beach again, I probably will not stay
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for your feedback.    As I am pleased to hear you were able to enjoy a few of our amenities.  However, I was very disappointed to hear that our housekeeping standards were to upheld nor was the handling of your laundry.  Please know that I will be reviewing this with our Housekeeping Director to ensure proper training and checks and balances are in place.  We would love to have your back to Surf & Sand, as our guest.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: All services were so wonderful, we never left!
Summary: We did not plan to stay there the entire stay but, the food, the views and spa we're so wonderful that we just stayed in one place.  If anyone is familiar with Laguna it's always best to park in one spot and wander by foot from there.  This place is so central it's easy to do.  Although we do enjoy the montage I prefer surf and sand much more overall..

Summary Heading: You want close to the beach?  You get it here!!
Summary: We checked into the Surf & Sand Resort and were totally blown away with the room we had.  It was on the first floor, but it meant that our balcony was basically suspended about 15 feet above the sand and at high tide.  The view from our room was a full 180 degree oceanview and was fantastic.  As if the view wasn't enough, the food was spectacular.  Normally, I do all I can to avoid eating at onsite restaurants.  This was a completely different story.  Even buffets that were prepared for our nearly 200 convention guests was amazingly top notch.  Compliments to the chef and his staff.  The onsite restaurant "Splashes" is also exceptional, providing selections that will force you to deviate from the norm, but will make it worth it to taste something new and different.  The shower
We traveled with our small dog. This hotel is totally dog friendly. Great location, great food, great staff.

Summary Heading: Great location & A- service with well appointed rooms at the higher end price but NO A/C.
Summary: Without a doubt the location is superb for Laguna beach.  It is toward the middle, which provide options to go into Laguna or down to Dana point.  It is a smaller hotel which makes it easy to get around but lacks some of the service and amentities you would get from a larger resort like a Ritz Carlton.  The staff was very accommodating and provided good recommendation for activities and even booked boat reservations for us.  We were here for meetings and the meeting rooms were very comfortable, but it was dissapointing to have NO A/C in the rooms.  Though it is nice to leave balcony door open and enjoy the cool ocean breeze, you have to be careful of pigeons trying to come in.   Then at night closing the plantation shutters seems to protect against the pigeon issue, but it does

My wife and I are locals. We have frequented the Surf and Sand, Splashes Bar for over 5 years. I can say without reservation, that the service that Ken and Nick provide in the bar is unmatched. They always treat every guest, including visitors with great respect and offer fantastic food and service.They are terrific. We give them a hearty recommendation! Bryan and Kat

We got married at the Surf and Sand on May 19, 2012. WOW! is all I can say about the hotel, the staff and the location. Ali from the concierge, Michael and especially Michelle, our coordinator and wonder woman. It was the most magical weekend and everyone the came had a great time and commented on how friendly and willing to accommodate your every wish the whole staff was.  The hotel rooms are right on the sand if you stay in the tower. The rest overlook the pool, then the sand. All I believe are ocean facing, so there isn't a bad room in the hotel.   If you plan on getting married there, please let Michelle be your coordinator. She took care of everything and my lovely bride, Donna, felt no stress that day at all.   Any questions, please email at geoteter@msn.com  Regards,

Summary Heading: The hotel was extremely nice and the employees were really friendly.
Summary: I wanted to thank the entire hotel staff for the amazing time we had there. I proposed to my now fianc√© and had everything organized from dinner to rose petals in the room after the proposal. I wanted to thank the entire concierge staff including Tammy, Ali, and Brad for your help in making this a special day. I really wanted to thank Ryan Bortolussi for helping set this day up, as he helped guide me in the right direction on who to talk to about makIng this day so special. Also Peter at dinner was a great, everytime we looked up he was there making sure my fianc√©e glass of champagne was always filled and that we were enjoying our evening. I really wanted to thank everyone that was apart of our special day.   Thank you, Trevor brown and christin Aragon

We stay at the Surf and Sand every year on our anniversary ... I can't tell you how much we look forward to it.  It is a beautiful hotel, gorgeous rooms, and everyone who works at the Surf and Sand is so friendly.  I love the ambiance!  If you love the sound of the waves crashing (I do!!!) then it is perfect for you -- the rooms are literally overlooking the beach/the waves.  This differentiates it from the nearby Ritz Carlton, Montage, and St. Regis hotels which are set back from the ocean.  Plus you can walk to really wonderful restaurants (if you can make yourself leave the property!)  Wonderful spa treatments, pool, and restaurant.  Definitely recommend this hotel highly:)

Summary Heading: The Surf and Sand Resort is absolutely fantabulous!
Summary: We stayed at the Resort to celebrate our 10th year anniversary and had a wonderful experience.  We dined at Splashes which was beautiful and the food was excellent.  The service was impeccable and we really appreciated Ante Dapic for his attention to details and personal service.  The room was immaculate and incredibly comfortable - the sound of the waves was perfect for a good night's sleep. Everything and everyone was exceptional - we can't wait to go back!

Excellent property for people of all ages.  Close walking distance to restaurants, shops, and of course the beach. The resort had plenty of staff from valet, pool attendant, housekeeping, and front desk.
