There were many areas people could enjoy from outside bar areas, poolside (which has killer loungers and shade if you want), and the beach also has an attendant who will set up loungers for you if you'd like.  There is a coffee shop and spa as well.   Upon check in I believe it was Michael who assisted us and was so helpful in suggesting the snores and s'mores amenity. They delivered a tent and two sleeping bags at our time preference with s'mores for the kids. It was a nice feature that our kids loved.  The building looks updated in decor. The rooms are beautiful and when you

We stayed at the Surf and Sand for my 50th Birthday getaway. My husband and I will definately return. From check in, room service, to a clean room promised with a ocean front view and sound of ocean waves as well as relaxing on the beach.... made for a perfect getaway retreat.

I've been to some great hotels all over the world. When choosing, I look for great location, clean and well appointed rooms and professional service.  Surf and Sand has all 3 in spades, especially location as Our room was practically in the ocean...lol.   Kudos to whoever hires and trains the staff because EVERYBODY we encountered during our stay was full of life and sincerity....what a breath of fresh air. Well there was the one girl who never came back after I ordered an ice tea on the beach....maybe her shift was ending or my order was too small?  Anyway, the restaurant was great but very expensive. So after a few days we did venture out. But quite honestly time is $$ so if you do the math, its almost worth it to dine on property cause this place is so awesome I couldn't wait

We loved our ocean front room (all are) with the sound of the ocean lulling us to sleep, pool area with comfy lounge seating and relaxing hot tub, quick and helpful beach side chair and towel service, and fresh and simple lunch and dinner options. The meals were a bit expensive, but expected for the convience of walking right from the pool to dinner, and then back to our room. The concierge, valets who helped with our car, luggage and bikes were super helpful and so cheery! Perhaps we noticed the attitudes more as coming from the east coast where everyone is in such a hurry we appreciated the "no worries" CA attitude. We recommend building 3 which is the farthest from the noise of the pool (we were here for Memorial Day weekend which was quite busy).

I stayed at Surf and Sand for my girlfriends birthday and I must say this is the most relaxing and beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. I checked in with Coty who was amazingly helpful in setting up a surprise for her upon our return to our room. Our room was not ready due to it being so early but I received a text the second it became ready which I thought was a great touch. Another person that stood out from my stay was Steven at the concierge. I have stayed at 5 star resorts around the world and never have I met a more personable knowledgeable concierge. He is really one in a million.   The location, the ambiance and the staff makes every penny so worth it.

Our department had a wonderful time.  The Concierge greeted us with a warm smile and that attitude was consistent throughout our time there. The rooms were outstanding with unforgettable sights and sounds.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone.  The Bellman were attentive with follow through service.  There was a lady who brought us water to us just when we needed it.

I stayed at this hotel this past weekend and the place is absolutely beautiful. The rooms all face the Ocean, which is perfect. The size of the room is large, not like most places which are getting smaller and smaller these days. When I went to my room, there was a wonderful fruit and cheese platter, which was a nice surprise. Upon arrival there was a fish taco party in the front of the hotel with a pop-up bar available. In the afternoon, there was a steel band playing by the pool and since it was a holiday weekend, all the extras really made you feel like you were at a tropical island. The food here is really amazing, I love everything we ate, from the Splash bar which is right on the beach to the restaurant. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Definitely get

From the moment we arrived, I knew this would be the perfect little getaway I'd been planning on for a while. The service was great the whole time we were there. The location is right in the middle of this charming little beach town, and sound of the ocean at night put me to sleep each night. The room service and housekeeping stuff was very pleasant. The restaurant Splashes impressed us the most, as the food was superb. Overall really impressive. Will definitely come back.

I took my husband here for a weekend. I have stayed there many times, and this was his first. I tried to explain that the rooms are right on the beach, not like many hotels, where there is a view. Our surfside room was clean and comfortable. The hotel has nice Philosophy products. The towels are pretty thin, however. The hotel is about one mile from downtown Laguna, so I think the location is ideal. You can walk the beach to get to Laguna. We went and visited the Montage, which is a large, beautiful resort, but you can't beat the views at the Surf and Sand. The pounding surf was loud to my husband, but the hotel supplies earplugs. The bar and restaurant are very good, and also have great views. There is a small fitness facility with very nice equipment. It is still my favorite

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and play
Summary: We absolutely loved the Surf and Sand Resort!!! The accomodations were wonderful.  The room stayed clean all the time no matter how messy we were.  The food was great. The beach and view are spectacular. The staff was very friendly, helpful and accomodating. I will definitely return and I highly recommend this resort.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our product and services and look forward to your next visit out to Laguna Beach!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: One of the best Hotel experiences I have ever had
Summary: I stayed here quite some time ago, however I have only recently become a trip advisor member...My experience at the Surf and Sand was so good that I HAD to come on their page and write a review!  Everything about this resort is incredible. The arrival experience was on point, the bellman was beyond accomodating and even offered items I would never have even thought about needing...The location is beyond perfect! The views are amazing! The pool is just enough and the endless views of the ocean around you take your breathe away every time. The jacuzzi style bath tubs are exactly what you need after a relaxing day at the beach...  My boyfriend and I travel quite a bit, and still to this day, we rave about our experience at the Surf and Sand.  Amazing Hotel!

This delightfully crisp hotel is perched so close to the pounding surf that you wonder if the spray will get the TV wet.  Concierge Ally was superb at pointing out some great restaurants.  Chairs, towels and umbrella's are brought to you whenever you choose.  Dolphins swim along the surf line.  Seriously, was it a dream?  Nope, Surf and Sand resort.

My friends and I love it here! I can honestly say it was the best brunch we've had in a long time! We are from Miami and were there on a work/vacation trip.  We loved eating here every chance we got.  The people that work here were great; they were always friendly and very helpful, especially our server Keith! He's a local and suggested sites for us to see in addition to giving us amazing service.  What a treat it is when you have great food in addition to amazing service by a local who goes out his way and suggest "local" spots to visit, thank you Mr. Keith!!  We highly recommend Splashes to anyone who want to enjoy some wine or cocktails and just hangout and relax and get great food and especially service.  Can't wait to come back for more!!
There is only one place in Laguna Beach with views like this. Brunch is good, not wonderful but again the views are awe inspiring. Staff is very professional ang work hard to please.

I feel this review is necessary for future guests. Unfortunately, my review would have been complete perfection had it not been for "the incident" as the Hotel manager referred to our cockroach infestation . I awoke on our second evening to find FOUR ENORMOUS cockroaches in the bathroom. I called the front desk and the told me that an exterminator would be at the hotel in the morning. TRUST me... Those roaches have been living there for years and only tenting the entire resort can fix the problem. They offered to "meet me half way" on our second day stay. How nice to only pay $360 that night with rodents.  We did not stay a third! My husband caught one of the 6 inch roaches in the water glass and left it for the manager to see.  I hope they will fix this "incident"
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am very disappointed to hear about your experience during your stay here at Surf & Sand Resort.  As we take great pride in having a prestine property with regularly scheduled maintenance, I can assure you this is an isolated occurrence, which is unacceptable.  We would love another opportunity for you to be our guest and will be sending a gift certificate to you.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager Surf & Sand Resort

Summary: My friends and family love it there! Best brunch with a view is at Splashes! We love eating here, the people that work here are great; they are always friendly and very helpful! Weekends here are the best to just relax and enjoy eating a delicious breakfast or lunch while enjoying the picturesque views of the beach. Let's not forget about the food either... everything we have had thus far (which is pretty much everything on the menu) is delicious! Even if you are not hungry, its an amazing spot to enjoy some wine or cocktails and just hangout and relax.
We had only a dinner in the Splashes Restaurant. Restaurant has a great location and spectacular full ocean view. Everything ordered was prepared and served very well.   We had a great time.
The location is great.  Pool is very nice and the staff at the pool was great. They were very family friendly and made the kids feel welcome.

This is a wonderful place.  My Wife and I spent a long weekend and it was great.  It is right on a beautiful sand beach.  The pool and eating locations overlook the beach and ocean.  Everything is maintained perfectly and the hotel staff is friendly and helpful.  Chairs, towels and umbrellas are provided on the beach.  There is nice wait staff that will bring drinks and food.  You can walk up and down the beach and it is not overcrowded at all.  The pool is great.  Everything is very classy and relaxed at the same time.  The room was average in size, but the view from the fifth floor was awesome.  Our balconey was quite large and had several chairs and a table.  Room was clean and the staff did a great job.  The front desk and concierge are nice and helpful.  Just a perfect

Summary Heading: Superb massage and relaxation at the Spa
Summary: I decided to treat myself to a head to toe massage at the Aqua Terra Spa before starting my new job.    I've had the pleasure of working at resort spas in the past, so I am very familiar with the level of service and treatments that are offered and the spa is in keeping with the boutique style of the hotel.   I was greeted warmly by the front desk staff and I felt completely pampered and cozy with the lovely decor, open air courtyard where I could read a magazine under the sun and the intimate setting of the hot tub just off the ladies changing room.   Delicious granola, fruit and nuts complemented my hot tea and the refreshing fruit infused water.  There was a nice selection of magazines from which to read.. which made for enjoying the space even more.   The Spa was not large

It doesn't get any closer to the beach than this. We stayed in the "tower" portion. Everything seemed fresh and updated. The room was large and the sliding glass doors opened up to the small balcony overlooking the water. My only complaint, which isn't really a complaint, is that the balcony only had room to stand. There were no chairs or table. I believe the "surfside" building may have a full balcony with chairs and table but call to ask if this is a concern for you.   We had dinner at the Splashes Bar instead of the restaurant. They had both a bar menu and full restaurant menu. We ordered from the bar menu and the food was spectacular. The drinks were strong and good. Get there early though as the bar was packed from around 5PM to around 9PM, then it slowed down a bit.   Room

Ok if I didn't need a change of scenery once and awhile, I would stay at this hotel every time we go on vacation. The first time I stayed, I took advantage of a online special and stayed with my daughters around Christmas time. It's a tradition we go to Disneyland for my Birthday in December. Yes I know it's far but wanted to try it.  Well let's just say it was really hard to leave and go to Disneyland once we checked in, walked into the room, was drawn to the sliding door (as you could hear the waves outside) and opened the door and looked out and below.  All I can say is WOW, what a view!!!  It was like the waves were going directly below our balcony!!!  The room was so comfy and cozy, I really did not want to go anywhere else and just stay and bask in the ambiance!!!! It is a

This place is perfect for a relaxing get away or even just a fun weekend trip! The staff is wonderful and so helpful, the ambiance is beautiful and so relaxing. The rooms are clean and beautiful views. The fire pits outside are a perfect spot for relaxing listening to the beach with a warm drink. French 77 is a great restaurant across the street. Everyone that works here is so nice and helpful! I can't wait to go back!

Summary Heading: A beautful resort on the ocean in Laguna Beach
Summary: My wife and I drove 11 miles from Laguna Hills to stay overnight for a little R&R to a resort we had always wanted to stay at, but hadn't made the opportunity to do so.  Surf and Sand was the perfect overnight getaway.  The full ocean view is spectacular.  Just open the sliding glass door onto the balcony and the sounds of waves crashing and smell of the Pacific Ocean permeates the room.  If that is not enough, the room itself is spectacular.  The room has architectural features found in very expensive homes and the bed was very comfortable.  The staff is first class.  The valet service welcomes you with smiles and helpfulness.  The front desk staff is efficient.  The bell staff is the final part of any welcome to a resort, and this bell staff should get an award.  After our

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For!
Summary: Although the Surf and Sand is not the most economical hotel in Laguna, it is by far the best experience you could ask for.  I can give no negative comments about it as the hotel is tottally first class all the way.

Wow what an amazing place!  Absolutely loved our visit there.  The staff and accomadations were fantastic.  The reservationist was kind enough to set my children up with the tent package.  My children are 6 and 4 and they thought it was so cool to "camp-out" in a tent.  They loved their sleeping bags and the smores on their pillows the second night was a great touch!  We loved the turn-down service, complete with proper lighting and music.  I cannot rave enough about this place! Thank you to everyone at the Surf and Sand that made this such a fantastic family trip!

Summary Heading: Weekend getaway at the Surf and Sand, Laguna
Summary: I surpised my wife with a 2 day birthday trip to Surf and Sand.  I am not sure which part made me look better, but the rooms, views, definately the staff, and the overall "experience" was one she or I will never forget.  Without question, we will be return guests and next time we will bring our kids to share the next special weekend.  I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to relax and feel welcome in a remarkable property on the beach.

My wife and I have stayed there numerous times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are great with fantastic views. The staff is very friendly and professional. The bar is right on the ocean and must be experienced. The only minor downside is the ocean can be a little noisy at times...

We stayed here for a group meeting, and I hope to go back on our own someday.  The rooms are lovely - the Tower rooms are RIGHT on the beach, and beautifully appointed.  If you like to go to sleep with the sound of the surf in your ears, this is the place (they provide earplugs for those who don't).  Staff service couldn't be better - the concierge gave us a right-on restaurant suggestion, taxi for early-morning departure was arranged in advance and there ahead of time.  The on-property restaurant isn't cheap (what hotel restaurant is) but the food is good with lots of healthy options. Can't comment on the spa but the fitness room was reasonably equipped, and a broken machine was fixed within 24 hours. Having a car makes the most sense, but downtown Laguna Beach is barely a mile

First time to Laguna and staying at the Surf and Sand and it is stunning.  To be able to be that close to the water is rare on the California coastline and the service and staff are outstanding.  I work in the hospitality industry so I am hyper-critical of any mistakes made, and I had a flawless experience at this hotel. Would definitely recommend it for a weekend getaway from Los Angeles.

Great resort with a great staff. Our room was in the north building on the fourth floor overlooking the ocean. Very little noise other than the wonderful sound of the ocean. The beachfront was not busy making this a great place to relax. Loved every scond of it and will return!

I chose this hotel - - once again relying on tripadvisor to steer me in the right direction. They didn't let me down. But you have to do some reading and do your homework. Based on the reviews, I read recommendations like "choose the tower"    "the lower level floors can be loud with beach noise"   "the rooms overlooking the pool can be noisy"  and "the rooms on the 9th floor are larger but have no balcony". Once you've determined your preference, I would call the hotel directly and let them know the room and location you're hoping to secure. We stayed in a King in the tower on the 7th floor. The corner room wasn't available, but the interior location was fine. We found the room to be beautiful and from this room (ours was 274) you see nothing but water and Catalina Island in

Summary Heading: Very loud construction noise prevents an enjoyable stay....find another property!!
Summary: Last time I stayed at Surf and Sand Resort, the property was undergoing improvements.  The entire stay was terribly noisy.    When I made my reservations this time, I phoned the hotel to ensure I would not have the same experience.   They assured me that there would be no construction during my stay.   Upon check in, I heard jackhammering.  The front desk told me it was only for a couple of hours.  Those couple of hours turned into the entire day.  Furthermore, I was informed that it would continue tomorrow.  When I asked to speak to the manager, he was unavailable.  He told the front desk that there was a broken pipe that was being repaired.  I had already spoken to the construction workers to see how long this was going to take and they gave me a different story.  I am very
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  On behalf of the Surf & Sand, I offer my sincere apologies for the miscommunication and inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us last week.    I certainly understand your surprise and frustration upon learning of on-site construction as in your previous stay.  The project was not planned far in advance and was due to unexpected circumstances that were imperative in addressing immediately.  Upon commencement of the work, it was determined that the original timeline was not sufficient or realistic to complete the project and additional repairs were needed.    Please know that we made every attempt to relocate guests to alleviate the noise issue and also made concessions and special considerations to ensure their comfort during this period.    As our valued guest, we would like to have you return to the Surf & Sand.  Please contact our Executive Office directly at 949-793-8075, so that the details of your stay may be handled personally and to avoid any miscommunication.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We only had a short time for a one day to get-a-way but staying at the Surf & Sand made us feel like we had been away for a week. It was so relaxing and beautiful in every way.  Thank you to the great staff!  The restaurant (Splash) was fantastic as well as room service!  My spa treatment was one of the best in years.

Superb hotel.  The location is outstanding - rooms right on the beach with the million dollar views.  The staff was outstanding and friendly in every part of the hotel.  Our room (#423) was a little worn but nothing too bad.  The views are just fabulous.  The main bar is small but nice.  We did not eat in the restaurant (opting for room service each night) but the food was excellent.  The Surfside section of the hotel is a little more secluded and private and is located away from the pool area.  I would recommend that part of the hotel.    The resort provides ear plugs because the crashing of the waves is pretty darn loud.

We come here every year to attend a business  seminar.  Everyone from  valet, check in/out, housekeeping, food servers is attentive, friendly, and helpful.  The rooms are very nice and comfortable.  Each room comes with a patio that overlooks the ocean.  Beds are comfy.  I love walking up and down the beach.  Very peaceful.

My wife and I needed a weekend respit from the kids.  We've been to all the nice resorts within an hour of Los Angeles, but I was just tired of ending up at $1,000 for a one night stay.  I had heard much about and driven by this medium sized beach side hotel and decided to take a shot .  It's now our new favorite.  Why?  Simple, easy access and the closest hotel to the beach possible.    You open your room window, and all is you see and hear is crashing waves.  I felt no need to leave the comfy bed.  If it was cold, I could turn on the heat, and still enjoy the crashing waves.  (If nature's sound machine gets tiresome, they provide ear plugs, but we didn't use them)  If you're expecting grandiose amenities, this is not your place.  They have a very nice gym, very nice spa, TV

I have to say that is my favorite hotel.  I  have stayed here over 5 times.  It is a small hotel that gives you a very personalized experience.  We have only stayed in the Main tower where all the rooms face the ocean.  The rooms are large, clean and very well laid out.  The beds are very comfortable and sleeping to the sound of the waves crashing against the shore is heaven.  I highly recommend it.  The price is steep but worth it.  The restaurant Splashes is small but the food is great.  The ambiance of the whole place is great for couples.  You are located near the center of Laguna Beach.  I highly recommend eating at French 75 across the street or going to listen to live music at Mozambique down the street.  If you want to be spoiled in style stay at the Surf & Sand

Summary Heading: WOW! I LOVE being spoiled this way!!!!
Summary: It's not cheap, but well worth the price.How many hotels can you stay in where you are practically on the beach, and you get earplugs  just in case you DON'T like the sound of the waves.(That's basically why we come here!!) Staff is extraordinarily courteous and responsive and Splashes restaurant, while again not cheap, is innovative and with a fantastic view.. This is a great place to chill/veg out ,etc. Only negative:the cell phone reception is nil in some of the rooms, so you could be carrying out your private conversations on the stairs!! (In fairness, though, there are many nooks inside and out where cell reception is good. Just not in some rooms...a small price to pay for paradise though

Summary Heading: Turned a weekend into a vacation
Summary: It's easy to drive past this low profile resort on your way down the coast, but don't.  We turned into the driveway and were greeted by the valet and doorman with a smile, then welcomed into the airy lobby.  The front desk and concierge were happy we were there and efficiently checked us in.  We stayed in the main buidling (Tower), on the 4th floor.  The fact that it was the most gorgeous weekend ever in Southern California certainly helped impress, as from our room, with the waves and sand just under our balcony, we could clearly see Santa Catalina Island and San Clemente Island beyond it.  We could see up to Palos Verdes to the north.  The view was stunning and the sound of the waves crashing mesmerizing.  We joined friends who have stayed here over 30 times and we get why

By far the nicest hotel ON THE SAND in Laguna Beach and I've been to all the big names.  I've been staying here for years and the improvements are amazing, from the new room decor, the lobby, Splashes Restaurant & Bar, the pool and the upper outdoor lounge off of the lobby.  Every time I stay I look for the creative changes they've made.  The staff is always friendly and seem to enjoy their jobs!  The food quality is amazing and the new Saturday & Sunday brunch menu is off the hook!  I've stayed here with both friends & family and you always hate to leave.

Summary Heading: Pet Friendly Hotel + Guest w/Pet Allergy = Unfortunate weekend
Summary: The hotel is lovely, with an excellent location right on the sand.  Our room had a full-on ocean front view, with the waves crashing outside our window.  The staff is very friendly, warm and welcoming, and I have no qualms about our room or the staff.  Unfortunately, I have recently become allergic to pets, and am quickly learning that I will have to change some things in life - one thing to change is to inquire with a hotel BEFORE staying there whether they allow pets to stay in the guest rooms, although it would be helpful if hotels noted these things on their websites.  After spending one night there for what was supposed to be a romantic getaway, I suffered greatly with red, itching, burning, watery eyes.  Upon speaking with a staff member, I was surprised to learn that they
Manager Response: Dear Valed Guest,  Thank you for your king words regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.    Thank you, also, for sharing your concerns about our pet policy.  I am sorry to learn that you had health issues that resulted in an uncomfortable stay.  I certainly sympathize with your position and take your suggestions very seriously.  For health reasons, we have in place, a policy to charge $100 non-refundable deposit, which allows us to take extra precautionary measures in sanitizing these rooms upon the guest departure.    Your message serves as a reminder to continue to improve upon our present practices and procedures.  Please call upon me directly for any needed assistance in the future.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed at the Surf & Sand in Laguna Beach, California.  This property is first class all the way around.  The entire staff couldn't be more pleasing and helpful and our room and views were beyond our highest expectations.  Treat yourself to a stay ~ you will leave with wonderful memories..............

I recently stayed 3-nights at the Surf and Sand for a business meeting.  Overall, I was pleased with the hotel, staff, amenities, and the view -- boy, the view is fantastic!  Every room seems to have an ocean view and small private balcony where you can watch the sunset and listen to the waves crashing on shore.  Those waves, by the way, are almost literally right under your balcony when the tide is all the way in.  The room was clean and well appointed, with a comfortable bed, large bathroom (with separate shower and tub), and ample closet space.  My only gripe was that there was no air conditioning in the rooms.  I was there during a warm spell in mid-January and it can get REALLY warm in those rooms when the afternoon sun is beating down.  The only way to cool the room down

Summary Heading: Beautiful rooms right over the sand!
Summary: My husband and I stayed here last week for a week for 7 night.  This is the second time we have stayed at the Surf an Sand and enjoy everything about it!  The king oceanfront rooms are beautiful, are decorated in pleasant sand, cream and sea green colors and are hanging right out over the beach!  The roar of the ocean is so loud that unless you like the sound of crashing waves you may find it too loud!  Not us, that is why we go to the beach!  Also the deck off of your room is nicely furnished with comfortable attractive furniture. Another plus is the complimentary coffee in the downstairs coffee shop or lobby, so no need for a coffeemaker in your room. The staff couldn't be friendlier and of course there is no shortage of things to do in Laguna Beach and the surrounding area.

My husband and I have been coming to the Surf and Sand for 28 years. We've traveled all over the world, but this hotel continues to be our #1 choice for a relaxing get-a-way. Sitting on the balcony and watching the sunset while enjoying a glass of wine with the waves crashing beneath us, is what it's all about.

Oceanfront rooms, great meeting space, good food, nice staff... you'll be hard-pressed to find better space in southern CA. The hotel rooms are spacious and modern, and every room has a view of the water. Balconies are great too.

Summary Heading: So close to the ocean, you can taste the salt
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Surf and Sand for a conference. The experience was first-rate from start to finish. Staff is welcoming and knowledgeable, rooms are well-appointed and comfortable, food is excellent (although pricey). Several world-travelers at the conference said they had never stayed anyplace where they were so close to the ocean. At high-tide, we watched from our balcony as a seal swam past about 100 yards away. In the late mornings, we watched dolphins and one afternoon we saw a whale surfacing - all from the hotel. (The hotel provides ear plugs for those who find crashing waves less than restful at night.) Restaurant is lovely and excellent, but be prepared to part with some money. We spent $250 for a meal including salads, main course, dessert and a bottle of

We were concerned when we found the hotel located directly in a bustling area right on the Pacific Coast Highway, but from the minute we entered the lobby of the hotel, our worries proved unwarranted.  The reception was warm, friendly and helpful and our room was a gem--well appointed, comfortable, with a balcony framed by palm trees and providing a direct view of the ocean.  We slept with the balcony doors open so we could hear the sounds of the ocean through our plantation  shutters.  We had a delightful lunch and absolutely everyone we encountered was helpful and nice.  Somehow our room was always cleaned or turned down for the night while we were gone without ever disturbing us.  One evening when we drove up just before sunset and discussed our regret at not having any wine

I have stayed at this hotel twice now, once for business and once for pleasure.  This hotel is a gem and worth the price as the rooms are well appointed with comfortable beds and the best balcony views.  We walked to the local liquor store (a block away) and enjoyed a bottle of champagne on the balcony as the sun went down.  The crashing of the waves was so peaceful as we watched the tide come in and out. This hotel does a nice turn-down service in the evening and the service is always friendly.  The hotel is within walking distance of many great restaurants and galleries.  It was such a treat to stay here and will make a point of doing it again soon.
The hotel is amazing, weather was great.  Right on the beach. The employee's where amazing especially Kyle at the front desk.  Very relaxing and 5 star treatment!

Location:  Right ON THE SAND in Laguna!  Ocean front rooms => you will hear waves crashing at night - especially in Winter when tide is higher.  Just South of Laguna Beach main street/ downtown area - close to restaurants, galleries etc.  They have ear plugs if you are a light sleeper (waves crashing).  Casual beach atmosphere - no attitudes here.  Rooms:  Multiple buildings facing Ocean - updated in last few years.  Stayed in the 2 Bedroom Penthouse Suite for New Years.  Master Bedroom => 15 x 15+, with TV, King Bed, dressers, deck, bathroom with whirlpool tub, 2 sinks, separate shower + toilette.  Safe in room.  2nd bedroom (interior - no window) had Queen bed + in suite bathroom (2 sink, separate shower and whirlpool tub etc.).  Living room / dinging room / desk area (great

Every few years we stay for a few days during the winter season. We've gotten lucky with the weather the last few trips. The location is great and accommodations have always been 5-star. It's evident that staff training is thorough and ongoing. We've always enjoyed the pampering which is in full supply. It's truly a retreat with just enough activity when needed.

Whenever I read an unfavorable review of this resort , I feel that the person writing it must be a terrible curmudgeon. We have visited this hotel once every year for 29 years, the length of time we have been married. We have traveled all over the world and we love the Surf & Sand. It's all about the ocean, the sunset, the service, the food, the room.The dedicated staff is the frosting on the cake.This is not some stuffy resort, high on a cliff, where maybe you can have a ocean "view". You have a beautiful room "ON the beach" when you are at the Surf & Sand ! We always look forward to our visit and count the days till  we can be there once more.

This place is the best place I have ever stayed.  We (Hubby, 5 & 6 year old and two sisters) stayed there 11/23-11/26.  It was the most relaxing vacation I have been on.  From the moment we pulled up to Valet, it was an experience that will never be forgotten.  The staff were amazing, 5 stars.  Valet, belldesk, concierge, GRA's all PHENOMENAL.  we Stayed in the building that the lobby was in and the rooms all overlook the ocean.  Views are terriffic, you couldnt get any closer to the ocean if you tried.  There is nothing better than falling asleep to the sound of the ocean waves crashing on the beach (be warned they are loud but the hotel supplies ear plugs if its too loud).  The rooms are spotlessly clean, updated and have there own private balcony that if big enough to sit on,

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, food, accommodations and location
Summary: I had the pleasure of staying at the Surf & Sand Resort for a multi-day, large scale private event at the end of November of this year. The event was a smashing success, to no small part because of the dedicated, attentive and gracious staff at Surf & Sand. In particular, Amy, Michele, Shelbi, and Oscar did a fantastic job helping us coordinate this big event, and they were eager to assist us at every turn with our room accommodations,  meeting room setups, catering menus and event logistics.   I was lucky enough to get a chance to eat at Splashes during my stay, and the service and food were top-notch. My meal was delicious, and the ambiance was nothing short of luxurious. Our table overlooked the crashing waves of the Pacific Ocean and the beach below. We even saw whales! It's

We stayed at the Surf and Sand many times in the past but this is the first time we've been back since they totally refurbished the hotel.  They did a beautiful job to make this a very luxurious resort.  Every employee we had any contact with was extremely friendly and went out of their way to make our stay a very memorable one.  Our room was fabulous...9th floor, corner king room.  There is no real balcony on the 9th floor but you can open the sliding doors, look out and feel like you're on a cruise.  There is a jacuzzi tub in the room which is a real bonus.    You can hear the surf with the sliding doors closed which is fabulous.  The view is exquisite.
I love it here...fantastic service, location and resort! We got married here and I recommend it to everyone! Can't wait to go back ;)

If you want luxury and enjoy sleeping to the sound of the crashing surf, this is the place to visit.  The property is about a mile outside of the main town of Laguna Beach.  We visited during Thanksgiving weekend and were given a fabulous room for two, only problem was that we had our teenage daughter with us and had requested a room with a sofabed.  They switched us to a room with two queens on the same level, which was 10 feet above the surf.  The service was excellent throughout our stay.  Only downside was the small pool area, which was crowded with young children.  The property isn't large enough for an adults only pool.  We will definitely stay here again though - it's a romantic and relaxing place to stay.

We spent Thanksgiving weekend at the Surf and Sand - my wife, daughter, and I. The only snafu was that the Hotels.com site indicated that we would have a sleeper sofa in our room and we did not. The hotel changed our room to one with two queens, no problem. This is really a nice property, which you would expect in Laguna Beach. The rooms (most of them, anyway) are right above the beach, and the ocean sounds are loud, which we liked. The hotel does provide earplugs! The rooms was large, comfortable, nicely appointed. Complimentary wifi. There is complimentary coffee in the lobby (indoors and out) and the on-site coffee shop until 10am. We sat in the outer lobby with firepits and an ocean view each morning. The Surf and Sand is pricey, but I would call it a good value - excellent

Paid top dollar for a mediocre room‚Ä¶Dirty carpet, dirty floors and bathroom not only smelled but looked like it hadn‚Äôt had a good cleaning in months. You pay for the lovely beachside view and sounds. But you can park on any street and have that for nothing. Stay somewhere else that‚Äôs at least clean and have the beach on your own terms. NOT coming back. Room 321!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  I am also disappointed to hear that the cleanliness of your guestroom was not up to standards.  I will be reviewing this information with our Director of Housekeeping to ensure our focus on details and training are prioritized.  We would love another opportunity to have you as our guest.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect boutique hotel in perfect beach location
Summary: After staying in large American hotels, this was a wonderful haven.  The room was perfect, with little touches only boutique hotels provide.  The restaurant was excellent with many more restaurants within walking distance.  Located right on the beach, the lap of the waves helped you relax. Beautiful sunsets from your balcony and if you are lucky your own dolphin show! Would certainly return.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel in lovely Laguna Beach!
Summary: I got married here last year and it is a beautiful hotel. From the heated pool to the awesome ocean views, you can't go wrong. It is very pricey. The rooms are large and clean. Service was spot on! And they are dog friendly!($100 non refundable fee for as many pets as you bring!) Morning walks on the beach were worth the stay here. It is a AAA 4 diamond property so rest assured, it will be nice. If you want the best of the best. The Montage Resort is down the street!

We added a night after reading the reviews  and were disappointed,  One night was on our own, We were put in a smaller room-   Finally called at 4   about  having the room cleaned, We were told we had to put something on the door?!!? No A/C   It does cool down at night   but with the afternoon sun it does get uncomfortable,,  Had to ask about a Newspaper, Fitness room was need of much repair Towels were a little treadbare, Bathrooms needed a good deep clean, But it was the end of October... giving the benifit of doubt. View was a 10  Can be a little loud over the pool  Music was annoying,  but after several complained it was just turned off, Hot tub was also not working, never did see anyone to report it to
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am also disappointed to hear about the lack of service and cleanliness you encountered during your stay at Surf & Sand.  I will be personally reviewing these items with our department managers to ensure proper training and follow-up is addressed, as this is not up to our standards.  Thank you for taking the time to share these details.  We would love to have another opportunity to have you as our guest and experience our services and amenities that we are noted for.  Please contact me directly at 949-793-8054 or e-mail me at jbear@jcresorts.com.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed for three nights and everything about the Surf and Sand is amazing! The atmosphere, view, staff and restaurants! We were married nearby and the hotel made it so special for us and was very accommodating to our every need. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I have traveled all over the world and this hotel is the best I have stayed in.

We stayed one night at the Surf and Sand Resort in Laguna & we wish we had longer. The arrival & greeting of staff were polite & welcoming. The hotel is located directly onto the beach with different beach access, places to wash off your feet before entering back into the hotel, reasonable size pool, jacuzzi, restaurant & bar area. The food was amazing although pricey, but expected in a high class and a great standard hotel. We ordered room service for dinner and was certainly not disappointed. Then ate breakfast in the restaurant in the morning, which was relaxing, not busy, welcoming and the food was great. Great views & great for couples wanting a nice relaxing getaway. As they do a turn-down in your room between 6-7pm. Where they put certain lights on, soft music, chocolates

I recently had the opportunity to spend six nights at this lovely hotel- the first night was personal and the balance was business.  The weather matched the fantastic view.  The rooms were recently upgraded and had an elegant beach motif.  The beds were very comfortable and the sound of the surf lulled you to sleep.  Our team enjoyed some wonderful breakfasts and lunches at the hotel each day and great dinners nearby.   Highly recommend.

I had a great stay at the S & S. I was there for a business conference for about 150 people. They handled it like seasoned professionals. They even kept their bar open later for us. The rooms were always clean and they turned down my bed at night without even asking. My only true complaint is that the ironing board covers were in terrible shape and they didn't remove the dirty glasses from my room.  For the money you pay, the ironing board covers should be pristine. Other than those two minor details everything was great. To address other peoples concerns about how loud the waves are... Yes they are loud, but close the doors if you don't like it.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your recent stay with us on TripAdvisor.  Also, I am pleased to hear that you were able to enjoy our service and amenities.   I will be reviewing the condition of your ironing board and glassware cleanliness with our Housekeeping Director to ensure those items do not get overlooked.    Thank you again for your feedback.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The surf and sand resort, laguna beach
Summary: We stayed two nights in late October and the experience was perfect. Our daughter was married nearby and we needed a lot of special services. The hotel provided everything we needed with no effort. The restaurant was good with great views.

Summary Heading: A great gem for any occasion
Summary: Even though the weather wasn't quite Sunny California the weekend we went, the Surf and Sand truly delivered in every way.  The service was very attentive without being overbearing and the hotel was perfectly located right on the water. It was the right type of "casual" resort to fit in with the beach locale.  The room is spacious and I enjoyed the Philosophy bath products.  The only hiccough was that they only had one bathrobe in the room.  I'm glad they gave us earplugs because the ocean sound is quite loud.  The breakfast from Splashes was amazing. The Mesquite pancakes were quite delicious and so were the chilaquiles.  I can't wait to return for a special occasion!

We stayed two nights in early October in an ocean front suite on the ground floor.  The comments you will read about the noise level due to the surf are probably accurate. It can get loud but who cares, you are at the beach!!  The room was average size and suitably clean.  I don't believe this place offered great value for the price you are paying.  One would think that they would at least have an in room coffee maker but no such luck.  However, room service will bring you a pot for $24.00...yikes, this is not Manhattan!!  In addition to the room charge, you will pay $30 to park and a $20 per night resort fee plus the state and local taxes.  It adds over $100 per night to the room.  Yes, we had a nice stay, the view was unmatched and the staff was friendly and efficient.  I just

The first good impression that the property gave me came from the receptionist. He had a positive, professional attitude and it made us feel very welcomed. Second: Location, Location, Location. It is walking distance to many great restaurants that the area could offer. We stayed at the Surfside King Room and we're pretty pleased. The room is beautifully furnished with ocean-themed decor and furniture. But the little cherry on top is the view-- it's Amazing! We woke up in the morning greeted by the vast ocean and the sound of the surf!  P.S: We can hear the ocean surf 24/7, but they provide complimentary ear plugs for light sleepers... how thoughtful.

Summary Heading: trash on the beach from hotel
Summary: This is our second time staying here. Rooms are nice, right on the water. Room service food is C or C- grade -- tastes like corporate catering. Not very fresh.  I am disappointed this time to see that there is trash on the beach, right in front of the hotel, obviously trash from hotel guests, either left on the beach or thrown out of rooms..... A hotel like this, for $600 / night, really has a responsibility to clean up trash left by patrons immediately....
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.  I apologize for your Room Service food not meeting your expectations and would like more details to better understand and ensure this does not reoccur.    Also, I am disappointed to hear about the beach cleanliness was not up to our standards. I will be reviewing with our  Director of Housekeeping to ensure our procedures are being upheld.  Please feel free to contact me at jbear@jcresorts.com or my direct line 949-793-8054 when you have a moment.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistance General Manager

Summary: Over the summer, my best friend and I stayed at this property and had the best "Girls get-a-way" of the year! We were a little nervous because we were probably the youngest 'single gals' at the property, but everyone treated us like we were VIPS!  The staff at this hotel were just outstanding. From the Valet and Bell, to housekeeping & room service, to the bartenders on the patio... Just amazed us! Aaron (bartender) was fantastic and we could tell he really enjoyed working at the hotel. I thought it was just great to have a live piano player (Denny White) to listen to while we drank our cocktails and watched the sunset. I found that I could ask ANYONE at this hotel a question, and they were all very knowledgable and polite in answering my questions. It was just an overall

Stayed at the Surf & Sand this month as part of a friend's wedding.  We knew this was a great location but the hotel far exceeded our expectations!  The rooms are very nice and room service is outstanding....and then there is the sound of the surf!  It is like sleeping on the beach -- so relaxing!  We attended a wedding here and they did a fantastic job!  The ceremony was on one of the terraces and overlooking the Pacific Ocean -- breathtaking view -- including whales in the distance!  The food was terrific and the staff was great -- as a wedding attendee, I would highly recommend this place!  The outdoor sitting areas are outstanding -- equipped with fire pits and gas heaters.  The fitness center was very good, and the walking/running/biking opportunities in Laguna Beach are

If you like the beach and the surf, this property is for you. Most, if not all rooms, are ocean front...about 25 yards from the surf depending on the tide. The sound of the surf is soothing and not intrusive.  Even with the sliding patio door closed, one can still hear the gentle roar. But if you're like me, open the door and close the shutters and sleep like a baby! The beds are very comfortable and the room is first rate. Very large and immaculately maintained. Service is tops in every category. No in room coffee maker, but hey the coffee is free in a close by building across from the Lobby. I think given the location and the condition of the property, the price is not outrageous. Conveniently located in the heart of Laguna Beach, close to just about everything. Would

Yes, loved it here.  ROOMS:  We originally booked the Catalina Jr. Suite which has no real view to speak of and the room itself had an unpleasant feel to it.  We went to the front desk who immediately took care of us and moved us to the Oceanfront Towers-- you must stay in this building if you want the *total* experience.  We were giddy with the smashing of the waves that was even loud with the doors closed, the beach below fun for people watching, and in the early morning we saw dolphins so close to shore as we drank our coffee in our robes.  Loved it here!  FOOD:  Splashes served excellent food and you're protected by plexiglass from the wind off the ocean, and there are gas heaters as well to keep you toasty-- and that's during the daytime.  LOCATION:  Just a few minutes

Summary Heading: Great customer service and unbeatable views/layout- the whole package
Summary: It doesn't get much better than this. Ocean views from every part of the hotel, impeccable customer service, incredible dining fare and atmosphere, I could go on and on. Definitely try the restaurant Splashes - I had a biz dinner but it looked great for a romantic, cozy dinner as well. I was here for a business conference and felt like it was a mini vacation. I can't wait to go back on my own and relax on my own time!

My third stay and the place never fails to impress. Although the building itself is older you can't tell once you get in your room. From sunsets in the evening to watching the Dory fishermen in the morning, this place is all about relaxation and service.

Summary Heading: Party hotel with too many weddings
Summary: This place has an amazing location that's why the entire hotel is packed with weddings and conferences so if you are looking for a property to relax, this is not the place for you.

We recently stayed at the Surf and Sand in Laguna Beach.  All I can say is perfection!  Even though it was rainy we could still appreciate the beach from our room.  It was perfect in every way including the service and food.  We went in the fall which meant that the pool and beach were not crowded and had no problem getting the perfect spot.  A warm fire by the sea for breakfast near the pool was the best spot to start the day.  One tip - if you use a debit card they will put a hold on double the amount but worth it to stay here.  Also, keep in mind valet only for parking.  Make sure and walk to the nearby shops - they are darling.  And one other tip on the way back to the airport go all the way up Pacific Coast Highway to McCarther for the views and stop by Rose's for the best

Summary Heading: Your personal beach house with staff
Summary: The Surf and Sand is like having your personal beach house right on the water and having it fully staffed.  We had a wonderful time.  We enjoyed the food, had a nice room (Surfside King) so close to the water that they provide earplugs if you think the surf is too loud.  It's not cheap, but it is a wonderful experience.  Guys, this is a real "wife pleaser".  We will definitely be back soon.    The only negative is poor cell reception (Verizon), but I was not there to talk on the phone and answer e-mails so no problem.

Summary Heading: Great room, service, food...and the surf!
Summary: I bought a night here on Luxury Link for $400.  It was worth every penny. (Note sure it would be worth the usual $600...)  We paid for a Surfside King but we were upgraded to a better view.  Our room was in the building away from the pool...so no noise from the pool as some reviews have complained about.  We thought about going out to dinner but then we realized we could not beat the view so we ordered room service.  The portions were large and the scallops and shrimp both terrific.  We also had room service for breakfast.  The waffle was disappointing but the French toast terrific.  Our room was large with a daybed that looked out on the surf and comfortable rattan furniture on the balcony.  The service was flawless.  Everyone went the extra mile.  And the star of the show was
Beautiful setting in picturesque Laguna Beach, CA. Charming and comfortable rooms and great service! Can't wait to return.

We loved this hotel.  Family of 4, two teens.  Great setting, literally right on the beach.  The rooms were well appointed and even the lounge furniture on the deck was lovely.  Extra special features were the cozy robes and blankets on the beds.  Understated elegance.  The pool deck is very chic, but chairs are hard to get.  Offered beach service and complimentary chairs which is really outstanding.  Food was excellent.  Overall a must stay hotel and well priced.

My favorite part about this hotel is the restaurant. Absolutely the best dinner and breakfast I've had in a while, and I eat out in 4-5 star restaurants all the time.   The location of the restaurant is pretty as well - you can sit on the patio right on the beach overlooking the sunset.   Laguna Beach has a beautiful ocean shore, so the view is lovely.  The hotel itself is nice. Although our room was right over the pool, which I didn't enjoy due to lack of privacy and much noise. They were full and couldn't move us, and in exchange they offered us a free breakfast. Fortunately it was not a special occasion so  the bad location of the room wasn't a huge deal. I recommend getting there early on your check in day to secure a better room. My friends checked in two hours before me

We spent two nights here middle of August and absolutely loved it! I have never had a room so close to the ocean before - it felt like we were on top of it!  There's no air conditioning in the rooms, but it isn't needed - leave your balcony doors open and get the ocean breeze! Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Concierge recommended amazing Italian restaurant within walking distance of the hotel.  For a stay in Laguna this hotel is in a great location - you can walk up the beach into the town and walk back along the road for some interesting shops & coffee stops.  The water was very rough and cold when we were there but i think this is normal. For some better boogie boarding waves and surfing we found the beach in Laguna Niguel at the bottom of the Ritz Carlton to be the best.

Summary Heading: Incredible Ocean View, But Not Worth the $$$$$
Summary: I stayed at the Surf & Sand for a weekend in 8/11 w 2 of my closest friends for an early birthday celebration, & we had a very nice time, but it just was not worth the price.  We stayed in a 2 BR penthouse suite, which was actually a 1 BR penthouse suite w an adjoining single room.  This was not the suite that I had actually reserved, but that turned out not to be an issue or a problem, though I think that they should have at least informed me of this change, & this was not the first time that this has happened to me at the Surf & Sand.  The maid locked me out of my room by locking the door between it & the living room, which was very, very annoying.  The front desk staff initially gave me keys for the single room, & not the suite, which didn't exactly start the weekend on a

Summary Heading: surf and sand is first class
Summary: I just took my family to Surf and Sand hotel and had a great time. The hotel is family friendly located on the beach. The hotel staff provided quality service that tends to your every need.. Splashes reastuarant has wide variety on their menu and the food was excellent. That hotel does it right. I will take my family back. Thumbs up!!!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Way too expensive for what you get
Summary: My wife and I came here from Seattle to get away and celebrate some good health news.  Unfortunately it did not meet our expectations.  We paid over $600 per night for a very average small room.  Granted it was right on the ocean, which makes for a unique experience of hearing the waves crashing, but I can't emphasize enough that  the room was just really average.  At $300 per night it would have been perfect, but for $600 you should get much more.  Let's start with the pros:  nice staff, everybody was friendly and accommodating.  A couple of nice perks, free coffee in the morning, managers reception on Friday evening  (free PBR and cheap white wine for an hour), and a nice reasonably priced taco bar on Sunday morning.  Now for the cons:  far too much tolerance for smoking.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for providing feedback on your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.    Although I was pleased to hear our team was friendly and accommodating, I was disappointed to hear that your pool experience, size of your guest room and neighbors smoking took away from your experience.  I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you directly and hope we can invite you back with much more enjoyable memories.  My direct line is 949-793-8054 or e-mail me at jbear@jcresorts.com.  I look forward to speaking with you,  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the resort for three nights and had a wonderful time. The room was clean, service was wonderful and the food from room service was great too. FYI, you can borrow sandy toys and boogie boards from the hotel. This was our 5th year staying at the Surf and Sand and we still love it. The pool remodel is nice and you can't get closer to the beach than this! I highly recommend eating at Nicks for lunch or dinner; it's best to take the free trolley during the summer.

Summary Heading: Wish I could give more stars.  Perfect in every way!
Summary: Perfect location for walking to town, perfect service from front desk to beach, perfect room (one of the few hotels with standard rooms large enough for a roll away with 2 double beds).  When we made the reservation, I mentioned that it was a special occasion and we were upgraded to a tower room, received a bottle of wine and gourmet chocolates...very unexpected which made it very appreciated.

We stayed four nights at the Surf and Sands. Beautiful room overlooking the ocean. Dolphins, pelicans, cormarants to watch all day and the waves are spectacular. Food in Splashes the hotel restaurant was excellent if pricey. We spent all our time on the beach - beach attendants were fab and looked after us brilliantly. Really friendly, welcoming and helpful staff. Extra charges like parking a bit pricey - added about $200 dollars to our bill for four nights. But this was one of our favourite hotels and we'd definitley go again if we were in the area. Cafe great for takeaway breakfast and complementary coffee all day.

Pros: nice pacific beach access on the property, friendly attentive staff.  Great pool  Cons:4th floor ocean view double queen bed room was just okay... Not fantastic.way overpriced.  Mandatory valet parking fee $30per day, no air conditioning

The Surf and Sand is where we accommodate our overflow house guests.....and once again they remain my very favorite Laguna Beach Hotel property!!!! This time we had young children staying as well...the staff provided them with little tents & sleeping bags for an in-room "camping" experience!!!! Too, cute!!! Happy kids make for happy adults!!!! Thank you, Lisa Silva for your special effort to make my guests to feel at home.....

Summary Heading: If you need to see and hear the ocean, this is the place...
Summary: The Surf and Sand is pefectly located in South Laguna Beach and walking distance to several GREAT bars and restaurants....the property is class all the way, from the valet to check-in to its own "Splashes" restaurant that is literally right on the sand.  Rooms are small, but very clean, modern and right on the beach.  The SAS has its own private beach, so you can lounge in luxury on the sand then wash off in the pool....its a perfect place to relax, but only if you love the ocean and the California sun!
nice place overall 8 out of 10  10 being four seasons resorts on top of the water in a corner room very nice

Summary Heading: 5 star resort without an ounce of pretension
Summary: The Surf and Sand Resort is a perfect marriage of 5-star amenities and beach-side charm.  The rooms are lovely without being overdone and there is no way to describe hearing the sound of the ocean rolling right up to your doorstep until you have experienced it at this beautiful hotel.   Hotel services, ranging from check-in to housekeeping, are top-notch.  It's clear that the staff put guests first.
Absolutely one of the most beautiful and relaxing days we have ever spent.  S&S thank you!

Summary Heading: Living it up like the rich and famous in Laguna
Summary: Our  family (teenage daughter) spent a wonderful few days  at the Surf and Sand in Laguna over the holidays and were truly spoiled!  You can't beat the location - right on the surf, and within walking distance to everything Laguna has to offer.  The rooms are gorgeous, spacious, and smack-dab on the sand. It doesn't get any better starting or ending the day sitting on the balcony and listening to the surf.     We loved the smaller more personal scale of the hotel - this is not your typical "corporate" resort experience.  The staff does an excellent job of keeping vibe is beach-luxury-casual. We made ourselves right at home, and could not have had a better experience.

Summary Heading: FABULOUS 50TH BIRTHDAY AT FIRST CLASS RESORT!!!
Summary: We just spent my 50th b-day at Surf and Sand Resort and they went beyond my expectations. I am a travel agent and pretty much have stayed everywhere and Surf and Sand is not just a beautiful 5 star resort but they actually care about their clients.  I told them in advance that it was my 50th birthday and when we arrived they gave us a corner suite room with a fabulous view and their was champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in the room, along with a card.  It meant so much to me. I already knew the hotel was spectacular, but they went above & beyond to make my 50th b-day extra special.  We had stayed in Vegas prior to arriving here and had booked the 1200 s.f. penthouse at Palms Towers and they didn't even acknowledge my b-day at all, so again, this hotel understands that

It had been several years since my wife and I stayed at the Surf and Sand Resort.  The place has gotten much larger (new tower), but the service and staff people are still excellent.  The location is great, very near town, restaurants, bars, clubs, etc.  Had dinner at Splash Restaurant one night (delicious).  Like our first trip there, we stayed in the older part of the hotel due to location (your balcony is virtually right above the beach).  Needless to say the sunset views are really something.  We live in Los Angeles and the forty mile trip to the hotel is like being in another country.  Gotta recharge those batteries now and then.  We'll be going back to the Surf and Sand.

As other reviews state, the location of this resort is simply amazing.  We stayed at this resort to celebrate a very special birthday.  We were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite overlooking the beautiful beach literally underneath the hotel.  We were also given a complimentary bottle of champagne.The bed was comfortable, the bathroom amenities were excellent, and the furnishings had definitely been updated.  It was very relaxing to fall asleep hearing the waves crash in the distance.  It was lovely and intoxicating to be so close to the ocean.  I can't give this property a five because of the following things: 1. The fan in the bathroom was broken and outdated.  This could be a very easy fix for the hotel. 2. A maid walked into our room unannounced.  She asked if her "friends'

Summary Heading: Surf and Sand, a family tradition
Summary: Surf and Sand is perfect for singles, couples, or families with children.  The location right on the beach means children have immediate access to frolicking in the surf, building sand castles, playing paddle ball etc. all under the watchful eyes of their parents who are provided with beach chairs and parasols.  All the facilities are top rate without being pretentious and the staff is awesome.  Every room has a balcony with ocean view and if you leave your sliding glass doors open at night, you go to sleep to the sound of crashing waves.  We love to have a big family breakfast at Splashes and venture into town rarely as there's no need and the kids don't want to leave.  On this last visit, the concierge found us an inexpensive rental car delivered to the hotel.  I have never

Summary Heading: Location, location, location - this is one ofthe best
Summary: I suspect experiences in this hotel fall into two categories; you either have a room leaning over the Pacific crashing onto the beach below you or you don't.  We paid the premium to be on the beach and where the rooms are in a separate, much smaller block. This provided great seclusion from the larger and busier parts of the hotel.  The rooms are well fitted out and you feel you are virtually sitting on the beach when you are on the room terrace.    The hotel staff organising chairs, umbrellas etc on the beach were first class.  A definite winner for those who like to sleep to the sound of the ocean.

Our hotel stay the week of July 24, 2011 was amazing. We loved our room (even though we requested double beds but only had King available) we should have booked a little earlier. Anyway we stayed at the tower and view was amazing. The room was very modern and spotless. Beds super comfy. Everyone that worked there was very helpful and provided excellent service. We will return next year.

Summary Heading: Favorite hotel on Pacific coast highway trip
Summary: It feels like the ocean is breaking right at your hotel balcony! Beautiful views! They were so nice! We checked in late and had missed the s'mores so they sent a special care package of them to our room! You can walk to some shoppes and dinner. View from the restaurant and bar has the waves breaking right outside your window! Free cofffee outside in the morning! Inexpensive kids breakfast, $6! Fireplace and heat lamps so you can sit outside at night!  Only reason didnt give an excellent and it was pretty darn close was no air which you normally don't need I guess but once we figured to open front window to give cross breeze we were fine!

Summary Heading: Spa massage is good, spa itself isn't
Summary: My hubby and I recently went for massages at the Surf and Sand for some relaxation... the massages themselves were great and the staff was very nice, however the facilities are cramped and disappointing. I know that real estate in Laguna is tight and all but the spa was not what I thought it would be for such a high end hotel. The women's spa area is so tiny- there is one bathroom and two showers with a door onto a teeeeeeny patio big enough for a small spa and about 3 regular (not lounge) chairs. When we got there (early in the morning) we were the first ones but as soon as the girl showed me my locker, she was back with someone else. This is obviously not a big deal except she put her locker RIGHT next to mine. That meant that because the locker area is so tiny, the other

We reserved a suite for my husband and me along with our 2 children who are over 6 feet tall. We get there and the room is taken. Management tried to weasel out and give us a double occupancy room. Didn't even comp us drinks while we waited for them to sort things out. Still waiting.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  My apologies for the inconvenience you encountered regarding your room.   Upon receipt of your husband's subsequent correspondence, I was pleased to hear our efforts were appreciated and your family does plan on returning to Surf & Sand in the future.    Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: AMAZING ... YOU HAVE TO STAY HERE!!
Summary: This hotel was the first stop on our honeymoon ... and what a start! The Surf and Sand is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in!  The service is second to none. The front desk, concierge, pool side waiters and everyone else were so helpful and genuinely caring.  The rooms and the rest of the hotel are beautiful. They have ensured a very high quality of furniture and fittings and it definitely shows!  We want to come back every year!  Thank you Surf and Sand!

For $500+ a night (before parking and resort fee), we expected a truly memorable experience. But, as the adage goes, be careful what you ask for.  Our memorable experience started when the bellman opened the door to our unit. The ocean view was beautiful but the room was close to 90 degrees. When asked where the air conditioning controls were, he informed us that you don't need air conditioning in Laguna Beach. We spent the next three days tweaking shutters, using fans and opening doors in an ultimately unsuccessful attempt to manage the temperature of the room. Night time was a disaster-- the only way to cool the room was to leave the balcony door overlooking the ocean wide open. However, for some reason (building configuration?), the waves crashed with such force that it

Summary Heading: Beautiful location, beautiful property, fantastic service.
Summary: We had a fabulous dinner in Splashes, loved the dive-in movies for the kids and had a blast in the ocean. We will be back.

Stayed at the surf and sand back in June as part of a trip to celebrate my girlfriend's 21st. Having spent 4 nights in L.A. and moving onto Vegas after the thought of being in Laguna beach had not appealed to me and was purely to keep the missus happy. That all changed after staying at the Surf and Sand and i cannot wait to return. The hotel was beautiful, the staff amazing, each and everyone one of them was friendly and attentive and could not do enough for you. We were upgraded at check-in to a full sea view room, which was wonderful and the sea being below our balcony was a new experiance, they supply ear plugs incase it is too loud but i liked it. The maids were spot on (considering we were a little messy, leaving clothes about) and we always came back to find the room spot

Summary Heading: Too expensive for what it is
Summary: I was looking forward to my Fourth of July getaway in Laguna.  We arrived at The Surf and Sand ready to relax and enjoy the weekend.  We learned very quickly that is was not conducive to families with small children especially if you have a stroller as there was only one elevator in service and at any given time we had to wait behind other families to use the elevator.  There were way too many stairs all of which were not safe for small children including the steps down to the beach.  The rooms felt incredibly small for the price, and we were quite disappointed that none of the rooms offered air conditioning especially for the price.    While the hotel had sopposedly been remodeled, it felt run down, the rooms seemed very small for the price, the hallways were narrow, and
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback.  I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations during your recent visit to Surf & Sand Resort.    As we do pride ourselves on our family friendly environment and service, I was dissappointed that we came up short with you and your family.  We would love another opportunity should your travels bring you back to Laguna Beach.  Please feel free to contact the Executive Offices directly at 949-793-8075, so we can personally handle your reservations.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: I have been coming to the Surf and Sand for years. The accomodations are just wonderful. The location is among the best in the world. The sunsets at Splashes which is the the restaurant at Surf and Sand is always delicious. We dined at Splashes one night during our two night stay. As always the food and service was just to die for. Our server, Pepe, was fantastic and great with suggestions. The restaurant manager, Andrew, was also so nice and went out of his way to find us a wonderful table and make sure we were cared for. I will be returning to Laguna Beach in September and can't wait to return to the Surf and Sand and take in those beautiful sunsets.  Thank you Surf and Sand and Splashes for always making us feel welcome.

Summary Heading: This use to be one of my favorite hotel.
Summary: I stayed here last week and was not as happy as my previous stay.  I felt our room was run down.  The service wasn't as great.  Felt as we were staying at a 3 star hotel with prime location.  Yes, the location is amazing the hotel was not.  I had a room over looking the pool and couldn't go out my balcany because there was a private party at the pool area.  So if you stepped out it felt as though you were on stage for eveyone to look at.  The pool was closed due to the event.  I feel you should be warned the limited access you would have to the pool and stepping out of your room.  Wasn't a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  Your comments are invaluable and I truly appreciate you taking the time to provide it.  I want to apologize for the lack of communication regarding the pool closure, the condition of your guestroom and service levels during your visit.  I can assure you this is not our usual standard.  When your travels bring you back to Laguna Beach, please feel free to contact myself at 949-793-8054 to ensure your stay is handled personally.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed here overnight over a weekend during a business trip. Don‚Äôt let the street front put you off. This location is amazing. Right on the beach and all rooms face the ocean. Its definitely worth the extra $20 for a surfside room instead of the entry level seaview that are set back from the beach and directly over the pool (could be quite noisy).  Hotel was full but service still very attentive and professional. Nice to have turn down service in the room. On Sundays they even have an upmarket taco stand and drink selection outside the building entrance - adjacent to the lobby. This is a real winner. Great food, drinks and a view to the ocean.  Bar was packed at sunset and food there a small let down in comparison with the rest of the stay (4* not 5*). The aquaterra spa is a

I recently stayed at the Surf & Sand with my children as a weekend getaway and we had the best time!  We went from playing in the surf to swimming in the pool, and ordered a pool-side lunch that was perfect for us.    This is the first time I've stayed since the rooms were renovated, and they're BEAUTIFUL.  It's the prettiest hotel room I've stayed in!  Lots of light fabrics and mirrors made the room look huge.  I'd recommend to anyone wanting a mini-vacation as it was just what I needed!

My daughter, who had stayed her once before, and I spent a wonderful day and night at the Surf and Sand.  We were upgraded from a room overlooking the pool and ocean to a room on the 7th floor overlooking the beach and the price didn't go up.  The service people were friendly and I felt they enjoyed meeting people.  Our room was huge with 2 queen, I think,beds, a large desk and chair, a chair in which to relax, and good lighting.  The bathroom had both a tub and shower, double sinks, and nice amenities.  There was a large closet, robes, and a safe.  We had a very nice balcony.  There was no noise in the corridor at any time.  Parking was included in our package. We had lunch on our arrival, and breakfast the next day at Splashes Restaurant.  The food was presented well and was

We stayed here for 10 days (a mixture of work and pleasure). It is amongst the best hotels that we have ever had the pleasure of staying in. The location (right next to the beach) is stunning, and from the balcony, we saw dolphins in the sea, and on one occasion a whale and her calf. The beach is lovely, and the outdoor pool is also excellent. The hotel itself is very comfortable and the standard of service is excellent-this isone of the things that made the stay so consistently good throughout. We are both very picky about hotels and we couldn't find fault with this one. The staff are excellent, they couldn't do too much for the guests.The valet parking captain and the concierge were the best we had ever met. The room was lovely and very well appointed ( we had free internet

Summary Heading: Wow! Beautiful resort, amazing beachfront location.
Summary: At first I was upset that the rooms are not air conditioned but I slept with my patio doors open and had amazing breezes and fell asleep to the sound of the ocean. Waking up and having my morning coffee looking at the ocean started my day off great! I really miss being there. I definitely found my happy place at the Surf and Sand Laguna!

Summary Heading: Great hotel and a gorgeous location, loved our stay in Laguna
Summary: We had a fantastic time at the Surf and Sand in Laguna. The hotel was great, excellent service, prefect location and the room was nice. We enjoyed superb views with a room and deck that overlooked the Pacific Ocean. The resort was so good that between the room, the beach and the pool we really didn't need to venuture out. Overall a souperb relaxing stay.

Summary Heading: A nice hotel not a destination unto itself
Summary: My husband and I just celebrated our 5 th wedding anniversary at surf and sand. I was torn between here and the montage  I was swayed by the fact that we would have a penthouse suite vs a room at the montage. Not sure I made the right choice. Yes being right over the ocean was great but this really isn't a resort it is basically a hotel room.
