The pool is small the restaurant was good but nothing fabulous there really wasn't a bar/lounge area other than some couches and fireplug over looking the parking/car arrival area. Our suite was nice but the balcony didn't have any lounge chairs the bed was comfortable bathroom nice but we paid over $800 a night i guess I was expecting to be wowed a little more than I was.  I am anxious to try the montage next visit.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We appreciate your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort and regret to hear we didn't meet your expectations.    With our suites product, we do have other options that include large decks with lounge chairs as well as other amenities.    In addition to our 1555 Lounge adjacent to our Lobby, our guests also enjoy Splashes Bar, located "just above beach level".    If your travel plans include Laguna Beach, please free feel contact the Executive Offices at 949-793-8075.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nothing like it! Hypnotic view you feel the ocean.
Summary: Everything is first class. Romantic and relaxing from the service to the food you are treated special by the staff. The ocean view is spectacular.

I should start by saying that we encountered a few problems before we arrived. I received a courtesy call a few hours before we were supposed to check in to alert me to the fact the pool would not be available for most of the time of our stay. This was a deal breaker as I was traveling with an 8 and 12 year old who happily can spend all day in the pool- which in turn allows me to have my very much needed time to relax. I wasn't happy as it was closed due to a private function, not a pool malfunction which would have been out of their control and I thought I should have been given the option at an earlier date to change reservations if needed. I can tell you that the staff at Surf and Sand bent over backwards to make things right, and arranged for pool access at a neighboring 5

Summary Heading: WOW - What a Perfect Place to stay!!!!
Summary: A VERY SPECIAL THANK YOU!!!!      (Yes I‚Äôm yelling‚Ä¶.a little bit)  I know it has been a couple of weeks‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.but trust me‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶you are not forgotten!   I greatly appreciate everything that you and your team did for me while my team was there in ‚ÄúFabulous‚Äù Laguna Beach!  You guys all ROCK ‚Äì total superstars ‚Äì love you all!!    The hotel was fantastic‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.staff was superb‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..catering to every need and want For a visiting customer‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶total satisfaction! Kudos and huge pats on the back to all of you! (I would give you all hugs but I‚Äôm not there)  I loved getting to speak with the staff and knowing them on a work and outside of work conversation‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..that was so wonderful!  Everyone loves the not so normal customer right ‚Äì that would be me ÔÅä  Let‚Äôs make this happen, succeed, and have fun

Summary Heading: One of the most picturesque locations anywhere!
Summary: We have stayed in some of the most highly regarded resorts in North America and Europe. We found our extended weekend at the Surf and Sand to be one of the most well managed anywhere. Our room was gorgeous, updated, clean, comfortable and reasonably quiet (considering we had the rush of the ocean as a background!). Staff was professional and friendly. They went out of their way to acknowledge and celebrate my special occasion many times throughout the weekend. We could not have been happier! We look forward to returning soon.

......always enjoy putting up our overflow out-of-town guests at our local hotel Surf & Sand! Laguna Beach has several more upscale resorts South of town, however, if you want to stay walking distance to the center of Laguna Beach with the local charm, wonderful service, and "old school" literally on the sand property this is the one for you!!!! Lisa and Mike were super knowledgable at the front desk and the entire staff always made our guests feel as though they were welcome....actually, opened the hotel gift shop in the middle of the night so we could get some cough drops without having to drive to a store!!! It is the little details which say "special hotel" to me :)

We arrrived at the Surf and Sand Hotel jaded from a three week road trip - what an amazing surprise - it was listed as 4 star in our brochure - don't know who reviewed it but it was way above our expectations.  The check-in staff were welcoming, valet staff more than helpful - everybody we met whether it was front of house or cleaning staff were first class.  As for the spa - should be compulsory - treatments out of this world.  If you want a slice of heaven with uninterupted views of the sea, the sound of the waves lulling you to sleep in crisp, clean sheets on comfortable beds and the morning fly-past by the pelicans then stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words!  We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your recent stay at Surf & Sand!  I will be sure to share your feedback with our team.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: Came here to celebrate 50th birthday. The staff were very accomodating. Rooms beautiful, clean, and spacious. Looked just like the photos online show. Stayed in oceanfront room. Excellent view. Ate at Splashes restaurant at sunset. Beautiful view, excellent food and service.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Surf & Sand Resort for your 50th Birthday Celebration!  It is great to hear you enjoyed the rooms, our service and food.  We appreciate you sharing this on TripAdvisor and look forward to many return visits.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: Just spent 10 days at the Surf and Sand, using it as a base to explore Southern California. Had a fantastic time and would thoroughly recommend the hotel.  A friendly and welcoming hotel thats as close to the beach as it is possible to be. Lots of outdoor activities organised from a patio "Smores" BBQ through to Ice Creams at the pool and Yoga on the beach. Look out for "happy hour" drinks specials and the complimentary coffee at times during the day.  For a British travellor the Valet parking charges are a surprise (but this is not unusual for North America, we just don't have it in quite the same way across the UK). However, the valet team were great and entertained and informed us "Crazy Brits" on where to go and what to see.
Manager Response: Thank you sharing your feedback about your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  We are thrilled you enjoyed the Spring Break Activities that we are offering as well as our services.  Feedback from extended stay guests are invaluable to us and very helpful in our future planning.  Thank you, again, and we hope you will return!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: What a view and sun set
Summary: We had a corner room bright and nicely appointed. The staff was very friendly. Although the pool was not large it was very nice and the beach is right there what more could you ask for.  It is nice to  be in a smaller resort with a little more personal attention. The manager even stopped by to chat. Hope to go back again soon.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor!  It is great to know that you enjoyed our amenities and services. I will be sharing this with our team.  We look for to many returns!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't get much closer to the beach!
Summary: This resort is nestled beautifully along the beach with spectacular ocean views. Literally, you are RIGHT on the beach. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with everything you need. The ocean can be a bit noisy but they provide earplugs if you have issues sleeping.   The hotel staff is incredibly helpful. All in all, a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed our property, amenities and service during your stay.  Your comments are invaluable and we will be sharing with our team!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The closest on the beach you'll ever get in Laguna
Summary: Stayed in an ocean front room,  in a higher floor in the newer remodeled tower rooms.   Unbelievable view and sleeping with the balcony doors wide open to allow the sounds of the waves rolling in below all night long was heavenly.  The rooms were elegant, fresh and very luxuriously appointed.  Nice surprising touch having the bellhop not only bring our luggage but greet us with a loverly half bottle of Californian sparkling wine -- just perfect.    Highly recommend this hotel if you must stay at least one night as close as you possibly can on the beach in a luxurious hotel.  Great experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed the room and amenities and will certainly be sharing this with our team! Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: I was at a 1 1/2 day conference and my fiance came along. We had enough down time and an extra day to enjoy Laguna Beach. This hotel might be the best I have ever stayed at - and I have traveled a lot. Every aspect of the service is first rate. I checked in, and one of our room keys did not work. I went back to the desk and the young man staffing it immediately remembered my name (and for the entire stay). One day it rained, and the hotel provided umbrellas in the lobby for guests to use. These are just a couple of examples of how they take care of their guests. The first night, we had a buffet dinner at the hotel with the conference attendees. The food was excellent. Definitely many notches above your typical hotel buffet fare. When we returned to our room, the turndown service
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear your positive feedback regarding our services and amenities during your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  Also, it is wonderful you had a chance to see all that Laguna Beach has to offer!  Thank you and we look forward to your future stay with us.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: From the service at the front desk to the amazing view, my sister and I had a wonderful experience! We spent my sister's 50th birthday in a beautiful room with a fairly large balcony over looking the Pacific ocean. The room was tastefully decorated and updated. Our sleep quality was very good--great bed, but we did hear a bit of noise from our neighbors next door. We enjoyed the sound of the waves, but they provide ear plugs if necessary. I would recommend a room on one of the higher levels(we were on the 8th floor) since the sound of  the waves were less intrusive. We didn't get a chance to eat at Splashes on this visit, but it has wonderful (and expensive!) food and one of  THE BEST views of any restaurant in southern california! Our breakfast was served on our balcony and it
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor.  We are thrilled you had a great 50th birthday celebration at Surf & Sand!  I will be forwarding your comments regarding the service at the Front Desk, bed quality and views to our team.  We hope you make this an annual celebration!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing service and a beautiful hotel
Summary: The other reviews are right, this is a very beautiful hotel and well worth the money for a relaxing weekend in Laguna Beach. From the hotel you can walk all the way to downtown on the beach, no need for your car.  During our stay the service was impeccable - when a sweater was accidentally damaged by a staff member (it fell off a suitcase and got caught in a wheel) , not only was Eliana (the hotel Supervisor) polite, she gave us a generous room credit with no hassle AND complimentary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries, and a handwritten note! When is the last time something as nice as that happened to you during a hotel stay? Also, everyone from the maids to the gardeners to the valets are extremely friendly and very well trained. whoever does the training here deserves
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor.   It is always nice to hear that when an issue arises,  we are handling it properly.  I will be sure to share your comments with our team.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager  P.S.  I also love that you can walk to downtown Laguna from our property!

Summary Heading: Great room right on the beach!
Summary: It is a great Hotel. I met many famous people over there.  But the truth is if you are too picky and used to have the best, it is not for you. I would say it is comfortable 4 star Hotel. I stayed there only ones, because it was Oscar weekend and I couldn‚Äôt get in any other hotel. I would stay there again if I have too‚Ä¶ What I remember I had a nice room right on the beach and it was very relaxing to fell asleep listening to ocean. BUT, the price for room was too high ‚Äì 680$ per night! I believe it was because of Oscar, but still I used to pay less in 5 star hotels!

Although we live within one mile of the Surf & Sand, it is still a favorite place to plan a weekend getaway.  Along with the tremendous views and proximity of great Laguna Beach shopping and galleries, the courteous staff and comfortable rooms make it a truly first-class experience.  One of the best pool bar areas in Orange County.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your comments on TripAdvisor.  Love to hear from our repeat guests and look forward to your next stay at Surf!  Thank you again.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: This is a hotel of the highest quality.
Summary: We just checked in for our second visit in the last 4 months- a Valentine's stay.  Again, we are delighted.  Top floor of the tower in a gorgeous , romantic room- waves crashing below our balcony and warm sun lighting up the space.  Even a jacuzzi to sit in & enjoy the view.  Did I say romantic?!! And complimentary champagne & luscious strawberries!  Staff could not be more friendly & professional.  I suggest anyone wanting to see how staff should perform come here and observe. We love it here!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words regarding your recent stay at Surf.  It is great to hear about both the service and your guest room hitting high marks!  We look forward to your next stay with us.   Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic, Sensational experience, would go back in a heartbeat!!
Summary: I visited Laguna Beach on business this month, and was fortunate to stay at the Surf & Sand Resort on the beach for 3 nights.  This was my second visit, and my trip was nothing less than spectacular.  The resort is luxurious, exceptionally clean, comfortable, and the staff is wonderful.  My room overlooked the beach, and I was able to watch the most amazing sunset I've ever seen each evening I was there, and listen to the soothing waves crash against the beach nightly.  The turndown service was a treat, with soothing music playing in my room, my robe layed on my bed, and candy on my pillow.  The trip was business but the hotel definitely made for a vacation at the same time.  In addition, when I returned home, I realized I had misplaced my engagment ring, and was devastated
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  It is always good to hear when our guests return and we were able to exceed your expectations.  I will pass along your compliments to David Kubik our Security Director.  I am happy to hear your engagement ring was found at home!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Surf and Sand was amazing and really made our trip! Our room was right on the water with the most incredible view, and just high enough to still be private. The restaurant was unbelievable and the service was great - they even had a bottle of champagne to greet us. And best of all you could walk to almost everywhere in Laguna.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your recent stay on TripAdvisor.  I am thrilled you enjoyed the view from the guest rooms, Splashes restaurant and the ability to walk to town from our resort!  We look forward to your future stay.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: We were fortunate enough to spend a few days at this beautiful hotel ! One of the nicest places that I have ever stayed at !!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor.  I will ensure to share this with our team and look forward to many returns!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great ocean view!! Can't get any closer
Summary: What a great way to spend our 27th wedding anniversary. This was better than our honeymoon trip to Hawaii. We were in room 417 which is just 15ft above the sand. At high tide, the water was under our balcony.   Weather was good, we woke up to sunny skies. The only complaint was the sound of the waves can be very loud at night but what do you expect when you are right on top of the beach. The hotel gives you foam ear plugs but we did not use them.   The rooms are a bit on the pricey side but we got a deal since it is winter. Make sure you negotiate with them since our 'resort fee' was waived and we got a food allowance. This might only be during the winter but ask anyway.   Downtown Laguna Beach is just 1 mile away so there are plenty of places to eat from fast food to fancy
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at Surf & Sand.  As many guests are not use to the sound of the waves, we provide the ear plugs.  I am glad to hear they came in handy for you.  Also, it is good to know that the Front Desk promptly resolved the room cleaning delay.  Thank you again and look forward to your next stay with us.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful place on the beach in Laguna Beach
Summary: There's nothing to not like about this hotel, however, the pool area is usually overrun with screaming kids leaving the adults without any serenity or relaxation.  Otherwise, I love this place.  The rooms are very nice and the hotel is right on the beach.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and will be reviewing it with our Pool staff as our goal is to ensure all guests are able to enjoy themselves.  Thank you - Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: Laguna Beach is a wonderful artist community, beautiful in so many ways.  My daughter and I needed a break from our busy lives, so we decided to take one night and we didn't know what to expect.   Boy did we get  special treatment.  Beautiful room, room service , flowers on tray, beautiful restaurant, gourmet food and service.  We could't ask for more. Ocean view on an upper floor.   If you get a change to go, go and have fun.  You won't  regreat it.  It was the perfect perfect hotel.  ( go in Winter it much more affordable)

Summary Heading: Magical, felt like I was royalty
Summary: We stayed at the Surf and Sand seven years ago when a travel package was offered to us. We always knew we wanted to return and finally did this week for my husband's birthday. It was the same wonderful experience we had the first time and we realized our two night trip was too too short. We won't let seven years go by without returning.

I purchased a "Night to remember" package for my husband's birthday.  The package included a free breakfast.  I checked out and received my final bill which showed that our breakfast had indeed been comped.  In review of my credit card statement, I found that the restaunt had charged my credit card individually for the breakfast.  I did not give them my card and it was charged through the hotel.  When I tried to resolve the issue, I was transferred back and forth between the front desk and the restaurant with neither taking the responsibility for the charge on my credit card - the charge was for $65.  I have disputed the charge through my credit card company.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I want to apologize for the confusion and time spend trying to resolve your breakfast charge.  Please call me directly at 949-793-8054 and I will ensure proper adjustment is made immediately.  Also, I will be able to get more information to assist in preventing this situation from reoccurring.   Sincerely,  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Classy, Sumptuous Hotel - the Perfect Getaway!
Summary: Love this hotel!! My husband and I went last November for my birthday and stayed the weekend.  We stayed in a beautiful room right on the ocean.  The room was luxurious and all the little touches that make a hotel a great place to stay were present.  Music on, bed turned down every night, chocolates, robes, even earplugs to block out the sounds of the surf if you want.  We loved relaxing by the pool, at the beach, having drinks in the bar, and breakfast at Splashes.  I grew up in Orange County and now live in Carlsbad and this truly is one of the nicest hotels along the coast - fantastic!   We will be going back this weekend for our anniversary - can't wait!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your stay on TripAdvisor!  I am thrilled to hear you enjoyed our services and amenities and look forward to your future memories with us!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: This was our second get away to the Surf and Sand.  We were able to enjoy a great, great deal offered to members of their e-mail listings (included parking and resort fee, plus a great rate for an ocean front room).  Very helpful and friendly staff.  The loud waves can be a little annoying at night (they do provide ear plugs on the bedstand), the waves bothered me, but not my husband.  (We totally closed the sliding glass doors the second night as well).  We received turn down service each night with a small chocolate & water bottles.  We saw dolphins twice--next time we will bring binoculars.  Loved sitting on the balcony (directly above the sand) and watching the waves & the minimal activity on the beach (we went in January).  It was very peaceful and relaxing on the balcony.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your experience at Surf on TripAdvisor.   I am happy to hear you enjoyed our special offer and an extra surprise with dolphin sightings!  We look forward to your future stays with us.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stay at the Surf & Sand frequently and it is one of our favorite hotels.  We decided to try something new for our anniversary, and stayed a weekend at the Montage. We paid over $750/night. We were completely disappointed with the service and decided that we needed to take a trip to the Surf & Sand to have a better anniversary experience.   We booked a weekend at the Surf & Sand 2 weeks after our weekend at the Montage so that we could compare our experiences at each hotel. Surf & Sand, as we anticipated, blew the Montage out of the water. The ocean views are far more superior (no comparison), and the service was impeccable.  We did this "experiment" because we wanted to create memories for our anniversary every year. We now know where we will be staying every
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We are thrilled you had a wonderful anniversary and look forward to many more here at Surf & Sand!  Thank you again, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The most wonderful seaside hotel room on the California coast
Summary: We have made it a point to stay at the SURF and SAND at least once every year, for the 27 years we have been married....To say it is a romantic location , would have to be an understatement...The stress melts away with the crashing of the surf....We love it there.  We wish we could stay there longer than we do,but we are limited only by our pocket book.  This is not a hotel where you just spend the night to sleep,this is a destination!!
Manager Response: It is always good to hear from our loyal repeat guests!  I am thrilled that you continue to enjoy our resort and services and appreciate you taking the time to share them.  We look forward to your next stay with us - Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Fabulous and Relaxing 5-Star Experience at Surf and Sand - Worth Every Penny!
Summary: My husband and I were in dire need of a quick getaway to de-stress. With only one night available to escape reality in Los Angeles, we opted for a stay in Laguna Beach. It had been years since I had stayed at the Surf & Sand and my husband had never been, so I booked a night in their ocean-front room. What a wonderful and relaxing 24 hour trip! The views can't be beat and we were blessed with 80 degree weather in the middle of December, but what really "wowed" us was the high level of customer service. Everyone, from the front desk to the pool concierge to the groundskeepers, were friendly and went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. We can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your recent experience here at Surf & Sand.  It is always good to hear when guests depart stating they can't wait to come back!  Your positive feedback will be shared with our team - thank you again and look forward to your next visit - Sincerely,  Joanna Bear, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Absolutely wonderful!  The service was amazing - the views spectacular!
Summary: We live in the area, but wanted to be on the ocean so my husband could recharge after 30 days in the hospital getting leukemia treatment.  It was exactly what he needed - beautiful, peaceful and excellent service!!!  Can't wait until he goes into remission & we'll be back to celebrate!
Manager Response: I am happy to hear you were able to relax and enjoy our services during your stay here at Surf.  Our hearts are with you and your husband and look forward to your next visit here with us.  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is such a wonderful resort. It manages to combine refinement and elegance with a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. The rooms are just fabulous, luminous and comfortable. The public areas of the hotel are more like being at a good friend's mansion than a hotel. The staff is so kind and caring. I stopped expecting someone to be short tempered or impatient because it never happened. The spa was blissful and, best for last, the food was DELICIOUS!! We had room service every morning and they managed to get it to us hot and make something like oatmeal a joy to behold. Don't miss the lemon ricotta pancakes with huckleberry compote. We got in the habit in the morning of going down with the children in our jammies to get a cup of coffee and peppermint hot chocolates from Corey at the

Summary Heading: absolutely brilliant ,loved the place so much we are going back in two weeks time.
Summary: everything about this place is great , even checking in was a pleasure , nothing was too much trouble, ask and it was done, the room we had at the far north end of the property is the best location ,quiet and with a unbelievable 180 degree view.............tim stewart
Great long weekend! Loved the resort, looking for an excuse to come back soon!

Summary Heading: Beautifull location, perfect for beach and sunset
Summary: Very nice hotel on the beach, pretty and comfortable room with a great balcony  right on the beach, bathroom needs some update, service nice and helpfull but not always very efficient. That is unfortunetly a problem happening often in the US hotels, where there is a lack of training. Coming from Europe and having travelled all over the world, I often find the  US staff nice and friendly but missing some refinement. But over all, I spent a very nice week in sunny Laguna and the Surf and Sand was very plaisant;

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay and relax.
Summary: Everything is top notch and the staff is friendly and helpful. We have never not totally enjoyed our stay here.

Summary Heading: Excellent experience that provided elegant relaxation.
Summary: The elegant room had an incredible view of the ocean. The sunset at Splashes, the bar at beach level, was beautiful and very romantic.  We were celebrating my husbands birthday with a few days away. There was a bottle of wine and a cheese and fruit plate waiting for us in the room. I especially enjoyed the candle, massage oil and other spa gifts. The hotel was romantic, cozy and an elegant beach experience. This was not our first or last visit.

The Hotel is really nice, We got a free room, because my husband did a job on their pool. My husband works for Arto Brick and they did the whole pool area.  The room had a ocean view, that we could really listen to the waves. Complimentary coffee in the morning, spa, fitness center and a good restaurant. Also they have a smores and snores program for kids. The kids can sleep in a tent  with a sleeping bag and they have a water and cookies turndown every night.

Summary Heading: This is the best resort in Southern California
Summary: We have our annual departmental offsite meeting at this resort  for 20 people  from London, Paris, Munich and Chicago.  First of all, it is so reassuring (and unusual)  to pull into the parking lot year and see the same employees - from the valet parkers to the Concierge. Everything went so smoothly at our meeting that it was nothing short of amazing. The food was delicious and the service excellent from every member of the staff.  The Director of Catering/Conference Services helped me with so many last minute problems and requests such as printing out  quantities of presentations when my printer went down to changing food orders at the very last second.  These things were done so promptly and calmly that it soothed my sometimes fraying nerves (I panic very easily and become a

I can easily say this is the nicest hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. The rooms were fantastic, the views were stunning, and the location can't get much better for Southern California. If I could, I would stay here forever.

What a fabulous hotel! Our room was amazing: on the ninth floor and newly decorated with a balcony that opened out with views across the ocean. Our bathroom had folding shutters that let you sit in the bath and look out to the ocean! The hotel is everything you would expect of a five star establishment.......complimentary coffee in the lobby in the mornings; laundry service; evening turndown.......Very nice Good for breakfast in the morning is the Orange Cafe which is a few blocks' walk north from the hotel on PCH.

My family & I re-visited again The Surf & Sand resort to celebrate our Anniversary...and again, like previous year..it was exceptional!!!  We kind of mentioned to Chris, our receptionist at check it, that we were coming back to celebrate our Anniversary, and he was so kind as to give us an upgrated room!! We were then later suprised by a nice bottle of champagne accompanied by nice chocolate later on in the room!! What a nice and thoughtful touch from the staff!!  We will definitely come back next year to again, celebrate our Anniversary....in fact, we will make this our yearly event!!    My kids also had a great time swimming at the heated pool and jacuzzi, even more..they were fascinated with feeding the seaguls ..LOL   I would recommend this resort to anyone in a heart beat!!

This wonderful, friendly and beautifully located hotel has it all.  Our balcony overlooked the beach and the sound of the waves was mesmerizing.  Sunsets over Catalina are so lovely.  All of the staff could not have been more helpful, friendly and professional.  We liked it so much that we booked 2 more visits in the Surfside building.

Summary Heading: No air conditioning in the room
Summary: While this hotel was nice, with a great view of the Pacific Ocean, I was shocked to find that there was no air conditioning in my room.  The room was very warm when I arrived (very late in the evening) and I was advised simply to open the doors to the balcony and the room would cool off from the evening air.  However, I was uncomfortable sleeping that way as a solo female traveler - I did not want to leave the balcony door open all night long.  So, I opened it until it was time to sleep and then closed the door.  I was very warm all night and slept very badly.  I have never been at a hotel that did not offer air conditioning.  I was very surprised, especially since this was an otherwise very nice resort.

Excellent 1 night stay on 10/24...we had a wedding to attend. Very impressed with the entire property...beautiful! Our room was great & ready when we checked in early...the view was AMAZING! I'm hard to please when it comes to hotels/resorts...The Surf & Sand exceeded my expectations!! The room was clean...turn down service was excellent & a nice suprise to come back to after the wedding! Very romantic :) I hope my husband will bring me back again...would love to try Splashes next time. We took a little tour and it looked like a beautiful place to enjoy a meal. Thank You to The Surf & Sand for an excellent stay...I loved it!! :)
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your recent stay with us and will be sharing it with our team!  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel, located right on the beach is a 5 star quality hotel but with 5 star prices. everything is well cared for including you.

If you can stay here- do! It definitely is on the more expensive end- but it‚Äôs worth saving ahead and staying here if you‚Äôre a fan of looking at the beach and having instant beach access. The views are breathtaking. The hotel also had a great and attentive staff. The location and view is unmatched-you can't be closer to the ocean without being in the water. I travelled with my husband and teenage brother. My husband is in a wheelchair and therefore usually dislikes the beach as its not compatible with wheelchairs- but with this hotel-we had so many options, including our own room and deck- for him to enjoy the ocean in a completely wonderful way! The roar of the ocean in your rooms was amazing- I was shocked at how loud it really was. The waves crash into the building at night
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your recent experience at Surf & Sand Resort.  I am thrilled to hear your positive comments regarding our team, hotel amenities and guest room.  We look forward to your next stay with us!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: Surf and Sand has thee best location at Laguna!  It's located directly on the sand.  The ocean waves lull you to sleep.  My room was very clean and nice.  I'm super picky.  I look under beds, behind headboards, under mattresses, on top of ceiling fan blades, and in corners.  It was spotless.  The staff  was very polite, professional, helpful, and cheerful.  The bed was very comfortable.   The resort is small, but, very nice....casually elegant.  I was traveling alone and felt very safe here, too.  The resort was also very quiet and relaxing.  Surf and Sand is an excellent value!

Nothing but great things to say about the S and S.  It is a wonderful hotel with a fantastic view.  Wish it was a little more afordable but then again you get what you pay for...The body surfing was excellent with the monster waves that roll in...be ready to hear them all night long crashing on the shore...

After spending a few days in the Disneyland area this was just what we needed.  This hotel is so nice and relaxing.  I would stay here next time and commute to Disneyland.  Right on the beach and just such a stress free atmosphere.  All I can say is Outstanding.

Summary Heading: The best hotel to hear the ocean from your room.
Summary: I love the size of the Surf and Sand hotel.  It still feels intimate.  It is my favorite beach hotel in all of the USA.  It is the only hotel I have ever been in you could hear the ocean waves crashing from your bed.  Splashes restaurant and bar have great atmosphere.  Excellent food and drinks.  All the staff from the front desk to concierge, bellman and valet parking are attentive.   You can walk to shops and restaurants.  I love the hotel.

Let me start by saying this hotel is in a great location. The hotel sits on the beach, a beautiful beach. The hotel has a great but small pool. Great lounging around the pool if you don't mind kids. I don't mind kids so the noise and fun didn't bother me. The beach out front is great for swiming if you or your kids are used to swimming in the ocean. Depending on the day, the shore break can be challenging for a person who is not used to getting out past the waves. Once your out past the waves the paddle boarding, swimming, snorkeling is fantastic. You can go for a great walk south or north toward the town of Laguna Beach. There are some great restaurants and bars within walking distance and there is really no reason to drive anywhere. The food at the restaurant is ok, nothing to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed the resort and our services, I will be sharing your comments with our team.  We look forward to your future stays with us!  Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: Beautiful resort. The best view you could possibly get for that money, with the comfort to match. Everything was so convenient, we could go to the beach, then walk right up stairs, shower off, and jump right into the pool. And every room provides an amazing view of the ocean. I highly recommend this to anyone who can afford it.

Summary Heading: Forget Montage & Ritz ~ This is THE surf side hotel
Summary: I was looking for a special place for my wife's birthday "kidnapping" ...I live in South Orange County, so I was well aware of many options.  I looked into the Montage - beautiful property, but the room costs with tax were over $900/night for a standard room. The Ritz was in the same ball park -- and neither of them offered the romantic aspect I was looking for.  St. Regis was expensive as well.  Then the Surf and Sand popped into my mind.    I've driven past it a zillion times, and heard great things about it.  So I decided to take the plunge.  The reservation agent was very helpful.  She had one standard room left in the Towers with a king bed, which she offered for the same rate as I found on the internet ~ I hesitated, and then took the plunge.  I'm very glad I did!  From

Summary Heading: Try the Montage, St. Regis or Ritz Instead!
Summary: We stayed for two weeks at Surf and Sand, from July 24 to August 7, 2010, and had ample time to observe the staff, operations and culture of the Resort. I hope that you find this feedback, although lengthy, valuable.  I would first like to chronicle some circumstances and situations unique to us before I share with you some concerns we had for the general population of hotel guests.  To begin, my husband and I were married at Surf and Sand Resort in July of 2009. After our wedding day, we shared with Lora W. and Nick B. (the formal general manager no longer working with Surf and Sand) feedback about our wedding day, both positives and negatives. After sharing our feedback, Lora and Nick invited us to stay at the Surf and Sand, offering us two complimentary nights and a rate of
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and regret that the recent stay did meet your expectations.  As mentioned in my letter, we have addressed several of the service concerns identified.  At Surf and Sand we strive to make our guests feel warm and welcome and sincerely apologize that we did not achieve that on your recent stay.  Blaise Bartell, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I took an impromptu trip up to Surf & Sand looking for a relaxing overnight getaway but found so much more. Our spacious oceanfront room and view was beyond spectacular.  Service at all outlets was wonderful- front desk, room service, beach-side, etc. And our lunch in Splashes was excellent - so fresh and delicious. Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations and we're already looking forward to a return visit!

Hello all!  I stayed here easter weekend of 2009 with my boyfriend and we had a lovely weekend here.  Rooms- I miss the sound of the ocean from our room! Rooms very clean and spacious and man we had the biggest TV in front of our bed, I can spend all day there watching TV.  the pool and beach was very nice, we spend a lot of time walking on the beach and taking nice dips on the pool.   Room service was sooo good, true california style, very healthy options, enjoyed having our breakfast in our balcony and looking at ocean!  Spa- was small but very nice and we were well take care of.  We walked to many restaurants and the center of Laguna beach, a good 5- 10 min walk to everything.    We cannot wait to make time to return to this lovely hotel, definitely recommend it.

My husband and I spent three nights at the Surf & Sand.  We have been there many times over the past 25 years, and it is always a wonderful experience.  Aside from a few minor issues (we had to run the hot water for 5 full minutes before it got hot- an incredible waste of water), everything was perfect.  We had room service and the food was probably the best I've ever had through room service.  The room, although a little smaller than in the past (we usually get a Tower room, as we did this time), was comfortable and very clean. It is a little irritating that other guests smoke on their balconies and the smoke periodically wafts into other rooms, but I am not sure the hotel can do anything about it. I do think it is a bit too expensive, but it seems to be always full, so I guess
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I apologize for the delay in your hot water.  I agree, it is a huge waste.  I have our Director of Engineering following up on that issue to ensure it is resolved.  We look forward to your next visit!  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best experience in a hotel at southern California beaches!
Summary: The staff is beyond excellent!  My rooms were awesome, great view, clean, crisp, cool!  The Hotel location practically over the water is among the best in the world; the constant sound of the waves is heaven!  One of the best boutique hotels in the world
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  It is always nice to hear when guests have enjoyed their stay with us!  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The best place to stay in Laguna!
Summary: A great place to stay in Laguna and worth the extra money to be right on the beach.  Great pool, excellent restaurant (pricey, but well-priced kids' meals).  The service was fantastic.  Ask for an upgrade to the Towers building.  During the summer months, a free trolley takes you right around Laguna (or you can easily walk as well).  This was our favorite hotel on our trip to California!

I booked a deluxe king room in the new tower on the ocean.  It was expensive and worth every penny!  The beach staff was wonderful.  EVERYTHING was wonderful.  I would definitely stay at Surf and Sand again!

Summary Heading: The facilities are stylish and inviting; the staff is friendly and eager to please.
Summary: From the valet to concierge to reception to house keeping, this place is abounding with helpful, friendly crew.  Loved the outdoor lounge with gas firepits and lots of pillows.  Beach accommodations were complete with chairs, umbrellas and beach toys (boogie boards, paddle ball, frisbees and wait staff).  Spent a very comfortable day next to the pool (pictures online don't do it justice - my daughter actually complained prior to the trip that "the pool looks puny!")  I heard guests complaining that the pool deck was crowded, but they didn't get up early and reserve their spot for the day.  A little hectic pulling your car out of the resort and getting onto PCH, but several times we opted to walk instead, and took advantage of the free Laguna Trolley.  Took us all the way to the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words! I will be sharing your comments with our staff.  We appreciate you taking the time to share.  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: Four friends & myself decided on a "destination feel" for our next "Girl's Birthday" party. We decided to stay at the Surf & Sand in Laguna Beach since one of the girls had stayed there previously and loved it. From the moment we pulled in we felt like we were in Hawaii or some remote location rather than local to us. We were blown away with the view from our balcony and thought our room was spacious and well laid out. We decorated and added our "goodie bags" to the champagne and strawberries already in place, compliments of the hotel (I had to order these when I booked our room). Our room was clean and so comfortable and homey we decided to stay in rather than to dine out. We weren't thrilled by the food, but the service and presentation was fabulous. There was a DVD player in

LOVE it!  It is a little spendy but...worth every penny!  If you like a really nice hotel, there is nothing else like it on the beach!  The service is amazing.  The pool is nice and overlooks the ocean but is protected from the beach and wind by clear glass.  Restaurant and bar overlook beach and offer nice atmosphere and good food.  Smores ingredients in cute individual little boxes in the evening in tidy firepits surrounded by couches with cushions and a waterfall.  Great little coffee shop on resort with really reasonable prices. Yummy bakery across the street. (Try the bearclaw, unbelievable!) All the great shops and restaurants are a short walk from hotel.

This is one of the best hotels that offers beachfront accomodations. We stayed in the Towers with an oceanfront room #263. It was awesome. You can also walk to alot of things and places in Laguna or take the Trolley. We ate at Splashes one night and they sat us near a wall, seriously. I made reservations wayyyyy in advance and even asked if we could switch tables after other people were done eating and they said no, they were already reserved. Customer service in Lobby is great! I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Surf and Sand Resort in a Surfside Oceanfront King room in July.  We would highly recommend this resort.  It is located in Laguna Beach and is convenient to shops and restaurants.  There is a trolley in town that runs every 15 to 20 minutes and will take you to the downtown area or the art shows for free. The resort's bar and restaurant are right on the beach so that you can enjoy the ocean while dining. The menu's are interesting and varied. The staff is very accomodating, especially the Concierge Desk. We requested early housekeeping each day and the staff showed up within 15 minutes to clean our room. In room dining was unbelievably fast and delicious. We each had treatments in the spa that were fabulous. We would definitely stay here again.  What a treat it
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.  It is always nice to hear the positive feedback and will make sure to share with our team.  Sincerely,  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here twice now and really like this place.  It has a wonderful location on a narrow beach in Laguna Beach.  With the doors open, they breeze, and the sound of the waves, it feels like you are sleeping on the beach -- with a really nice comfy bed.  The rooms are very tastefully done in a "modern beach-y" decor and well designed to make them look and feel bigger than they really are.  The bathrooms are nicely done (although the toilet/shower area is a little cramped -- a vestage the former hotel no doubt).  On that point, you can see if you look hard that it is a renovated older hotel.  But I didn't have any of the issues that some of the earlier posted had.  I think it was a pretty well-done renovation myself.  We didn't spend my time at the pool, but the beach
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences and for the kind words on our property's improvements.  Your feedback is invaluable to us and allows us to prioritize our training efforts.  We will be reviewing these concerns with our Pool & Beach, Splashes and Valet teams to ensure these issues are addressed promptly.  Thank you again for your patronage and we look forward to your next stay with us.   Sincerely, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: We especially love the beach.  They provide towels, chairs and umbrellas.  You can order food and drinks on the beach.  Early check in and late check out are never a problem.  Everyone on the staff is friendly and helpful.

I wanted something special for my wife to celebrate her birthday. She loves the beach and always wanted to have a beautiful room overlooking the surf and sand. This hotel was recommended by a friend. It's not cheap, but the view  and the roar of the crashing waves is worth it. We did not use them, but ear plugs are provided in case the sounds of the waves get too loud. We had a balcony with table and chairs to enjoy the full ocean view. Breakfast and evening cocktails on the balcony were romantic. Only awkward experience was a smoker below us, but we called the front desk and they responded immidiately to stop them (strict no smoking policy even on the balconies). Splashes restaurant was pricey for dinner, but again, worth it and delicious. The hospitality is EXCELLENT!!! My

We usually rent a house for a week each July in Laguna and have considered switching to a hotel/resort right on the beach.  We test drove the surf and sand for a possible consideration for 2010.  We always love splashes and will continue to eat lunch there..  Our room was great- clean and perfect view.  There is no a/c in the rooms which means you leave the doors open and sleep with fresh sea air and sounds of the ocean.  This was nice until our neighbors started smoking pot.  If it was just for a little while it would have been OK.  We were traveling with a 1.5 yr old and did not want to expose her to the nasty smoke.  Closing the door made it uncomfortably warm.  After we checked out I filled out the email review the hotel sent me.  I promptly received a call from the  manager
Manager Response: I apologize for you not receiving the gift certificate and want to ensure we have your correct information.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 949-793-8054 and I will overnight the certificate to you.   Sincerely,  Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: We keep coming back here when we visit Laguna Beach.  We have been here both for romantic get aways as well as family get togethers. - location is superb -  right on the beach yet a 15 minute walk to town - beautiful ocean view rooms with balconies - casual atmosphere - friendly service  -staff is very helpful on suggesting places to eat and activities to do - beach access (service on beach as well) - lovely sunsets from your room or at the bar/restaurant  -very adequate fitness center and spa The building is not too impressive from the street and the hallways to your room are a little "motel like",  but once inside your room or by the beach and pool, you find total relaxation.  T

My husband and I spent last weekend at the Surf and Sand Resort. I like it better than the Ritz Carlton in Dana Point since it's smaller and right on the water. The service was superb; friendly but not stuffy. The spa services were normal prices, very good staff, and lovely venue. We felt completely comfortable everywhere in the hotel. The Splashes restaurant food was fresh and perfectly cooked ($22 - $34 entrees).  Our room was pristine and overlooked the sand and waves: meaning looking straight down from our balcony we saw sand at low tide and waves at high tide. Glorious views up and down the coastline. This trip would have been perfect if the guest nextdoor hadn't smoked on his balcony day and night, which went right to ours. We called the front desk for help (it has totally
Manager Response: As a person with a heightened sense of smell myself, I completely understand how your husband felt about your neighbor smoking on their balcony.  I will follow up with our team to ensure we are successful in creating an environment every guest can enjoy. -   Also, thank you for your kind words regarding our staff, restaurant  and guestrooms. - Joanna Bear, Assistant General Manager.

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable property with great service.
Summary: I didn't know what to expect.  This property is very nice, neat location, great staff, rooms have incredible views.  California really isn't my favorite place to go, but I sure did like this place.

Summary Heading: Excellent venue for small business meeting
Summary: Everything was very well done.  Rooms were clean and light (and directly over the beach), service was attentive, and the food was fresh and well prepared.

We have stayed at the Surf and Sand many times, but not for a while. It is just as wonderful as I remembered from the waves right outside our window to the delicious food and the great gym. Not to be missed

From start to finish the hotel was amazing.  The employees were extremely polite & friendly and went out of their way to visit with us.  We had a beautiful corner room overlooking the ocean.  Can't wait to go back!

We like to get away to the Surf and Sand when we can because we feel it has one of the best locations in Laguna, comfortable guestrooms and amazing viewsof the coastline.  This last trip we were upgraded to a corner tower  room and it was fantastic!  Rooms are very attractive with beach chic decor.  Bed/linens were very comfortable.  If I have any complaint, its only that when someone is smoking on the balconies it can drift your way and spoil an otherwise perfect setting. I would have loved to have coffee service in the room.  Highly recommended for a romantic splurge, even if only for a night.
Manager Response: I agree- this is a very romantic spot.  Thank you for sharing your experience and keep an eye out for our Summer Programming.  It is geared for both couples and families....something for everyone!  Look forward to your next stay, Joanna Bear - Assistant General Manager

Summary: The website for the Surf and Sand Resort was sleek and chic and that gave us the impression that we were in for a wonderful treat. The purpose of our stay at the Surf and Sand Resort was to attend a sunset wedding. Upon our arrival the staff was very kind and helpful. However the check-in process was somewhat cumbersome. I was attending the wedding with my boyfriend and his name had been added to the reservation. However upon checking in they treated us as though we had two reservations which was somewhat confusing. I'm sure there is thought behind this process, however it was confusing when even though we shared one room, we were asked for two credit cards and then handed two bills at the end of our stay. Again that part of the process was somewhat clunky.   Our rooms were up a
Manager Response: I am also very disappointed to hear about the mildew smell in your room.  I am having our Housekeeping and Engineering teams work in tatum to ensure a deep cleaning is done to all our guest rooms, including all the drains.   In regards to our wedding/group reservations, I will review with our Front Desk team to ensure a smoother/seamless process for our guests.    I am happy to hear the wedding was a success and the food was delicious!    Thank you for your invaluable feedback - Joanna Bear, Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a conference the last week in April, and the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  They always addressed us by name and would do anything to accommodate us.   They cleaned our room at specific times, made dinner reservations for us, helped with directions, etc.  We did not eat at the Splashes restaurant ‚Äì as our food was handled through the catering department at the hotel.  The catered food (which I would think is by the same cooks as Splashes) was excellent.  I wasn‚Äôt expecting it to be that good, but it really was.  We always had several selections at each meal, and all were good.  The room was also nice with a beautiful ocean view.  There isn‚Äôt any conditioning in the room (only heat), but in all honesty, we didn‚Äôt
Manager Response: Name recognition has been a focus with our team and I am pleased to hear they are listening!    Also, it is good to know that your specific requests are completed to your satisfaction.  In this industry it is vital to our success.    I will make sure to forward your comments to our team !  Thank you again - Joanna Bear, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I surprised my husband for our wedding anniversary and took him to the Surf and Sand resort (a recommendation from a friend who is originally from Laguna Beach).  We both loved the place.  The concierge called me a few days prior to our visit and asked if there was anything she could do to make our stay more enjoyable - she was very helpful and very nice and she upgraded our room.  The view is unbelievable.  The hotel and rooms are very nice and very clean.   The concierge the day of our arrival was also very helpful getting us a reservation at a great restaurant.  We hope to experience such a great time next year, since we are already talking about going back for our anniversary in 2011.
Manager Response: Referrals are so important in this industry;  please thank your friend for us.  What a great gift for you and your husband to spend  your anniversary here at Surf & Sand.  We look forward to next year's celebration!  Joanna Bear

Summary: Celebrated my birthday over the weekend here at our favorite getaway spot. Even though we only live 20 miles up the road, felt like we were 5000 miles away from the hustle & bustle of OC. Front desk, so sweet to upgrade us to a gorgeous room in the Tower bldg.  Thank you! Service throughout the hotel was excellent.  Spa, simply decadent & melted away all stress. Room Service so quick & right on! We will be back, soon!!!! Thank you for help making my birthday so relaxing!!! L. Stratford  (PS- don't listen to those AC complaints. You are ON the ocean! Most classic hotels in Hawaii do not offer AC.  Stay inland if you want to freeze!)
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback.  It's great to hear you enjoyed the Spa, Room Service and a room in the Towers Building! We appreciate you celebrating your birthday with us!  Joanna Bear

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have ever stayed in
Summary: I have traveled all over the world, and the Surf and Sand was, overall, the best hotel experience I have ever had. The hotel is beautiful and meticulously clean. The staff was friendly, helpful, and very accommodating. They heard it was my birthday and sent complimentary champagne and strawberries to the room. The room was breathtaking. We had a private balcony right on the beach. Sleeping in those extremely comfortable beds with the balcony doors open, so we could hear the waves crashing, is an experience everyone should have, A perfect hotel for a nice weekend getaway.
Manager Response: It is always great to get such positive feedback.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your comments.  I know our team will be thrilled to hear this!  - Joanna Bear

Summary: My husband and I expereiced a very stressful & taxing week. His solution for the hectic week was a weekend getaway; remembering a friends referral I immedialtey looked up the hotel onine. I was so excited and immediatley called to make a reservation, however the accomidations we signigucantly out of my budget. I informed the agent of my need for a lower rate and belive it or not, a room that was originally rated far above my finacial expectiations suddeny fell BELOW my expectations due to a rare weekend promotion. Yay Me!! This allowed my husband & I the opportunity to take advantage of a program we wouldn't ordinarily have the opportunity to take advatntage of.  Thank you surf n sand, We WILL be back!!!
Manager Response: First, please thank your friends for referring Surf & Sand to you!  Secondly, I am pleased you were able to take advantage of a special promotion and enjoy the property.    We look forward to your return visit-  Joanna Bear

Summary Heading: Best Hotel & Staff in Laguna Beach!
Summary: This hotel is our favorite in Laguna.  We usually stay in the Surfside rooms which are romantic and quiet but we had our 13 year old with us so we stayed in the Tower.  He couldn't get over the fact that our room was directly over the sand!  If you like hearing the sounds of the ocean, this is the hotel for you!  Sue, the concierge, was a tremendous help in recommending a restaurant for dinner (Cafe Zoolu - YUM!) and the rest of the staff was just as friendly.  This is a luxury hotel with every amenity you can imagine on hand.  We got a great deal because we are on their e-mail list.  Go to their website and sign up!  Only downside is that services and food are a bit pricey so bring in your own snacks and drinks!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great comments regarding your last stay at Surf & Sand! I will make sure to forward this to Susan, the concierge.  As we create our summer menus, we will be sure to keep in mind having items that fit all budgets.  Thank you again, Joanna Bear.

Summary Heading: Over priced and the pool area is under renovation
Summary: When we made our reservations, we were not made aware that we would be unable to use  the pool area because it is under renovation.  Since the ocean is chilly in February, the hotel pool is an important amenity, specially when traveling with kids.  The repairs should be going on for a while.   The hotel usually has an employee providing beach towels, and  assisting with beach chairs and umbrellas.  This was also missing this time around.  At $495.00 per night + parking, it is the least the hotel could do, specially when guests are unable to use the pool.  The shower that is usually available to wash your feet after you leave the beach was closed.  All the sand that guests tract from the beach accumulated on the steps and the only entrance back to the hotel.  This area was a mess

I stayed for one night while attending a business meeting at the hotel. Nice large room with ocean view, flat screen TV, comfortable bed, usual room amenities, although I was surprised not to see a coffee maker. Some noise from nearby rooms, must be why they offer ear plugs. Decent fitness room, although fairly small for a resort this size. I did not have mobile phone reception in my room (lower level). WiFi in room, normally $12.95/day, but charge waived for our group. The pool is currently closed and under renovation.

Summary Heading: Perfect location, excellent rooms, top service, but expensive parking
Summary: It was just great - all rooms face the beach and have a spacious balcony from where to watch the sunset. The room was very spacious, with modern design. The bed was not positioned straight but angled to the wall, which might sound strange but gave the room a special touch.   We had a problem with the iPod docking station (a nice plus) and called the front desk. Within five minutes staff was in the room and changed it, and the front desk called twice, first to confirm that a guy was coming up, and then again after he had left to confirm it was OK. That is excellent customer service!  I had a similar positive experience when I found a cheaper price online and they immediately matched the price.  Internet in the room is supposed to be 12.95/night, also a bit pricey, but when I

We stayed 2 nights in late Dec. 09 for our 17th wedding anniversary and it was wonderful.  From the moment we drove into the driveway, everything was perfect.  Beautiful entry and lobby.  Spectacular service from the valet to front desk to the bell staff to housekeeping.  We had a top floor oceanfront tower room that was truly lovely.  Very spacious, clean and well-appointed while also exuding a feeling of comfort.  The view is unmatched!  Smack on the beach with a never-ending view of the Pacific.  We told Lisa at the front desk that it was our anniversary and she sent us a lovely note and gift -- those kind of generous touches helped make our stay truly memorable.   We had a delicious dinner at Splashes, again with wonderful service. Overall a top notch experience and worth

Summary Heading: They obtained credit preauthorization for charges already paid.
Summary: Beautiful view, beautiful room, but beware. I received the trip as gift from my brother (it was for his niece's wedding, which was held in the resort). He prepaid the room charges, but when I checked in, I was told they needed a credit card in case of incidental expenses. Fine. I gave them the number of my debit card.  Without telling me and without getting my permission, the hotel then obtained preauthorization for the cost of the room, even though it had been paid weeks before. That meant a rather significant hold placed on my checking account.   Incidentally, my brother was not informed that his guests would have their personal credit cards used in this fashion.  I gather this preauthorization is arguably legal, although the common practice, in my experience, is for the hotel

This was the most fantastic hotel EVER! The view is amazing. You have to walk on the balcony to see the sand. Dolphins go by in the morning, walked with the kids to the tidepools, hubby and I had a couples treatment at the FAB spa and it was one of the best I've had. Splashes is great with kids and at night with friends. Terrific food and the wine list had terrific choices. Go straight there and don't leave!

Booked by phone way in advance of arrival and paid $525 a night for the supposed, premium, oceanfront tower, corner King Room.   Reservationist lied to me about room type, location and amenities.  Front desk tried to fix things but was slow.  Got home after vacation,  and checked their price online and found this room was going for the mid $300s.  No one offered a price deduction while I was there and I figured I was overcharged around $400. (2 night stay).  The pluses, staff was super friendly and helpful. Restaurant was outstanding.  Location was unbeatable.  Negatives, only expensive valet parking available, rooms lacked adequate heat, no AC at all, no refrigerators in rooms, grossly overpriced rooms with comparable properties, Spa has only one toilet and  only 2 sinks in the

Summary Heading: Cant get any closer to the beach.........
Summary: this resort was amazing!!! Splashes(the restaurant) was soo romantic and the food was incredible.  This is the closest feeling to Hawaii in California!!

My husband and I come here at least twice a year! The resort is fabulous, and you can not beat the outstanding view!! So close to the ocean it sometimes hits the building!!  The restaraunt Splashes is soooo romantic and the cocktails in the bar are amazing.  You will not be disapointed!!

Best view from a hotel room I have ever had!  Annoying to have to pay $13 for internet.  I was on a business trip so the room was paid for but I would definitely return with my wife.  We had buffet style food in the business meeting which was quite good, so i imagine that the restaurant food would be reasonable as well.  Great location, about 6 miles south of Pelican Hill Golf Course, which is one of the most beautiful courses I have ever played..

My daughter and I choose the Surf and Sand Resort for our "girls getaway" weekend.  We were not disappointed.  Our room was beautiful and spacious, with incredible views of the ocean and Laguna Beach coastline.  We loved everything about the spa.  From the services, to relaxing in the beautiful courtyard before and after our appointments.  The spa services are outstanding...a highlight of our trip.  The staff were exceptional and made us fell like family by the end of our stay.  We're totally sold on the Surf and Sand and plan to make that our sole getaway destination!

Summary Heading: The staff made this a most perfect weekend.
Summary: My wife's only request for our anniversary was to fall asleep and wake up to the sound of the surf at the Surf and Sand. Ninety minutes and a world away from our home in the San Gabriel Valley it was the perfect escape. We were blessed with beautiful weather, but knew that it would not matter. Even in stormy weather it is a little piece of paradise. Every one of the staff made us feel like royalty, the meals were excellent (the cheese platter before dinner was a wonderful assortment of various goodies!) and there is no better view for your money than starting your day (breakfast) above the sand and roiling surf and finishing it with a georgous sunset with Catalina looking close enough to touch.  There is a big difference between 'cost' and 'value', and for my money there is no

We have been coming to the Surf & Sand for years.  My family loves it.  The rooms are beautiful and clean.  The service through out the hotel is spectacular everyone is very friendly.  You can not beilive how close we are to the beach it is sooooo close.  The sound of the waves each night as you watch the sunset.  AAHHH... Breathtaking, I would recommend the Surf & Sand to anyone who wants a nice friendly place to come and enjoy their time away.

My team held a meeting at the S&S - it was a huge success.  Meeting space had ample room, good a/v support and the catering was AWESOME!  Hotel management and catering staff did an excellent job!  Hotel is beautiful and in a great location. They have an excellent chef and helpful staff.  Our sleeping rooms were beautiful and the views spectacular.

Our stay here was supposed to be the grand finale to our honeymoon but turned out to be a hugely disappointing and frustrating end to our trip. We paid nearly 2000 dollars through our travel agent who requested deluxe room. S&S instead gave us the worst room they had, with no privacy whatsoever. We complained and were told that there were no other free rooms (which we very much doubted). The following day when we complained again their response was to move us to an even smaller room, with only moderately more privacy, but still in the inferior building above the pool. For our last night they eventually accepted that we had been badly treated and gave us a penthouse suite but the damage was done at that stage and we couldn't really enjoy it. There were a number of weddings on at

Summary Heading: Great place to relax and enjoy the sun
Summary: Was a great visit.  Was a little more expensive but well worth it.  Laguna is a great little town and having this hotel just up from down town was great.  Far enough away to have peace but close enough for a nice dinner or just a stroll at the beach park.  Great shopping and tons of restaurants.  Our room was beautiful and even though it was slightly warm outside having the doors open and listening to the waves was enough to keep us cool through out the night.  A large fan is also provided if you like it a little more cool.   No airconditioning.  But makes you enjoy the outside so much more instead of holed up in a airconditioned hotel room.  Great views and small but nice beach because not super busy so can enjoy on your own.  Restaurant is pricey and can find just as good in

Good: Location and beach service  Bad: old room that wasn¬¥t very clean            they should have sound proof windows because ocean and people on the beach at night are very loud  But worst, there is a LOT of drinking going on here, I have never seen so many  drunk people in a hotel. Even during daytime I saw a lady crawling on the floor after dropping her room key. Another couldn¬¥t walk straight  at 4 in the afternoon and another woman spilled a drink on me in the elevator ( she was carrying her drink around with her!) Therefor you have a certain crowd of people with not much class. This is a pity because it could be a very nice hotel.  For this scenario it is way overpriced, stay at the Montage instead.

Summary Heading: Lots of Dough to Hear the Ocean Roll
Summary: Stayed there for three nights the middle of August. Thursday night was $380 and Friday and Saturday were $530 for a surf side room in building number 4, right on the water. We got one breakfast thrown in and free valet parking for all nights, but as others have noted, everything else including wifi is extra. Frankly I find it almost unconscionable in this day and age, especially at a property that likes to think of it's of the five star ilk, to charge those kind of rates and then ding the guest for wifi. Thank goodness for my iPhone and 3G even though the reception was not all that great.  The hotel is a bit of a relic, but so is most of Laguna. We travel to Laguna at least once a year and have stayed here before, although it had been a while. The property is old but has been

My wife's wedding ring disappeared from the nightstand at this hotel.  (Totally our fault for having left it there (and not having used the safe.)  We checked out, and a day passed before we realized our mistake.  Fortunately, we live nearby and were heartened to hear no one had stayed in our room during that time. ... Heartened, that is, until we learned that no one on the cleaning staff had returned a ring.  And we were heartbroken after my wife checked every inch of the room herself (even sifting through the vacuum cleaner waste with the head of security, if you can imagine that).  No trace of the ring.  And to top it off, we got a blasse, even incredulous, response from management.  The staff were all long-time, trusted employees, we were told.  It must have gotten swept

Great service, beautiful room with stunning beach front views.  We saw dolphins playing from our balcony and the private beach was well maintained and serviced by helpful staff.    This hotel charges a lot for the extras (parking, room service etc...), but if it's pampering and relaxation you're looking for, then this hotel delivers!  We would visit again.

I have to admit, I had very low expectations before arriving, and especially, when I pulled up and got a glimpse of the 70s-ish brown exterior.  As a Four Seasons lover, I thought I'd made a major tactical error in not choosing Montage or the Ritz.  However...this hotel FAR, FAR exceeded my expectations.  Our room hung over the Pacific Ocean and gave us a sunset view every single night from our patio.  Yes, the crash of the surf is a little loud, but people who complain about drifting off to sleep, and awakening, to the sound of the ocean, perhaps don't have enough in their lives to worry about.  With 2 kids under 6, we loved the convenience of having the beach and pool right there.  You simply can't get any closer.   A warm outdoor shower made sand-exfoliating off 2 boys as

We stayed here for 3 nights. It has the best location - right on the beach. The room (a Junior suite) was spacious and comfortable, with an awesome view. The hideaway bed for the kids was very uncomfortable, but in no time at all, 2 comfortable rollaway beds were delivered to our room. The staff were excellent - friendly and very helpful (front desk, concierge, valet parking, housekeeping, poolside, beach, room service). They made you feel like they couldn't do enough for you. Nothing was a problem for them. The manager's reception was a great bonus - complimentary, delicious food and drink. Nothing is cheap, but you get what you pay for.

I just recieved a flyer for this hotel for summer rate of $475.00 per room for sea view.  It reminded me of awful stay last year where I rented two rooms from my family.   The ugly viewalbe  parking deck below grade as you enter your tower rooms.  The tired furniture.  Small bathrooms.   The beach that has erroded which I must admit is out of the hotel control.  The Surf and Sand has lost class.  Furthermore I felt the customer service was lacking in several respects.  If you are going to spend this kind of money it is well worth looking at the St. Regis, Ritz, Montage.   I used to love this place.  They lost a long time customer who used to come

Summary Heading: Avoid if looking for Ambience - can tell old motel that was rehab'd
Summary: We intended to stay 4 nights in a Jr. Catalina suite (room 440), but checked out after 1 night. At >$600/night, we felt this was way overpriced.  The bedroom was nearly windowless/very small, and overall the fit/finish was not that great.  Our "view" overlooked a gravel roof with seagulls laying on it with the ocean beyond.  Not terribly scenic.  The beach is quite narrow with the building right there, so you don't get a wide open or natural feel at all. The swimming pool is like a postage stamp. Generally, you can tell that this was an "old school" motel from the 50's or 60's that has been renovated, but the renovation doesn't really have a luxury feel at all. We moved to the Ritz Carlton - 10 minutes away - less $$ and not even comparable. The Ritz is full service, gorgeous,

Summary Heading: Costs a fortune & everything else is extra too!
Summary: Beautiful hotel right on the beach with a pool  Expensive and then they charge extra for everything!   No free wifi here although the coffee place had pcs you could use for free - but that was not mentioned in the room info  Nice pool, good size room but housekeeping need a lesson in dusting Access to our room went past a cupboard which was always open with rubbish/housekeeping stuff in. Lots of steps & the hotel map is wrong.  Staff also don't seem to know where the rooms are either.

We stayed in the Ocean Front Tower and were amazed at the view.  The service was the best I've ever experienced and i would LOVE to go back.  They know how to take care of their guests and everytime we called or asked, they jumped to help and went out of their way to make sure we were happy and well served.  Such friendly service is rare, and i would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

Our Anniversary, this May 18. Inspired by all the great reviews and the website. Well...read on. Between the Two Weddings and the huge high schoolers everywhere, i felt like my anniversary weekend was in Fort Lauderdale.  Room 442 smells, and you guys try to cover it up, with a room freshner?   Seriously, i can't believe you rent that room out. There was trash on the ground outside of our room for a whole day.  I mistakenly broke a bottle from the mini bar fridge and called housekeeping to clean it up. And they didn't come .   Two hours later i had to call again, and by then, all the champagne had dried up?  I went to go to the hot tub at 10am on saturday may 17th, and there were 6 adults drinking can's of beer in it. Disgusting.  An entire class, some thirty high schoolers,

Summary Heading: Stunning ocean views with great service
Summary: This is the best spot in the OC -- friendly people, quaint shops, good food.  Beautiful hills lead up to the coast and a wonderful walking beach with tide pools.  The hotel is beautiful.  It's laid out very well with outdoor space for taking in the views at every turn.    The service is really wonderful.  We stayed in the oceanfront three-story building.  The balconies gave us absolutely stunning sunset views.  A great wine/cheese shop down the street gave us the rest.
