The rooms are so close to the water that apparently some guests complain about the ocean noise.  But we slept great both nights.  The rooms are a bit outdated -- especially considering the price per night.  The carpet was a little worn, and the bathrooms were nothing special.  There did not seem to be any air

We stayed in the Vista Suite on a weekday so the price was more reasonable. The place doesn't really live up to the hype....yet it was still beautiful.  ROOM: Plush & relaxing.....it was overcast during our stay so we couldn't get full use out of our sun deck. Loved the style and small touches.  FOOD: It was 'alright'....I'd expect more from this resort. We only ate lunch there and then went out for the rest of our stay. We visited Savory's and the coffee shop across the street.  SERVICE: Excellent, we checked in very early and were taken care of by all the staff (Valet, Spa, Restaurant, Check-in). They were polite and down-to-earth. We would recommend this resort to friends.

We really liked this location and the quality of the facilities.  However when we needed help, the bellman was not interested.  Finding our room was a challenge and when the front desk asked the bellman to help us he declined (once he learned that we didn't need his help with our small bag).  That was a bad start that after 3 days was offset by a great location and nice facility.

Summary Heading: Hotel in Paradise right on the Beach
Summary: We have just returned from a fantastic stay at the Surf & Sand Resort. The hotel is right on the beach with views over the Pacific Ocean and ear plugs provided if the sound of crashing waves is too much for you! All staff were very helpful and although a bit more expensive than we would normally pay - well worth it. Located 1 mile from the Centre of Laguna with plenty of bars/restaurants within walking distance. Car park $30 per night issteep but we parked in the street about 3 minute walk from the hotel without cost. The valet helped us with our hire car when we had trouble with the trunk en route to LAX. A great hotel with fantastci views, pool and deck.

Summary Heading: The Ocean Shushed Me to Sleep! Romantic!
Summary: What a romantic anniversary weekend! We were delighted with the Surf and Sand hotel, which is right on a lovely sandy beach. Staff were excellent throughout our stay...the valets were astoundingly quick, the staff at Splashes restaurant were friendly and professional.   We booked Surfside room #410, furthest north on the property, which is the quieter end. Our room was on the 1st floor, with a balcony right over the sand... At high tide the waves were just below us. From our balcony we saw sandpipers darting about the edge of the surf, and at night, there was a path of moonlight on the ocean. Beautiful.  Very nice homes share the beach front with this hotel. In January, the beach is peaceful, without any of the summer crowds. The hotel is right on the sand.   Our King bed was

Beautiful Hotel. Stayed there for 2 nights and really couldnt be happier. Alot of times you see amzaing pictures before you go to a hotel and are disappointed once you get there (the room, prox to beach, etc)....this place is right on the beach and has spectacular views up and down the coast. Walking distance to shops, but probably not walking distance for many all the way downtown.

After a disappointment on Coronado Island, I promptly booked the Surf and Sand in Laguna as the off season price was competitive. With a room located right on the beach and all the attractions in Laguna, its hard to beat the Surf and Sand for price/quality return on investment. The rooms have LCD flat televisions, in room movies you can order, plus a dvd player. There is a business center on site if you need to print items. If you can get a corner room, its a plus. We stayed on the top floor floor with a corner view and had great views of the Pacific Ocean and Northern beaches.  The only comment on the Surf and Sand is that it looks like after the last time I was here four years ago it could use new carpet and some paint touch up in the restrooms and on some doors. The overall

The hotel is located right on the beach - you can hear the waves at all times! Staff was very friendly and responsive to our requests. The rooms were nice but we only spent time there at night - we were outside all day exploring the beach and town. While we were at the hotel, the crowd was an interesting mix of people from Los Angles, the East Coast, Europe and Russia.  We really liked the bar that is right above the beach - we saw a great sun set while enjoying an adult beverage! There are a number of very good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel (the concierge was very helpful). I did find it odd that the hotel did not have a shuttle to take people down town (20-25 mt walk) for dinner.  Being a dog lover, I was happy to see a number of dogs in the hotel (assume

Loved the Surf and Sand!  Called and made a reservation that day and got a great rate.   The room was absolutely amazing...literally hanging over the ocean.  Big and spacious! Very clean. Really beautiful bar and restaurant overlooking the ocean.  Expensive parking but the valets were very quick!  The hallways are open and it was cold out.. but I image it would be perfect if the weather was nice!    Can't wait to come back!

Summary Heading: did not live up to expectations
Summary: I booked a romantic one night stay for my husband and I. upon arrival, we were told our room wasnt ready and reminded (with an attitude) that rooms were only guaranteed after 4pm (somewhat late compared to many other hotels we;ve visited). we were told - it should only be a few minutes, we'll call you as soon as the room is ready. that didnt happen so we waited until after 4 and were eventualy handed the key with no apology or reference to our wait.   when we arrived to the room it was blasting hot. it was a warm afternoon and the room faced the direction of the sun. the glass patio door was closed so it felt like a solarium. we tried to turn on the A/C to no avail. when I called the front desk, I was told that many of the rooms dont have AC (not sure then what the control was

The hotel offers valet parking, but no Valet greeted us until after we had already unloaded the car. We had reserved a 2 bedroom Penthouse suite, which we found was located on the 5th floor right next to a stairwell. At the top of the stairwell was the ventilation system for the restaurant. The ventilation system vibrated and was so noisy that it echoed loudly throughout the stairwell and into the suite itself. We complained but were told that there were no other 2 bedroom suites other than the ones on our floor. We were told that the ventilation system would be turned off at 10 PM, however it remained running until 11:45 PM.   The 2 bedroom suites are located directly above the pool and restaurant so it stays noisy until late in the evening. The rooms are lacking in cleanliness

My wife needed to stay here in conjunction with a business conference she attended.  Right on the beach is hard to beat.  We were only there for a few days and a raw sewage spill nearby  closed the beach.  Not the hotels fault though.  They have a great pool, and hot tub.  Rooms were clean and beds were great.  Well, we thought the furnishings were a bit dated to the 70's or 80's but everything worked.  Our room did have a LG LCD TV in it though.  But who stays right on the beach to stay in their room anyway?  Some other reviewers mentioned being bothered by the sound of the ocean.  Being from Kansas we enjoyed it.  We did have one of the rooms overlooking the pool and thus were a little further away than some other rooms.  Surf and Sand does not have air conditioning, but we

Summary Heading: Awesome Location, Nice Accomodations, OK service
Summary: You can't beat the location.  The hotel is located right on the beach and lives up to it's name as the surf crashes non-stop on the beach, sometimes causing your room to shake.  They do provide ear plugs for guests who don't like the sound, but I like it.  Otherwise, the restaurant is OK, the waterfront bar is nice, and the room service is pretty good.  The overall service at the hotel can't compete with some of the larger and more well-known properties down the street (Ritz, St. Regis), but I don't think that concerns them.  The only other drawback is that there is no A/C and it can get hot even though you're right on the beach.  It's probably only an issue for them for about 10 - 20 days a year, but I always go over Labor Day when it is an issue.  I would absolutely recommend

Summary Heading: Not the best in Laguna but not the worst either
Summary: We arrived at the hotel on Christmas Day. The lobby was nicely decorated for Christmas, there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room. Our room was right on the water. Laguna is a beautiful town and I have spent a lot of time there so I can say that although the view from the room was beautiful, that's par for the course in Laguna. I didn't think this hotel was anything special (especially when considering the price). The actual halls leading to the rooms almost reminded me of a motel. It just doesn't have that "luxury" feel to it. I was not impressed. My advice is stay at The Montage. The Montage is right up the road, far more luxurious and an even better view.   Other than that I can say I could see how kids would like it. Think "a nice Hyatt on the water" and you

The Surf and Sand is the quintessential ocean side hotel. We stayed in a suite up on the top floor, and the roar of the ocean could still be heard as if it were right in our room. The suite was beautifully decorated and comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable and even the couch was a great for napping spot. There were two very cool features; there's a dim orange light that you can turn on under the bed to create a very romantic atmosphere. And there is a mirror over the balcony section so that if you are lying on the couch, you can see what's happening down on the beach. Very cool!  The only drawback to our room is that the balcony was smaller than most (though the bedroom was bigger), but that was okay as we could still sit half in/half out of our room and get the full

We stayed at the Surf and Sand for the first time and loved it!!!  It is very relaxing and the staff were great. The Towers rooms were beautuiful and the views were wonderful! The balconies in the Towers rooms have a table, 2 chairs, and ottomons.  We ordered room service for dinner and loved eating out on the balcony.  Room service was cheaper than eating dinner at Splashes but Splashes was also enjoyable. We had previously booked a room at the new Seven4one hotel but were forceds to cancel when our credit card was charged for a cancelled room without any resolution until disputing the charge with our credit card company.  However, the stay at Surf and Sand was wonderful and we ended up being happy that we didn't stay at Seven4one.  I believe that a comparable rom at Seven4one

Summary Heading: Luxury and location, we will definitely be back
Summary: We booked the Surf and Sand based on recommendations of friends and of TA reviewers.  I was a little nervous because of some negative reviews, but we did not experience anything like that at all!  We LOVED this place, the location and services were unbeatable.  Just top-notch all the way....I don't even know where to start.  The rooms were great - we stayed in the king tower room, with a balcony overlooking the ocean.   The room was large, with a large bathroom and jacuzzi tub, fluffy towels, nice sheets, flat screen tv, dvd player, ipod station, etc etc.  Staff was available and quick to respond to any requests.  No air conditioning was not a problem at all, even though it was in the high 80's on some days.  The breeze from the ocean was absolutely cool and refreshing, and if

This is a truly wonderful resort and we will definitely go back on our next visit to southern California.  The room was very comfortable with good facilities and the balcony had the most fantastic view of the sunset over the Pacific.  It was wonderful to go to sleep hearing the sound of the ocean.    We ate once in the restaurant, which was excellent but there are so many other places to eat at in Laguna that we didn't return.  During our stay, there were free shuttle buses into the town centre, but you can walk in about 20 minutes.  The children loved running between the pool and the sea, both of which were lovely and warm in August.    The staff were all brilliant ... managing to be efficient whilst maintaining a friendly and informal atmosphere.

we spent 3 nights here and could have stayed much longer. It is the most beautiful position with just the sound of the ocean at night. A really friendly laid-back hotel. The rooms were just fantastic, huge and beautifully designed. The only criticism was the restaurant which was way over-priced for very average food. This wasn't a problem because there were plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.

Summary Heading: fabulous and memorable for all the right reasons
Summary: My family just got back to the East Coast from the West Coast and Surf & Sand Resort.    We all loved it....  there are lots of employees walking around wanting to help in any way they can.... one's every wish is made to come true, think chocolate-covered strawberries and champagne, beautiful sunsets, wonderful view, clean and quiet room (aside from the loud surf that we love) and food to be had on the property and very near - scrambled eggs and toast from across the street , or resort breakfast.   Free, fun, often-running Trolley everywhere we needed to go, never took our car out of the garage until it was time to leave ( a wk later), a nice sized diner with fabulous food via trolley in one direction, Mexican , Italian and several other restaurants walking or trolley in the

I had researched extensively the hotels in the Laguna area as I am very picky when it comes to cleanliness, food quality and resort location.  I was really pleased on all levels with our stay at Surf and Sand.  We were there in late July and while it did get a little warm some days,  the breeze off the ocean cooled off our room nicely.   The sound of the ocean was so relaxing.  Plenty of great restaurants and shops within walking distance.   We had breakfast served every morning on our private patio just feet from the ocean.  My fiancee and I have already discussed going back (possibly when the rates are a bit cheaper!)  The staff was very friendly and helpful...front desk staff even gave us tips as to best time of year to visit again when rates are cheaper and Laguna not so
Great room, service and views!!! Love staying here.

We were in the Laguna area August 10-12 for which we booked a premier deluxe ocean view king room . Upon opening the door  to the room we were shocked at the temperature inside the room. Facing the west sun, (ocean view)  the room was stifling hot on this particular 94 degree day. I called the  front desk to inquire only to learn the resort is "A/C free". I felt this was unacceptable for a room costing $600/night. The manager reluctantly issued me a credit on my credit card.     For the money, I felt the property should at the very least offer air conditioning . No where on their web site is this mentioned to unsuspecting guests.

From the start to the finish, this hotel is outstanding in every way.  My best friend and I wanted a great place on the beach (and we've tried others at Laguna before) and this was it.  All the staff has a "Yes" attitude which is what I need when I truly want to relax . . . no hassles at all.  The room we had on the 8th floor was very roomy and nicely decorated.  When you enter the room, the first view you get is an unobstructed view of the Pacific Ocean . . . nice!  If there is anything missing from the room (we wanted a microwave, the mini bar emptied and a coffee maker), the staff is there immediately with your every wim.  The bar downstairs is just awesome (try the flat bread pizza with your martini . . . yum!) and the open windows allow the ocean breeze to gently cool you.

Summary Heading: casual combo of surf, sand, and dining
Summary: Good beach resort. Ample, but not extensive, beach services and amenities. Definitely plan to return to Surf and Sand.  Surf is loud! This was great for us, because the sound of the waves was one of the attractions to booking Surf & Sand Resort.  All rooms in towers building have a balcony directly above beach, overlooking beach and waves perhaps 25 feet horizontally away. Balcony fits 2 chairs, each with ottomans, and table. Had room service one evening, to watch the sunset.  Surfside rooms have similar balconies, except smaller and without ottomans.  "seaside" rooms overlook the pool and are much farther back from the beach.  There are many other places to stay in Laguna Beach, right on the beach off Pacific Coast Highway. Surf and Sand Resort appeared to have the best

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Place - No a/c was no problem at all
Summary: We've just returned from a fanatastic stay at this hotel. We had sea view rooms, and the rooms were unbeatable, really spacious and bright with fantastic views of the waves crashing, also saw several dolphins. We were a little worried beforehand by the tripadvisor reviews that said there was no a/c at the hotel,  however, that was no problem at all. I normally love to have the a/c on full blast freezing everyone when were in hotels, but it did not bother me one bit. The celing fan and also separarte electric fan were just fine - and i do like the room to be quite cold!!  Food was good in the hotel, the restaurant is right on the beach and has great views. Breakfast could be bit hit and miss, generally very good, but some mornings better than others - very good menu for

1. Our room was not ready, so we decided to get some lunch down stairs and than we waited and waited still know room. Than when we inquired about our room, we were told that it would be ready in a few minutes, we continued to wait. Finally we were told that it would be ready in five minutes and we continued to wait.   2. When we finally got our room it was gross and unacceptable. The carpet was black, the room was dirty, the glasses in the room looked like they were rinsed out placed on the bar for our use with Coke still in them and there was mold growing in the shower. When we brought this to the attention of the manager on duty and she saw the condition of the room, she agreed.    3. So on the second day of our four days at your resort we had people cleaning our carpet all

I stayed at the Surf and Sand for 4 nights. The property is very conveniently located within walking distance of most of the shops and restaurants in Laguna Beach (this is why we chose to say there). The decor is beachy and perhaps a bit dated in the hotel rooms (needed new carpeting, I thought). Our corner room was very spacious and had beautiful views of the Pacific ocean. The bathroom was spacious, clean and fairly well maintained (had separate tub and shower). I would not describe the feel of the property as luxurious, elegant  or staid (like Montage resort). It is beachy, somewhat casual and fun.  We had requested a room at the end of the hallway and this request was honored. We walked into the room and my travel companion immediately began looking for the temperature

Summary Heading: If you love the sound of the ocean, this is the place for you!!
Summary: I went their with my boyfriend to celebrate his graduation. We purchased the 60th anniversary package where we received a 2 night stay, $60 credit to the spa or the restaurant Splashes, free breakfast, and daily gifts. We arrived early for R&R, the room was not ready so we waited about 4 hours by the water, that was a bummer, but received free drink coupons. When the room was ready, we were greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of bubbly, the bellman brought us an extra bottle too! The room was clean and beautiful, they have an Ipod hook up so that was exciting. Since we love the sound of the ocean, we slept with the windows open. Our room was above the pool on the 3rd floor, a great location and an amazing view. The only problem is that there was a bunch of

I loved the Surf & Sand and it's location right on the beach!  The rooms were terrific and the bed VERY comfortable.  But the crashing waves, while lovely to listen to during the day, were too much for my husband when he was trying to sleep, so we closed our sliding glass door.  Well, it was sooooo warm in our room at about 2am, that I had to give in and open the door again.  No air conditioning in a hotel that charges over $500 for these rooms!!!!  That's the one thing that would keep me from going again.  Otherwise, nice staff and great views.

The Surf and Sand was the most perfect spot for my husband and I to celebrate our 10th anniversary.  It was hard to decide between this property, The Ritz and The Montage.  We are devoted Ritz patrons but took a risk and were so thrilled.  We wanted to stay somewhere less formal and this is the perfect beach hotel.  While in Laguna we walked around the Ritz and The Montage, and also dined at Studio at Montage, so I saw first hand that we made the right decision.  The Surf and Sand is so lovely - the rooms were really big and all clean and white.  The bed was so much more comfy than the Ritz beds and even Heavenly beds at Westins.  We were actually worried the ocean would be too loud, given what other reviews said.  It wasn't.  Our sleep was perfect.   The bathroom is a little

Right from the start me and my buddies were treated like royalty, upgraded to a bigger room as soon as we got there for free.   Got to our room and it was better than any 4-5 Star that I could remember.   The staff waited on us hand and foot and even brought stuff from our car which had been valeted so we didnt have to.   We were given complimentary wine and a few other things as soon as we got there.   The setup was very nice with a bunch of couches outside on the patio facing the water.  The view was amazing with the ocean right behind us but also there happened to be a lot of women walking around :P    When we left we were not charged for parking which was an added bonus.   Bottom line is this place is absolutely worth the stay, I will stay here for sure next time I come down.

My friend invited me to join her on a "girlfriend getaway" to the Surf and Sand Resort in Laguna Beach.  The hotel rooms were incredibly spacious and clean and the view from  the balcony was to die for.  The ocean was literally steps away.  The balcony provided the perfect setting for sun bathing, reading, or sipping a glass of wine at sunset.  Surf and Sand is walking distance from downtown, so you really don't need to drive around.  Also, the food at Splashes is absolutely delicious.  My friend actually won the stay as a gift, so all we had to pay for were our meals and drinks. Though the rooms are pricey, after staying here, I can say it's worth it and I would definitely come back.  My only negative is that the proximity of the rooms to the ocean can make it difficult to

Summary Heading: From the ocean crashing to the sun sparkling on the water.......Sublime.
Summary: Loved everything about the place........... The room was wonderful.  Spotless, comfortable, well appointed.  The turn down service made me smile at the end of a fun evening!! The ocean delivered sensory delights every day. The bar was fun.  The restaurant was good.  Work out room well equiped. We walked to many great places downtown  (230, K'ya, Sapphire Grill - to name a few).  Our last afternoon, we sat on the balcony, ordered a cheese and fruit plate and drank some bubbly and watched the sun go down.  Ahhhh - California dreaming.

My husband and I stayed four nights in a corner tower room.  We hesitated booking after reading some of the reviews here but are so glad we did!  Fabulous location, beautifully redone rooms, gracious staff.  The restaurant is a bit pricey, but the view is incredible.  Very attentive and courteous staff on the beach as well.

Having  been to Laguna twice before and stayed at the Ritz at Dana Point (and loved it), my husband and I decided to give the Surf and Sand a try after finding a great deal on Luxury Link.  We had spent two fantastic vacations at the Ritz and were hesitant to try S&S because we had loved our first two trips so much, but we were so glad that we decided to do it!  Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a corner king room on a high floor in the tower right on the beach.  The room was absolutely fantastic, and the chaise was a perfect place to lie and read looking at the surf.  The concierge was particularly helpful in arranging a car for us to visit the Temecula wineries (we highly recommend Ponte).  The pool was lovely with good service and a beatiful view of the beach.  It never got

We live near the coast in California and go on beach vacations elsewhere frequently.  The Surf and Sand still blew us away!  We weren't expecting much - a quick local getaway.  We were deciding between Ritz, Montage and Surf and Sand, but the hotel recommendations on TripAdvisor when we booked were so enthusiastic that we chose the S&S.  Our expectations were exceeded!  Our room in the Surfside Tower (the area they recommend for romantic trips - there are only king beds, so no kids) was beautifully decorated in contemporary white.  It was not huge, but the ocean view was to die for.  Even living near the beach, this stretch of ocean has thundering surf, gorgeous rocks - and you are right on top of the waves.  Splashes was delicious - and the price, which someone complained about

Summary Heading: Romantic Setting, but OverPriced (Nickled and Dimed)
Summary: Great OceanFront Location! My only complaint is the Rack Rate and Parking Rate and Spashes Food Prices!

I never write reviews but after reading some of the negative reviews, I felt compelled.  A friend of mine described this hotel as "dreamy" and I agree!  The service was prompt and superbly friendly.  When requested, our room was upgraded on arrival and arrangements were made to get us checked into the room early.  This was a bonus but I imagine in the high season this is more rare.  The hotel is an open-air complex but I would consider it VERY far from a motel.  It is a large hotel with a small intimate feel.  It is ocean front with very easy access to the beach.  This is not the case at all hotels in Laguna given the bluff landscape of the area.  You received champagne on arrival and turn-down service each night.  It is pricey but worth it -- especially if you are looking for

Stayed here on our honeymoon.  Valet and front desk were unfriendly.  Front desk took credit card info I was thinking for anything we wanted to charge to room... ended up they charged my entire stay 'again' and it had been prepaid at the time vacation was booked.  Didn't know that until I tried to use cc for outside purchases.  Yes, it was a new credit card with a small credit limit only for use on our honeymoon... that ended up tying up our credit for the enitre time of our stay...  and hours with credit card company on the phone to see why we couldn't use it... Anyway it's a beautiful location.. hotel is older and resturant isn't all that.. def go outside hotel for dining...  We stayed in the smaller building which was nice and just about on the sand...  Laguna is a beautiful

Unfortunately, this hotel was a big disappointment.  It really looks and feels like a motel that they have tried to renovate over the years.  It is RIGHT on the beach, so if that is what you are looking for, then it might be the place for you.  Otherwise for the price, it is a major disappointment.  The room was ocean facing with a balcony, but the it was very small and the bathroom was tiny.  Not the place if you are looking for something luxurious.

This was our first time in Laguna and we could not have been more impressed. My girlfriend and I were looking for a romantic getaway and it was perfect. Right when we got there, we were immediately upgraded for free to the ocean tower on the 7th floor. The room is not just on the ocean, but you can see the ocean from your pillow when you wake up. It almost looks like you are on a cruise ship, the view is that good. They even give you ear plugs because the ocean is so loud. They also had a dvd player, ipod stereo, 42inch plasma tv, along with other novelties like sea shells and sand in the guide book. The bed was also amazing. We used the new gym facilities, that was very good for a hotel and provides head phones and water bottles. The concierge did a great job recommending local

Summary Heading: View dolphins and whales from your bed
Summary: Stayed here with the family for 10 nights over christmas and new year. 2nd floor tower block. Woke up most mornings to see dolphins and whales swim past the room. Didnt even have to leave the bed!  Service was excellent. Was provided with a christmas tree. Also kids given choice of presents. Received a bottle of wine and christmas cake on christmas eve.  Were given a bottle of champagne on new years eve.  All staff were really friendly.  Their website images of the hotel dont do it justice.  Splashes food was excellent.   Never heard any noise from PCH. Could hear the waves all night though, which was very relaxing.

We can't say enough positive things about this resort.  We stayed for one night as a getaway from LA.  We were automatically upgraded to an ocean view room on arrival and a complimentary bottle of champagne was brought up with our luggage.   The view of the ocean from our room is the best we've had in California... It reminded us of Maui.   We had a drink in the bar (and one of the better crabcakes we've enjoyed) that is literally at the water's edge and doesn't have a bad seat in it.  The restaurant, Splashes, is first- rate and also has a great view of the ocean.  Compliments to the chef for using fresh ingredients to make delicious CA cuisine without over-salting or sweetening.  We planned to go to French 75, a well-liked restaurant across the street from the hotel, but

My wife and I got married in Dana Point and chose to spend our first two nights as a married couple here; we were not disappointed.  As most others have noted, the hotel furnishings, location, etc are all wonderful.  However, what really impressed us was the hotel staff.  The service is really in my mind what makes this hotel stand out.  They did an excellent job of making our stay memorable.  We were given a room upgrade (5th floor corner room in the Towers), free parking, champagne, wine and chocolates delivered to our room throughout our stay (do make sure to mention any special occasion you might be celebrating when you check in).  Every time we asked an employee to do anything they exceeded our expectations in promptness and courtesy.  The concierge made us a reservation at

I have stayed at Surf a couple of times in the past couple of years as a nice one night getaway from San Diego.  I have really enjoyed all of my stays but this last one was over the top perfect.  Upon check-in we asked if there were any upgraded rooms available, as we usually do b/c it never hurts to ask, and discovered that no one was staying in the Two Bedroom Penthouse Suite for the night.  We asked if we could stay in there, and a couple of minutes later we were entering the 1,150 sq ft suite.  Absolutely beautiful with wood floors, great view (obviously) from the top of the hotel, very large bathrooms, fire place, and dining area.  Usually on our trips to Surf we go to the Splashes bar for some cocktails and appetizers.  This time, however, we decided to make a night of it

I have stayed at this hotel on and off since 1980.  One of my favorite hotels.  Gorgeous scenery.  The food is fantastic and the people are so wonderful.  I would recommend this wonderful place to anyone.

Summary Heading: A really hot hotel -- and not in a good way
Summary: This is a lovely property (although not quite as lovely as their rack rate might suggest), but it has a major deal-breaker: NO AIR CONDITIONING!!!  Perhaps the climate here at night is usually mild and the rooms cool off from the ocean breeze, but this week it's very hot out (90's) and there's no wind. My room is sweltering. Even if it weren't brutally hot out, I can't imagine that anyone would want to sleep with the balcony door open because the ocean is very loud -- so loud that the hotel provides earplugs on every nightstand.  There's really no excuse for a hotel in North America in 2007 not to have air conditioning -- and not to advise their potential guests in advance of this fact.  The hotel itself is very well maintained (although the elevators seem to keep breaking down)

I stayed at the Surf and Sand Resort for business.  It was a great hotel!  I wish I would have stayed longer and invited my husband to come out after my meeting for a weekend!  The hotel staff was very nice.  The rooms were large with a sofa area, flat screen TV, and "off-white" tranquil decor.  The bed had a neat light underneath, so it "glowed" at night.  It was interesting and funny trying to figure out how to turn it off.  There were tons of buttons for all of the lights, but I finally figured it out!  I had a great ocean view room, I enjoyed taking in the views of the blue sky and blue ocean!  The restaurant was very trendy with very good food.  The portion sizes were just right, very California-like.  The hotel also had a very nice pool by the restaurant with great ocean

Summary Heading: Can not imagine staying anywhere else
Summary: I decided on the hotel because of its location on the beach but was a little apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews on Travel Advisor. I really can not understand how anyone would have even one negative comment. The hotel, the staff, the service and the location were all top notch. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the country and this certainly competes with the best. The staff honored all of out requests including a very early check in. We received complimentary champagne on arrival and drinks in their oceanfront bar. The pool area was great and the service there impeccable as well. If you prefer to sit at the beach it is only steps away and complimentary chairs and umbrellas are set up for you there without question. The spa treatments were first

Summary Heading: Very friendly and helpful service!! Wouldn't stay anywhere else!
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at Surf and Sand for 6 days, 5 nights. The service was remarkable! Any questions about the area where answered within minutes by friendly hotel staff. We also needed an earlier check-in and later check-out due to flight times which they accomodated for without question. Although our room was not ready, we had full service of the property (pool, beach, spa, etc). Also, before we stayed at Surf and Sand we read many reviews about how horrible it was without air conditioning. I for one NEED a.c. to sleep comfortably, however, with the fans and ocean breeze, I was freezing all night long and needed extra blankets. No a.c. was no problem at all for us. We hope to visit Surf and Sand again next year and I recommend it to anyone who wants a romantic get away.

Great location on a fairly quiet beach.  Within a mile of the main shops and restaurants.  Our room was right over the water and VERY romantic.  The resort has a great pool and hottub.  The rooms are a good size.  Our room had a king size bed and nicely appointed bathroom.  Restaurant at the hotel is top notch, so you don't even have to go anywhere if you don't feel like it.  There are lots of stairs if you stay in the surfside rooms so its probably not a great spot for older people.  Also, the surf is LOUD!  My wife and I didn't mind, but I couldn't believe how loud the surf is at night.  Kind of a funny oversight.  If you are a light sleeper you want a tower room on an upper floor.  Regardless, I would recommend this to anyone wanting a nice romantic place for a getaway.

Summary Heading: Surf and Sand - Tight but could be Tighter
Summary: Booked our stay through Travelocity because when we called the Surf and Sand directly, they were all booked.  On arrival day, we called the hotel at 3:15 PM to say we were arriving a bit later than 4PM.  They didn't show our reservation.  We stayed on the line with the hotel while we called Travelocity on another phone, and while on hold with both parties, Surf and Sand came back on saying they could check us in.  We were  never told what had happened but it was quite unsettling.  What if this had occurred when we got there, causing us to stand in the lobby waiting for things to be straightened out-hardly how we wanted to start our vacation.  Travelocity was still on hold when we left for the hotel as we could wait no longer for them to come back on line.  PROS:  On arrival, the

Summary Heading: One Monumental Step Away from Perfection
Summary: My wife and I stayed with our two young children at the Surf & Sand in Laguna for a week in July of 2007 in a one bedroom Penthouse suite.  Overall, we had a positive experience, but I need to start my review with one negative that was so significant that it will probably prevent us from returning, at least during the summer.  Virtually none of the rooms and suites at this property have air conditioning.  At these 5-star price points (I paid over $1200 per night), one shouldn't have to suffer with a warm or stuffy room.  During the day it's a little uncomfortable, and at night the only way to stay comfortable is to open the sliding door, which cools the room but also makes it challenging to sleep due to the incessant sound of crashing waves.  In fairness, my wife enjoyed the

Summary Heading: A Slice of Heaven at the Surf and Sand
Summary: The Surf and Sand has the best of everything...the sounds, smells, feel of the ocean is right there, surrounding you.  If you don't like white sandy beaches, with powerful surf then don't go to the Surf n Sand.   The service was impeccable, the rooms are updated with all the latest and the food is everything you would expect from a top notch California chef.  I did not want to be any where else.  We stayed in a suite with a wonderful balcony overlooking the turquoise water with white foamy surf of the Pacific Ocean.  I loved it and want to go back!

Vista suite is beautiful - the large deck made the room which is a good size feel huge. Everything abouth the resort was really good except that they do need airconditioning. In a regular room you could open the sliding doors and cool room down howewer in Vista suite the bedroom is right in the back so it was difficult to cool down as was the bathroom. At $1200 per night - we should not have had that issue - other than that view, service and food was superb.

This is a difficult place to review, because the location is so good and the property is quite classy so those factors are likely to dwarf any other issues.  We stayed 4 nights and had a really memorable time there. Sleeping with the waves crashing outside is wonderful, if you sleep well! My wife and teenage family thought the place was great.  The rooms were ocean front double queens and were nice and certainly clean, modern, well equipped and very comfortable with wonderful views.  However, I have stayed in some great hotels round the world and at $600 per night this should be comparable and frankly it wasn't. The location is truly excellent, but the service (which marks out really good hotels) was lacking. Any request typically required 2-3 repeats to get activated and I gave

So we stayed for 2 nights in the King Surfside room on the 1st Floor. The hotel itself has nice grounds and amazing location on the beach. However for $575 per night there were definitely problems. First it felt like we were in a dungeon in the hallway to our room (1st floor problem).  (I think the Tower rooms must be nicer but they were more $$). When we got to the room the view of the ocean is fantastic so I guess it makes up for it. I know the hotel was recently renovated and the room was nice but really not that great. THe sliding glass door to the balcony was rusty and hard to open and close, the shower door was missing the plastic which keeps the water in and it ended up all over the bathroom each time, the toilet ran every 20 min which was irritating at night and the

It's been about 8 years since I've been back to the Surf & Sand.  This time, I brought my husband who'd never been here but only heard about.  I was really excited to take him to the property but what was so wonderful was how the experience exceeded what I remembered!  Back then it was wonderful - this time it was excellent!    We arrived 4 hours early - since check in was at 3 pm.  The front desk staff apologized to us for not having a room ready and gave us free drink coupons in their bar!  We weren't expecting anything since we knew we were early and here they were apologizing to us!  After about 45 minutes, we were called and our room was ready early!  We also arrived to a bottle of chilled champagne in our room.  I believe every guests receives it when checking in.  We had

I contacted this hotel at 11pm on a Saturday night, as we were down the street at a dump!  They had a room available from Sunday through Friday night.  I went by  (in my PJ's) and they were more than accomodating.  Offered me free parking (saving the $27 per night).  We checked in at 9am the next morning and I was thoroughly impressed with everyone from the front desk, to housekeeping, to the pool boys.  The place is contstantly being cleaned, they go above and beyond my wildest thoughts.    When I contacted the front desk to tell them how happy we were, they gave us a free movie for the kids to watch.  We had 2 queen beds, a gorgeous view of the ocean with dolphins and everything.  Upon checking out, I questioned some of the charges and they instantly reversed them.  I whole

My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon at Laguna Beach.   This hotel was gorgeous.  The staff was beyond friendly and helpful, and the view from the rooms were amazing.  It was easy to find your way around the property, easy to get to shops around town, and very easy access to the beach, pool, and restaraunt.  The beach staff was awesome, we came back a few hours later and they remembered where we were sitting and set our chairs and umbrella up in the same spot.  If you're looking for a vaca. to just lay around the beach, or even your room and relax, this is definitely the place to go.

Summary Heading: Great time at the Surf & Sand
Summary: My husband and 4 year old daughter stayed here while on business for 3 days.  We absolutely loved our stay.  The view from the balcony is 2nd to none.  The pool and beach access is terrific- my 4 year old loved being able to go from the beach to the pool and back to the beach.  The pool staff treated her really nicely. Good poolside service as well- food and drinks were great.  The beach area is nice for digging in the sand and running in the waves. The rooms were a little small, but very comfortable.  Only drawback would be if it was really hot with no air conditioning- luckily, that wasn't an issue for us- but, I could see how it would be if it was over 90 degrees out.  Good location- close to downtown.  I would stay again.

This is a high-end hotel in a high-end destination.  You should expect to pay a LOT of money.  The Surf & Sand is not nearly as fancy as the nearby Montage Resort or Ritz Carlton, nor is the restaurant as good, but the Montage and the Ritz are more expensive than the Surf & Sand.  Then again, some might say that the Montage and the Ritz are over the top.  The distinguishing characteristic of the Surf & Sand is that the hotel is right on the ocean, with every room facing the ocean, and with waves breaking under your balcony.  The Montage and Ritz are set back from the ocean, so you don't get this experience.  Some people are kept awake by the waves, even with the sliding balcony door shut and even using the complementary ear plugs.  Other people are lulled to sleep by the waves

This is one of the nicer hotels in Laguna Beach. We booked a two bedroom suite. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large and had two large balconies overlooking the pacific ocean. They were remodeling the suites next to our room so every morning early until early evening we heard nothing but construction noise, so this was disturbing. The manager credited our account for a full night after checkout. Other than that this was a nice, comfortable place.

Summary Heading: Great place for business or pleasure!
Summary: I was at this hotel for a business meeting and spent two nights.  They thought of everything!  Earplugs (in case the surf was too noisy for you), plush towels, great turndown service and the housekeeping was unseen and very efficient.     The one restaurant was under renovation and if you were thinking of a nap or want to sleep in, I would not suggest the place as the workers were noisy.  Business facilities and food were above average and great service from the wait staff with clearing dishes, keeping glasses full and over ambience.     Business meeting rooms were more than adequate to accommodate our group (about 50 people).

Summary Heading: Bad experience at Surf and Sand
Summary: The view is marvelous, but our experience was not at all good.  The valet service was terrible, and although the front desk people were friendly, some of the staff was incompetent.  The hotel adds unexpected charges on top of very high prices.  They charge $27 a day for a car (valet parking is required), plus the expected tips,  although the hotels on both sides offer free parking for their guests as well as far more reasonably priced rooms. I do NOT recommend this hotel!

So, first you should know that my review is a bit influenced by the fact that I didn't have to pay for it. This was a due-diligence trip for a real-estate investment and it was copletely provided by them...not me. That being said, once you open the door to your room here (all ocean views), your jaw will drop. We immediately went to the white washed floor to ceiling shutters...opened them...and saw nothing but ocean!!! We actually had to belly up to the safety rail to look down & see beach. A HUGE flat-screened T.V. covered one wall and mirrors covered the other. They've even added IPOD stereos for playing your favorite music, which is such a great idea.The bathroom was as luxurious as it could be but very small...it's weird to see a 5 star worthy restroom at a fourth the size.

Summary Heading: Water streaming from ceiling lights is 'normal'; Hidden charges everywhere.
Summary: Arriving in the room, we found a clean, nicely furnished environment with a great balcony and a beautiful view. Shortly thereafter, water began streaming from an electrical light fixture in the bathroom ceiling. They sent an engineer to the room who told me that "The people upstairs overflowed their bathtub, this happens all the time, it's normal, and there is no danger." Hmmmm, water and electricity is not dangerous? There's no possibility that it's a toilet overflow? From the demeanor of this "engineer", it wasn't hard to tell that he was hiding the truth from me. Nevertheless, the hotel made no apologies, and no offers to switch our room.  This hotel starts taking your money the moment you get there. The only parking is valet. They didn't ask if I wanted my luggage handled,

I had an great experience at the Surf and Sand. Not only did the folks at the counter treat me great, they took the time to find a great room for me. Omer and Dani were both helpful and courteous and very visually appealing.  They gave me tips on some great restaurants and helped my friend to find a dentist the next morning.

If you're looking for a room that's right next to the waves, this is it!  We stayed in the surfside rooms, and at high tide waves practically come up under your balcony.  Loved the sound of the waves all night, and watching the sunset from the room.  All very romantic.  Took some great walks on the beach to some tidepools, and into town. Great place for nature lovers.  If you're looking for the Ritz experience, this isn't it.  But we loved the more homey atmosphere and found the staff friendly and helpful. We were comped drinks and a bottle of champagne at check in, and water bottles when we left.    Food was decently good.  We ate in the bar a couple times and in our room on the balcony watching the waves.  Springtime during the week was a great time to go.  Not too crowded and

Won an auction Skyauction.com after bidding 6 or more times.  Was excited as I went there as a young mother with a young child for years, but after a time could not afford it. Within the terms of the auction and dates specified - no restrictions 1 to 7 days gave my credit card and tried to book 6-29-2007 through 7-1-2007.  Would not confirm stated only could not confirm those 3 dates though no day restrictions.  To add insult to injury this same auction with the same June 2007 dates is again up for auction 3-12-2007.  Terrible, dishonest hotel, dishonest auction - STAY AWAY. Won on 3-11-2007 requested same day in the early A.M. EVEN REQUESTED ALTERNATE DATES OF 6-22-through 6-24-07. NO RESPONSE, SIMPLY NOT REPUTABLE AND I BELIEVE MY CARD WAS BILLED.  UNLESS YOU ARE PAYING FULL

We stayed at  the Surf and Sand for five nights beginning on Valentine's Day.  After reading some of the previous comments, I was skeptical about staying there.  But we had an excellent experience.  The location is unbelievable - right at the ocean's edge, with all rooms having a balcony overlooking the water.  We did not find any of the previously posted comments to be true.  The staff was very cordial and helpful; the food and drinks were first rate; the room was beautiful; and there were some nice touches that made the hotel seem even more welcoming, such as an ihome in the room, a note left in your room every night informing you about the time for high and low tide the next day, free coffee and LA Times every morning, free bottled water as you depart, and tiny seashells

Great hotel......!  Very quiet......!  Excellent location!   Have a fresh rasberry mojito in the bar!  Great nachos as well!  Had room service and the pasta was fabulous!  Walked down to the Orange Inn for coffee and freshly made muffins!  It's next to Taco Bell.  Avoid booking spa appointments first thing in the morning...staff not quite ready.  Best to book after 10:00 AM once they fire up steam room.....etc.  Book rooms next to spa or pool if you plan on using the jacuzzi or spa.......otherwise......a hassle to walk to.  great walks on beach.......get a mojito to go....bartenders great!

We had our wedding here, and it couldn't have been any better! The service was amazing, food was great, the resort was very welcoming-we had so many compliments on the entire wedding from everyone. They were very flexible planning everything, as we planned it from Alaska. After everything, We fell asleep listening to the waves crashing directly beneath our room. Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Heat wave and no A/C = miserable trip
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Surf and Sand the 3rd weekend in July. It was "unseasonably" warm (so the locals said) for that time of year. The hotel room was nice. They had been recently redone so all of the furnishings were new and updated. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and a private balcony but......the no air conditioning made our stay miserable. We could not spend anytime in the room other than to get ready and sleep. There was one lousy ceiling fan and one box fan to cool the room and we had to sleep with the balcony doors wide open (which did not do a lot of good other than the to listen to the rude people playing and screaming in the ocean at 1 AM). The food and drinks were horrible at the resort. We had to send several drinks back and chose to eat Subway from

the surf and sand resort in laguna beach was amazing. it was right on the beach and the rooms were incredible! we had an ihome in our room and flat screen TVs! the pool and jacuzzi were beautiful and it was so nice and sunny.

It is a beautiful place. We stayed in The Towers.Room was gorgeous, comfortable bed, nice bathroom..champagenme and choclates on arrival. We went in November thinking the no A/C wouldn't be an issue as I had read from other posts. Yea..it was. The sun beats into your room making it a hot box.I had to get ready in the late afternoon to go to a party. I looked like I had run 17 miles! The shower leaked badly! We told the front desk several times. They are all very sweet but sorta weird. Everybody says 'yes..certainly.." but, does nothing. It is a good hotel don't get me wrong.But, for over $500.00 a night.I don't think so.For $300- a night....okay Nice bar that over looks a beautiful beach as does the resturant splashes. The valet parking got very old! Everytime you left you had

Summary Heading: If this is a 4 star hotel... Motel 6 should be a 5 star...
Summary: First off, the staff at the front desk is very rude and not helpful AT ALL. I would probably get better and friendlier service at Motel 6. They messed up my reservations for the amount of days I wanted to stay, then didn't even offer to help out. The rooms are nice, but if you want climate control, open the window and turn on the fan. Definatly not worth the money, go somewhere else. The rude, ignorant, unhelpful front desk ruined the whole experience.

We had to come back!  We first stayed at the Surf and Sand in Nov/Dec of 2004 and fell in love with the place.  We always stay in a "Surfside" room.  The waves crash under your balcony at high tide and you can get lost in the sound and view from your room. The hotel has renovated most of the rooms and the updates are very nice: flat screen TVs, spa tubs, comfortable furnishings. Service is excellent and the staff are profession yet genuine and friendly. We always have a leisurely breakfast in the Splashes restaurant to watch the sea birds start their day, lone fishing boats checking their traps and we've even watched pods of dolphin swim just a few yards offshore headed south...We are leaving tomorrow after a 4 day stay and already are planning our 3rd stay.    We recommend you

Summary Heading: Fantastic location but too many kids
Summary: The view was spectacular and hearing the waves all day and night was incredible. The rooms were beautifully appointed, generous size bathroom with glass doors (thank you for not having shower curtains!) and shampoo/conditioner (Aveda Rosemary Mint) was a generous size which was perfect since I probably showered several times a day because of the pool and beach.  I was able to play my music from my iPod on iHomes, very nice touch!   I spent a great deal of time by the pool since the tide was high and the beach wasn't ideal for lazing around.  Service by the pool was great, food and beverages served were tops. One thing I found unfortunate was the number of small and loud children running around the pool. The deck and pool itself was not very large and spacious so there was no way

I wanted to stay right on the beach and paid dearly for a "best view oceanfront" room. When we checked in, our room did have a great view but was so hot we could barely stand it. I was astounded to find out there was no air conditioning but only a ceiling fan. We had our sliding door open 24 hours/day and 3 fans and could never get the room cool not to mention lots of noise (drunks on the beach 2am). In addition, our toilet broke at 2am the first night!! The rooms were worn, the towels were rough and there is no coffee available until 7am. A miserable experience at $625/night plus $27/day to park. Never again.
I just spent a weekend here and everything was great. The Top of the Surf (9th floor) views are great, the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The staff is very good and exceeded all expectations.

The private beach and ocean view from the room is worth every dollar.  We really enjoyed our stay staff was awesome and valet parking attendants were on top of their game.  I paid $21 per night for parking only after i told them i wouldn't pay the $27 they were charging.  No complaints about the room cleanliness.   Make sure to make reservations for Ti Amo, excellent Italian food only one mile from resort.  Can't wait to go back!!

This hotel is awful.  The rooms are rundown. Bedding is cheap and hotel staff could not be more rude and unhelpful.  For a place that claims to be a 4 star hotel, it treats clients like a MOTEL.  Staff makes no effort to help with anything.  Rooms are hot (NO A/C), smelly and noisy.  The walls are really thin.  We could hear the people next door to us watching TV until 4 in the morning and the staff at the front desk didn't seem to care when we called at 2AM and then the next morning to complain.  Apparently the management changed a couple of years agao becaue this USED to be a great hotel.  This hotel has the look and feel of an old motel.  It's awful rooms and poor customer service make it a huge waist of money.  I would highly recommend the newly remodeled Ritz Carlton or

I based my decision on staying at The Surf and Sand Resort on what I read on Tripadvisor. For this reason I am writing my own review so you will have additional information to base your decision on.  My 22 year old daughter and myself stayed at this hotel from July 3 - July 9, 2006.  When we arrived, our room was not ready, so we were given free drink coupons and sent down to the restaurant to have lunch.  I would rate the food and service as average and the restaurant itself as okay. We did have dinner there one other evening and decided not to eat there again.   In order to get to the public pool and public restrooms, people need to pass through the restaurant.  Walkways are quite tight and the tables are very close.  When we did finally check in and went up to our room, there

My wife and I stayed at the Surf and Sand Resort this weekend, and I was actually eager to write a great review of this place.  We had a teriffic time, and this place is first rate in so many ways.  Let me first say the the staff and service was suburb!  From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone (without exception) was friendly, professional, and eager to help.  And the staff was plentiful and always there when we needed them.  I had booked this reservation online, and unfortunately did not have the opportunity to specify the room configuration.  I should have called to request a King size bed configuration, but I forgot and as the resort was competely booked, had to settle for a room with two fulls.  The front desk explained the situation, and promised that they

We stayed in the Surf and Sand June 18-20.  We won't be going back.  We were hoping for a peaceful calm hotel.  Although our room was peaceful and lovely, the public spaces were loud, frantic and smelly.  The lobby is tiny with all hard surfaces.  Very very loud; which does not set a good mood when you're checking into a hotel.  Since our room wasn't ready, they kindly comped us for drinks at the bar.  Through narrow hallways, into a tiny elevator, we got to the crowded narrow bar.  All the public spaces are narrow which give a feel of being crowded.  There were also some funky smells in several places at the hotel and the hallways looked dirty. As long as we didn't leave our room, we were fine.  And the room was lovely and the view divine, so it made it passable.  Still,  I

Summary Heading: If I could only move to Laguna- Beautiful!!!
Summary: My boyfriend and I flew into Vegas and drove the next day to Newport Beach and the next day Laguna Beach. We stayed on the top floor of the Surf and Sand in a newly renovated room and it was absolutely breathtaking! Yes, there was a younger staff but everyone was polite, there was a 5:00 pm cocktail hour, we even found out they had taped a function for Laguna Beach, on MTV, there the first season. Everyone was exceptionally nice, we ate dinner at Las Brisas, which was great and I would recommend the Surf and Sand to anyone wanting a beautiful place to stay on vacation! I Loved It!

My family and I have been going to the Surf and Sand for over ten years.   Although the service is famously subpar (the front desk staff seems to turn over completely every year or so, the concierge [is there a concierge?] is capable of fulfilling only the most rudimentary requests, and the wait, pool and beach staffs seem recruited from local high schools), the setting is so lovely that it could be overlooked.    That is, until our last visit over Christmas.  Although the hotel was in the midst of a major renovation, its owners/management had elected to keep it open...and not to inform guests at the time they made their reservations or upon checking in.  We thus had construction on the floors directly above and below our rooms; patio doors had to be kept shut from 8 am (when

Great Hotel, Great Location, Awesome Beach, Fantastic Restaurant, Really Great Gift Shop, Impeccable Professional Staff. Relaxing, rejuvenating,refreshing. Excellent location to everything. You must go to Crystal Cove State Park/Beach in Newport Beach. Wylands gallery is just down the street from this hotel. I can't find one reason other then it is a little pricey to not stay here. I went there once in 2002 and went back 4 years later and they remembered me with a card and a bottle of wine & truffles upon check in. They pay every attention to detail! Don't hesitate book now!!! Oh yea, the bar is right on the beach and the waves crash into the bar/wall (safely) at high tide and it is awesome!!!

Summary Heading: Think of it as a Motel with an "M"
Summary: The surf and sand is all about expectation.  This was our 4th stay at the place.  I like it but it is not for everyone.  If you think of it as a coastal motel you will not be disappointed.  Its major asset is location, location, location.  As others have noted the service is poor. no kidding.  There is mold.  Absolutely.  The hallways are dark and dumpy.  Yes. The restaurant has fair-poor food and even worse service (but a killer view). Yes as well. The bathrooms are a joke, the showers just trickle, and there are funny smells everywhere. You only stay here if above and beyond all that you want to stay basically in the sea foam.  If your legs were a few feet longer you could dangle them off the balcony and let your feet touch the water. By all means do not stay in a poolside

Summary Heading: Lovely Place - Can't be closer to the ocean
Summary: Since our first stay at the Sand & Surf in 2000, my husband and I have been back at least twice.  Yes, it is expensive but we have always been able to find discounted rates online. MUCH cheaper rates. I love luxury hotels like the Ritz Carlton but would not pay the published rate of $460 or so for the S&S. Around $250 represents the value more closely.  The location is FABULOUS. If you like small hotels, with few people and relatively little action - this is the place. Although, the reality show Laguna Beach did this place no favor. We heard a teenager talk on her cell phone by the pool announcing that "yes", she is at "that" hotel. Increased traffic is good for management, not for guests :-).  What I love most about this hotel is that EVERY room seems to have ocean view. When

I have stayed at many world class resorts and this one doesn't really compare. For me the minute I step into a hotel/resort I need to be impressed...I just wasn't! The check in area is comparable to that of a motel 6! The service was nice but when it comes down to it, it really is just a simple beach hotel nothing spectacular. For some reason I got a free upgrade into one of the Deluxe King Tower rooms...it was on the top floor and the view was great! The room itself it plain but the bed was really comfortable. Room service was good especially because they set it up right near the balcony overlooking the ocean. The balcony wasn't really even a balcony..you could only take one step out! I probably won't stay again at this hotel it truly isn't all that....next time i'll try the

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a 3 week tour of California.  As the most expensive hotel during our tour it was intended as a treat for our teenage daughters who fell in love with the area (after watching the MTV show - Laguna Beach).  After a hectic start to our vacation I was looking forward to staying at this hotel.   On parking our vehicle the valet came rusing over explaining it was 'Valet parking ONLY' and took the keys to the car.  We had never stayed at a hotel were valet parking was 'compulsory' and wondered how much we should be tipping etc!   There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room ..... but saw an area with complimentary beverages near reception the morning of check-out.   The door to our room was directly opposite the lift just a stone's

What a great experience! We were on the bottom level of the beachfront tower. The view and overall experience was fantastic. The room was tastefully decorated, but a little bit dated. However, construction was under way and the model (renovated) rooms looked INCREDIBLE! In addition to the fabulous view and resort atmosphere they had a wide-screen flat-panel TV's.  The breakfast - with ocean views, of course, is a must!

I spent my Thanksgiving Break at that Surf& Sand in Laguna. The full oceanview room was beatiful and peaceful. The service is impressive, and the beach is a dream. Don't stay at those dives on PCH in Laguna. Stay at the tested and true vacation spot. Rooms are cleaned and re-stocked twice daily. I enjoyed resting on the bed and the patio over looking the ocean.Look for deals on their website or on the web. The beach is always sunny and warm there. I am planning to return their before the years out.

The staff was incredibly helpful, the room was clean and very comfortable, but the reason to stay here is the incredible oceanfront location.  The views are breathtaking, and the sound of the ocean was wonderful music.  The lack of air conditioning was surprising, but not a problem as long as I closed the blinds in the late afternoon.  The jacuzzi tub was a treat, also.  It's not cheap, but I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

My husband and I had a wonderfully romantic time at The Surf and Sand.  Our 4th floor room was breathtaking overlooking the coastline and relaxing listenening to the rhythm of the crashing waves.  Splashes Restaurant was great, we enjoyed both dinner and breakfast. This is not a ritzy place, but a classy place which simply supplies a romantic ambiance.  It is definitely what you make it. This was a great choice for celebrating our  24th Anniversary.  We will be returning.

Summary Heading: Oh, listen to the breaking waves!
Summary: We stayed at the Sand and Surf in an ocean view corner room (7th floor)in the newly renovated section.  The room was quite large for a beach hotel and the additional corner window added ocean breezes and sunlight to the room. The balcony was quite comfortable with 2 beach chairs w/ foot rest and a small table.  One morning we were even visited by a seagull for breakfast.  The bed was extremely comfortable with a light down comforter and extra pillows.  The ceiling fans over the bed and over the tub added an additional ambiance.  The Aveda toiletries were a nice touch.  The sitting area was also quite cozy with a plush pillowed sofa.  We loved the room and thought it was one of the best because of location, size and comfort.  It may be a little hard to get around in the hotel

Summary Heading: One of our favorites in Laguna
Summary: We have been going to The Surf and Sand for years and it is an amazing hotel. The only reason I cannot give it an excellent is because the rooms are getting a bit run down. They are working on them and supposedly they will be refurnished with linens and custom furnishings in the near future. The views of the ocean are spectacular, the staff is always awesome and more then accomodating. My husband and I stayed the night for my birthday and both had amazing massages in the very clean and lovely Aquaterra Spa. Once again, not cheap but worth it! We ate at Splashes which has incredible ocean views and delicious food. The rock shrimp risotto and apple bread pudding were to die for. A night time walk on the beach is all it took to let me know we would be back again soon. If money is

The Surf and Sand resort is being renovated and although certainly no bargain, is very nice.  The service is excellent (valet parking, beach service, pool service, etc), the rooms are larger than standard and very clean.  The hotel restaurant is open to the ocean, the food is very good and the view is superb.  The beach is nice and the surf is big enough to enjoy body surfing, but not so big as to intimidate young children (just right!)  The hotel provides complementary beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, and assorted beach toys.  The rooms are not air conditioned and the surf is very loud - can be tough to sleep at night with the sliding door open.

We stayed at the Surf & Sand for two nights last month in our trek up the coast.  What a great view of the ocean!  If you want the experience of staying right on the ocean and falling asleep to the sound of pounding waves, this is the place to stay.  I was surprised at some of the previous reviews who mentioned that it was too loud.  What a wonderful and soothing sound to fall asleep to.  It also helped to drown out the sounds of the two wedding receptions going on!  The only drawback was that we were on the second floor - pretty much right above the pool - which meant the entrance to the pool and the ocean was right below our room.  Be sure to ask for a room higher up.  The attentiveness of the staff was fantastic.  They were always so accommodating and friendly, it was

This hotel is supposed to be a world class resort but has NO air conditioning.  In all my years traveling to palm spings I have never been so hot and uncomfortable.  With temperatures soring 90 degrees our hotel room litterally became unbareble.  To make matters worse our dinky ceiling fan was broken and the hotel refused to change our room or fix it in a timely manner.  Needless to say, I must have lost 5 pounds from just sweating so much all weekend.  This hotel was one of the most uncomforatable places I have ever stayed in the world.  From acrylic sheets and comforters to a rundown bathroom in need of a makeover--I would never stay at this hotel again.  The Surf and Sand is in desperate need of an extreme makeover in its rooms and front desk staff.

Our quick four-day getaway at The Surf and Sand was just perfect. Yes, we had a much-requested corner room overlooking the pool and the ocean and the entire coastline. We had worried that our stay might be marred somewhat by the tired decor (the renovation won't be complete until November), but we found our room to be bright, sparkling clean, and spacious enough to entertain a trickle of guests. The bottom line is the location. This hotel is perfectly located on the surf within jogging distance of Main Beach and the best art galleries on the block just north of town.  If your mind is on the splendor of the ocean that stretches out before your very eyes, you'll love this hotel.

We went to stay at the Surf and Sand to celebrate our 18th anniversary.  I had booked a room though a 3rd party wholesaler (big mistake).  I thought that we had confirmed reservations, however, when we got to the hotel we found out that there were no reservations in our name!  To make things worse, the hotel was sold out for the room that we had requested.  The hotel manager was extremely accomodating and spent 1 hour researching what had happened to our reservation.  When the error was found (not the hotels fault at all) she did everything she could to make it up to us.  She put us in the 2 bedroom penthouse suite for the night!  Incredible views and room!  We travel all over the world, but I have to say this was the best room we have ever stayed in!  We were in heaven.  The

Summary Heading: Incredible Views but age is showing!
Summary: Stay in  a Tower room and the ocean is right below you.  This once beautiful resort is in need of renovation.  It has gone from an A+ to a B.  Note:there is no A/C.

We stayed here for 4 nights while visiting LA.  This hotel met and exceeded our expectations.  We enjoyed it~  The hotel has beautiful views of the ocean.  Our room was nice, a tad outdated, but nothing to write home about either.  The hotel staff was great. We never had one complaint about them.  Check in/out was a breeze. We didnt' find any extra charges on our bill.  Splashes the onsite rest was good. We enjoyed it.  The beds were very comfortable.    The pool, was rather small, but a good enough size to "wash off" after a long day of playing in the ocean.  When I come back to L.B. in the future, although I liked this hotel, I would like to try something different!

Summary Heading: How badly do you want to be ocean side in Laguna?
Summary: After many Vegas vacations, we wanted the beach experience...sitting under a cabana on the beach, reading books, having people fetch us drinks with umbrellas in them, romantic walks on the beach, sleeping to the sound of the ocean.  Considering all our options driving distance from Vegas, and after much research, we picked the Surf and Sand.  The warm welcome of the staff upon our arrival was wonderful, very "Ritz Carlton"-esque.  And it was pretty much as anticipated:  older (a little "pieced together") but very well maintained, clean, and *right* on the beach.  I was disappointed there was no hotel service actually ON the beach like there is in South Beach Florida (apparently it's against the law to have alcohol on the beach itself).  The hotel pool was a disappointment too -

On our one year wedding anniversary my husband surprised me with an ocean front room. I normally would love it, but the waves were deafening! So much that they put ear plugs by your bedside. the restaurant was mediocre, the decor was dated and the place was not clean! We spent over $300 for a Sunday night stay! I have lived in Laguna Beach and know the area, always wanted to stay there, but was terribly disappointed.

My husband and I stayed at the Surf and Sand this weekend for our anniversary. From the moment we arrived the staff was friendly and professional, and no matter where you were in the hotel the service was impeccable. The evening started with a complimentary welcome cocktail party with appetizer and drinks. This hotel is pretty old but very well maintained. There is a neat little gift shop in the hotel with anything you could possibly need and many high quality gifts. The city of Laguna Beach is known for its quaint and relaxing but old atmosphere. This town has much personality and there is something for everyone. This hotel was no exception. Our room faced the ocean over the pool with a view of the waves hitting the beach. There was not a lot of noise from the pool. The waves
Dramatic, unusual, unfetted casual luxury. My daughters loved the views...dolphins, gulls and fish aplenty! Great pool. Superb staff. Top floors only for the brave.

Granted, we stayed in a Tower room on a high floor, at $330/night.  However, there was a promotion that gave you $100 credit, so we had a great dinner at the restaurant as well.  Our room was very nice, clean, spacious, and had a 180 degree view of the ocean - it was really beautiful!  The hotel itself could be nicer, but we mainly walked around town (it's kind of far to walk there, so we just drove).  The pool area is great, but the spa is atrocious, it's just a little room with a tiny steam room and a jacuzzi (that wasn't working).  I rated it "above average" because we got wonderful service and because the room itself was excellent.  Our stay was a very relaxing experience, but I would really advise to stay in a Tower room.

Usually I will look at the ---- site and if the hotel is listed then I know "it's up to scratch".  Not this time!  I found a deal on the Surf and Sand and decided it was worth the risk.  Big mistake!    The hotel must have been a "beaut" in it's day but sadly that day had come and gone.  Perhaps if you are splurging for the best room in the house you'll be satisfied but we stayed in a very average room.  We were not in the Tower but instead overlooking the pool and ocean on a low floor, although the view was uncompromised.  However, the room felt musty as if it had been flooded not long before our arrival, the decor was fine, but, overall the service poor, room was noisy (pool doesn't close so hope no all night parties are going on, as was the case during our stay) and

This hotel doesn't come close to four-star, Preferred Hotel quality.  I booked a room at a rate that was about half the regular price based on a special I saw on a discounter's website and was really excited about that.  Trouble is, we had workers on scaffolding right outside our window both days of our stay.  Not only did their scaffolding block some of the beautiful view, but it woke my three-year-old up in the morning, and the pounding and drilling made it impossible to take a nap.  When I called to complain about this the first day of our two-day stay, I was assured the workers would be gone by 2 pm.  They actually worked until 5.  Worse still, I was told they'd be gone the next morning (Christmas Eve, so it made sense).  We were offered another room, but I thought - we

Summary Heading: A wonderful place right on the sea
Summary: We just returned from a long weekend at the Surf and Sand.  I must say that the location directly on the beach is spectacular.  And I for one could spend the rest of my days happily going to sleep to and waking up to the sounds of the surf outside every window...(there's a review here that cannot be for this hotel because every single room faces the ocean). But obviously the surf sound is not for everyone becuase every room comes equipped with earplugs!   We had a king bed room overlooking the pool.  The first night there were some revellers in the pretty jacuzzi whose voices travelled up.  There are dozens of rooms with the ocean and without the pool view if this proves a problem to you.   Our room was comfortable, the bed very much so.  To my mind, the place could be spiffed

Summary Heading: Location but it stops there..... Needs work & upgrades
Summary: We stayed here last year because of the downtown location. Upon arrival we were told the ocean front room we reserved "had issues that were being addressed" but would not be available for our stay. They put us in a dingy little room overlooking the highway with no discount for our troubles and no view. The room was very noisy as the downtown nightlife was right outside our window. The restaurant was nice and being on the beach had wonderful sunset views, but that did not make up for our dismal room. There are better hotels and prices in town so I'd say do your homework and you'll have a great time in Laguna. Your best bet is to go south a couple of blocks. You'll have several hotels to choose from, and the walk is easy to downtown and the rooms are quieter with better prices and

Summary Heading: Go for the Surf Side Room
