Summary: The Surf and Sand has excellent views of the ocean.  From your balcony, you are within a stone throw of the ocean.  Best rooms are the surf view, 3rd floor.  Imagine the 1st floor rooms are nice but not private enough, i.e. people on the beach can see in your room.   Service was good and the beach is great.  We were told that the surf view rooms were not up to date, but we didn't notice given the view.  Highly recommend.

We moved to the Surf and Sand after spending a horrible night in a Capistrano Beach hotel. We were stunned by the incredible view from the hotel room at the S&S: nothing but water and sand. We didn't even leave the room for meals; we had dinner in the room and breakfast in the room. We watched the Olympics on TV, drank champagne and entertained our daughter and granddaughter. The beach is literally steps away (unlike the hotels in Capistrano Beach, where fences and railroad tracks separate the hotels from the beach) and attendants bring you chairs, umbrellas and Perrier. While on the beach, though, look up and you will see that many of the balconies are crumbling and cracking. My husband, an architect, said these balconies could easily fail if one gets too close to the railing.

We are just leaving for our 25+ stay at the Surf and Sand Hotel in Laguna Beach.  Our (grown now) children feel like the Surf and Sand is their home away from home!  Our entire extended family (20 of us) make the trek back to the S&S every August.     In the summer, it is true, the hotel caters to families.  With the best stretch of beach and best accommodations in the area, the Surf and Sand is hard to beat.    Coming from a land locked state, while we are in Laguna we do nothing but beach it......beach service is absolutely wonderful.....umbrellas, beach chairs and great food/drink.  Also, in the summer months games and activities are set up for children on the beach.  Year after year we see many of the same families staying at the S&S, we've now become good friends!  We

Summary Heading: Overall a Great Stay at the Surf and Sand
Summary: We spent our anniversary weekend at the Surf and Sand.  I originally booked a poolside room, but after reading the reviews, I changed the reservation to a tower room.  When we arrived, they bumped us up to a tower room on the top floor in the corner for no extra charge.  The view is to die for.  The room was comfortable, but a little dated.  The cushions on the couch could have been cleaner, and the shower kept filling up with water when we used it.  However, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were the best.  Splashes had great seafood for a reasonable price.  The staff at the hotel was friendly and courteous.  We had the couple's outdoor cabana massage and it was worth every penny.  The hotel is located within walking distance of great little boutiques and art galleries,

The Surf and Sand Resort is great for people of all ages.  Whether you want to swim in the dazzling ocean with waiters tending to your every need, or sit at the pool sipping a famous Oreo shake.  The rooms are wonderful with many amenities and almost every one has a breath-taking view of the Pacific.  The food is quite good and not as over priced as all other resorts.  If you don't want to spend your days in Laguna by the beach there are many art galleries and shops, as well as quaint resturants.  A stay at the Surf and Sand will make your vaction one to remember.

My husband and I spent the night at the Surf and Sand for our anniversary and had a wonderful time! Our room was a little dated but the view made up for everything. When you stepped out on the balcony you could almost dive into the ocean. It was amazing to lay in bed and hear the waves crashing. We had dinner at Splashes restaurant which was perfect. We had no problems with check in and everyone was very friendly during our stay. We plan on returning same time next year!

Sher and Shirl's Weekend get away,  some how I booked this without checking trip advisors reviews. What was I thinking. I requested an early check in cause mom likes to go right to our room to freshen up and to eyeball the room. Although we were given no promises, I had requested early check in. Most  4 and 5 star hotels will try and accomodate you. We arrived at 3PM, check in was at 4PM, long story short- back and forth from the front desk to the bench outside the hotel our room was not ready until 5PM, only when I said I was extremly upset did they offered us 2 drink tickets. ( why can't they at least give an apology for the inconvience)   Oh and that ocean view suite I was promosied, was located in front of about a 700 sq foot rock roof with a bunch of men working on some

When I called to make a reservation, I was given a great rate on a two-bedroom suite.  Upon checking in, however, we were shown to a one-bedroom suite with a pull out couch in the sitting area.  It even contained a welcome bottle of wine with someone else's name on it!  When we called down to the desk to tell them that there was a mistake, we were told that the room we had originally reserved was not available--no apology, no compensation.  We asked for spa services as compensation, but were told that the spa is not connected to the hotel--which was confusing because we had booked a "spa package." Indeed it wasn't.  When we checked in for our spa services, we were told that we had missed them.  Apparently, they had left a message on my home machine to tell me they had been

S & S was probably one of the top 2 hotels I have ever stayed in. It was so beautiful. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. We got a great rate for the room and breakfast for 2 adults. The sound of the surf lulled us to sleep and during the day (when we were in the room, which with so much to do was rare), we saw dolphins, sea lions and then a humpback whale off of our balcony. The heated pool was A+. The restaurant was elegant, yet accepting of our 2 and 4 year old boys. Imagine eating with a view of the pacific ocean every morning. We were able to walk from the hotel to downtown Laguna. Overall we could not have been happier!

My friend and I went here for a birthday celebration. The room was beautiful, what a view. The ameneties were great and the service was outstanding. It was one of the most relaxing weekends I have had in a long time. Being in the service industry myself I am often disappointed in the service I receive at other spots. That was not the case here. I will stay at this hotel again and highly reccomend it.

Summary Heading: Going back for stay number two.......
Summary: I have just booked our stay for this coming August, today. This will be our second trip to the Surf and Sand. Each summer we go on vacation just before the kids go back to school. (2 kids, 8 & 4). The memories of last summer's visit to this resort, is what are drawing us back like a magnet for this year. This place is amazing. you MUST stay in the Towers building, which is DIRECTLY on the beach. We stayed on the main floor, which is the same floor as the Restaurant and swimming pool (however, they call it floor # 2 for some reason). We walked out our front door, turned east and you are at the steps that go directly to the sand. Once perched in our spot with the hotel provided lounge chairs, towels, umbrellas AND food service, you can just turn around and look up at the patio of

I have stayed at this lovely hotel twice this year, and both stays were wonderful. I would stay here over the Ritz Carlton down the street in Laguna Niguel, and that's saying a lot. Everyone from the Bellhop to the valet to housekeeping to room service give service with a smile (did I mention the concierge and front desk?). I found this to be the most professional staff I have seen in a non-5 star hotel. As for the rooms, they are great, clean, beds are totally comfy, room is equipped with CD players, safes, mini-bar. All rooms have patios on the ocean.  This being said, there are two options in rooms, the main hotel and the outer buildings. In the main hotel, there is an elevator and much easier access to the beach and pool area with its lovely heated outdoor spa. The other

Beautiful, and relaxing, The service was great, from the bell hops to the room service. I could not believe how close we were to the beach. The only down side was the parking. It was $18.00 a day to park, also the food is very pricy. But overall want a wonderful vacation. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

My husband & I expected our long weekend (Oct/03) to be great by staying at this hotel. The only great thing the hotel has going for it is the view of the ocean and the sound of the ocean waves. The hotel rooms are over priced for what you get. We ate lunch at Splashes the first day we arrived. The food looked better than it tasted. As for the room, we have stayed at much, much better for the price. I would not rate the room a 5-star, rather a 3 star. The bathroom was very clean, however, the overall hotel room was not inviting. The furnishings were not updated and the headboard for the bed was dirty. We stayed in the 400 section. If you decide to go to this hotel, do not stay in this section. The walls are paper thin and we could easily hear the gentleman in the room adjacent
